Comment: Great ambiance indoors and attentive staff. Really great food. Right next to Cedars so lots of ambulance sirens, so eat inside if that bothers you. Be careful with the margarita. They must put ghost chili peppers in it because I couldn't feel my lips after one sip. Had to ditch it. But the Stroganoff and brownie dessert were terrific.
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Wrong wrong wrong.   AIf you don't fit the Ty as they will escort you out.  Don't drink here.
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Bad service!! The worst servers. Marcos the manager and the host on Thursday 9/7/2023 have been very rude and liars!! NOT COMING BACK HERE AGAIN I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: One of my absolute favorite places in WeHo for brunch. The atmosphere is sleek and inviting and the menu is humongous and varied. Homemade craft colas were a highlight for me but the food was delicious too
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Always a good experience and food is great.Team are very courteous and pleasant.Not too loud, and nice & clean.
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: These five stars are for the food, service, and ambiance.First off, I love how this location allows reservations unlike the one in Pasadena.Secondly the customer service was off the chain. I know there are plenty of snooty customers here daily, I witnessed many while dining here. But that's not what we are here for lol our waitress Charis M and manager Celine were exceptional. This was the first time my friends and I dined here for brunch and we will definitely be coming back.From the drink recommendations to the food everything was delicious and tasteful,It was a group of six of us and we all enjoyed a variety of items on the menu. I will say the grilled cheese dipper and skirt steaks were highlights of the dishes,The cucumber martini was phenomenal , lemon drops were also delicious! Overall our experience here was a really good one thanks to Charis and Celine please continue to hire wonderful employees like these ladies!
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Visited Granville for a quick lunch and had an excellent experience. We were seated immediately, which was a nice surprise.Started off with the brussel sprouts and bread and butter--both were delicious and set a high expectation for the rest of the meal. For entrees, I had the El Gaucho salad with chicken, and my partner opted for the angel hair pasta. Both were satisfying and flavorful.We were so eager to dig in that we forgot to take photos, so I guess we'll just have to come back for round two! Overall, a solid four-star experience.
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Great ambience, generous portions, delicious cocktails, attentive service. Not the most interesting menu ever but it's a good choice. I'd go back.
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Food was fine. Follow up service was non existent. No one ever came by to take the dirty plates or refill drinks. We had to get up to ask twice for water refills - still never came. We left.
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: The food was fine and the ambiance was nice. Our server was the bartender and he was kind enough but a bit too busy to focus on our refills and checking in.I ordered the salad with add on veggie chicken. It came out to $23, which I would call very over priced for the portion size. The taste was good but it was a small salad and the $6 add on protein was super bland without much thought given to its preparation.My husband got the Caesar salad with an $8 salmon add on. He enjoyed it but, again, it was small.I don't think our waters were ever refilled.I can understand being busy but I probably wouldn't revisit simply because of the unwarranted high prices.
Address: 8701 Beverly Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Visited this restaurant based off of a recommendation on Instagram, and needless to say had a very mixed experience.First, the service was very good. The staff was very nice and helpful when describing the menu and some of the more popular items.Secondly, the food was delicious. My friends and I each enjoyed our plates as we ordered everything from the calamari to the chilaquiles and steak.  The short rib in the chilaquiles was super tender and flavorful and I could've eaten bowls of it the remainder of the day.The biggest issue we had while dining was simply the flies that were around due to a lot of the live plants from the environment of the restaurant. So that was a bit of a nuisance when dining and trying to fight off the gnats a little bit during the earlier hours of brunch.Unsure if that's a normal experience, but aside from that definitely recommend the cuisine here.
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Came here before pantages and what a unique find. You can tell the chef trying to be unique and trying to do things just a bit different.  The warmth and hospitality were wonderful. We ordered a variety of dishes Including Arugala tostada (tasted like a delicious avocado toast), corn tostada (ok), potatoes (yummy but could be crispier), pork belly (deliciously charred), beet quesadilla (wow...who would have guessed), baked Brie (oh my!), and the crème brûlée (very good). The only thing that disappointed me was the pavlova.  One of my ultimate favorite desserts.  I loved  the effort to be unique. It was a deconstructed pavlova with ice cream.  It seemed to be more ice cream than anything and The fruit was very tart. So one bite was  super sweet and the next was so tart my mouth and face literally puckered.  The back patio was quaint and a fun find tucked in Hollywood.  The owner was super sweet making sure everything was ok, telling us to walk to pantages bc parking was cheaper.  This felt much more like a European cafe  where you asked for a check and you can sit and talk to friends all night.  Or even going over to his house for a bbq.  We weren't rushed in anyway.  Would recommend trying.
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We came with friends on a Sunday and just expected more. The dishes had subpar food flavor and was overpriced.
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Excellent food and service!  I've had 2 meals here.  All plates are meant to be shared.   This is the perfect place to go before a show at the Pantages.  It is within walking distance.
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I can't say anything about the food because unfortunately, I didn't make it that far. We came in on a hot summer day and asked the owner/waiter if there was a fan or somewhere with a/c. His reaction was rude, apathetic, and snobby. If he would've answered empathetically we probably would have stayed, but the attitude definitely made us loose our appetite. I felt like he was doing a favor letting us sit at his restaurant. Everyone in the restaurant looked like they were sitting in a sauna. For a nice expensive meal, I don't want to drip all over the table and be talked down to, thank you.
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Phenomenal. Came for brunch and all the food was amazing. The benedict comes with ham not sliced ham, chunks of ham. I thought it was actually pork belly. So, so good. The brioche toast was like a dessert. The house-made lemonade is perfect: fresh lemon flavor and not too sweet. Service was great, and the outdoor seating area is great. If it were a hotter day, I could see it getting uncomfortably hot on the patio, and they could use some fans out there. Highly recommend for brunch!
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Amazing food, my friends and I could not believe how great everything tasted. The service was exceptional and the restaurant itself is a cute hidden gem.
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: From walking in to walking out was phenomenal. Exquisite dining experience, excellent service. The appetizer to dessert was fabulous. The ambience was serene. Can't wait to go back!
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great little place in Hollywood.  The pictures of the Duck confit on yelp sold me and I had to try it.  So tasty and the purée was good as well.  Short rib was tasty.  Gambas was a first try for me.  Just the right amount of spice with the shrimp.  And last the Horchata crème brûlée ended the meal perfectly.   Would for sure go back and suggest this place to anyone going to the area.  Great family feel and the service was spot on.  Two thumbs up.
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: WOW!!!! THE FOOD IS UNIQUE AND DELICIOUS!!!! I went with my niece, we were both hungry, and ordered 2 corn tortillas, lamb chops, the farmers vegetable which was fried carrots and short ribs. Every single dish was Extraordinary in taste and texture. The best meal I can remember in a very long time, so different in taste. We were full and didn't have room for dessert, which also looked scrumptious!!!My only critique would be better curb appeal. When we walked in I thought maybe I'd made a mistake as the ambiance was lacking but the friendly staff and incredible food made that all a minor foot note. It wouldn't be costly to create an other worldly ambiance. Just some faux leaf trellis panels attached to the wooden 1/2 walls that are throughout and maybe some big ceramic pots and some kind of creative hanging animal art descending from the ceiling. Like hanging globe or wild birds from the ceiling. There's such a diverse culinary experience that creating an atmosphere that draws us in would make it all the more Stellar. But Stellar Running Goose is!!!!
Address: 1620 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Highly recommend! This is THE place for a filling bowl of knife cut noodles in Koreatown. Handmade noodles in broth with such depth in flavor, each slurp warms your soul and each bowl feels like a snug hug. Perfect after a long day at work! Also loved the barley rice appetizer, 3 types of kimchi, and tteokbokki (spicy rice cakes). Very friendly service and cute interior decor.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Always hits... such delicious comfort food and always a vibe inside. Highly recommend the chicken kalguksu. Portions are large so you can comfortably split with someone. Sometimes there's a wait, but you get seated relatively quickly and food is always served efficiently. I've only ever gone at night, and parking is valet and $4.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Fast line, nice servers, great lighting, YUMMY food! This place has the best bossam I've ever eaten. The food is just so delectable even though the price is a little bit much. But I believe the food and the service fits the price so that's why I'm giving it all the stars. The sauces and side dishes included gave the dishes a lot of flavor and we asked for extra bowls and stuff and the staff were very accommodating. Definitely coming back here again if I get the chance!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: We came early on a Sunday evening, and was able to beat the dinner rush with no wait. I really loved the open seating. The decor was pretty modern yet felt homey. I ordered the chicken kalguksu and was very surprised to see how big the portion was. I'd say it was very worth it at its price. The broth was light and easy to eat, while still being well seasoned. Definitely a super comforting meal. The sides were also really good as well. Service was swift but the attentiveness/care was a bit lacking. For starters, the menus were thrown onto the table as we were being seated. An alarming eyebrow raiser for sure.  It also took awhile for someone to take notice of us. Not a huge issue though. Otherwise, would give a 5/5. I'd come here again to try the bossam.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Service is amazing and price is really reasonable. Meat is really good and there are various options to choose. Really recommended place in k-town!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: OMG!! Tasted like my grandma's homemade kalguksoo!! My grandmother really loved kalguksoo and I wish I brought her to this place. She would have loved it! The chicken kalguksoo broth was so rich and they give you a whole chicken! Their bossam was the best ever!! I dream of this place!!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I went with a friend and getting two things was way too much, we definitely should have split one thing. But, we didn't regret it because it was really nice to try multiple things. The sujebi and the noodles were both perfectly cooked and chewy, and both soups had deep flavor and were so good. Generous with the amount of clams and seafood too, which was nice! The ambiance definitely is more of a modern vibe than traditional Korean spots, and service is good but there can be pretty decent lines at peak lunch hours, maybe 30 minutes or more (it really depends). Overall, this place is so good and I love recommending it to others, but it has a good reputation anyway.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The noodles in their kalguksu are the best I'm the area. The place is nice and very clean.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: One of the best spots in K-town -- I used to frequent this place once a week until the prices went through the roof circa COVID-19.If you haven't tried the hand cut noodles in their Kalguksu, you're missing out - opt for the clam based stew instead of the chicken.5/5 easily.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Best korean food I have had. Service was very helpful and kind. While the restaurant was not huge, it was comfortable and neat.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 9&10 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I would definitely recommend this place. It has a great atmosphere. The owner is a very very nice person and I can't say enough about their food. Whoever has not tried. This place. Hass to give it a try at least once. Guarantee you won't be dissatisfied.
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Everything was great! The ambience was amazing, good service and food was tasty. Definitely recommend
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Absolutely wonderful! We found this place last night and were able to book a reservation for 5. We were celebrating my partners birthday! The food was outstanding. Very good quality and fair pricing for what it was worth. The service was also great! Our waitress was very kind at attentive. The ambiance of the restaurant was also very comfortable and the lighting was beautiful! We will definitely be back!
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Well let's start with the ambiance was pretty awesome we went for dinner last night but we didn't make a reservation since me and hubby didn't know that we need to make a reservation ahead; restaurant look pretty busy but not overcrowded; but as soon we walked in we were greeted by the hostess and we got our table right away by the bar area Wich was great; after like five min our server came and offered drinks and I got just water and my buddy got some lemonade;later he came by to offer some appetizers Wich we choose the zucchini flower Wich we're like just ok and we later ordered the margarita pizza and the pesto with procciucuto and  and after like ten min they all came out .Food was just ok nothing special just a couple of thin crust and flavorless pizzas; definitely not going back and drive almost one hour just to eat that very expensive and tasteless food; I only put one star for the service that's all.
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The pizza and food is good but they pump the place full of glade air freshener... makes it hard to eat and breathe. Unfortunately I doubt I will return based on the smell of glade air freshener alone. The piece of pie pizza was amazing though.
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Fantastic pizza!Made with Italian flour imported so no uncomfortable feeling the next day!
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Love this place! Food has been great. Back patio is wonderful. Service has been good and it good depending on if they are super short which happened once recently. Front patio seating had tons of flying bugs and some bees so that was not good but we def will be back but o love you to sit in back patio!
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Finally was able to make it here even though it was down the street from my place.  The food was incredible, simple but tasteful. The ambiance was very chill and relaxed and I loved the indoor and outdoor option that they give you here. I will say I was obsessed with the pizza that we ordered. The prices were a bit more then I would have wanted to spend on a pizza but that's okay, its worth it for a special occasion. Service to add to this was very straightforward and simple and she recommended all of the best things. I will definitely be back since it was a very lowkey but lovely place to eat.
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The place was kinda perfect! I have been looking for a good pizza and have been wanting to go back here. It's perhaps my favorite LA pizza spot.The pizzas and the Torta de la Nonna were fantastic. I have been looking for a good pizza and have been wanting to go back here.
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The place was kinda perfect! Nestled away just off Sunset in old Hollywood it was a charming oasis with incredible ambiance. The pizza was perfection (and since they use a double zero Milled Caputo wheat flour even the most gluten sensitive can eat without issue. The pasta is also made in-house and was superb!Highly recommend!!
Address: 1534 N Mccadden Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The food quality is amazing. The interior was a bit drab...would expect more from the interior design. Pricier than the average place but amazing food quality.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: The ambiance was fantastic. I have heard of this restaurant for the longest time with many friends offering their recommendations - so when my wife and I finally dined it was an experience that held up to its hype.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Too crowdedVery hipster $$$$Not worth the waitDon't like the seating, high stools, you better be over 5'5" !
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: So many delicious options at this French-inspired brunch experience! The atmosphere is charming with a classic French ambiance, and the pastries are yum-my! The croissants are flaky and buttery, and the brunch menu offers a variety of savory and sweet options. It can get crowded, so be prepared for a wait. I recommend looking at the menu before arriving so that you could order quickly and find a seat.I definitely recommend the potato pancake (it's not a hash brown, it is literally a potato pancake), but I don't think you can go wrong with any menu item.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I'm obsessed with this place!! The food is amazing, it's a gorgeous space and great ambiance. I always take out of town guests here. I've gotten the potato pancake and I think it's the best thing on the menu by far! My friend got the shashouka, and said it was good but the potato pancake is better. Amazing place.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: There is almost always a line out the door and onto the sidewalk, and for good reason. The pastries are not only beautiful to look at but beautiful to eat. The restaurant itself is an inviting open space with fun lively staff. I would say the sit down food is alright--expensive for alright food.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Republique in Los Angeles is an exquisite culinary haven. The moment you step inside this grand bakery-restaurant, you're greeted by a tantalizing display of pastries and artisan bread. The menu features a fusion of French and American flavors, and each dish is a masterpiece. The ambiance, set in a historic building, exudes a charming and rustic elegance that adds to the dining experience. Whether you're indulging in a fresh croissant for breakfast or savoring a gourmet dinner, Republique consistently delivers an exceptional culinary journey. It's no wonder this restaurant has become an iconic destination for food enthusiasts in LA.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Nice brunch experience. There's no wow factor everything is very standard but still great food. Love the vibe and interior Design in the restaurant. Very airy and bright.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Great food! We ordered Traditional breakfast, Maine lobster omelette, avocado toast, kimchi fried rice and half baguette.  Everything we had was exceeded our expectations.  Huge thick cut of bacon in traditional breakfast.  Lobster omelette was luxurious and delicious. Avocado toast was too pretty to cut into. Kimchi Fried rice was so tasty when you mix the two sunny side up eggs in.  Baguette with butter and jam brings back memories of Paris!Service was great.  They fill the water, check on you even though the restaurant was busy.Very relaxing atmosphere.  Beautiful place.  You order your food at the counter and prepay.  Then find a table and they will bring the food to your table.  There was a line but moving.  We waited in line for about 20 minutes.  Parking was a bit hard.  The area has some meter parking or free parking but very limited spaces.  Restaurant has valet parking but I didn't see the person.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Posting again because they took my review down. Honestly I used to come here all the time for breakfast meetings and also dinners until I brought my parents for their birthday and there was an "influencer" / tourist sitting next to us. She literally recorded the entire meal. When my mom noticed we were being filmed and we asked the waitress to please ask the stranger to put her camera away they said no because we are in a public space. Honestly how rude and gauche. I loved that Republic was woman owned and took over the old la Brea bakery but wow I have literally stopped going since this incident. Wow. Wow. Wow.
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Great food, venue, ambience and staff. The tiny downside is that it can be very busy at times. All in all, 5/5 for me. To quote Schwrzenegger, 'I'll be back!'
Address: 624 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Discovered this new Korean spot which is so gooood!! Come with me.Highlights of the menu:1. Braised Wagyu beef back ribs2. Spicy marinated fresh raw crabs3. Korean BBQ lateral cut Angus beef short rib4. Kimchi stew5. White rice with beans
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I've had a lot of Korean food but nothing beats this place. Every single meal we ordered was phenomenal, service was top notch and the server's had wonderful recommendations that complimented our orders even better. We loved all of their spicy food and will 100% be back to try even more. 10/10 would eat again.
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: HanEuem is a tasty Korean restaurant/gastrointestinal where you can find big platters of delicious Korean foods while grabbing some beer or soju. I came by on a Friday night and place was busy but generally 1-2 tables open so we were able to get seated quickly.The pork belly and octopus is a satisfying dish that's well cooked with covered with a gouchujang sauce laid on top of onion. Goes well with a drink and a side of rice (they only have purple rice here). The seafood pancake was fantastic - good fillings and the batter was seasoned well and I loved the crumbly flaky texture on the outside.Service was solid. Decent ambient though if there's a loud party the sound carry.Valet parking or street. Or h mart
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The restaurant has valet at a reasonable price of only $4. My date made. Our reservation for 6pm and they seated had right away. The waiters know their menu very well and are very strive and patient. The food is a whole experience! I don't think there was anything I didn't like. The ambience there is low light , intimate , tables are small, the restaurant itself is very small but they do have a table for a larger party.
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Their spicy Galbi stew is awesome. I could not help stop eating it even I was really full. Their spicy marinated raw crab is very tasty but its too spicy I could not handle more than 2 pieces. We wanted to try all different kind of Jeons, we asked to a server if we order mixed combination things it comes with little bit of all different Jeons include seafood green onion pancake. He told us yes. But it did not come with that item. :(I still can give 5 stars cuz their spicy galbi stew is the best I ever had. Better than S_N_Dan place.I will come back here for that stew!! Thank you! It was great!
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Went here with a friend who had never eaten Korean food before. We got a seafood pancake and the mackerel. Both were delicious. The mackerel was cooked well but a bit plain - I didn't want to get anything too crazy or spicy since my friend and I were sharing. The decor is lovely, it was packed full of Korean families. Service was timely and efficient. Wish I could eat here one more time while I still live in Ktown, but I'll have to make a drive and fight for parking next time. Absolutely recommend, great place to take visitors or people new to Korean food.
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: After stumbling upon this place on TikTok, I simply had to give it a try - and let me tell you, it went beyond my expectations. The staff was exceptionally kind and attentive, creating an ambiance that felt like a home away from home. Among the highlights, the Wagyu ribs stole the show for me. Their tenderness and exquisite flavor were nothing short of incredible. As for my girlfriend, she opted for the raw spicy marinated crab. While it leaned more toward the spicy side for us, the flavors were undeniably vibrant.
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Visited for a late lunch and had a mixed experience with both the food and service. Our order included the spicy raw crab, braised beef short ribs with cheese, and beer.Starting with the positives, the banchan assortment was delightful. I particularly enjoyed the spicy raw crab, although it was a touch too sauced. It paired well with rice. However, the braised beef short ribs left me disappointed.The first piece I picked up was a rice cake. Just before taking a bite, I noticed a faint sour smell. Despite that, I proceeded, finding the taste alright. Eventually, I realized the odor originated from the melted cheese topping. Unfortunately, the cheese had gone bad, casting a negative shadow over the dish and affecting my overall meal experience.Though the staff was friendly, their lack of attentiveness was noticeable. There was no check-in during the meal, despite our wish for banchan refills, water, and an additional beer. We even had to signal for assistance to order more rice, which should ideally be a standard accompaniment. Additionally, the rice served was dense and lacked fluffiness, further diminishing the experience.It would have been appreciated if the staff inquired about our meal satisfaction, but they were rather quick to present the bill and depart. Hoping for a more well-rounded experience next time.
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Comfort Korean food in Ktown!Came here on the weekend at around 6:30 and only waited for 15 minutes before getting seated. However after us, we saw parties waiting like 30 minutes for a table. The staff are so friendly and quick, we would ask for something and they would quickly give it.The food was good too and price was reasonable. My friend and I were obsessed with the banchan here and ate all of our banchan with nothing left over. We had the kimchi pancake which was cooked with perfect crispyness and softness and the kimchi stew which also came with free servings of rice. The stew was ok but the pancake really stood out for us, try it!
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: People are incredibly kind. The food is amazing. A real gem in Los Angeles for Korean food. The food is noticeably made with care. May God's peace be on this place. Thank you!!!
Address: 539 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: A cute date spot that I can always really on. The wait staff is alwys very friendly and the cocktails are bright and fresh. It's mostly pasta and pizza here, but both are done very well. I had the Heirloom tomato salad (very fresh), Nonna's meatballs ( the sauce is :chef's kiss:) and the puttanesca (tasty and spicy). I've had the Squid Ink Frutti di mare on a previous visit, and can highly recommend.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I'm giving the two stars because the guy as the host up front was super nice and kept a conversation going with us which was sweet! The service from the lady was horrible. Very nice to other people around us but just didn't like us for some reason. You know when someone thinks you can't pay the bill or even treat you with bad service because of your skin color? That's how we felt and yes I did pay $93.62 for our food !! My sister enjoyed her Alfredo pasta with shrimps but I will not recommend this restaurant to people !!
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: One of the best Italian foods I've had specially for the price. The staff are great they are friendly and do have great recommendations. The bruschetta was amazing tasted really fresh as well. The carbonara done to perfection and good portions. The restaurant itself is still having on going renovations but is very nice inside. I have gotten the chance to sit inside and outside and would  recommend inside during the day and night during the night specially on a date.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Cute brunch spot and love the story behind the 2 sister restaurants. My go to is the thai chicken waffles here. The matcha waffles are also really good.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Met Him At A Bar certainly serves up some of the most outstanding pasta I've ever had the pleasure of trying! The Bolognese pasta was incredibly meaty, and the Vodka Sauce pasta boasted a rich and creamy texture, both accompanied by perfectly cooked al dente noodles.The attentive hostess and waitstaff were quick to assist and ensure the tables were ready for the next guests. It's worth noting that this isn't the kind of place where you can leisurely enjoy a meal for over an hour; it's more of a high-energy spot.As for parking, street parking can be a challenge, so it's a great suggestion to utilize the nearby garage across the street for a hassle-free experience.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Um, the pasta was indeed very solid.Their portions are on the smaller side though:( The clams were way too salty. I would personally never order that again. The truffle ravioli also had some raviolis that were deconstructed and had no filling (..?) The food took really long to come out and were probably behind on orders. They also kept wanting to take away our plates near the end even though we weren't finished....but nonetheless it was good and my party had a good time. The ambiance and servers were nice and I think that's what made up for it.Parking: street!!
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: The dishes we got weren't amazing or memorable. All of our pastas were mediocre and the best thing we got was the calamari. Gets super busy so make a reservation!
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: My partner and I have been frequenting here over the last year. We always have a wonderful time. The staff is always 10/10, super nice and friendly. You can't go wrong with their pastas, they are always incredible. But I tried their tuna sandwich for the first time last night and just.... Wow. Hands down the best tuna sandwich I've ever had, which is saying something since I was already a huge fan of the basic tuna sandwich. The egg, cucumbers, and dill dressing blend beautifully together and bring out the tuna's flavor perfectly. The bread is exactly what you'd want on it too, sliced + toasted with just the right amount of butter. You can tell the chef behind their recipe was out to make the best tuna sandwich and you can taste the love behind it. So worth the 16 bucks! (And it comes with a side)Never have had a bad drink here. Their wine is great, but I get tipsy from wine easily and I'm often the designated driver, so I usually go with their pear cider Stem (and it's so good).As for desserts, I've tried their tiramisu some time back and wasn't a fan. Might've just been a bad night cause it just was on the bland and dry side. But they've since added cannolis, which are very good! I love their affogato as well.Price wise, it's about typical as any date night place in LA. Pastas are around 20 dollars, with it costing more to add protein. Apps remain around 10-15 depending on what you get. But you are paying for quality and won't be disappointed.Parking can be tricky. I usually go to one of the public parking lots a couple blocks down 8th street that's a dollar an hour. The garages right on La Brea can be quite expensive.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: My party of three came to MHAAB for brunch on Saturday.  As a side note, they serve similar breakfast items at the breakfast location Met Her at a Bar.  Him has a much larger interior so this is a great choice of the line at Her is too long.The food was fantastic.  We had a Chicken and Waffle, Mama's Omelette, and a breakfast burrito.  We rounded it out with coffee and orange juice.  It all tasted delicious and came out hot.We arrived right at opening time of 10 AM and it was relatively empty.  By 11 AM it was packed, so earlier will favor larger or hungrier parties.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Great pasta, one of my favorite Italian restaurants in LA! The Carbonara is amazing, highly recommend. Service is friendly and ambiance is somewhat busy, depends of the time you go. Drinks are also good, great cocktails.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: The food was delicious. I highly recommend the lobster spaghettone which is their new dish. The portion was feeling and small wait time. Service was friendly and the ambiance is good too.
Address: 801 S La Brea Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I feel like there aren't too many places with outdoor BBQ and I'm so glad my friends and I stumbled onto here! It's also a charcoal BBQ so there's great smokey flavor imbued in all the seafood. For three hungry people, the Master set is the perfect amount of food. We debated the set meant for 2-3 people, but we really wanted the hagfish ($42.99). The price difference between the two sets was about $30 so it made more sense to just go for the Master set (meant for 3-4 people).Staff were attentive and did all of the cooking for us. They'll cut the hinges on the big clams and cut the other pieces of seafood into tiny bits for you. The seafood was delicious and fresh, no fishy taste at all.For the Master set, there is a giant bowl of noodles at the end so remember to keep space for them.
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Great place with amazing food!!! Went here twice already and for sure will be back again!!!
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Such an interesting restaurant. Delicious food and excellent service! Highly recommended for all the seafood lovers
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Differentiated service when you are not Korean customers. Very small portion for four people. Illegal after tax service charge.
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The food is great not so great but great. The service is the best I think people come for the service the service is the main part of burnin shell. Ambience is great with music.
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Went here on one of my most recent visits to LA, and completely loved every part. I've been wanting to try this place for quiet some time now but I believe their hours were a little weird since they were remodeling, but now they're back and better than ever. Every felt and looked really clean in the inside and it has a very chill drinking type of atmosphere. Our table sat outside and i must say I do prefer that. It felt like a scene out of a Korean drama. We got the grilled eel (it was good but wish it had some type of flavoring), and the chief set. There was 4 of us and I must say we did all get pretty full. One of my favorite has to be their spicy cold noodles. Insane how much flavor was in it I could eat atleast three! Seafood was fresh and the waiters cook for you here, truly better service than anywhere you'll get. Would recommend if you're in the area
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Food and service was amazing mouth watering highly recommend to try. Loved it! Burning Shells
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Seafood is fresh and service is amazing! What more can you expect from a restaurant? Also, I honestly thought the price was on point.
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Burnin' Shell was absolutely great from all aspect--the service, food, portion, pricing, and presentation. My girlfriend and I had the Crew Set, which was more than enough for two people with a great assortment of side dishes and appetizers. The servers were very friendly and had taken care of the grilling part. I'd recommend this place to anyone for lunch or dinner with some drinks.
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: We got the Chief set and it was pretty filling. We didn't think we would've had enough food but the side noodles and soups were pretty filling and there were food leftover we couldn't take since they didn't have soup containers. Their ceviche was really good and all the waiters/waitress cooked for us! They're all friendly and nice, especially John and Jeff. Enjoyed this place after a long drive from Big Sur. All seafood only, I don't think they have any meat, Atleast I didn't see it? Definitely a good experience
Address: 3916 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Just unimpressive all around.  Do not accommodate customers in any way.  Not worth it.
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Went on a Saturday around noon and was told it would be a 50 min wait, but actually only ended up being about 25 mins. Ambiance is great, cute decor and good vibes. We got the mushroom fries which were a bit bland but still tasty with the sauce, and the pizza which was good. I would rate the food 3.5/5 but ambiance brings it up to a 4. Good place for group brunches!
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Great food! Gluten free options galore! Only gave a 4 star because they took forever for the pasta and when it came out it looks like it was for a child.
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Delicious food and they were really kind to seat us even though I'd booked for the wrong great white! Good wine list and we liked the octopus.
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I recently dined at Great White and here's my honest review:The ambience at Great White is nice, with island-like vibes, though it can be a bit louder than my preference. It's not overwhelmingly noisy, though. Now, onto the food - I tried the "Tremendous Burger ($20)" which, to be honest, tasted only slightly better than a McDonald's burger. It didn't come close to the tastiness of In-N-Out. The sweet potato fries were decent but nothing to write home about.I also ordered a coffee for $7, and it was a pretty basic shaken latte, nothing exciting. When it comes to service, be prepared to wait at least 10 minutes for someone to take your order, and make sure to tell them everything you need all at once because who knows when you'll see them again.All in all, I'd rate the food 5/10. As for the overall experience, I have to stick with a 5/10, maybe a generous 6/10 if I had to be nice. I don't see myself returning anytime soon.
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: The food was too complicated. Reminded me the 80s. There were so many ingredients, I couldn't tell what I was eating. It was very crowded. We had a server in training which didn't help the situation. The customer service was great. I sent back my food and they took it off the bill without saying anything about it. That was very nice. I then ordered a $10 fruit plate that had one piece of fruit on it. The ambience is cool though.
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Mediocre food overpriced restaurant. Ordered several items for breakfast- burrito tasted stale but in house hot sauce was good. The "Great white breakfast" wasn't so great... No sausage and potatoes? I asked for jam for toast and said they charge $2 extra for jam... Stop being cheap asses. Small glass of orange juice was $10...
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Went on a Saturday around 11am and it was about a 50 minute wait but we walked around, got a cup of coffee. And it was soooo worth the wait. The food was delicious! We tried the truffle pizza, ceviche, and the club sandwich. The green juice was great as well. Great vibes + service. Cant wait to go back again.
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: This place is POPPIN .. I've been to the melrose location and let me just say IT GIVES WHAT IT NEEDS TO GIVE OK !!! I came alone for a quick bite clearly not finishing the whole pizza not for not wanting to just because it's meant to share ... I'll eat it later for sure :))) love love love the vibe and will return ! It's busy so get here early or be by yourself or def prepared to wait about 25 mins to thirty for a party of two on a Friday at noon !!!! Happy eating ;))
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Ambiance ..beautiful!! Walked in got a seat at the bar .. place is packed .. vibe is awesome . Got the kombucha .. was able to watch the pizza come out ! It's busy fun and upbeat . Would def recommend it's very La .. casual during the day ! Ordered the tacos  fish gf (lettuce wrapped ) yummy !!
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Food-  I had fried frozen calimari for 22.70 including tip.  Not very good. Some of it was chewy and tasted previously frozen.
Address: 244 N Larchmont Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Foods  r pricey ..  menus limited...  and the waiting time  for  ur order  is so lame & takes a while..
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The food was amazing and the service was good. The ambiance was amazing in terms of visuals, and wasn't that busy. All was good until we got were going through the noodles in one of their "popular" dishes and found a hair. I'd be less disgusted if it was just a strand of hair, but no that hair had debris and knotting. Idk if its cuz we went late, or the person cooking up food there needs better shampoo. Never seen anything like it before, enforce a hairnet or hat policy for that place.
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Cool spot located next to Sushi Hon. The space is definitely on the smaller and more intimate side--good for a date but probably not for a big crowd since they were turning away parties bigger than 6. We found this place on social media and decided to give it a try. Service was a bit slow but I get it, they're newer. The server was nice and tried to pay attention to all the tables but definitely getting overwhelmed.As for the food, we got two things: the assorted savory pancakes and the octopus/pork belly.The assorted pancakes were good. I initially thought for $40 it's a little steep but it comes with an assortment of different foods--stuffed peppers, stuffed mushroom, king oyster mushroom, Korean sausage, meatball, etc. You don't see a lot of places in Koreatown that has 전 in that capacity.The octopus/pork belly dish was okay--the dish came out warm, not hot, but it didn't taste bad.Tl;drOverall, I think Butnal is a cool spot to go for a lowkey night. Food is okay. Space is small so don't go with a big crowd.
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: New spot in Ktown!Transparently, I can't say I was blown away by the food, but it was good enough for me.I got their Jun platter which wasn't bad but I wasn't sure if it was worth 39.99. It was just sausage, cut up mushrooms, imitation crab, etc. I know Ktown food in LA is overpriced but cmonnnn.The bright side is that the beer and soju are $8, service is nice, and they let you take a Korean ice cream from their ice cream fridge.I may come back and try other things in the future.
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Pretty good food - though felt serving sizes were in the small sizeSeemed to be only one make server so somewhat slow but good service
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Butnal is a new gastropub that opened up on the border of Mid City and Koreatown. It is so underrated and great! I hope it gets more business but not Tiktok viral... this is truly a gem for the locals. They are having an opening deal where all alcohol is $9. The regular price is $13 -- still way cheaper than the $17 or $18 bottles of soju I see at most places in Koreatown proper. The  waiter was so nice and offered my friend two free bottles of soju when we told him we're celebrating his birthday. The food was great and very affordable compared to Koreatown. The vibes were also amazing -- it gave a cozy forest aesthetic. Best of all, since it is on the fringe of Koreatown, there is plenty of free street parking. I will definitely come back and bring my friends!
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Ordered the recommended braised spicy chicken. Very spicy, the chicken wasn't too flavorful as if it was just mixed in with sauce rather braised. I added more potatoes and braised the chicken myself the next day.
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: 10 star for tonight.   My date keeps saying this was excellent.  We were greeted right away as we walked in with the most adorable smile.   He said they are getting a table ready for us and that we'll be seated asap.  Once seated, water was served, menus, settings and was asked if what we would like to drink.  Sugar free soju is avail you guys!  But who's counting calories.  We ordered the pork feet special and it was delicious.  It's a big serving so that was it.   couldn't try all the other dishes so we'll have to come back.  Maybe with group of friends so we can try more.   Can't wait to get back here!   Everyone was nice and attentive.  Truly a 10 star experience tonight.
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Hotttt!!! Love the rustic Korean vibe with the hip vibe of adorable neon lights....and food is Delish! Great ambiance,  great quality,  great service!  Thank you, Jay!
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: YOU GUYS I can't rave enough about how much I enjoyed my time here! This spot is a whole vibe! It's like you've been teleported to Korea Out late drinking with friends?? Come to butnal to curve your late night munchies - and to drink some more hehe! The food was delicious and paired so nicely with soju and beer. I wish there was an egg included in the tteokbokki but I still enjoyed it. The restaurant is decorated with Sakura flowers which is SO CUTE! They play kpop in the background. Service is fast and the staff is so friendly! I'm gonna bring all my LA visitors here!
Address: 954 S Norton Ave Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Food was BUSSIN! I'll be back Fam! FIRE ASS FOOD! Go get y'all a plate or twoooooooo!
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Love coming here for brunch! Food is amazing. We always get the chicken and waffles, French toast, and chicken club! Service is great as well, expect to wait a bit but usually not too long! We've only ever dined outdoors, but always a great experience. Would definitely recommend!
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Chicken Club - (5/5)  not dry, juicy, perfect, toastyWaffle Fries - (5/5) seasoned well, crispy and good portionNow this is Love Waffletella - (5/5) beautiful presentation, perfect crunch and softness, and the fruits weren't sour it was goodWaffle & Berries - (5/5) beautiful presentation, not lacking in any toppings or sauces (good portion), perfect sweetnessThis spot is such a great breakfast spot that is nice decorated. The food is fresh, warm, and good. They also serve double portions of butter with the waffles -- one on top of the waffle and another beneath the flower decor on the plate. The wait isn't as long as you might expect. When my friends and I joined the waitlist around 11:30am, the tablet indicated an hour wait. However, we received a text 8 minutes later notifying us that our seat was ready. Also, parking mainly consists of street parking in this area.
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Undoubtedly the finest huevos rancheros I've ever tasted! The ambiance is consistently fantastic. It's a charming spot for a brunch outing with your friends or your special someone.
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Adorable brunch and date spot. Love the restaurant name and the food is pretty good here. Wait times can be long but you can also visit their sister restaurant "Met Him At A Bar" down the road.
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Cute ambience, the food was delicious and service was excellent! I would definitely recommend this to anyone
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Cute brunch spot in a convenient location to meet my friends coming from all different parts of the city.  Although they're known for their waffles (and those should be ordered) they have so many other options for both breakfast and lunch.  There was about a 30 minute wait at 1:00 on a Saturday but wait times seemed to be winding down once we were seated.I tried the grain bowl and the waffle with berries. Loved them both! The grain bowl had a bit of everything and felt pretty light and healthy. We split the waffle for dessert and it was perfectly sweet and satisfying. Also tried a lovely lavender latte.I think my only complaint is that the tables outside are kind of close together so it can be a little awkward but perhaps the tables inside are better spaces.Parking was easy to find in the residential streets and it was free for two hours.
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: They have the best everything here. I love this place!! The lattes are so good. I love the Thai chicken and waffles... it's not too spicy. I also love their dinner as well.
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: i'd had this on my list for a long time & finally gave it a shot today. the atmosphere was really cute & cozy. service was awesome, really attentive and super kind & upbeat. the food.. i think it's hit or miss! i ordered the crispy chicken sandwich which was a bit dry for my taste, i wasn't getting much of the green curry aioli.. the chicken itself was just okay.my boyfriend got the breakfast burrito & had about the same reaction--no complaints but also not much to rave about.the flinstones waffle however was REALLY delish. we kept talking about it throughout the day, the whipped cream & ice cream were perfect, creamy, great additions to tie everything together. if we go back, i plan on trying out the other waffles they had that looked really yummy.
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: i love the lavender coffee latte and waffle eggs benedict a lot they are awesomely greatest hangover food and nap after
Address: 759 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Wow I have no words! This place was amazing. Food was amazing, I have no complaints. And although prices were a bit steep, it was worth it! Don't get coffee here though, I'm sure their agua frescas good. The service was phenomenal, shout out to our very attentive servers!The vibes were immaculate and honestly can pass as semi casual. I would definitely come back, maybe a staycation at the hotel.We very much recommend the flan pancakes!!!!! And their tortillas!Tommie Hotel valet is $20 or street parking. Don't mistake it to Mama Shelter valet.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Came here for my birthday since it's within walking distance from Bar Lis... I've tried TAO before but wanted to see what else was in the area.FLAVOR (4.5/5):1. 1/2 DOZEN OYSTERS: Yummy and fresh. Would definitely order again, but hard to share with 4 people. Maybe I should have gotten more...2. PAPAS BRAVAS: The potatoes were whole and super delicious. Really soft inside and flavor wise it hit the spot. I've found that you can never really go wrong with ordering Papas Bravas.3. PESCADO ZARANDEADO: The whole fish was yummy and came with 2 sauces. In my opinion, the sauces are a must! For both the entrees (this and the Cochinita Pibil) they come with tortillas so you can make your own taco. I thought this part of the experience elevated the food and allows you to adjust the dish to your own liking. I didn't like the whole fish as much as the Cochinita Pibil in terms of flavor. As far as whole fish goes, the sauces are what made this dish unique, but I preferred Zinqué's and Bavel's whole fish better.4. COCHINITA PIBIL: This was a flavor explosion! The meat was so tender it just fell apart and honestly it didn't need anything else - it was perfect with the pickled vegetables all rolled up in a tortilla. The highlight of the night.5. CHURROS: The churros were just okay; I wasn't in love with them in the same way as the Cochinita Pibil.SERVICE (5/5):Service was good!AMBIENCE (5/5):Beautiful atmosphere, perfect for date night or if you just want to have a nice night out. Somewhat of a jungle vibe with lots of plants and fans (lots of fans!) blowing breezes in every which direction. They had someone come by doing fire performances, which definitely elevated the ambience.TAKEAWAYS:I would definitely come back to try more of their menu - if everything is on the same level as the Cochinita Pibil then Ka'teen really tops the ranking in terms of restaurants in the area. Honestly, for ambience alone Ka'teen is worth a visit.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Such a gorgeous outdoor dining space! Came here for a friend's birthday dinner and the service was great. Usually with pricier and more aesthetically pleasing restaurants, we tend to lower our expectations for the quality of food -- maybe we're just used to being charged astronomical prices for mediocre dishes. But everything we ordered here was incredible. Each dish was unique, hearty, and so flavorful. I would recommend coming here with a large group so you can get the chance to try more dishes.. and the ambience is unbeatable, especially on a warm summer night. Would definitely come back!!
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This restaurant is absolutely beautiful. Believe the reviews were it tells you it gives tulum vibes. I recently went on a Saturday evening for a friends birthday dinner and it was definitely an experience. Great food, drinks, and entertainment.Our server Monique was attentive, patient and very informative about each dish as this was our first time there.I'm only giving four stars because I do believe it is overpriced :( but I'm starting to see that as a trend here in LA. For a party of 6 the bill was over $800 w/ gratuity, taxes and their HLA fee. We all had about one drink each, our own dish and shared 2 appetizers so I thought this was a bit pricey.I would love to come back during the day time and grab brunch.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I agree with other reviewers that the prices for the food and drinks here are pretty extravagant. My husband and I wanted to try KA'TEEN out as part of our celebration for our one year wedding anniversary. We ordered the ceviche, the short rib, and the yucca fries as well as the pana cotta for dessert. Short rib and yuca were delicious, so we didn't mind paying the prices for that. Our ceviche was pretty much all small pieces of mango. We maybe had 10 small cubes of fish. For 24 dollars I would definitely pass. Small drinks at 20 bucks a piece...I know it's Hollywood but it's pretty steep. The panna cotta was supposed to be tres leches inspired but it literally just tasted like yogurt. Like a lot of reviewers said, you are paying for the ambience. It is pretty, however our table was a little weird the way one of us was sitting really high up and the other very low across the table. Check your bill too, because they had charged us a six dollar "champagne greet" which maybe was supposed to be for our anniversary, but I guess the server forgot. Then they also add 5 percent for employee healthcare charge...just a heads up. We won't return, but it was fun to try out. Our fav restaurants in LA are Michelin stared with epic views, dishes, ambiance, and impeccable service. They don't charge for champagne greetings for special occasions and they actually remember to do it! And what's hard to believe is they aren't near this expensive...We'll be sticking to our tried and trues for special occasions.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: It's like being transported to Tulum so you are definitely feeling the vacation vibes but just in the middle of Hollywood.   The entire restaurant is outdoors nestled within between a couple buildings.  The service was impeccable and the food was top notch.  Had the potato taquitos, campechana ceviche, camarones ala Diablo and the short rib.  The flavors from every dish were 5 star and the presentation elevated each dish.We even enjoyed a cocktail or two and watched a beautiful fire dancer entertain the guests.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great spot. Entrance a bit hidden between 2 hotels but magnesite with all the green once you walk in. Service was good. Food truly amazing! We had the lamb- super juicy and perfectly cooked! The cauliflower dish was generous and delicious as well! The color was unique. Definitely recommend this place for a date or family.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Went  Ka'teen for dinner with friends. The restaurant has very Tulum Vibe great ambiance. The food was delicious and very flavorful. The service was good. Drinks were average.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This place is definitely a date night place ... Too bad they didn't have the archway the time we went... we had 2 orders of steak, mole chicken, el pastor cauliflower, mushroom birra, cheviche, guacamole ... everything was exceptional especially our drinks. This is good place for vegetarian.
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Step into a magical jungle with BOMB food! It is an entire enchanting experience. The food had so many flavors that blended so well! The ceviche was really good but the guacamole was the BEST! We also tried the Bronzino, lamb and chicken. Everything was delicious. The staff was friendly and attentive. Great place for a date night, friends night or work event! Bathrooms were super cute too!
Address: 6516 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: 클러빙 후 오전 네시쯤 갔는데 사람 엄청 많았어요 메뉴가 다양함. 특갈비탕 진짜 맛있어요 고기 실하게 들어감 부드럽고 맛남 국물도 맛남 양 많음 바나나 우유 짱
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This is definitely one of the better locations in terms of food but not service. It has always been busy with a long wait time. Majority of the workers who we have interacted with are curt and rude. They do not explain how ordering works at all either on the menu or directly but expect you to know and then are clearly annoyed at you for when you have questions. We felt super rushed every single time we talked to a worker.Aside from the service, food was amazing. We got the Galbijjim and two soups. Overall, I would rather go to the other locations where the workers treat you better and you don't feel rushed.
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The food is 5 stars but the serve was non existent. Two party members ordered Yang Ji Sulung Tang and were served in 5 minutes. The other two members of party ordered Galbi Jjim to share, 40 minutes later we were not served, Two other table were served before us, there was only one table before us so it was not busy. I had to go to counter to ask for water and inquire about my order. There was no apology and said rudely that he would bring water to our table . After eating I wave to lady at counter and she saw me but turned her back. Went to counter to ask for check and to go boxes.  Still no apology, just said there was a shift change and confusion??? We were there from 4 to 5 pm on Sunday. Other tables were served that came in after us . Food is wonderful but service came with attitude.
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This popular dish was excellent and so much fun! Usually people get this dish with cheese on top and a server cones out with a torch and lights it on fire for a really big flame show! I'm allergic to cheese so we got it without but it still very very good. The ban chan was all really nice with the dish. They will give you an option for white rice or brown rice, we went with brown rice and what we got was really really good black rice. So I highly recommend the "brown" rice with your dish. The restaurant is not very big so be prepared to wait in line for a table. But the wait is so worth it.
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: You come here either for galbijjim or salungtang.. we got both. Probably would have been fine with just the galbijjim. There were four of us and we got the large and added cheese. The meat just melted off the bone and we did the spice level medium. We wanted to get the ssalungtang because we needed some type of soup to balance the meal. I suggest getting something smaller. The galbijjim was sufficient for the 4 of us alone.We came around lunch time and it was full. Didn't have to wait too long. There's valet parking so bring some cash. Parking is better here than the other location. You. An always Uber too.
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: They have four soups that are $12 each ($13 if takeout) until 10:30 AM that are very good. Very clean, hearty portion, and VERY TASTY. I normally get multiple breakfast specials and eat for days. Totally recommend.
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: We tried Sun Nong Dan's Koh Galbi Jjim Specialty, their signature dish, with an extra addition of cheese and rice rolls. The unique taste was outstanding, and it arrived hot and fresh, satisfying all of us.The dramatic fire explosion and the mesmerizing sight of the cheese melting added a fun element to our dining experience.The tenderness of the meat and the explosion of flavors in the entire dish were truly impressive.Considering we were a group of three, the portion size was just right, and we thoroughly enjoyed every bite. A highly satisfying meal!
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I got the a spicy Korean stew, which was extremely spicy for me, even though I can manage my heat fairly well.The side dishes were amazing and tasted so fresh, I was so happy.Service was fast and it is a nice, hip, and clean restaurant
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Multiple locations but went to the one on Western Ave. Looks newish, bright, vibrant, and good offerings on soups. However, we came for 1 thing and 1 thing only. We ordered the medium sized $85 Koh Galbi Jjim that came with Braised Beef Short Ribs, Black Ribs, Ox tail, and rice cakes. It came with a few banchans and rice. It is large and does take time to make. We did add cheese for $8 so they blow torch the cheese to melt at the table. You can also let them know your spice level, we chose "2" medium level. It was delicious, filling, and a lot meat can be found!
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: went last week with two friends and food was really good. however when we arrived to get seated they just kept ignoring us walking past us until a gentleman finally sat us. they wouldn't go near us to call them over the entire time we were there. lastly, once we were about done eating, one of our friends was clearly still reaching out of her dish to eat when the waiter comes and snatches her plate away and said "everyone done?"she didn't have a chance to finish her food, he was being super rudeafter the plate snatching he still suggested us to give him a huge tip.also this place is quite noisy
Address: 710 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Whatched yelp review and visit first time here.saturday dinner. so busy at that time. every one looks busy.but we got the point and enjoyed meal. our server was kind&take care us.thank you and must be coming back.
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Found this spot for a late night korean meal on a chilly night after a going to a comedy show. Was excited to have some large intestines and ordered what I thought I will be getting based on the picture on the menu but instead, I was served with a small plate and the portion is very underwhelming and disappointing. I spoke to one of the servers to clarify about the portion size comparing the pic on the menu and got the impression that they were basically falsely advertising. Our server only checked in once to refill water and didn't come back anymore to see what else we needed. As much as I love korean food, I will unfortunately charging this to experience and won't be returning.
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Such great service and amazing quality meats!! Thank you for the experience. Came as a party of 5, seated fast for a weekend dinner; servers were very nice and accommodating.
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: We ordered the small Beef Combo which was more than enough for 2 people. Meat is of good quality.Service - servers were friendly and attentive, and they  grill the meat for you; reservations accepted; wait time to be seated not too long.Ambiance - nice Vibe; clean; good lighting and not too loud.Would definitely come back the next time I visit LA.
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Meats were really solid, borderline great, but the true hero was the cold noodle soup - probably the best I've ever had tbh. Service was good too even though they were super busy! It was very loud with some mildly weird music stream going on. Will definitely be back! Overall a good fallback when Ahgassi is too busy!
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Another great Korean BBQ spot right next to  Ahgassi Gopchang who also seems to specialize in intestines. Nobody in our group of 6 were interested in the intestines bit there was plenty of other dishes to choose from. We ordered the large beef combo and 2 seafood pancake. Everything was delicious but I did feel the combo was a little smaller than expected. I would say the large combo is for 4 people plus you'll likely have to order a few add-ons or an appetizer.Valet parking is in the back, you can access off of Harvard before 6th.Another great thing is that they do take reservations which I do recommend.
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Enjoyed the Prime Boneless Short Ribs, Kimchi Stew w Pork Broth and Buckwheat Noodles in chilled beef broth. Food was great and the service was solid. It was our first time here and needed some extra menu explanation. Ambiance was good.
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I really enjoyed the fresh meat and daechang. Thank you for being so kind and attentive to the server SIM in charge. This is a restaurant I will recommend a lot and go back to.
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: If I had to choose between King Chang and Agassi Gopchang, I would choose this place! Practically no wait and the quality of the food was really goodWe did a combo set for intestines and did gopchang and daechang. This combo came with side dishes and a choice of Korean stew.Highly suggest you visit this place if you're in town!
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This place is amazing! Love the vibe. It's very casual and fun. Amy, our server, was such a pleasure. She cooked the meats perfectly and took great care of us. I bring all my friends to King Chang and will continue to do so! Thanks Amy and team!!
Address: 3732 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This is the WORST omakase experience I've ever had.Do NOT get the omakase. It's 150 per person and basically the chef just picks out the dishes from the menu a la carte, which is like 4 items.So you lose the opportunity to pick which items you want from menu AND it's upcharged.I could have ordered those 4 items at HALF the cost. I feel very tricked.The wagyu tasted like regular steak that I could have made at home. Very dissapointed.
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: My husband and I have now been to all 3 locations (Scottsdale, Las Vegas, LA) and the LA one is the WORST. We attended 9/15/23. The server changed his attitude real quick when my husband and I said we were not ordering alcohol. He ignored us while we ate, forgot to give us the check at the end and it was obvious he prioritized tables that ordered alcohol. We ordered the $225.00 tomahawk steak medium rare and it came out blue. Barely warm. We sent it back to be cooked more, and it came out 15 minutes later well done. Don't order the shishito peppers. They're $16.00 for a hot, soggy bite of seeds. The ambiance is the same in all three restaurants as far as dim lighting, borderline obnoxious music and too many plants per square foot but on top of that, LA location is packed with tables, dying plants and staff at evert corner that is doing everything except smiling and moving to the right when you're trying to pass them. Guests should have the right of way. The nicest person about the experience was the bouncer. And the valet guys were nice and doing their jobs efficiently. The Scottsdale location is by far the best and the only one we will be recommending and returning to.
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Food was delicious and the cocktails were outstanding! It was our first time for a birthday dinner, and I was impressed, especially with their customer service and stunning decor. Our server, Christina, was fantastic and checked on us frequently. I will definitely be back!
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: I'm giving this place 3 stars because the heat is absolutely absurd inside. I could barely eat my hot food. I was constantly sweating and having to step outside. Being hot makes me lose my appetite. On top of being hot, there was a fire dancer inside tossing her flames around. I stepped outside at least 3 different times.
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Great..Great..Great.....Ambiance is off the chain. The food is good. Drinks are cool.
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Pure pleasure of the senses!!!!!The house spicy margarita was fire....literally.   They light it on fire.  It's delicious as well.  5/5The guacomole was nice.  I liked the plaintain chips.  4/5My carne asada was juicy and flavorful.  5.5The carrots were too sweet for me.  Probably the only dish I didn't like.  2/5We liked the corn.  4/5Ceviche was decent but needed more flavor.  3/5They had live music and a dj spinning.  Wonderful people watching spot!!!My only gripe is that they agreed to providing our group separate checks but refused once we arrived.  The waitress said she would do something nice for us to make up for it, which did not happen.  Broken promises but still great food and ambiance.
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Came here for you birthday and was amazed at how great everything was. From the food to the decor it was absolutely stunning.
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: I've been to several restaurants in Beverly, but this one is by far the worst I've ever experienced. It took the waitress 26 minutes to take our order and 15 minutes to bring my drink. It was my mother's birthday that day, and I ordered the a la roca-shrimp, which had a peculiar odor, along with a side of macaroni and cheese, which was really bland. It saddens me the most that she didn't enjoy her food. A waste of my money
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Visited the location on a weekend morning. Wasn't as busy as I thought it would be. It was dark and looked nice inside. Our server wasn't really attentive to our group. I ordered the salmon and it was delicious, well seasoned and the spinach paired really nice with it. Unfortunately there were flies that kept swarming near our table even though the window was closed, tainting our experience.
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: We love toca madera and the flaming drinks. Such a fun place to go for a girls night out or date night or to show off the LA scene when you have visitors in town. Lots of taco options as well! Highly recommend
Address: 8450 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Absolutely recommend this place. It's Asian and Korean with a twist - everything is plant based and incredibly tasteful.The kimchi pizza is delicious. Incredible 5-star customer Service. Friendly and fast.The lemonade is deliciously refreshing. So many bonus points to the staff serving on the picket line.Seek it out. Go try. You can't go wrong with any item here.
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Excellent food and atmosphere. Upscale vegan and vegetarian cuisine. Pizzas and pastas and happy hour wine, delicious balanced appetizers. Allergen friendly and incredible seasonal flavor.Seasonal menu changes all the timeStaff is so friendly and accommodating. Small restaurant with an amazing local team. We love dining here - great for date night and with friends. Don't miss it!
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Everything was amazing. I couldn't believe it was all vegetarian. Everything we ordered blew us away. I'll definitely be back. Oh and service was top notch too!
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Olivia is my new favorite restaurant in Koreatown LA! I oftentimes go to grab a bite to eat with girlfriends, and it's also great for a date spot. The ambiance and decor are really feminine and pretty, the ambiance is super approachable, and the food is fantastic (I personally love the pizzas)! It's hard to find vegetarian options that actually TASTE good, but Olivia somehow achieves this. They apparently get all of their produce from local farmer's markets, so you know that you are eating super high quality and fresh ingredients. And on top of all this, the staff is so wonderful. They are super attentive, friendly, and know the menu inside out. Definitely check this restaurant out if you are looking for a new spot!
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: This place was amazing! Ordered the mushroom pizza, melon salad, fried olives, everything was so good! Ambiance was really cool, great wine selection, and staff was super friendly.
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Food was amazing! Within every bite you can taste all the different flavors in the dish. I'm not a fan of olives but I definitely recommend trying the fried olives. The melon in the salad was juicy and refreshing. Good wine selection for happy hour. For my main I had Cavatelli pasta it was so good I forgot to take a picture of it. For desert I had the horchata rice pudding. It was really good as well! Ambiance was good and clean. Service was fast, it is a order through your phone place which some people might not like. I didn't mind it. I would definitely go back to try different things on the menu.
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: :I recently dined at Olivia and she was mind blowing!!  The ambience was enchanting, with cozy seating and beautiful decor. Their commitment to using fresh ingredients from the farmers market every week was evident in the vibrant flavors of each dish. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable, making the experience even better.  I AM NOT A VEGAN but definitely had a good time with my fiends and simply appreciated the great food,  its  a must-visit! Hence why I put so much time into review lol
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Disclaimer: Before I get into more details about Olivia, a thing to note is this place does not have traditional waiters/waitresses taking your orders and instead utilizes an online ordering service where you can order at your own pace and charge within the same group/table. The system works like at the bar where you have an open tab and when you're done ordering, you can close it and pay directly through the phone. If you aren't as technologically savvy, the staff is friendly and accommodating too!I booked a reservation for my girlfriend and me for a cute little anniversary dinner on a Sunday and the vibes were on point from the get-go. Our waitress greeted and congratulated us on our anniversary. She was very thorough when it came to describing how to use the ordering system and any recommended dishes. All of the staff were very lively, accommodating, and really friendly to the point where I felt like I was revisiting some old friends again.For the food, we ordered fried olives, crispy chicken, mushroom pate, housemade focaccia, and mushroom soy sausage pizza.-Fried Olives is really good and what everyone says about it is true. I am not a person who enjoys olives but this was a positive flavor surprise. GET IT!- Crispy Chicken is fried mushrooms and the seasoning gives them a similar nostalgia to eating KFC popcorn fried chicken. I loved it, especially with the pickled onions on the side and the dipping sauce it came with.- The mushroom soy sausage pizza was great, especially with the vegan, melty cheese topped with arugula for a peppery finish. We initially weren't able to order pizza since the waitress notified us there were some complications with the dough, thus pizzas were not available to order via the online ordering system.
