However, the problem seemed to be resolved and the waitress told us that the pizza may look a bit smaller due to the dough, but still the same portion used daily.-Lastly, we were surprised at the end with a complimentary olive oil cake with a dark, cherry sauce and topped with vanilla ice cream. The cake was subtly sweet, not dry, and tasted bright combined with the cherry and ice cream.Overall, we came as guests and left as family members. Everyone there was so nice and attentive. There was especially one of the waitresses who also checked up on us multiple times at the end, got to know us through some small talk, and brought good vibes in an endearing auntie way. Not only that, the music was exactly my type of jam. I love this place for its ambiance, friendly staff, and for having the best vibes. I'll definitely be back soon whenever I'm in LA.
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: The food is delicious! Definitely try a bit of everything. The ambience is just as good too!
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: We came here on a Saturday evening. I was able to make a reservation through Yelp super easy. When we arrived it was maybe half full. It looks s a smaller place, they do take walk ins but I'd probably make a reservation just in case. The inside is very charming and has nice decor. The wait staff was very friendly and helpful. We started with the fried olives which were absolutely incredible. Such a great mixture of the saltiness of the fried olive, the creaminess of the ricotta and sweetness of honey. You can also make this dish vegan by substituting the honey for agave. Next we had the mushroom soy sausage pizza. All I can say is omg!!! It was so good. The crust was perfect, light and crispy without being burnt. It was to die for. I have been looking for a good pizza and this place delivered!!Another bonus, there is a parking lot which wasn't packed and didn't require valet like alot of places in K town.I would highly recommend this restaurant!!!
Address: 205 S Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I love eating here with my wife and kids the owner Filippo is very knowledgeable about the wine and food.  I can't wait to eat here again.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Deserves a lower review but...Lobster pasta (Spaghettone) was over-salted, and lobster pieces were tiny. Compare to existing pictures on yelp, think 1/3 the size.Tagliatelle was watery, flavor was off.Carbonara was overcooked, egg was scrambled, and guanciale was burnt.I will say the pastas were cooked al dente. Otherwise, very disappointing.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We had a lovely family meal early this evening. Started with the calamari mixta and Caesar salad with anchovy dressing. It was lovely and rich. We got a pizza for the kids. The cheese was amazing. The New York steak bone in along with the spaghetti Bolognese all of it was fantastic. Our server suggested a perfect red wine pairing. He treated us like family the service was impeccable. We ended with Limoncello and a piece of tiramisu. Sorry I was too busy eating for pictures.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The service here is amazing. The maitre d was funny and welcoming. He was so delightful that we pretty much ordered everything he recommended: tricolore salad, pappardelle short rib, and black ink pasta. The dishes were very tasty and I can see why they're so popular. I like that we got a balanced mix of a light salad, beef and seafood. Everything paired well with pinot noir. You'll want to make a reservation because it starts getting crowded early.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Don't order take out ! Every time I order take out it's a fail today there was a hair and I had to throw it out and everything about the lasagna was disgusting too salty , hair in it and dry and the bechamel was chunky just not fresh or made with love but when dining in it's amazing . This is the a 3rd time I ordered take out and was beyond disgusted and disappointed.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: My first time in the hood to Osteria mama and it was impeccable. The pizza was to die for. The wine list is amazing! I will be back it is walking distance from my house which is a plus.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: ** First time trying Osteria Mamma **Wine menu is extensive and impressive!!We also made a reservation on a Saturday FOR Saturday.Parking was a breeze - found a spot right in front of the restaurant and so did our pals meeting us.Everyone is talking about the complementary bread... I feel like the idea of the complementary bread is wonderful but the bread itself isn't great. What is great is if your dining pal is ordering something with pink sauce... and then you can save the bread for the pink sauce but other than that, the bread is a big MEH and could totally step it up.Our waiter was from Italy - we thought this was wonderful! However... he interrupted my wife a few times and was actually kind of rude to her. Wasn't the coolest thing I experienced... he was attentive to our party but the rudeness was a little off-putting.The prices for the dish are very high considering the portions are on the smaller side. I had the salmon... it was cooked perfect but I felt like when I read the menu I was receiving something on the side vs just a tomato salad. For some reason, I interpreted this as a salmon with a tomato salad and a spinach salad. Turns out there were pieces of the spinach on top of the salmon - but it wasn't phrased as a sauce/or that it would be a salmon flavor addition.As I looked around, it seemed everyone's portion was small... which is fine (I suppose even more fine for fine dining) but for the prices, it just didn't seem worth it. I think my wife had like 20 small gnocchi's... my pal had 5 ravioli's and the lasagna was just TOO CHEESY.It was a bit warm inside the restaurant - and they have these lamps on the tables instead of lighting the restaurant with the restaurant's lighting. I feel like the lamps got in the way and some tables had cool lighting... some had warm lighting... it was an odd touch.Bathrooms need an update - the decor looks very out of place and there was a Christmas decoration. Why? No clue.I enjoyed the food - the tastes were delicious but for overall experience I am really a 3 star teetering a 4 star. We were all hungry after! And for a salmon for $38, I really didn't anticipate being hungry after but I am glad to have found a new restaurant... that is always the highlight.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This is hands down one of the best Italian restaurants in Los Angeles. I have been dining here for 15 years now. The decor is simple and understated with generational photos of the family that run the restaurant. Ask your server to point out who is who and hear the history of this incredible, hard working family. Chances are the young ones in the photos have grown up and taken a role in the operation of this family gem.On to the food...The menu has grown over the years adding dishes that are a bit more contemporary while also keeping the original items too. For starters they recently added an Arancini dish loaded with saffron infused arborio rice and short rib. It is super crispy on the outside and beautifully decadent on the inside. The dish is accompanied by three incredible sauces to soak up. Additionally I have always loved their Frittura Mista and the Polipozzo to start with. The salads are beautiful and fresh and delicious.The Pasta is on another level here. All of these dishes will make you feel like the namesake Momma still prepares them herself, may she RIP. My favorite is the Tonnarelli alla Carbonara, the sauce is thick and creamy yet delicate and the guanciale is cooked to a crispness that just makes it pop in your mouth. Another favorite is the Bigolo all'Amatriciana, the pasta is thick and filled with a beautiful texture and the guanciale is mouth watering in the san marzano tomatoes it is cooked down with.For mains we have always enjoyed the Bisteconna and the Il Branza, both of which always come out perfectly cooked and leaving us wanting more, which is hard because these dishes are large and worth sharing.Now I am no wine aficionado, however the wine menu is incredible. They feature mainly Italian wines with a BOOK that gives the region the grapes were grown and define's each areas practices and tastes. It's a history lesson of wine really. Do not let this intimidate you. The servers know each wine almost by heart and can tell you, based on your likes or dislikes, which will best suit you. They are currently offering a $20 wine flight that is unbeatable. Do not pass on it!I truly love this place so much and am so happy this family has kept their Momma's traditions alive. It brings me so much happiness just stepping into this place.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Wow the fact that I don't feel bloated after eating pasta and pizza is mind blowing for me! The servers were kind and always checking up on my table. The restaurant was a bit hot inside but that did not matter at all. Definitely want to come back again!
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We split the squid ink pasta and carpaccio for lunch with my wife. Everything was delicious and server really seemed to know the menu and care about quality.
Address: 5732 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The place was beautiful, perfect place for a date nite.  The staff was kind and attentive, great service.   the food, what can I say about it.  there was not anything that disappointed.   The salmon was crispy on the outside but flacky in the inside, YUMMY!!!!, seasoned well, the mac and cheese cheesy and the peanut butter cake is definetly worth trying.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: How can youGo wrong it's beauty andEssex. Great for a date night. Definitely make reservations or walk in for a drink at the bar.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: My husband and I had a reservation Saturday evening. We arrived at 5:45pm and we were seated at 6pm in the upstairs dining room to the right. We were the first party to be sat there. The ambiance was nice, darkly lit and romantic. Very LA fine dining vibe. More parties were seated in this dining room section and the noise definitely picked up, it was hard to hear yourself talk.Honestly, I was ready to give this restaurant 1 star and leave before ordering our food. We waited almost 25 minutes for someone to take our order. We watched 4 parties who came after us get their orders taken AND we watched them get their drinks and food delivered to their table. Not sure if they were under staffed tonight, but this was very frustrating since we had to make our showtime for the Pantages and I was worried if our food would come out in time. We made eye contact with two staff who would circle around the dining room, but they seemingly were just in charge of refilling water.My husband talked me down and finally, our waiter approached our table. My husband politely informed him that we have been waiting for a while to place our order and would have to leave soon to catch our show. Our waiter kindly apologized and he did do his best to remedy the situation.As soon as we put in our orders, I got up to use the bathroom and by the time I got back, all the food was already there on our table. They even gave us an extra complimentary dish of meatballs. This gesture and the swiftness of getting our food quickly to us was very much appreciated.We ordered:- Braised chicken meatballs 5/5: juicy, tender meat and strong flavor with creamy truffle sauce- Classic Thick Cut Filet 4.5/5: the steak on its own was very flavorful and came out perfectly medium rare, sauces were just okay- Baguette with garlic chive butter 3.75/5: bread was warm and soft with a crunchy crust; butter was creamy and easy to spread, but the taste kind of reminded me of AMC popcorn butter which isn't a bad thing- Mac and cheese with shrimp and lobster 2/5: Al dente pasta, saucy had a nice creamy consistency but there was absolutely no flavor to it; the only flavor came from the lobsterWe also ordered drinks. The Beauty Elixir was just okay, it tasted just like a glass of champagne but with a frothy consistency from the strawberry and cucumber pulp yet no hint of the fruits' flavor. My husband liked his drink though the Spicy Crush.Overall, I strongly give this restaurant 3 stars. The food borders between decent and good. I don't think it's worth its very expensive price point to warrant a second visit. Our server was kind and tried his best to make up for our situation. I just really wish the restaurant would have a better system of attending to guests once they are seated in the order they arrive.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We had visited the bar and lounge of this beautiful restaurant in Hollywood before. I really liked the strong and tasty cocktails. Of course the cocktail prices have increased drastically after pandemic. Champagne prices were not bad to my surprise. They offer impressive gluten free and vegan menus. We really liked the eclectic dishes with an Asian fusion twist.The patio seating was very relaxing and spacious with beautiful potted plants. It was jazz Sunday but the entire restaurant was kind of empty. They didn't even need to open the upstairs dining area. For food we decided on fresh oysters, Thai shrimp, Branzino, filet mignon and broccolini. The food tasted fantastic and so flavorful. The portions were on the bigger side. We loved the dessert wheel in the end and it was fun to try them all. Our drinks were very well made and tasty too. We really enjoyed our dinner with jazz music in the background. It was a lovely evening for hubby and I. Our server was so friendly and attentive, in fact all staff were very welcoming and pleasant.I was glad that Beauty & Essex didn't disappoint, Tao group is really up to their game! We will definitely be back whenever we want a special dinner in Hollywood!
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great ambience. Our server was really nice and engaging. The tomato soup dumplings were delicious, unique spin on the classic grilled cheese & tomato soup. Mexican street ravioli was okay, expected a little bit more in flavors but it was still good. Entree wasn't to bad, had the Hanger Steak. It was cooked just right and had some good flavor. Something felt like it was missing though, nevertheless I ate all of it. If you are celebrating a birthday or an occasion and looking to have fun while sipping cocktails and want to share some bites with your friends and/or family you'll have fun here. Can get a bit loud but it's because everyone is laughing and enjoying the great music in the background. Parking is tricky but they have valet in the back of restaurant. Entrance is in the back as well. Great spots throughout for selfies and group pics.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: My review is solely based on a dessert and cocktails experience. The ambience and service were great. The cocktails were nothing out of the norm, so the satisfaction to cost ratio was like 2:5. For dessert we had the wonder wheel and it honestly tastes like they threw together a bunch of premade deserts from Costco, this I don't recommend.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I had the most incredible night here! This was my first time having dinner at Beauty and it will not be my last. Everything was amazing- from the ambience to the food. Our server Jimmy was the best! He made sure my sister had a great birthday dinner and was so helpful the entire night.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: WOW!! Our dinner was absolutely amazing! Everything from the food, drinks, and ambiance was top tier! Our server Jimmy provided the best service and was beyond any expectations I could of imagined. This was my first time and now my favorite restaurant.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This spot got all the good vibes- the drinks, music and ambience are all top notch. The crowd was definitely loving the mixes and singing to the songs. Very classy. The service is on point. The bf and I are already planning to go back. For drinks: we got the Woodsman and It Pears Well. Both were well crafted.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Good food to snack on and share, good drinks & pretty ambiance. Staff is always friendly.
Address: 1615 Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was delicious! The portions were generous and the owner was super friendly. I highly recommend their shrimp platter which comes with garlic purple rice, crunchy shrimp, and salad. For me, it's 5/5 stars!
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Great service, great people, great food!!!! In an interesting building!  A cool quirky food court in the heart of LA.  The owner/created is great to explain the dishes and cuisine.  We'll definitely be back!!!
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: My partner and I decided to come here after browsing through highly rated restaurants on Yelp and it did NOT disappoint. If anything, I have now left with one of my new favorite places to eat in DTLA! Tim, the owner of Broken Mouth, was the person to take our order, and he was so incredibly kind and friendly! His hospitality alone is an 11/10. We ended up ordering a beef plate and a shrimp plate. We were also given a SPAM musubi and our drinks on the house as it was our first time! It wasn't busy when we came in the late afternoon so we waited roughly 10 minutes for our food. When our food got called out and we unpacked it at our table, we were speechless it all looked so amazing. Not only did it look amazing, it tasted so incredibly wonderful. The shrimp on my palate were nearly as big as my fist and were bursting with flavor. The beef on my partners plate was so tender and flavorful as well! Also, the greens come so well seasoned and the purple rice is perfectly cooked! I would certainly re-order both plates! The complimentary SPAM musubi was also so grand; I will definitely add it to my next order! Overall, if you are in the DTLA area, I highly recommend Broken Mouth. The service, food, and overall quality is worth every penny. The owner, Tim, mentioned he has dreams/goals of opening a sit-down restaurant. Please support this business so he can get there! You will not regret this dining experience!
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Broken Mouth is inside a shared building with alongside a few other restaurants. It's quite peaceful yet lively here despite being in the center of LA. The service we got from Tim (the owner) was amazing! He's one of the kindest and most passionate owners I've met. He went through his entire menu with us, which made figuring out what to get a breeze! I got the beef plate and my fiancée got the shrimp plate, along with spam musubi, and two soft drinks. The food was DELICIOUS! We'll definitely be coming back again not just for the food, but Tim's welcoming and exceptional service. This is a MUST TRY if you're in LA. You won't be disappointed.
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: The only place I know that serves meat jun. If you are not sure what that is, or not sure if you should try this place. When the wife is craving for food from home we will make the trek out here from Yorba Linda just to get that comfort food.
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Got a chance to try out broken mouth and ordered the spam musubi, chicken plate, and beef plate.Spam musibi - 4/5; the seasoning is really flavorful throughout but for me the spam itself was a little too salty and there was too much rice (but we just used it to eat the other plates)Chicken - 5/5; our favorite dish. The chicken was cooked great with a nice char. Perfect with the rice and saladBeef - 3/5 my biggest complaint is there's is not enough beef in the dish. I honestly was confused at first because I could not figure out where the beef was as all I could find was the egg batter. The sauces were really good but for the price of this dish I wasn't impressed.
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Super friendly service, and the food was bombastic. Would def come here again if I'm in the area! Had the meat jun and spam musubi, which were out of this world.
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Best Hawaiian food hands down and the owner Tim is super nice and friendly. They moved to Santee court which has a really cool garage vibe to it. We've been coming here 5 years in a row now and the quality has always remained consistent and taste superb
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: Wooow. So ono!!! I was a bit skeptical at first but all of the good reviews are well deserved. I had ordered take out but there is a super cute eating area. The staff was kind and the owner was present. I really enjoyed every bite. I will be going back!!
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: So ono!!!The food was great; they definitely deserve their #1 rating!  The owner was very nice, too.  He explained the menu, made some recommendations, and gave us a complimentary dessert because it was my son's birthday.Don't miss your chance to eat at Broken Mouth!
Address: 718 S Los Angeles St Los Angeles, CA 90014

Comment: I've heard a lot about Hui Tou Xiang and always wanted to try it!FLAVOR (3.7/5):1. SCALLION PANCAKES: Yummy! Not too oily and really addicing.2. CUCUMBER SALAD: The cucumber salad was a nice break from the dumplings, but it wasn't anything special3. HUI TOU (Beef): This was good! Crispy and yummy. Very filling4. VEGETARIAN PANCAKES: These were also good!5. XIAO LONG BAO: Not the best xiao long bao I've ever had, but yummy. At this point I was starting to get dumpling'd out and everything blurred together.6. THREE FLAVORED DUMPLINGS: I'm not a huge fan of surf and turf and I would probably skip this one next time, but that's just personal preference.7. SPICY PORK WONTON: We had to try this one since all the reviews talked about the Spicy Pork Wonton! It was also yummy, but I think I prefer Little Fatty's wontons.SERVICE (5/5):Service was good!AMBIENCE (4/5):Nice atmosphere - for a while they were playing 2000s emo music then switched to R&B once it got later into the night. Good for casual dinner or date night.PARKING (1/5):Street parking is atrocious. During a weekday you can find parking but all of it is paid. I imagine on weekends it's worse.TAKEAWAYS:I liked Hui Xou Tiang and it's nice to have a spot specifically for dumplings! The main downside is parking.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Terrible parking since it's right next to Hollywood.The sign and restaurant is semi covered by a tree so makes it hard to notice from the street.Parking at a nearby garage was a flat $20 (Sept 2023)Lots of noodles/wrapping so it fills you up.I liked the thickness and chew of the noodles, would opt for a sauce that had more of a kick/flavor than the pork.Dumplings were all pretty good - liked the pork hui tou the best. Spicy dumplings taste average, beef hui tou was too dense and meaty.Lamb skewers were ridiculously tender, delish, not gamey at all. Best I've had in a long time.Coming back for the beef skewers and pork hui tou.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great option for a pre-show dinner at the Pantages. Great food, awesome staff and casual vibe!
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Would rate higher than 5 starts if I could! I've been back a few times and it never disappoints, all the dishes I've tried are phenomenal- I especially love the spicy pork wontons and beef noodle soup! A little bit on the spicy side with their house chili oil which makes it even better! Food always comes fairly quick, and there's never a wait when I do go. It's small but comfortable inside, there's also a full bar! I also recommend trying their teas, it comes in a glass teapot that's perfect to share with your party. Parking is a bit limited since it is in Hollywood so definitely be prepared to park on the street. Hui Tou's become one of my favorite restaurants in LA and y'all should definitely check it out!
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This place smells soooooo bad. Smells like luoshifen. I love luoshifen, but hate the smell remain in room. Food were ok.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Came soon after they opened for dinner on a weekday and it was pretty dead. I think this place is definitely more of a late-night dinner spot. The staff was super friendly and guided us through the menu. There's few veggie options, it's mainly pork and beef - just something to keep in mind. We ordered three different types of dumplings, the hui tou and xiao long bao being our favorites. Everything was very good, but I wasn't super wowed by anything (except the hui tou!). I would come back again later in the evening when it's more lively.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I've been craving dumplings ever since coming back from Asia. I'm in the San Fernando Valley, so I figured this would be close enough. IF ANYONE CAN RECOMMEND A VEGETARIAN DUMPLING PLACE IN THE SFV, please let me know.Parking: you're in the heart of Hollywood, so you'll most likely cruise the block looking for street parking. The closest parking lot was trying to charge me $20 to park there for one hour. NO THANKS. On a Saturday, around dinner time, I found parking a couple blocks down. Not a huge deal for me, I love to walk.Onto the food: I love that their menu isn't overwhelmingCHICKEN POTSTICKERS: yummy, so yummy that I got a second round of theseVEGETARIAN DUMPLINGS: simple flavor, but tastyCUCUMBER SALAD: meh appetizer. I wouldn't get this again. It doesn't have any unique flavor to it. I could replicate this by chopping some cucumbers at home.SESAME NOODLES: wish I would've read other reviews about these noodles. Super bland. WOULDN'T RECOMMEND. Even adding soy sauce and chili oil didn't help. Sesame flavor was quite muted.Service: good, friendly staffOverall, I'd return for the dumplings, potstickers, and perhaps try a new appetizer and noodle.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Delivery review (to be fair):Below average. Dumplings and wontons mediocre. The noodle dish was dismal. Unremarkable flavors...but at least fresh ingredients.This experience does not entice me to visit the physical location.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Cute ambiance... food was lacking in flavor. You could just tell it wasn't made with love (almost seemed like frozen dumplings). Service was wonderful.
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Really yummy Chinese food! The spicy pork wontons were great about an 8.5/10 and the Noodle dishes are really great portioned! Actually everything portion wise they show lots of love. I think the noodles are great but there's one flavor missing. I still keep going back tho so it's still very good!
Address: 1643 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This spot is such a gem! We had a great lunch here. Started off with the octopus karaage and the breading was on point. I had the short rib bowl for myself and the meat was cooked perfectly, paired with a delicious garlic ginger rice. My friends ordered the chicken curry katsu and katsu sando they were both raving about them. Such simple dishes but the attention to detail and high quality ingredients really made the difference. I didn't realize how different their lunch and dinner menus were so I can't wait to be back for dinner another time!I came on a Saturday afternoon and parking was free in their lot.
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Nice foodHealthy foodReasonable priceFriendly staffCleanGood for casual lunch or dinner
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: This spot took me by surprise! As soon as you walk in, the atmosphere of the restaurant is calm and soothing. The staff and chefs are amazing and take their time and consideration of introducing each plate you order. The head chef has worked at a few Michelin star restaurants so you know the food gon bussin! Highly recommend this joint and gotta call in early to get that reso spot!
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Five stars all around. Came here in a group of 5 on a Saturday night and the service was timely, attentive, and all around good. Loved the food, especially the volcano dish.
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Came up from San Diego and on a whim, realized this place looked really good on yelp, and so I decided to stop in. It's in a fairly unassuming strip mall type of place, but when you walk in, it's immediately obvious that this is a classy establishment. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful with the menu. My understanding is that their dinner is even more extravagant, but given the limitations of our travel plans, had to settle for lunch. Overall, it was delicious. I thought the Unagi and the octopus were both really delicious, and I would love to come back for dinner. Service was excellent if I haven't said so already.
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Absolutely the best food I've had in awhile. Service was great and the food even better. Would definitely come again since the menu is seasonal.
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Must try! Really glad hibi exists in LA. Great upscale casual restaurant with amazing food / plating and ambiance! Enjoyed every single plate so much. The flavors of each dish is really tasty and flavorful-- you know the chefs worked hard to create it. Service was great, really friendly chefs and staffs. Parking is not too bad if you're ok with valet parking. Valet doesn't take card or Venmo so make sure to prepare $3/4 of cash to park. If not, I'm sure there's plenty of street parking available outside! They offer drinks here as well, my favorite non alcoholic drink was this Japanese plum drink. Anyways, thank you hibi for a great experience-- will def be back!
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Four of us dined here together and it was very lovely! The space is small, but it was not very crowded and it felt very comfortable. The sushi here is very high quality and the flavors were complex and delicious. We had the hibi roll, the spicy tuna roll, and an appetizer which is no longer on the menu. The wait staff was kind and talked us through the menu and their recommendations. I would definitely recommend this place! The fish was so fresh and it was obvious they had high quality ingredients.
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: Everything from the food to the service is next level! Chef Daniel's takes on modern Asian cuisine feel fresh and new, like he took the plates I grew up with and turned it into fine dining. I highly recommend the stuffed chicken legs, scallops, and strip tenderloin. Hands down my new favorite place to eat!
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: To start off, the interior is really pretty, modern and clean. Service was great as well, our waitress had a lot of recommendations and she was super attentive. Both the waitress and the owner were very transparent about the composition of the dishes and where ingredients were sourced.For the food, we decided to share the koji butter steak and supplement the meal with more small plates (just make sure that if you want to order the steak, order it first to allot the chef at least 30 min to prepare it). We ordered the Hamachi Crudo, the scallops, and the stuffed chicken wings. The Hamachi crudo was super fresh and the quality of the fish was amazing. The stuffed chicken wings were also pretty good, but I think the next time I come here I'll try something different. On the other hand, the SCALLOPS, were delicious. I grew up vegetarian, and in the past few years, I've never quite warmed up to shellfish, scallops were something I've tried, but never liked. These scallops ended up being so delicious my partner and I ordered a second serving, and the chef was kind enough to add another scallop to our portion! The steak ended up being incredible, but the second most impressive thing was the coal-roasted Korean sweet potato side with some kind of Kimchi sauce. I would eat an entire plate of that, and my partner, who doesn't normally enjoy goguma, would 100% agree.Overall, Hibi was really great and it's been a while since I've had the chance to just sit down and enjoy nice Japanese/Korean food. I'll be coming again to try the miso butter elote and the octopus karaage!
Address: 3121 W Olympic Blvd Ste 103 Los Angeles, CA 90006

Comment: A true culinary masterpiece! The Jokbal! pork trotter dish at La Wangbal is a revelation of flavor and texture.The meat was impeccably tender, a result of skillful preparation that highlights the chef's expertise. Each bite was a harmonious blend of succulence and taste, leaving a lasting impression.The dish's presentation was nothing short of art, a testament to the restaurant's attention to detail. The combination of flavors and spices danced on my palate, showcasing the richness of Korean cuisine.The attentive staff and inviting ambiance added to the overall experience, making it a dining adventure I won't soon forget. If you're seeking a dish that embodies both tradition and innovation, the Jokbal and Bossam at La Wangbal deserves every one of its five stars.
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: We went on a Wednesday night to try this place out. We could tell it had opened recently as we saw the good luck plants standing out at the entrance.We ordered the bossam + spicy jokbal combo as well as the Gamja tang.First the bossam:It was very well cooked. The browning seemed to stand out more here. The morsels were tender and perfectly cooked-I could almost feel the collagen plumping up my skin. The spicy jokbal was a new dish for us. I've had the non spicy kind. We ordered the medium spice level, and it was spicy, but not so spicy that it took away from the taste. The sweetness of the sauce helped cut the spice. There will be some bone in this one for those who have never tried this dish. The Gamja tang was just so-so to my taste buds. One person in my party said he really enjoyed the broth as he felt it had a different depth to it than the others he has had before at different restaurants. I personally felt that it tasted "meatier" or more gamey hence my lackluster response. But the others I was with really liked it.The service is just like any standard Korean restos-to the point and efficient, no loitering and lingering. The food came out quickly and beers/soju were served promptly at our "yeogiyo" requests. This is the kind of service I personally love and prefer!The restaurant has a large tv screen on one wall playing Korean music videos-at least the entire time I was there, that's what was playing. Acoustics make the place a bit loud, so if you are looking for a quiet intimate atmosphere, this is not the place. All in all, pretty good food and service. I'd most likely return again for another round.
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: IT WAS SO GOOD...I had their lunch combo and their bowl... They were both incredibly tasteful and I was not able to speak even one word and my eyes were solely focused on soup and rice... I will be coming back often as possible!
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: It is a restaurant just opened recently. Neat and clean inside. Service is good. We really like the bossam, it is juicy and tasty. For the jokbal, the lean meat is bit dry but the pieces underneath them are very good with the bean paste. They are the pig feet with bone in pieces. The skin is soft and flavorful. The spicy potato beef short ribs soup is good, not too spicy. Definitely it is worth to try.
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: My bf and I were craving jokbal on Friday night and decided to try this new place. We got the medium-sized jokbal platter, and the server gave a side of soondae for us to try. Both the jokbal and the soondae were so good. At first, we thought it was too much food for two, but then ended up finishing everything. They also give plenty of ssam, aka lettuce wraps. The jokbal didn't have a smell at all, and the place felt super clean. I would definitely come back to try their spicy jokbal and their makguksoo.
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Wanted to feed myself and some friends some comforting bossam after a long trip out of town. Reservation for 5 people at 9pm was made easy with yelp. Staff is very friendly and explains what menu items are for first timers.We got large bossam and it was the perfect amount for 5. Bossam came with napa cabbage, kimchi side dishes, and lettuce scallion salad. We also ordered scallion pancake and seafood pancake. My friends really enjoyed them as a starter along with the pork and rice soup. Tastes like home.I have to try the jokbal and gamja tang next time!
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: First time and the last time we come here,we ended up getting the spicy jokbal which took 30 mins to get and when i took that first bite it just tasted like fat with gochujang ,it  was hot garbage for 4s dollars
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Anyone looking for some delicious bossam A.k.A Korean boiled pork wrap. This spot hit homemade dish tasting like your mom or grandma recipe. Pork is super flavorful especially with a dipping sauce. The seafood pancake is a must try. Whatever you do don't skip out on it. Super crunchy, crispy loaded with seafood in every bite. Service is A+ for me. Tending my needs in the food service on point. The place is a little small kind of make your dinning experience feel like home. Overall I'll be coming back for round 2 or 3. One more thing bring friends!! Portion size is large. Good for 3-4 people.
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: We ordered the sundae and small intestine dish yesterday and it was so delicious. The service was amazing and the ladies were very nice. I have to come back for the food and the service this week!
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: 족발정식 (jokbal combo) & 보쌈정식 (bossam combo)The food was delicious!Missing in the picture: 2 된장찌개 (comes with the 족발정식 & 보쌈정식)The lunch specials are $19.99 each.I highly recommend it!
Address: 4251 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This restaurant is such a hidden gem. First off, it's difficult to find this place. I think I walked around the block three times. It's tucked within an alleyway and there's an elevator that takes you to the restaurant. It's beautifully decorated in every way. You can tell they really put effort and thought into the design and little touches. Everything from the furniture to the tableware to the glasses, to the lamps on the tables, it's so well executed and stylish. Very photo-worthy. Lots of seating inside and there's an outdoor section as well where you get a decent view of Hollywood.My friend and I each ordered an aperol spritz, a classic.Toasted Walnut Muhummara: This dip was so comforting and delicious. A nice way to start off the meal. A savory dip served with freshly warm pita bread. Best eaten fresh, once the pita gets cold it gets tough.Shittake Mushroom Larb: This is so fun to look at, and so fun to eat. There's a crunchy rice sheet over each lettuce wrap, each one is filled with mushrooms and tofu. Great combination of flavors and textures as there's some lime in it too. This is a must get and it's great for sharing. It gets a little messy, there will be some drippage on your hands, but it's worth it.Seven-Vegetable Cous Cous: A stunning dish. A bowl with the vegetable medley comes along with a side bowl of cous cous. This was good but my least favorite out of what we ordered.Pacifico Striped Bass: This is a dish that will make you say "wow" when you eat it. It's served in a coconut broth and there are scallop pieces included too. The fish was cooked perfectly and the flavors were wonderful.My friend and I ordered some dessert to finish off the meal...Soft Serve Sundae: This is a dairy-free soft serve ice cream with cubes of matcha cake and it's topped with goji berries and bee pollen. Such a nice way to finish the meal!
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This place is attached to my gym. Super cute interior and healthy delicious vegan offerings. Their espresso martini is decadent.
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I'm here for one reason, our server. Erin. She is the best server we've ever had. Beyond hospitality, it was like being at my best friend's house. She was thoughtful with every recommendation, she anticipated our every need. Love her and would come back just for the service. The food was good. The drinks were okay. But what was lacking in those areas was more than made up for with her as our server. No complaints about the food or beverages, everything was good. But the service is why I'm here leaving this review. The ambiance was also really nice. A beautiful view too.
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Great ambiance and place will be back in. The future ! Ge the dips or trio of dips they are very nice
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: So this was a complete vibe. Came here for dinner to celebrate on of good friend's birthday.. The drinks were on point.. and the service was very attentive and friendly. the rooftop area was a great backdrop for all our pics.. Beautiful views of the city.
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Had my birthday celebration back in July with my dearest friends! We enjoyed the food and the ambience here! Feels like in the other side of the world! The staffs here are very nice and attentive! We had great time taking pictures in the roof next to the pool before our yummy dinner!We had Shiitake mushrooms larb which is really fresh and tasty!TOASTED WALNUT MUHAMMARA is surprisingly good! Love the favor and it goes very well with the warm and soft  flatbread !! Must try!!!GRILLED OYSTER MUSHROOMS is alright! Not bad at all!!ROASTED MARY'S FARM DUCK BREAST is pretty awesome! I usually don't eat duck but the tenderness and the favor of the duck here is superb! It really impressed me!!For the dessert , we had STRAWBERRY PANNA COTTA which is pretty good for my taste bud but the SOFT SERVE SUNDAE is quite a disappointment! ! The restaurant is pretty nice that they have given me a small soft serve with candle for my birthday!!Almost forgot the yummy non alcoholic drinks we had! Passion fruit margarita and Ghia are pretty good! Love them!!!
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We came here for my bday dinner-I called the restaurant asking if I can push the time out, the girl who picked up was extremely rude. I told her I'm texting my sisters right now to figure out how late we would be as I am a prompt person, I was asked to call back rudely once I had a time. I was taken aback not what she said but how she said it. I suggest to hire a person who knows how to speak to the public as first impressions kind of matter, especially in a fine dining establishment like this one. ‍ we were exactly 15 minutes late. I thought it would be swamped, I'd actually feel better on how she the handled phone call, it was not.In terms of food, it was decent.The whipped avocado was yum! I did not care for the roasted beef hummus but interesting to say the least.The hand cut steak tartare was amazingThe Duck was a tad saltyThe American wagyu was apparently medium but really tasted medium rare in my opinion but the yucca fries were so goodOverall it was good, they lost three stars for the initial interaction which kind of put a damper in my evening, and irked me a tad. We also asked if we can sit outside, she said it was reserved...ughh that evening the restaurant looked pretty slow, def not a full house, but whatever. We went outside, def empty seating, thanks for trying to accommodate. For 500 bucks, I expected a tad better service, but our waitress did made up for the rude initial interaction.
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Really loved the rooftop patio. Gorgeous venue, even had a great view of a Hollywood Bowl fireworks show. Food was solid with some being great.Drinks were so-so, trended on the sweet side which isn't for me. Staff was excellent, friendly, laid-back.Been meaning to stop by for awhile and glad I finally did. Will probably head back for brunch, bet the patio is even better on a sunny afternoon.Portion sizes were generous for a higher end restaurant. All-in-all a nice hidden gem.
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Great place! Went their with my fiancé and the customer service was phenomenal.They had many great dishes to choose from,My fiancé and I shared the lamb and it was delicious.Great ambience inside, didn't get to check outside but it did look like a better view. Will definitely be back but we are sitting outside next time (;
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The décor is spectacular : inside, outside, the pool area.The service is very correct and the food very inventive.I went there today and they had this brazilian day going on , serving feijoada, caipirinhas, and brazilian music.The feijoada looked very authentic.I had the 2 courses menu and enjoyed very much my oat banana coconut bowl plus the hamburger.Avery pleasant restaurant with great food!
Address: 960 N La Brea Ave Fl 4 Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: cocktails are amazing. bartenders are very friendly. food is good value and the venue is pretty. best part is validated parking in the plaza lot! where do you get that in ktown?!?!
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The service was amazing, very attentive to our table. I was so excited to try the seafood spaghetti, unfortunately the item is not available on the Sunday brunch menu. I did try the Gnocchi pasta and it was delicious. Highly recommend it. Also, the truffle fries are to die for. The decor is very chic!
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: First time trying this place, and it was ok. The inside looks very nice although it has a weird seating set up with a lounge like area and some high tops by the walls and a big communal table on the middle, and the music was good.Service was fast and friendly, and the bartender was fast and very friendly too, and the drinks were good.We didn't try a lot of things because it was a quick stop, but the food we had was very tasty. They have like a tapas style portions which make them smaller. But the mushrooms with bacon and the pork belly were very good. For sure will be going back to try more items.
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Very cozy and nice ambiance!  A great place to grab cocktails and relax with friends at the lounge.  Good vibe and music.  Excellent service.  Food tasted like Asian style Italian, very tasty and fresh.  French fries were crispy and fresh, unlike some "other" bar restaurants.  However, I think they can do better on their desserts.
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The food was decent. I was very impressedVery modern atmosphereStrongly recommended
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Don't waste your time and money. Food is the worst. Poor quality. All the reviews must be from friends and family.
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This place used to be EMC but they closed down.  It got remodeled and it is very nice inside. Very up scale vibes inside.  Food is alright though. I would say from a 1-5 rating.  food is about a 3.5. Was expecting the food to be great since the inside looked so fancy. Cool place to hang out though for drinks
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: My friends and I really wanted to like this place and support a fellow Korean American new business, so it saddens me to have to write this review.As some other 1 star reviews have mentioned, I was very surprised to see so many 5 star reviews of this establishment - take a deep breath because this is gonna be a long one.We made reservations for 6:45PM for a party of four. Host was friendly when we entered and upon telling her we had reservations she told us it was open seating and to sit wherever we like. They don't have standard tables, it is a "lounge concept" (their words not mine) with one long communal table in the middle and then a bunch of small round tables along each side of the walls. What was strange was as we were waiting for our order I saw the servers putting out 'reserve' signs and arranging tables - did our reservation not fall under that category?Interior is cute, very instagrammable. Dinnerware seemed very cheap. This place hasn't even been open for very long and the paint coating on the silverware was already 80% chipped off, which also made it look dirty. Glassware was sticky.We were excited to try all the food so here's what we ordered:Green Tangerine Ade (-10/10): No flavor. Glass it was served in was extremely sticky all around the outside.Truffle Fries (-10/10):  the most generic brand of frozen fries. Pale, soggy, limp - not crispy at all. Fried in a gang of oil and then tossed lightly in some truffle oil. No aioli, served with ketchup on the saddest looking plate. This was our bad, should've expected something like this for $6.Ceviche (1/10): served in a martini cup, which did not look food safe with 5 christmas tortilla chips. What we ordered did not look like the photo posted on yelp at all. We received less than 1/4 cup of ceviche. Only redeeming quality was the lemon was good.Prosciutto Bruschetta (-10/10): this should not even be called bruschetta. Bruschetta usually consists of grilled bread rubbed with garlic, topped with tomatoes, olive oil, etc. What we got was 2 tiny thick a** pieces of stale bread topped with the biggest mountains of ricotta cheese and two halves of a cherry tomato on top. no seasoning, ricotta tasted sour.Grilled Pulpo (3/10): this only gets a 3 because it was cooked very well, the octopus was tender, but the seasoning tasted like kids applesauce (very sweet) and there was no chimichurri sauce as shown in the photos.At this point we asked our server if it was possible to cancel the rest of our order because we were so disappointed with everything that came out so far. The gentleman came back to tell us it was too late, end of story. It would have been nice if he asked what was wrong with the food or if there was something they could do to remedy the situation.Herb Crisped Lamb Chop (0/10): 0 because we never received it. Actually kind of glad this one didn't come out because all the food we had tasted so far was not good.Tenderloin (3/10): this also gets a 3 because the cook on the steak was tender. Definitely not worth $35. The steak also had an extremely sweet seasoning that tasted like fruit rollups to me. Strange. The same server we asked to cancel our order with brought out this dish and he just seemed over it b/c we had previously asked if it was possible to cancel. The dish comes out with a dome lid with smoke inside - there was no presentation of the food, he dropped the plate on the table, took the lid off and walked away LOL. No description of the steak seasoning on the menu.Lobster Risotto (-10/10): the absolute worst. When the server brought this out I thought it was a korean pancake. It was drowning in a soup of "gambas" oil (also not mentioned on the menu) and was so overcooked it was basically a porridge. Lobster was undercooked and tasted like it had gone bad.My friends and I will normally finish as much as we can because what a waste of food! We're also not the pickiest eaters and are not that hard to please. However, these dishes were quite inedible so we asked for our check. There was another female server who came over with our bill and when we were explaining why we were leaving she was very apologetic, which is why I'm giving a 3 for service. The other dude should not be working in the service industry. A manager or server did not come over once during our stay to ask how things were or to ask if there was anything they could do to improve our experience. I have worked in many restaurants and typically if a customer is that dissatisfied with the food, the restaurant will comp some items. We actually had to remind them to remove the lamp chops from our bill b/c we never received it. We paid the entire bill + tip and as soon as we got up to leave we could see all the servers swarming to our table to clean it up and it seemed like they were badmouthing us. Not a good look, they could've at least waited until we were out of sight hahaha.Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I experienced a day that came remarkably close to perfection at this new upscale brunch spot. The atmosphere was beautifully inviting, matching the quality of a Michelin-starred establishment. Their sophisticated brunch selections were truly exceptional. We indulged in the omelette tray and pasta pomodoro, which stood out as one of the finest breakfasts/brunches I've ever enjoyed. Our server was not only kind but also incredibly attentive, making us feel truly valued. Without a doubt, I'm eagerly looking forward to returning for another delightful experience.
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Great environment it has a lot of cocktails and mix drinks to choose from, they can be a bit pricey about 18/20$ a drink. They have other drinks that's just what I had that night. The workers were on it but I really hit it off with one of them she was good vibes and keep my table company for the rest of the night. They have a cool coach area that is different but nice for pictures and for social media. You get the nice lights and 6th street view in the back.
Address: 3500 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Dragon roll, crispy rice with spicy tuna, hot summer roll, Niku Nashi roll, shrimp tempura roll and matcha cheesecake. All bomb! Everything was so good and there is no lack of flavor. The ambiance is super cute, the staff is friendly and attentive, and the vibe is chill. Thoroughly impressed with these eats, and I'll be back to finish the menu. Good job. (Tips hat) lol
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: It's so beautiful inside! Very chic and classy - I felt like I was in a different country. I love that the cocktails use real fruit juices and purées instead of fake syrups. One of the best parts was the DJ - this is a nice place to go to dance that doesn't feel like a frat house. We need this in LA. It will explode soon I think
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Came here on a weekday night and had the best service ever, the entire staff was so attentive- especially our server Rachel D. who was super sweet and so great the entire night. The food and drinks were amazing as well, thank you!
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I loved everything about it! My friend is vegan and we came to celebrate her win, so I was so excited to show her this place. The sushi met both our expectations and I loved the dry drinks. This is definitely the place to go to have a special date and get the friendliest service.
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Outstanding service and the best non alcoholic cocktails I've ever had. The vegan sushi was also exceptional. Great, laid back vibe, beautiful interior. Perfect for a date, celebration, or catch up with friend.
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Good food, good vibes, good drinks. Food was amazing, but the cocktails, were another level. I'll be coming back when I'm in LA again
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I am obsessed with this spot!!! 2nd time here and they do not disappoint!! I ordered basically the entire menu again and left so so happy! We got the same waiter and he actually remembered us. I love spots with that type of intimacy and service! Also love that they have nonalcoholic cocktail along with their amazing alcohol selection! The mood and vibe is always amazing here whether it be a weekday or weekend!
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I visited on a Saturday evening at around 7:30pm and was pleased to find that the restaurant wasn't overly crowded. The visual appeal of the establishment was truly impressive. In terms of pricing, I would classify it as mid to slightly on the pricier side. For our party of four, the bill totaled around $250, covering four rolls, one appetizer, and four drinks.The standout item from our meal was undoubtedly the ceviche tacos. As someone who appreciates vegan cuisine, I did have high hopes for the rolls, but unfortunately, they didn't leave a strong impression. The faux fish texture was a bit too gelatinous for my liking. The overall concept is intriguing, though.When it comes to the drinks, the alcoholic options were decent but not extraordinary. They lacked a strong alcoholic taste. If you're considering ordering a drink, I'd recommend opting for the nonalcoholic choices, which seemed to have better flavor profiles.
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I had the pleasure of visiting this place for the first time, and I'm already looking forward to returning. To beat the summer heat, I ordered the passion fruit margarita, and it was absolutely refreshing. My partner tried the 5th & Adam's cocktail and couldn't get enough of it.For our meal, we went with the Ginza Platter, and I must say, it's a must-try for anyone visiting. The platter included fried vegan chicken, spring rolls, and French fries, creating a satisfying combination of flavors.The ambiance is delightfully bohemian and relaxed, enhanced by the abundance of hanging plants throughout the main dining area. It all added up to a fantastic experience that left us excited to come back for more.
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Small overpriced vegan sushi!! I went with a big group of 6 people and we all order something different and all the portions sizes were small except the vegan fried chicken. I got the Dragon roll which was the best but for $20 and small I was disappointed and hungry after the gathering. My friends were RAVING about the matcha cocktail. I don't drink so I won't be returning but service and ambiance was good.
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Great place and great food. Been here twice already. Leo, Rachel and Mauricio are awesome. The food and drinks are really good. Will be back.
Address: 7302 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: dani is the best server i ever hadbread pudding taste so good, service was quick & she kept peeking over to see if we need help, place is a vibe too
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Amazing staff and food first timers at this place and I recommend the bread pudding for sure.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Service impeccable- we had another server, WILLiAM who was professional, knowledgeable, and extremely attentive.  We ordered the onions rings, bacon jams fries, patty melt, carrot cake and bread pudding.  The bus boy had our table cleaned right after we finished our main meal, the kitchen to table waiter was so sweet. As she dropped off the fries, "she said welcome to heaven."The staff and food is the best!The staff works as the team and it really shows. Atmosphere is Halloween theme - love it!You won't regret coming here.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Rodger was an excellent server! He was attentive, professional, and made my meal exceptional!  We had sliders, onions rings, fish and chips, and patty melt. All was amazing!  We are coming back again and again.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Love their onion rings!. Service was excellent. All their hamburgers are delicious! I had the truffle burger and went back for more! Sliders are good too!Don't order their mousse cake is misleading,
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: The Morrison, I need your bread pudding at least once a month.  Your portions are hefty and your service is *chefs kiss*.  By service I mean Kate and Jess', so attentive and familiar.  See you again soon at the bar soon!  :)
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: The atmosphere was very lively. We loved the food. William was on point with his service.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: it was our first time here at Morrison and the food is SO amazing. our server teddy gave the BEST service and made sure we had a great first time here. we will definitely be back!! thank you teddy!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Always love coming here but just had a great experience having a large party at the Morrison! We were out on the back patio and had wonderful service from Roger all afternoon. Great food, great drinks, lovely staff!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: The Morrison is perfect every time I come! Good beer! Amazing service thanks william! And the vibe is always right.  I love the holiday decorations!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Morrison is the happening place!  Great food, special and seasonal decor!  Teddy, our server, was fantastic!  Cordial and efficient.
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Roger was amazing!  Helpful. Informative. Efficient!  He got our orders quickly, and serviced us with products as we requested!  Wonderfully presented and a personable person!
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: I was having a very emotional day today having a family death and wanted to share a special time and have great food after the funeral. I was starving , let me tell you the food came by fast , hot and delicious. The drinks came and we got  the most amazing service  by Teddy who was very kind . Definitely had a great experience and would love to come back soon !
Address: 3179 Los Feliz Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90039

Comment: Service - 5/5 quickAtmosphere - 3/5 small and crowdedFood - 5/5Everyone has to be present to be seatedI have no idea what we ordered. My friends ordered everything but it all tasted delicious esp the one they lit on fireWould come here again if in the area
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Me and my partner were visiting LA and after a long day were craving Korean food. We discovered this restaurant through tiktok and decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised and I would 100% recommend Louders as they had very nice staff and the food was excellent.We ordered the Cheese Buldak and  a yogurt flavored soju. With the cheese Buldak we got a medium spicy which wasn't too spicy, if i were to go back, i'd get spicer. Would definitely want to try the pasta next time as well. Perfect way to end the night. However, id recommend to plan accordingly as there is valet parking for a fee, and street parking that is virtually filled for blocks down. The wait was not too bad, just be prepared to stand outside while you wait to be called. The restaurant is small but has a unique charm with kpop blasting throughout the experience. I look forward to coming back!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: WORTH THE HYPE!This place is sooo good. Service was fast and food was amazing.Got the Kimchi Bacon Carbonara and it was super flavorful. We had a lot of leftover sauce so we took it home and added ramen noodles to it. HahaI will definitely be coming back.Expect a wait time though because the place is pretty small.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Good food, K-pop on big screen, very attentive waitstaff. Fun place to dine. Would come again.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Keep in mind, it's less expensive ordering in the store. This place is sooooo good! I love the street corn and the sweet garlic wings. I love the seaweed rice. This place is a gem! Parking is a little crazy in this lot. They are open real late too!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food - delicious.Love all their menu items here. I come here with friends every once in awhile and have tried a variety of menu items and they were all good! I definitely recommend here as a restaurant. I wouldn't really recommend this place as a drinking place because it is very small, there's only Valet which is always full, and the ambiance is not much of a drinking ambiance.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This hole in the wall spot was amazing!!!!! They have various flavors of Soju!! I had the fried calamari and shrimp rose pasta would definitely order again. My sister had this chicken dish with cheese that they light on fire she loved it (I don't eat chicken) everything was good including the service!!!!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The Stir-Fried Baby Octopus and Pork Belly was so good, I can handle a spice pretty well, but I prefer things to be not as spicy as what my spice limit is because for me, overly spicy things takes away from actual flavor (though I'm sure some people like to burn their mouth), we got medium (보통) spicy and it was perfect. It comes out on a stone pan thing so the rice starts to crisp up at the bottom! So generous with the octopus and pork too. We both weren't feeling that hungry, so we had enough leftover that we could each take a to-go bowl home. We also got the cajun fries (not pictured), which were light and perfectly seasoned. The service here is not remarkable, it's just your standard Korean type of service, so your server might seem cold but that's just the way it is. We went during lunch so it wasn't crowded, but I can imagine it being a lot more busy at night because they are technically a pocha at the end of the day.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Really cute restaurant! Had a variety of Korean options but they r definitely big proportions so be aware. I got the kimchi fried rice w my friend and it def filled us up! The parking lot is strange cause there is valet for that small plaza but nonetheless I'd come back again with more people to try out more food!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food: 5/5Wait: 3/5Service: 4/5Vibes: 5/5We went on a Sunday night. Got there around 7 and had to wait quite a bit before getting seated. The food also took quite a while to come out, and there was quite a bit of wait between each dish being brought out. My favorite dishes from most to least favorite were the soy garlic wings, kimchi bacon udon carbonara, stir fried pork belly, and spicy cheese rice cake. The glaze on the wings was delicious, and the chicken was fried to perfection. The pasta had a unique flavor and was tasty. The stir fried pork belly was solid. For me personally, I'd prefer if the rice cake had a bit of other things in it, like ramen or even sausages. PSA: all the dishes are kind of on the smaller size, so don't expect to leave here feeling super full! They played Kpop on the TVs the entire time I was there, which kept me entertained as I waited for the food. For parking, we parked a few streets away and just walked over, which was not a big issue for us. Overall, a good spot with tasty food but there could be a bit of wait, especially on the weekend.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I went here for the first time on a double date and it was okay overall. We were told by our server the food was family style which was a bit misleading because the food was plated in a not-so-family style way. We got the pork belly, catfish, duck confit, and the tomahawk pork. The catfish and the tomahawk were the best dishes. It was nice to check out for the first time but I don't think I was impressed enough to come again. ambiance was good and the cocktails were well made.
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: The food was yummy.  My husband and I loved the catfish and pickles.  5/5The mac and cheese was good but not the best I've had.  3.5/5The shortribs were good.  4/5The crawfish hush puppies were amazing.  5/5I really liked the staff here.  Everyone was so warm and friendly.  I wish that they had a more extensive wine list by the glass.  The manager allowed me to have a glass of something they only sell by the bottle.  So amazing!  10/5
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: It's all birthday cake and candles at new restaurant Joyce, on Grand just past Bottega Louie and in the same building as downtown's Whole Foods.  Sounds like a recipe for success.  Tons of metered parking around there and a big open lot in the next block ($10?  I found a meter).The space is beautiful and I folded my 6'1" frame into one of the smaller booths with a good view of bar action and general revelry.  It's always fun when a hot restaurant with buzz opens.  Tons of well-wishers and staff is so glad to see you.  Everyone stopped by our lowly table to say hi, make recommendations, talk about the restaurant and generally make us feel welcome and special -- even owner Prince, both son of, and father to, the namesakes' Joyce.Food with fun southern fare with LA twists.  Get your wallet out, of course, but the starter platter 'Vinny Smalls' is actually a good deal (oysters, shrimp, crab, mussels with all kinds of things for dipping and squirting).  Totally enjoyed that platter and finished it off pronto.  The much-talked-about cornbread lives up to its buttery goodness, though you may need two orders as it's smaller than a piece of sandwich bread and the "order" is just one piece.Octopus, catfish, blue crab gratin -- all good.  I'd definitely try the boneless beef rib next time, as the neighboring table got it and it looked mighty good.No time for dessert as I had 8pm theatre tickets, but I will be back.  Welcome to the neighborhood, Joyce.
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: As a past Preaux & Proper regular, I was SO PUMPED to hear of Chef Samuel and his crew opening up another restaurant with that New Orleans/Southern flair! And Joyce did NOT disappoint! The restaurant is beautiful, service was on point and the food was delicious!! Some highlights my husband and I enjoyed were the Nashville Hot Catfish and the hush puppies! So delicious and flavorful! And our cocktails were PERFECTION down to the ice- which we always pay attention to! Highly recommend the Old Fashioned and Negroni.My only rub with our dining experience (and why I gave 4 stars instead of 5) was that usually when a patron is asked to order all their food items at once, this means that the food will be coursed out and timed. But all of our food was brought out within minutes of us ordering and it all came at once which felt rushed and a little overwhelming. Our table was too small for all we ordered too LOL I felt like we had to eat the hot food first and then get to the cold apps as we could, as opposed to a more relaxed dining experience where we could take our time and enjoy things more intentionally.But, nonetheless, the food was delicious and the service was great! We will be back to try more dishes! Bravo, chef!
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: I was so excited when a new restaurant Jo that offers southern cuisine with a twist, opened up in dtla. The design of the restaurant is gorgeous and it was such a vibe  I thought it would be slow since they just opened up but it was a full house. I requested to have a corner booth seating so I could take photos/videos and the host was so nice and made all the accommodations.Let's get to the best part, the food  We ordered these items:Scallop aquachilleCharred octopusHoney glazed pork belly (it was too hard and dry. I took one bite and didn't finish it)Corn breadAside from the pork belly, everything had so much flavor but my favorite are the ones marked with a star. I cannot rave enough about the cornbread. Seriously you have to try it because it's the most delicious cornbread I've ever hadI would definitely come back again to try the other items on their menu and get their cornbread again
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Joyce nails the ambiance and service. This is a welcome addition to the DTLA restaurant/bar scene. It feels like the chef is still figuring out and adjusting the menu. I wasn't blown away by any of the dishes but I wasn't disappointed either. I'm hypercritical of soul food, and that makes me hard to impress on that front. I'll certainly be back to try the seafood and cocktails.
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: My bf and I came back with more people. We wanted to share this gem with them and also be able to try more things! This time, in addition to our favorites - the Nashville hot catfish, the duck confit, the carrots, and the banana custard pie - we got:- mussel toast- pork belly- braised kale- mac & cheese- octopusAside from the pork belly, which was a little dry, everything was delicious!The mussel toast was the most unique since that's not a thing I have ever seen on any other menu. But the octopus was expertly cooked, it was so tender! The mac and cheese and the braised kale were both delicious, but because everything else was so stellar, they wound up seeming just OK by comparison.The Dusk on the Delta was a really nice version of a highball. My friend got a Punk Evans. The presentation was very striking with the watermelon ice cubes. Unfortunately, the drink was only fully realized once it melted and combined into the drink to balance it out some. I wished they had either used watermelon pebble ice or crushed some and left some as cubes to let it get to that blend sooner.
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: My boyfriend and I went last week and wound up there on the date of their official opening. The host and our server were both very gracious and we were seated right away. We ordered a selection of their offerings and everything was delicious but a few things stood out.The standouts- fried catfish: tender and delicate and even the fried pickles were delicious (and I usually don't care for them)- harissa-roasted baby carrots: so flavorful and well roasted- smoked duck confit: well-balanced heat, sweetness, and meatiness. The crisp on the duck skin was perfect and the salad that accompanied it brought some brightness to cut the richness of the duck meat.- banana custard pie: the sage in the crust was so delicate and delicious, the lightness of the coconut chantilly cream offset the richness of the custard perfectly- Valerie's Voodoo cocktail: herbaceous and well-balanced tiki drinkThe less good- blue crab gratin en cocotte: too rich for me with crab and cheese. But for those who enjoy blue crab, it is an incredibly generous portion! And the Old Bay seasoned crackers were a clever touch.- romanesco cauliflower: a little bland- cornbread: a little greasy for my taste- Son of a Sailor milk punch: very understated and not as flavorful as I wanted
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: My friend took me out here last night. It was incredible! The vibe was on point, the service was out of this world, and the food was cooked to perfection. The owner was so nice and told us the story of this restaurant and it's so touching! I highly recommend ordering the catfish it melted in my mouth. We also ordered the duck, game hen, corn bread, the tomahawk porkchop, and tasty drinks. I enjoyed all of the food I just listed out. Ask about their French 75 using fresh basil from their garden! I can't wait to come back here.Food: 5/5  |  Service: 5/5  |  Atmosphere: 5/5
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: The food, the service, the drinks and the atmosphere are just a great experience in dining, especially for a new restaurant. I normally would not order carrots, but they were amazing! Just a great night out with friends! Welcome, to the neighborhood, just love Joyce.
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Joyce provided an amazing experience. As soon as you enter, your attention is captivated by the art and carefully selected details. The food was incredibly delicious!! The staff was great! They created a comforting, homey atmosphere.
Address: 770 S Grand Ave Ste A Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Korean tapa restaurant in koreantown. The best thing about this place is the food, the worst is the parking...Food is so so good here. They don't have many items on the menu, but each one we ordered were delicious- we got the fried chicken, sweet potato, seasame noodle, uni toast, and truffle kimchi fried rice. My favorite was the uni toast for the juicy uni. But honestly, everything was so delicious. The kimchi fried rice was sooooo good as well, I would say this is a must for patrons.The service was pretty quick and helpful, and the ambiance was LA modern, pretty nice vibe.Now back to parking, we only found paid parking across the street. The cheaper Chapman lot was filled up rather quickly, so definitely a hassle.Would definitely recommend trying this place, but arrive early and give yourself ample time to find parking!
Address: 3465 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Really disappointed as I was so excited to try this spot!Everything was just underwhelming.. I ordered the white rabbit cocktail and it was really bland/plain. We ordered the uni toast which was not worth the $42 by any means. It's essentially Texas toast, thousand island dressing, pickles, and uni. It was good, it almost tasted like an uni Big Mac. But no where near the cost. Uni is everywhere, especially in ktown, and good uni doesn't cost that much. Next we had the scallop crudo. It's 2 large scallops, but they slice the scallops in thirds (top, middle, bottom) so it appears like 6 pieces. Again, really disappointing to see them cheap out and cut corners like that. How about just serving 6 scallops? The tteokbokki was super westernized, instead of the normal sweet/spicy flavor, it's in pasta sauce with basil and Parmesan cheese. Honestly it was gross. Then we got the crispy pork belly. The fat is SO sticky it glues your mouth shut, it's unbelievable. Barely any meat, just fat, can't believe they even sold it like that. Lastly, we got both desserts. The black sesame dessert was delicious, though I wish it was more than just a smear across the plate. And the cheesecake was disappointing. Not rich and creamy, instead it was airy and dry.The restaurant is also no longer busy and I can guess why.
