The food is already outstanding, and I have no doubt the service stuff will get ironed out in the coming weeks. What a great addition to the neighborhood food scene. I will definitely be back soon!
Address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd Ste 130 West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Ordered dry mixed spicy noodle with shrimp.Chewy, bouncy, and LONG noodles which made it a bit difficult to split with another person but sooooo good!Good flavor. Noodle was wetter than I imagined for a "dry" noodle.Delicious noodles without heading into San Gabriel Valley.Kind service.
Address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd Ste 130 West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: So so good!!! Went here for dinner in a group of 3 and we were blown away. The soup broth was delightful with a nice rich flavor. The street noodle had some more sesame flavor with the sichuan mala spice taste to it. The braised beef soup tasted super rich as well.The best was the noodles themselves - we got the wide and flat noodles which tasted super fresh.Service was great as well! Fast and friendly.Highly recommend to come here for a casual and delicious meal.Also - just a note that this is actually located right below the Target, the location on the Yelp map is a little confusing!
Address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd Ste 130 West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Amazing food! Absolutely loved the noodles. I had the combo A with Lan noodles and it was amazing. I love that you can choose the shape of your noodle as they make your noodles to order. Also the service was really great and she took the time to explain to us the different options. I would recommend everyone to come here!
Address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd Ste 130 West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Classic Lan Noodle soup with hand made and hand stretched wide noodle was just as good as the one that I would drive out (from Miracle Mile area). That was a 25 miles each way drive, meaning more that 1 hr each way! It's that good.I'm so glad that it's finally open this W. Hollywood location. I almost don't want to write a review just so that they don't get too busy when it gets discovered but hope they stick around for a while. I also usually order Chicken Chow Mein with triangular noodles, which is amazingly good. The only thing missing from Arcadia location is that the menu doesn't have any photos so it will be a learning curve for newcomers.
Address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd Ste 130 West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Welcome to the neighborhood Lan Noodle! So happy to be able to get my braised beef noodle fix with out driving 45 minutes to Arcadia!
Address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd Ste 130 West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Yay congratulations and welcome to the neighborhood LAN Noodle! I work in the area and I was excited for a Chinese in-house made noodle spot. The vibe is modern Chinese. I got takeout since I grabbed it for my lunch break. I ordered the veggie noodle soup with the wide flat noodles and a milk tea boba. Everything was fresh and delicious! You could taste each ingredient from the mushrooms, soft tofu, bok choi, garlic and cilantro. The noodles were chewy and LOOOOOOOONG.  I got no spice and added a little chili oil. It was the perfect spice level for me. The boba was also soft and chewy. The milk tea was sweet but "not too sweet". The staff and owner are super friendly and the service was quick! Emma the staff member estimated the order to be ready in 10 minutes and before I even got comfortable in nearby seating, she came out w my order! I 10/10 recommend this spot and I can't wait to try the rest of their menu
Address: 7100 Santa Monica Blvd Ste 130 West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: We absolutely loved the food here. Everything was so good. However we had a reservation, and the service was really slow. We were seated about half hour after our reservation and needed to ask for the check multiple times. The ambiance was nice and beautiful though!!!
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Amazing all the way around. Stephanie has so much talent. I am a culinary student at ICE.
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: I've had the pleasure of eating here 3 times and the food has consistently been delicious, fresh, and super flavorful. The mushroom tacos are a MUST and we also love pork shank - both shareable portions. The beet salad is so tasty & always on our oder, the chickpea fritters also delish. During one visit, our waiter was really busy and the GM came over to make sure we were taken care of. She was warm, attentive and made us feel welcomed. She's a real class act and we'll return for the great food AND sweet service.
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Well, I discovered one of my favorite restaurants in LA.Beautiful interior, some outdoor seating as well in their patio. Service is wonderful here, genuinely friendly.Naan & Dips: A nice way to start the meal. 2 dips - one tahini, one carrot hummus. A massive sheet of naan with green onion. Fun to pull apart and dip away. Beautifully plated and tasty.Shrimp & Crispy Greens Salad: Delicious! Lots of ingredients inside and fun texture combinations.Grilled Skirt Steak: Sliced steak with peanut sauce makes this an easy one to eat and share. Great flavor, would get this again. My friend was full so I was happy to eat the majority of this dish :)Definitely want to come back here asap! Lots of other dishes I'm curious to try, in addition to the cocktails, and we heard the mango sticky rice is a must get. A little pricey but it's a beautiful restaurant with good service and delicious food.
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Only great things to say about this place! This has been on my list to try for awhile.Requested the outdoor patio, lovely setting, prompt and friendly staff, food is off the charts!The naan bread is a must! Shrimp Salad, Grilled Skirt Steak, and corn were all delicious. Celebrated my birthday and saved room for the butter pound cake with popcorn ice cream...YUM!
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: The best thing is the ambiance and decor...inside is very inviting and the layout of the table/seating is well designed... The bartending staff is very nice and the specialty drinks were unique. However, the downsides...was that the food was just okay - a bit on the heavy side especially the goat liver with donut/crumpets. Also, the wait staff didn't make the experience desirable at all..just kind of eh! Overall, glad I tried it but I wouldn't be going back.
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: My third time visiting I love the food and the drink but surcharge 4% for covering the cost? What is this restaurant mangers doing??  Or maybe you can tell me first?  give me a chance to walk out for this ridiculous charge.
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Food and ambiance was lovely during weekend brunch. Would love to try dinner menu as a lot of the things on there were not available during the day time
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: This restaurant exceeded my expectations, great vibe. The drinks were delicious. The bottle of wine that was recommended by the amazing staff was so delicious.  Everyone was so helpful. When it came to the food... wow! Every bite i had was so flavorful and perfectly balanced.  The sweet and savory flavors were so well prepared. I was blown away by the pork belly noodles and the green beans. The Goat neck was amazing ! All the food was so delicious! You won't be disappointed!Next on the to do list is Cabra to see what chef did there.
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Flavors are delicious here. But only very few pescatarian options. I got the salmon bowl and wow amazing taste. I recommend
Address: 555-3 Mateo St Ste 300 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: MICE! There's mice in the trees  went for my sisters birthday and saw mice scurrying in the tree. I don't do RODENTS
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Grace grace grace! What superstar service we received. All the food was so delicious, gone so fast I couldn't get a picture
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: The food is so good. Literally insanely good and coolest atmosphere and hottest servers. 10/10!!!
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Delightful ambience and tapas style plates were delicious. Green falafel was nicely seasoned, shrimp ceviche fresh and tangy, though seasoning on the chips was off for my palate. Tasted artificial. White cheese pizza with egg was the highlight for me. Too bad I had to share with others in my party! Just the right amount of ingredients and then you poke the yoke and blissful yumminess spills onto the cheese. Oaxacan pasta was a close contender for 1st place. Creamy sauce and tender pasta! Great time had by all. Tip: make a reservation for even a Wednesday night. Place was packed by 6:30!
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: We really loved the look of the restaurant. We decided to sit outside, which is a mistake in the hot weather. We were sweating, and we could see the sweat on everyone else. I'd say that we're wimps though since no one else seemed to mind. Haha.The food was ok, just not exceptional. We got the shrimp ceviche, the egg pizza, and the dutch baby pancake. I have to admit, I had no idea what that pancake would be like and it surprised me. It was more like a bread pudding and wasn't bad. The egg pizza with bacon was ok, I just wished it had more egg. The ceviche tasted pretty fresh, but I really found myself wishing it was just regular chips, not the chili lime chips they had. It was just not the right flavor combo for me.As a side note, the wait staff was nice but after taking our order we never saw our waiter again. Someone else delivered the food and gave us the check so we never got any kind of drink refills.
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: A vibe for sure.Wanted to try their dinner menu but they were serving brunch only until 2pm, then dinner starts at 4pm. So this place is essentially outside so on a warm day it can get a bit toasty. I really want to come back in fall once it's cooler because it'll be comfortable weather wise.The service was great and the food was too. The drinks weren't that strong, we actually had to send our drinks back a couple of times because we couldn't taste the tequila at all and not in the good way lol. But the food was good except for the shrimp ceviche (wayyy too salty and I believe there was kimchi in it) and we weren't rushed to leave once they started to transition to dinner. I'll definitely be back
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Food is okay. Staffs is okay. The space and vibe is amazing. That's what's really great it's all about the location
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Great experience. Fantastic ambiance the way the outdoor patio is setup like a Malaysia forest. Service staff was so communicative, attentive, and helpful by staggering the delivery of food. This is tapas style eating and sharing is caring.Food didn't disappoint. From the rainbow beet salad, to the ceviche, to the pork belly, burgers and cauliflower. As good as advertised. Everything had the right amount of sweet/savory/acid. Can't go wrong dining here.
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I have now been to Bacari 3 times, and I have to say I love it! Bacari is such a beautiful restaurant. It is always so lively, which makes it hard to get a table unless you are patient or book a reservation a week in advance, but that doesn't bother me. I love how lively it is. The food is great. I have had some of my favorite meals here. I have some different pointers on how you should order though, because some of the things I've had, I definitely would not order again.1. Best thing there: The Lamb Hummus. It's amazing. I could eat that every day. The only issue is that they only provide ONE single tiny pita for it. And the amount of hummus they give you could literally serve at least 6 of those pita breads. The pita breads are also SO amazing, they're so so fresh. But it's a bummer because you always have to order at least one extra pita, which is another $2.2. The burrata caprese is so good.3. Papas Bravas are alright, strange proportions.4. Oaxacan Pasta is delicious!!! I had never tried this type of pasta before, so maybe that's why I love it, but I get this every time.5. Brussel Sprouts are my second favorite thing on the menu, to the hummus of course. The Brussel sprouts have the best flavor, and they also have the greatest proportion/serving size I would say. Always order these.6. Chipotle chicken wings are super not great. I am a HUGE chicken wing connoisseur and so I was extremely disappointed by these, my friend and I couldn't even finish them. They were just weird. Weird flavor, and the skin was like soggy and just weird.7. The La Brea Rose is such a delicious and unique drink. I can't really describe it, but you gotta try it!!!Overall, I love Bacari, I will be back over and over. The staff here is great, and the food is awesome. The next thing I need to try is their $30 90 minute open bar wine special!
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Beautiful & unique spot. i went for my birthday!I absolutely love the treehouse jungle vibes. Great spot for celebrating anything or just a night out for good drinks and food. It's small plates so good for sharing and tasting a lot of the menu. The outdoor patio up top get really dark so reading the menu can be hardOnly reason for 4 stars instead of 5 was the Service could have been a little better. Our first server was pretty good but she ended up getting moved to take over another servers section who had to leave and the second server we got was not very attentive and we were constantly waiting on her to come back. It wasnt that busy at that time so there wasn't much of an excuse. But besides the service we had a great time & the food & drinks were delicious!
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night. Make sure you make reservations or get there early. The restaurant does get full. Parking is horrible so get there early to look for parking or they do have a valet option but that also get filled up quickly. Let me start by saying the ambiance is great. We sat outside on the middle deck since there was another one above us and the ground floor was below. We were in a corner secluded which was nice since it was a date night. We were giving recommendations by the server on what food we should try based on our food likes. Let me say everything that came out was delicious!! We were both stuffed but the food was good we did not want to leave any so we ate more than we should've. They have a great drink menu and I went with the mad mango sour. More on the sour part but good nonetheless. For dessert we had the best cake you will ever have, that is the name of the cake and let me tell you it holds on to that name. We almost ordered another to go but with having more than enough food in our bellies we decided against it. Highly recommend this place if you are going on a date or just want to have a delicious dinner the ambiance is great our server was amazing.
Address: 3626 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Fantastic service, great vibes, and most importantly, AMAZING FOOD. I wish the best for this new restaurant!A previous review commented on the lack of directions. The restaurant is located inside the new Level 8 concept which is located inside the Moxi hotel. For parking options, you can valet at the Moxi for $25 or park in the parking structure for Circa for $20. Looks like they plan on having a front facing entrance on Fig, but it wasn't open yet. The entrance for Level 8 is currently right by the valet at the Moxi.
Address: Verified by Business
Style: Japanese, Hot Pot, Venues & Event Spaces

Comment: First of all, a shout out to a a great server - Dillon.  His personality alone was the star of the night.   However, we came for the food and it was sadly disappointing, although the presentation was beautiful.  There are wonderful hot pot options in town for a third of what you would spend here.  I really don't mind an expensive meal, but the taste and quality must be at a high level.I understand we ate here before the first official opening, but this does not excuse the fact that they need to communicate specific information about about the restaurant's location, parking, etc.  Why isn't anyone answering the phone during service hours??  We arrived about 7:50 for an 8:30 reservation.  We then spent 20 minutes looking for the parking for Level 8.  Ended up in $20 public parking building.  Not a big issue, but this is information that would be helpful for those not familiar with area.  So we walk around the parking building to Mizu's address on Figueroa and the double doors with a Level 8 sign are locked and there are NO instructions on how to get to the restaurant.  We took a chance and walked around the corner to the back of building as there was a hotel sign.  Surely someone there would know.   It was there that an entrance to level 8 was located.  It was now 8:35.  Now if someone was assigned answer the phone, we would have been able to ask questions.  I've more to say, but have lost interest in continuing.  Bottom line, disappointing.
Address: Verified by Business
Style: Japanese, Hot Pot, Venues & Event Spaces

Comment: What an unbelievable atmosphere!!! Bright colors, curated symbolism, and picture worthy details all around you. A unique countertop Shabu Shubu experience where everything is prepared right  in front of you.From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with warm smiles and great vibes. The service was exceptional. I think our servers name was Mo? maybe....but he was great, very helpful and attentive.
Address: Verified by Business
Style: Japanese, Hot Pot, Venues & Event Spaces

Comment: The entrance to this restaurant will catch your eye.With 700 lucky cats on the wall, you're bound to have an incredible dinner.The service is top notch here. The waiters are attentive and kind. There's so many options on the menu as well! From A5 to a plethora of meats, this shabu place isn't one to miss.
Address: Verified by Business
Style: Japanese, Hot Pot, Venues & Event Spaces

Comment: Food, Service, Ambiance was impeccable. This place  is an absolute MUST GO. I've lived here three years but this place made me feel as if I finally arrived in my own city. You haven't been to LA until you've been to this place. So fun. So delicious.
Address: Verified by Business
Style: Japanese, Hot Pot, Venues & Event Spaces

Comment: Such a cool spot , friendly staff and the food was delicious. I would definitely come back again.
Address: Verified by Business
Style: Japanese, Hot Pot, Venues & Event Spaces

Comment: You're in for a treat if you love healthy dining and cocktails. I can't get over how fun this place is designed with all of the cat figurines. Aside from all of the intricate details of the restaurant alone, you'll be brought through a wonderful journey that'll satisfy both your senses of taste and sight.
Address: Verified by Business
Style: Japanese, Hot Pot, Venues & Event Spaces

Comment: Food was good.Service was good.Theres a parking lot behind the restaurant and street parking in the area.Dishes here are made to be shared so come with some friends.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: First off, the ambiance was just perfect. It strikes a balance between modern chic and cozy comfort. The sleek, contemporary design sets the tone for an elegant dining experience, while the warm lighting and comfortable seating make you feel right at home.The outdoor seating area proved to be a brilliant choice. The temperature was just perfect, and it allowed us to relish our meal while basking in the fresh air and natural surroundings. What impressed us most was the impeccable service. Even though we were seated outside, the attentive staff ensured we were never forgotten. They consistently checked in to see if we needed refills or anything else, making us feel truly valued as customers.Now, let's talk about the drinks. I decided to go with the Haeundae Blue cocktail, a delightful concoction made with rum, coconut milk, and pineapple juice. Not only did it taste heavenly, but its striking blue color made it a perfect candidate for Instagram-worthy photos. The balance of flavors was just right, with the alcohol content not overpowering the tropical essence.As for the food, we couldn't resist sampling some of their offerings. We ordered the fried chicken & fries, and it was a decision we didn't regret. The fried chicken was expertly prepared, boasting a crispy exterior that gave way to succulent, juicy meat inside. The fries were golden and seasoned to perfection, making for an ideal accompaniment to our drinks.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: They have parking around the corner.As for the restaurant; Nice atmosphere. Good service. Decent drinks. Quite pricey mediocre food.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The only thing this place has got going for them would be their captivating interior and decor. You would think that their food would match what their environment offered... disappointingly, it didn't. No physical menus, only QR. When it was time to order, we decided to ask a server for recommendations. Which put us in a pretty funny situation because even he had trouble providing options. We ended up just going with what seemed popular on Yelp -- tomahawk pork cutlet. Also went for a wild card with the Bulgogi oven risotto. It was very underwhelming. The cutlet came uncut with a basic sweet tomato sauce. Very chewy and tough. I was pretty disappointed. I'd say the risotto was a little bit better, more enjoyable. Service was meh. Food was meh. Maybe my expectations were too high considering the high-end ambiance and prices. Would not come back.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The mentaiko spaghetti is the best Asian style spaghetti I've ever had in my entire life!! It's amazing. Worth a visit just for this! Tasted just as good when I got it delivered as well.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Great service, got a reservation and asked to be seated in a booth by the window and got it. Decor and vibes are great. Some items are a little pricey, but here we got the iron plate, mentaiko gnocchi, and watermelon soju. Watermelon soju reasonably gives at least 3 drinks, but is not very alcoholic. Sounds like they have a happy hour from 5-8pm on Sundays-Thursday where the whole check is 20% off - will be coming back for that.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food is pretty good, service was a little sore but it's expected cause it was busy so I understand, the ambiance is AMAZING, great place to have a drink and chat
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I was excited to try this new restaurant after seeing it online and it being so close to my place. It was smaller than I thought! And when I came on a Sunday at 6:30, it was nearly empty. So definitely a different vibe than I expected. We didn't have a reservation and it wasn't an issue.I believe happy hour is 5-8pm everyday (? Not sure) and it's 20% off!We ordered the crab meat pasta -- delicious and so creamy -- and the tomahawk pork cutlet. I thought the pork cutlet was just ok, but it's a massive portion. The two of us ate family style and we couldn't finish. Overall, they give big portions but the prices reflect that imo.My friend ordered the peach Bellini which was yummy. I ordered the Ms Korea and replaced the tequila with vodka. It was DELICIOUS. Will order again. Loved the yakult in it.Our receipt has a 10% coupon for Cafe Concerto nearby which we will try next.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Really sad to give this place such low rating. It's so cute. It took 35 minutes to get our cocktails and it was clear the staff they had there were not trained on how to make the cocktails on the cocktail list. Wouldn't go back.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food isn't superb, service is decent, but the ambiance is pretty nice. Overpriced cocktails as well as certain dishes... I don't recommend the truffle fries. Also, it felt like they intentionally reduced the portion for all the dishes ordered during the happy hour.
Address: 3600 Wilshire Blvd 100B Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I've heard really good things about this Italian restaurant, you may want to make your reservation (-:
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Came by Labor Day weekend afternoon for lunch with family.  Read another review that had a bad experience on LD weekend as well. Guess it's just our luck.We were the first to be there (restaurant was empty) and 2 more tables arrived after us. Put in our orders and it took half an hour to get our one calamari dish- appetizer. The waiter came out with free bread shortly after, but then we waited and waited and waited.. 40 mins went by and we still haven't seen the next dish.. 2 pasta orders and a large pepperoni pizza.  The other 2 tables also haven't gotten any of their dishes as well, I noticed.  I know if I opted for fast food, I could've gone there, but over an hour wait for 4 dishes?  What the hell was the chef doing?? Picking his nose back there??When my pasta dish (carbonara) finally came out, it was overly salted. When food takes that long to come out, shouldn't it taste at least decent?  I could've made a more decent frozen pizza at home.We canceled the last pasta dish that still hasn't come out, paid our $100+ with tip and left. It wasn't the waiters fault, but when you're hangry, it doesn't  matter.Food is barely decent, but taking over an hour to serve 4 dishes was beyond ridiculous!
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Stopped by for Labor Day weekend. We called in earlier to ask if they served wine and had been told that while they had a house red and house white, they also charged a $15 corkage fee to bring your own wine. My girlfriend and I saw in another review that there was a liquor store next door to buy said wine from, but when we pulled up to Supremo and parked the store was closed. We decided to walk on over to the gas station across the street to see if they had wine to bring in.We didn't even take two steps before a man yelled after us. He said, quite rudely, that the parking (an empty lot, btw!) was only for customers. I explained to him that we intended to come in and get dinner but we wanted to buy a bottle first."How long?" he asked. I told him around 5 minutes and then he, with an attitude, repeated "How long?"Not a really welcoming start to the experience. My girlfriend and I decided to go to Uovo down the street instead. Jury's still out on the food as we've yet to try it but I was so put off by this experience that I had to share. No wonder that whole dining room was empty.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: This spot is a true hidden gem in the city of LA. They have incredible dishes that I tried, see list below. The service was really great they have indoor and outdoor seating and a parking lot that is free. The ambience inside is very spacious and clean and the outside is very nice.What I tried and loved.....⁣⁣Main⁣Pizza Fresca ⁣Caprese ⁣Stromboli ⁣Capelini Genovese⁣⁣Dessert⁣Torta Di Mascarpone ⁣Pizza Nutella with Strawberries ⁣⁣Appetizers ⁣Tuna Tartare⁣Grilled Chicken ⁣******************************************⁣
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Perfectly pleasant but very ordinary food. You won't hate it but you can do much better at this price point.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Great food, kind service! I called to place an order for pickup on a Monday afternoon and they had it ready in ~25-30 minutes. There's a small parking lot in front which is nice but I anticipate it would get a little crowded during busy hours. Has a nice ambiance for dinner inside, though I got take out. Everything is freshly made and cooked to order - to top it off, freshly grated Parmesan and red pepper flakes were included with my margherita pizza! Thin, crunchy, yummy pizza that still tasted delicious when reheated days after. The luganega is a delicious pappardelle pasta with a creamy tomato sauce, sausages mushrooms, and arugula - definitely hit the craving as well. Delicious and can't wait to go back and order more!
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: This Is my new go to favorite spot to eat italian - pasta is fresh. They have a great pasta special Tuesday night. I love it highly recommend. Great service homemade fresh pasta, so bomb.!!William Sanford n family
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: We came here before a concert and ordered the prosciutto pizza. They top the pizza with unwashed arugula salad, and unfortunately, mine came with a pebble the size of a peppercorn. I really thought I chipped my tooth!  I told the waiter about it and he told me it was probably a peppercorn until I dropped it on the plate and he also realized it was in fact a pebble. He took the pizza away and told me he'd get me a new one. His reasoning was because of the arugula. After another 15 minutes the pizza came back with more unwashed arugula.  I feel like they could have handled it better. I'm glad they did make me a new pizza, but afterwards, most of the staff came out to look at me, and that was awkward.  Also, bribe me with a dessert or a free pizza or something! Anyway, food was okay, but overall experience was not great.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Ive been to Supremo several times since it opened as I live in the area. The best things there are the pastas. However, I've noticed it's not always consistent. 2 months ago I had the Alfredo for the first time and it was incredible. I had it again last week and it was bland. The pizza doesn't have enough flavor and never seems quite right. Tonight I went and shared the caprese and the calamari. The caprese was made with ricotta although the menu says burrata. I would have told our server but they never came back to check us on. Ricotta just doesn't taste the same in that salad and wasn't what we were anticipating as described on the menu. The calamari had a tasty breading and dipping marinara. However the calamari itself was dried out, likely frozen. I also ordered a glass of wine which on the way out I saw came from a Gallo magnum bottle. The glass was $14. Everywhere online that same entire bottle of Cabernet sells for under $10. There used to be a super nice, helpful youngish Latino guy working there but I haven't seen him in awhile. He seemed like he cared about things and customers but I haven't gotten that vibe from anyone there since he's been gone. Probably won't be back.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: You wouldn't think it but this place is absolutely amazingggggggggg the lasagna is to die for. The service is quick and they are super friendly. So happy to have found this place.
Address: 901 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Reliably good spot, I have loved pretty much everything I've eaten here. The space is super open and warm, and the staff has always been really nice and helpful. The shrimp wontons are my favorite. I will be back here more in the future and also the sister restaurant Joy.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Service was stellar! However, food was not. As a Taiwanese person, I was quite disappointed in the minced pork over rice. The ratio of rice and meat needs improvement and the rice was soggy. Egg wasn't fully cooked and you can tell it needed another 1-2 minutes to boil. The "Dan Dan" noodles were not your typical Dan Dan noodles it was more sesame cold peanut noodles which was delish. Portion was tiny though.Aesthetics were great. Didn't seem too crowded and place was clean and tidy.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I've been recommended this place so much that I had to stop by on my trip to LA. We came on a Thursday night around 7pm and it wasn't too busy, so we got to sit down to eat without a wait, maybe we just got lucky.You order at the register and then they give you a number and seat you at a table inside. Just beware, the restaurant itself is quite small (so that's why the wait could take awhile or more people order takeout).Since this was our first time here, we wanted to try their popular dishes. We ordered: stir fry cabbage, beef roll, dan dan noodles, mapo tofu, three-cup jidori chicken, pan fried pork buns. I think my favorite dishes were the dan dan noodles, beef roll, and mapo tofu. The mapo tofu was not spicy as other mapo tofu, but you can add chili oil on the side if you want it spicier. The pan fried pork buns were ok, I don't think I would get it again but it wasn't bad.Overall I had a good experience here and would recommend this restaurant if you are ever in the Silverlake area. I will definitely be back the next time I'm in LA.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Really enjoyed the food here. My favourite was the lotus root appetiser and wood ear mushroom appetiser. The cold dishes do change from time to time so definitely a few new things I want to try if it comes back on the menu. The vegetarian mapo tofu also had nice consistency and thickness. The Bok Choy dumplings were pretty good as well. My friend had the minced pork on rice which looked really delicious. It's a small seating area indoors so sometimes there may be a wait. A little cold inside but I do like the dim-ish ambiance. They also serve boba and loose leaf tea. Overall, yummy food!
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Yeaaaa this place has it. Walk in the door and you immediately get hit with aromas you thought could only exist in your dreams. I've been here countless times now and I always get the beef noodle soup, pork dumplings and if I bring the girlfriend we get some scallion pancakes too (her favvv). The broth of the BNS is just jaw dropping - for real, be careful. You don't want to lose any of that broth because you're in pure shock of what flavor you just experienced. The pork dumplings just never miss and that's that. Overall vibe of the place is dope. We sat at the community table a couple times and that's always chill, I want to recreate that new girl episode there, you know the one. Aight that's enough from me. Hope to pluck a dumpling off your plate next time I'm sitting at the community table
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I came on a Friday night and with the high ratings I was expecting the food to be better than average. However, I left a disappointed. Traditional Taiwanese food is citrusy, vinegary, spicy, and umami. Unfortunately, Pine & Crane missed the mark on all four. The food wasn't terrible but not up to standard. It's missing flavor, the food was bland and not made with love and dedication. Beef noodle soup comes with hours of prep and hours of simmering so the beef is falling off the bone. Instead, it tasted like beef stock with a little bits of beef shank. Dan Dan noodles is suppose to be spicy, nutty and fermented. But It just tasted like diluted peanut butter. Lastly, I got the shrimp wonton, again it lacked the flavor profile. The chili wontons it wasn't umami enough.Besides the food, the service was great! Everyone was nice and accommodating.Overall, I won't be coming back based on the food.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Delicious food at reasonable prices! We ordered all the rice entrees, and they were all amazing. This is a hidden gem in Silver Lake.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Wow, dare I say one of the best dan dan noodle I've tasted in LA. So simple yet so good! Beef roll and potstickers were very crispy and juicy. Especially the skin of potstickers were so thick and well fried that you can taste the home made crunchiness. The beef noodle soup wasn't my personal favorite as the meat was a bit too chewy for me but my husband enjoyed it very much.Service was exceptional, and the ambiance is a quick bite and hang with friends type.Highly recommend!
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Had lunch at the downtown L.A. location today with six guests.  The wait time was about 15 minutes.  The hostess was Micci. We ordered many of the most popular dishes ; Dan Dan Noodles, Beef Noodle Soup, Three Cup  Jidori Chicken, Beef Roll and Taiwanese Popcorn chicken. I asked the hostess if there was any Yelp Check-in promotion.  She said no, but she offered our table a complimentary dessert of Hakka Mochi.  Cool!  The food came out quickly.  The staff were very friendly and asked how our meal was testing.  Everything tasted great, but not in large portions.Restaurant was clean and had a nice vibe.Must  order:  Dan Dan Noodles, Beef Roll and  Jidori Chicken.Parking:  Metered Street.  Read posted signs.Rating:  5 Stars
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Very good Dan Dan noodles, scallion pancakes. Helpful service! You can sit and be served, or order on the app and go in to pick up inside and eat outside, too.
Address: 1521 Griffith Park Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Everything about this place is wonderful it's casual. The food is absolutely delicious. And the service is warm and friendly. I highly recommend this place for the food and for the ambience itself. It's very casual but the food takes front stage to this place and it's worth a try.
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: We decided to go here to celebrate my Mom's Birthday while my mother in law was in town from Miami. We loved our experience from start to finish. Atmosphere and ambiance was beautiful and comfortable. The service was AMAZING . From the hostess to the server to the manager. Food was so tasty, light and enjoyable. None of us are vegan's and we all wanted healthy and light. We ordered the ceviche (amazing), mushroom tacos (LOVED THEM), bibimbap bowl (perfect spicy), locals bowl (yummy and tasty) kimchi tacos () and ended with an amazing peach cobbler. We shared everything and EVERYONE walked away so satisfied. That's really a big compliment if my mom and mother in law we're both happy and pleased with their meal and their experience. I would HIGHLY recommend this place. I would recommend it for a walk in and to celebrate. The portions of the bowls were also a pretty big size. Definitely worth every penny.
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Delicious!! Literally writing this while I'm still here! Amazing food. We got the BBQ burger and the beet burger and were pleasantly surprised!I've been vegetarian for almost a year now, and I've been getting tired of imitation meats for vegan foods. This place is a breath of fresh air! I Iove the dedication to making delicious vegan food with whole ingredients. The food was perfectly seasoned and bursting with flavor!Service was some of the most welcoming service I've had since moving to CA! The manager even stopped by and we exchanged conversation. Love that!! Check ins from our server were frequent but not annoying, and it was great to know we could always rely on them!The ambiance is great, very modern with a leafy green twist. Love the natural vibes and outdoor seating is very comfy!We will be back again!!
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: We ordered the BBQ burger, potato tacos, mushroom tacos, and the churro waffle and everything was absolutely delicious! The restaurant and ambience is relaxing but the best part was the service. Liz, the GM, was very attentive the entire meal. She made sure our table was taken care of and asked us for feedback throughout the entire dining experience. We will definitely be back!
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: just had an amazing lunch and was delighted with the service , food and ambiance.I tried the purple taquitos and it was the best I ever had, who knew purple potatoes could taste so delicious . I also tried theMama Maria's caponata, it brought me back to Sicily.Highly recommended , and try the strawberry margarita too , delicious !!!!! Thumbs up!!!!
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This was our first time dining at this establishment.  The food combined with the service far exceeded our expectations.  We left talking about when we'll be back.  Thanks for a great experience.
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great experience here with Stellar service. Food is amazing and hard to believe it's vegan!
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This place is a gem! I love that they make their food from scratch, local produce and with love. The manager Liz was so kind & sweet upon greeting and to leaving the restaurant. The whole menu was great & and everything we got was yummy! We got the purple potato taquitos, kale caesar salad, eggplant burrata. Loved the outdoor seating, so clean, airy & comfortable. We will be coming back again. Free parking!
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I've been meaning to write a review for a while. This place is so tasty, fresh and unique. It's just yummy, vegan or not. It's so great!Everything I've tried has been delicious. Their drinks are refreshing and original. And it's a chill vibe and cute ambiance. I feel like I really want it to stick around so I hope it gets more crowded and people go more. I love it for lunch or dinner. Go!
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This is my new go-to. I'm here at least once per week, usually more. The food is amazing and everyone who works here is so friendly and helpful. I usually bring my laptop and get lots of work done here too in between meals, coffee and snacks.  You don't have to be veg to love this place. (Just an added bonus that money spent here supports the environment). Today I saw the brunch menu for the first time and was so happy to see all the amazing options.
Address: 2138 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Good food, reasonable price and nice customer service. And the best part is they have their own parking lot
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Delicious pretentious and expensive but that's silverlake for you... if you are in the neighborhood you should try it at least once. Service is mediocre.My favorite items: from the small plates it's the roasted cauliflower ($18), from the salads we like the Caesar ($20), from the grill get the branzino ($38 but worth it)Pizzas are all really good. The pastas I would skip.
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I don't know if I would recommend this place or not mainly because we had a half sale, pizza and a $7 small bottle of coke for $60.Pizza was the Bianca, not bad but it was very disproportionate, one side was all dough with little of anything while the other side was full of cheese and flavor. Seems like the pizza maker was trying to be like the Salt Bae guy and just threw whatever without looking.Chopped Salad was good but at $19 for a small bowl I'm not too impressed.Diet Coke was very good, cold and it had a nice balanced taste. Came in a mini bottle which was cute but still not worth the $7.Try it or not, I don't care. Just want to help the local shops when possible.
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Wonderful find!  We stumbled upon this place on our way home to OC.   We ordered Pepperoni pizza, Margarita Pizza, fries, lemonade, Chopped salad with Salami, French press and I had a rose.Everything was amazing starting with the incredible service and ending with fantastic food.  My daughter's friend said the fries were the best she ever had.  I loved that the chopped salad was loaded with small cut veggies in a great dressing.  Will definitely be back.
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: This place has decent food but it's very pricey. We ordered the kachipuri, my wife order a blt sandwich with fries, one glass wine and one coke. The bill was over $100 which was so overpriced for what we had for lunch. Service was good but this place was not worth the cost. Kachipuri was tasty but undercooked dough. The sandwich was nice but nothing memorable. The wine and soda were way overpriced. If you are gonna charge $17 a glass of wine, please serve it in a wine glass. That is so ridiculous. Overall, won't come back. The cost wasn't worth it
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Had the meatballs and noodles. Was amazing, tasty flavor. Came to me hot in the ro go box. Thanks so much
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: The food is way overpriced, end of story. $15 to add shrimp to a $28 ~2 oz pasta dish, comes with 4 shrimps?! Pappardelle were cooked fine, sauce was ok, shrimps were grilled too long, tough and tasted like char; the gnocchi marinara sauce was waaaay to sweet, possibly from a jar or can. It was basically Chili's level food at double the cost. That pasta Al limone with shrimp somehow cost more than any pasta at Osteria Mozza. "You sure about that?"All in, a small salad, 2 pastas and 2 glasses of wine was $166.52. La Pergoletta is right up the block, go there instead.Space is generic. Will say they have a few parking spots which is nice.Also this place is jumping on the 4% wellness surcharge bandwagon. Which is wild to dump on the customer in this case given the margins they must be making on their overpriced portions.
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: My husband and I were driving around in that area and we came across this restaurant. We thought let's give it a try we love to try new places. Such a cute tiny spot, the moment we walked in we were greeted so happily. The service was amazing but let me tell you about the FOOD! We got two pasta dishes, pizza, and caprese salad. I've never tasted anything better than their caprese (and I've tried plenty) it was DELICIOUS!! Their bread was to die for, the pasta was mama miaaaa. Definitely will be back!
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Their pizzas were really good but that was something that I think I expected and hence was pleased but not surprised. An absolute star dish for me was the crispy brussel sprouts. The texture, crispiness and the taste was all mind blowing. One of the best i have had till now.
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Really good pizza and pasta!The farmers market mushroom pizza and Della Nona pasta were our two favorites. Next time I'll try more of the pastas!
Address: 2861 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Walked into OUI and found a nice space with cool pictures. Staff was welcoming and nice as we ordered our food. The sandwiches were delicious. We ordered the baked chicken and falafel with an order of fries. Would highly recommend ordering some of their sauces on the side. Very filling and had great flavor. Would recommend for a casual but close (seating arrangement) meal.
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I got the Spicy Chicken Laffa. It was so big and very tasty. I also tried the salted chocolate cookie. It was a 4 out of 5. We tried it on lunch hour on a Friday. The small spot got very busy which made it take like 20 mins or so get our food. The restaurant is very small, it has wall seating around the perimeter and about four small tables. I want to come back and try the Nashville hot cod sandwich.
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Delicious Sammie's and allot of choices to boot! There can be a wait time so order ahead, or relax inside with the AC and catch up with a friend. Fresh donuts and cookies available also.
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: It was good. I might have ordered the wrong thing as the spicy chicken sand is VERY spicy.  I think I need to go back and try something else.  I think most of their business is take out because the ambience is really nothing to speak of and I decided to eat there.  Also thought the almost $5.00 for a lemonade and then another $5.00 for a re-fill excessive.May not rush back!!
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Really enjoyed the Nashville hot cod sandwich! It was fresh and had good heat. The pickles are crunchy and the buns are also really fresh. The fish was perfectly fried (not caked in goopy breading) and the pieces were generous. I'd definitely return. Service was quick and their water didn't taste like gross tap water :)
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: What a gem!! Search in the area for a lunch spot.  This lovely little establishment popped up & I'm so glad it did!! The chicken parm was delish!!
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Wee little sandwhich. Given the location you can do a lot better. Especially combined with the price. Check out ghost.
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: My son recommended this place but I didn't know what to expect?!  It's a cute spot and the people seated looked like they were enjoying their food!!  We walked in and were greeted like family!  He was so personable and offered suggestions on what to order.  We were informed that everything is made in-house!  I ordered the Garlic Shrimp Laffa!  OH MY!!  The flavor was amazing!!  All of my taste buds were engaged and satisfied!!  All I can say is my tongue is happier now since I've experienced perfection!!  I can't wait to try something else next time!!  Thank You so much!!
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Finally made it back here. Initially ordered the fish sandwich and fries. This time, ordered the Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich and the cabbage slaw.Clearly the cheese steak was made to order as it took 15 mins but definitely worth the wait. Full of tender meat, the perfect amount of cheese, onions, etc. skipped the fries this time and tried the cabbage slaw. Heavily salted, as someone who pickles vegetables all the time, you don't need this much salt. So I got creative and put some of it on my cheese steak. Not sure my Philly friends would approve, but the cabbage added a wonderful crunch and twist on a classic.Service was super friendly and the place seemed so much less congested this time around. While it was quite warm in this small space, really enjoyed a well-crafted sandwich.
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: My first visit here and I must say, super tasty sandwiches.Ordered the Fried Cod Sandwich and the bistro cut fries. I could have devoured two of sandwiches. Seriously, somewhat on the small side but packing a nostalgic punch that made all the ingredients work.Aside from a quality piece of cod perfectly fried, the house made relish and old school American cheese steal the show. Think an elevated Filet-O-Fish from McDonalds.The fries? Unfortunately, a soggy room temperature mess. Had to trash them. And you're talking to a guy who could fry my big toe and eat it.Staff was super friendly. Place is a bit small with a lot going on inside. But that first bite of that fish sandwich will clear things up. Excited now to try other options. Just not the fries.
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This place gets 5 stars because it has the best cheesesteak I've had in 5 years of living here.I had with provolone and mushrooms with peppers on the side. It was an incredible. The meat and cheese together melt with the mushrooms. So good is this taste that's it's hard to describe.But mark my words there's no better cheese steak sandwich.The ambiance is a chill simple vibe with indoor and out door seating. My wife had the Original Tony with sesame.It too was delish. The service is very kind and works hard to serve you the goods.
Address: 6909 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Our DTLA foodie walking tour, via Six Taste Food Tours brought us here, and I will be forever grateful!This is the best authentic, hand-made, Italian pasta I've ever had in Southern California. I'm born/raised LA, but have eaten in Italy, New York and Chicago so I can make this claim, lol.Y'all, it's legit SO good! There's a little pasta-making shop on site. Fresh-made pasta just hits differently.Our group shared family style:Pumpkin ravioli with truffle cheese sauce- my faveSpinach ravioli with osso bucco- 2nd faveGnocchi with ragu- tied for 2nd faveRigatoni with pom- simple/deliciousI'm coming back, very soon!Thanks for the intro, Sally from the Valley with Six Taste!
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Food: 5/5I got the boccoletti al pesto ricotta, lasagna di carne, . The pasta was so fresh, the each of the pasta sauces were delicious. So rich and fresh in flavor, and the flavor profiles were so in depth. The tiramisu was delicious as well!Service: 5/5Both times I've been here, the service is very attentive and friendly. They make fun conversation with their guests and give great wine recommendations.Ambiance: 4/5It's a romantic getaway from DTLA. It's nice but nothing too unique.
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: I don't even know where to start. It's difficult to think that you can find a small slice of Italy in busy downtown LA. You would think the food spot to go to would be Grand Central Market but little do the tourists know, the best food is just across the street in a small restaurant with a private patio that gets you away from the city.The food is amazing. Every time I go I get the Ravioli Di Zucca. I'll either get it for myself or we add it as an appetizer because it is that good. We also always get the garlic bread. It's done so well and one of the best comfort foods.The staff! So friendly, so helpful, and all about you having a great experience. You can tell they just want you to enjoy your time and savor your food.I'll keep going back again and again!
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: This is one of our favorite spots to visit in downtown LA. The place is so inviting with its patio lit up with strings of lights across the patio tables and just makes for a cozy area. The pasta is great and we always have the shrimp appetizer which is almost a meal in itself. We highly recommend this location.
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Charming with outdoor seatingHowever, ordered takeout and was pretty terribleStaying at the hotel next door, it was ready quickly and time between pickup and eating was minimal,2 orders spaghetti w/meatballs and order garlic bread $58Included bread was the best part of meal,Garlic bread overcooked and hard throughout.Meatballs were small and firm, had a good flavor, but the spaghetti was dry, parts were stuck together. It was like leftovers, tiny bit of sauce stretched to go with spaghetti at the bottom of pot.After a couple of minutes my husband looked over as he picked out a meatball and asked if mine was as bad as his.Possibly dining experience is a large part of other reviews. Perhaps the quality control of takeout is low, nevertheless, we threw out most of it, so wouldn't recommend
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Delicious clean ingredients and freshest pasta in LA!! Great atmosphere and the service was excellent.
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Best pasta and vibes in downtown LAService was amazing !! Best birthday lunch  Agnolotti Di Osso Bucco
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: My new favorite pasta spot in LA. Restaurant is super cute and food is delicious. They make their pasta in house, cook it to perfection, and serve with simple yet amazing sauce. I ordered rigatoni and spaghetti-both were phenomenal. The mushroom cream sauce was amazing and had a really strong flavor. Will highly recommend this pasta restaurant
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Let me tell yah... just order a bunch of meatballs and you'll be happy.To start, Servers are always attentive and kind. Discreet and efficient, love it.Food, a bit hit or miss honestly.Garlic bread: my friends love it! It is delicious but a bit too strong for me.Meatballs: ooooooooh, so tender and delicious, tiny so you can pop them in your mouth and the sauce doesn't overpower them at all.Shocked I forgot to take photos... basically, I think the cream pastas are great while the meat sauce pastas can be a bit... lackluster. Too light and, I know it's basically mainly tomatoes, but it almost taste like tomato juice with some herbs just sprinkled in.Still love the place, very affordable to for such great food
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: One of my absolute favorite restaurants in all of Los Angeles.  I've been coming here for at least ten years (back when they didn't have a liquor license and it was strictly BYOB!) and never have I had anything less than a phenomenal experience.  Excellent service, reasonable prices, fresh pasta made with love and care -- this is as good as it gets.  (WARNING: be prepared to wait!  They don't take reservations so the seating is first-come, first-serve.)
Address: 332 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: The food is good. I come here from time to time all the way from San Bernardino. Waited an hour to be seated which is fine. No problem ever comes up except for today. I paid and as I was leaving the restaurant, one of the lady blocked my way and asked me to tip. She was all up in my face forcing me to tip. Yeah, maybe when I'm rich but I'm a broke college student, lower the price or pay the worker the right wages. No one is paying for my gas or time and the bill is coming out to over $40, that's a lot for me but I still come here because of the food. I asked her if I have to tip and she said "if the service is good and the food is good then I need to tip these amounts" as she was pointing to the tipping percentages.First of all, service was standard and shouldn't service suppose to be good. I came for the food and paid for it so what's the problem?Secondly, blocking my way and forcing me to tip is considered terrible service for me. I did end up tipping because the lady was blocking my way and not letting me leave unless I tip. I also didn't want to make a scene but this is terrible. I feel intimidated and threatened.Not sure if I'll ever come back here again after this terrible experience. Please treat your customers better and with respect.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I've been here a ton of times and always left satisfied. The quality is just as good as when I first came here years ago. This is straight up one of my favorite spots in LA.If you come here at peak hours there might be a long wait list (that you have physically write your name on with a pen), but it tends to move pretty fast as they are efficient with turning over tables. I also want to note that the servers are always super friendly, which is nice!This is kinda a hole in the wall place. There is counter seating where you can watch the fresh noodles being made, or some cramped tables so I guess it kinda feels like an authentic Japanese experience lol. I don't mean this in a negative way and the food here is so good that I barely even notice that I'm super close to the party seated next to me.I've tried a good amount of the menu at this point and my go to is the miso carbonara udon. The fresh noodles are always so satisfyingly chewy and the miso carbonara sauce is creamy and savory. Tastes even better with a generous sprinkle of togarashi (the red pepper stuff). Italians would probably shudder at the thought of this dish, but sorry Italy it's so very good! I would say if you come here you should stick to their specialty udons over the traditional cause they just have a little more something to them.I also always order my udon with a tempura soft boiled egg (a must!) and whatever other tempura I'm in the mood for. The pumpkin and kakiage are also great choices! The tempura always comes out hot and perfectly fried.During lunch they also offer a special combo of a mini rice bowl with your udon. I love to get the pork belly bowl or the spicy pork, they're both great.I look forward to continuing to visit this spot for as long as I live in LA.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Two of us put our name down on a Wednesday nightTHE COST$61.44 total for 2 starts, 2 udon bowls.APPETIZERS/SALAD* Mushroom Salad ($9.80) - 2.5 starsA very basic salad, mostly lettuce, a few slices of tomato, and a pile of mushrooms on top. Not worth the price. I did like the dressing which seemed to be made fresh.* Tofu Agedashi ($6) - 4.5 starsLovely silky soft tofu with a soft thick layer of breading, so tasty half soaked in the broth. The shave daikon was great, refreshing, and added thickness/texture to the broth.HOT UDONS* Beef w Fluffy Jidori Egg Udon ($16.25) - 4 starsThe udon noodles were perfection. This is definitely a filling one, the egg and sliced beef making the broth intense and thick.* Duck Nanban Udon ($16.75) - 4 starsAgain the noodles were fantastic. More simplistic, this comes with a japanese spice you can add that smelled minty to me but has the numbing spice. It countered the duck well, which can be quite intense and gamey. We appreciated that the slices of duck had also been seared to add some char/texture.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Wow, the best udon I've had! Excellent, excellent texture. Made in-house, and it has just the right amount of give. I also liked the cold options, and their signature ones are good for those who want something a little more fusion. Plus the servings are huge - everything comes out in giant bowls!THE WAIT: About a 20-minute wait for four of us at noon on a Saturday.THE SERVICE: Really professional and thorough. The guy who took our order really wanted to get it right, he repeated it back to us to check three times!SIGNATURE UDON* Miso Carbonara (Creamy White Sauce based Udon w/ Bacon, hint of Miso flavor. $12.50) - 3.5 starspic:yelp.com/biz_photos/maru…An interesting mix of western flavors and eastern textures. Definitely a very thick sauce, very heavy, just like you'd expect from a carbonara sauce at an Italian restaurant, and it went surprisingly well with the thick udon noodle thought I couldn't taste the "hint of Miso flavor'. The thick bits of bacon were great. If you want something more familiar to a western palate or really different for Asian food, this is the way to go, but I wouldn't get this if you're looking for authentic Japanese cuisine.COLD UDON* Bukkake Udon (Cold Udon with Cold Broth. $6.95) - 4.5 starspic:yelp.com/biz_photos/maru…This was great! I was intrigued by the cold udon section, something I'd never had before. The photos made this serving look really small, but it still comes out in a huge bowl. You have to mix the different toppings (radish, bonito flakes, scallion, and tempura pieces) really well together. Once they're all in their right proportions mixed in, then it really tastes right! The radish adds a thickness, the tempura this great crunch, and scallion/bonita extra flavor. You can pour the sauce, in a separate container, over the noodle, but that ends up sinking at the bottom. I found it was better to make your spoon with the noodle and mixed toppings (get some from the bottom; they've invariably clumped there), then pour the sauce over your spoonful. Delicious!I also tried a bit of the Beef Udon (Hot Udon section), which was very classic and tasty. The meat was sliced very thin and was tender. It would've been my next choice had I not wanted a cold udon!yelp.com/biz_photos/maru…Menu:yelp.com/biz_photos/maru…
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: We came to Monzo in-between lunch and dinner hours and enjoyed our experience. We were greeted by friendly and helpful staff that told us a bit about the menu and recommended a few specialities.Amongst them was the Sea Urchin Udon, Agedashi Eggplant, Chicken Wings appetizer, tempura mix, and more... We ordered most of these and octopus balls (tacoyaki).The Uni Udon felt like a "home cooked meal" - nice and rich, a bit under salted yet tasty nonetheless. Tacoyaki was excellent. Agedashi eggplant is incredible. Tempura is some of the best I had in awhile, mainly due to variety.We loved both service and ambiance.Food: 4.5 starsService: 5 starsAtmosphere: 4.5 starsTips:Little Tokyo parking is tight, but you can score a spot.Follow their advise on food.This place gets busy at peak hoursGo on weekday, 2PM-6PMUni Udon is RICH!This is a very small restaurant.Perfect for sharing.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Been here at least 4 times and it doesn't disappoint! Came here with the homie on a hot summer day and waited about 30 minutes. Service was really attentive as always. It feels like they added more tables or maybe I don't remember because  it's been a while since I've been here.I usually go for the sea urchin udon, miso carbonara, or butter mentaiko squid udon but I've decided to try something different since it was hot and humid that day.I got the beef bukkake cold udon + $3 for double portion this time and I wasn't really a huge fan of the broth. The noodles, meat, and shredded daikon were excellent. The noodles still had that fresh al dente bite to them(nice and chewy), the beef belly wasn't too fatty, and the grated daikon gave it refreshing depth of flavor taste.Their fried chicken has always been on point crispy, tender, seasoned well and it pairs so well with the Japanese mayo/curry seasoning on the side.If you come here you have to definitely get sea urchin udon, miso carbonara, butter mentaiko squid, beef udon, and I would definitely try the curry next time. If you're a fat ass like me then you have the option to get double portion for only $3 more but that only applies for cold udon and hot udon!
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Came on a Friday night at 6:30 for 2 people with a few people in front of us, we didn't have to wait at all (we sat at the counter). Place is pretty small so I don't recommend for bigger parties. After we left around 7:45 there were a lot of people waiting so def recommend coming before 7.Ordered the mentai cream udon and miso carbonara udon with both being $16.75. Also got the fried chicken which was around $9. Both udon dishes were very tasty, especially the carbonara as the sauce was thick and the bacon flavor really came through. The mentai one had tons of mini scallops and a couple mini shrimp pieces which were nice and soft. However, both are a bit on the smaller side but would rate them a 7.7/10. The fried chicken was nice and crispy with a great umami flavor paired with curry power and Japanese mayo on the side (8/10).Biggest downside was that it did take a while to get our food (about 30 mins for udon) especially the fried chicken which took about 40 mins. It was a bit strange since it was an appetizer and it came when we just about finished our udon. I understand that it was busy but they didn't explain the situation or explain the wait while other tables (who ordered after us) got their food first.Overall would rate place 7/10 and would come again to try the other dishes.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I used to like this place a few years ago, but today it was too salty. Got the mentai and miso carbonara, and they were both too salty. I also felt like the seafood that was used for the mentai wasn't high-quality seafood. You can sit either outside or inside, and I opted to sit inside, which was a bit cramped.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: My review's probably not gonna matter much because this place is basically an institution in Little Tokyo at this point, but I personally don't get what the hype is about. I've had the Sea Urchin Udon and the Seafood tomato cream udon and both just tasted way more creamy than seafood-y. The udon noodle quality itself is very good and tastes handmade. I also ordered the Sansai Udon which was waaay too salty- I couldn't even finish it and felt the salt on my tongue for an hour after. Their fried chicken was very good and juicy (but not particularly unique). The only reason I've been here so many times is because my partner likes their Creamy Mushroom Udon. Overall, I'd say if you like creamy food, you might like it but as for me, I don't get the hype.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Cute spot in little Tokyo! Make sure you go during off hours bc the store is small and it'll be a long wait to get a table. Food is super reasonably priced here and the udon definitely makes you full :)My go to's are the uni pasta and miso cabanara hehe. Tried to try something different - the mapo tofu udon.. and it was very eh lol.Staff were all friendly and attentive !!
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: so good. not too salty and not overly creamy. such a good japanese fusion restaurant but you should expect to wait 30+ minutes at peak lunch hours.
Address: 329 E 1st St Los Angeles, CA 90012

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: This place is a great to get brunch and get the whole LA on Sunset Blvd experience. The social media coffee was also great and I would recommend to get a chocolate flavored coffee. The potatoes really stole the show for me. They were very delicious. The servers were really nice and attentive.
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: Home of the rainbow lattes! Yummy food and really nice servers. Great vibes and room for parking !
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: Awwwww its a really popular place for brunch  lots of people coming for the colorful coffee, burritos and salmon are good!
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: I love going here for brunch when I can make it. I always have a wonderful experience. The staff is super helpful and attentive and good I candy and the location is perfect on Sunset Plaza.
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: I stopped in for brunch with some girlfriends after one of them said it was a popular spot to visit. Although their color burst latte seemed like a fun drink to order, I went with the Butcher's Bloody Mary and loved the presentation of it when it came out. It comes with pieces of grilled cheese sandwich skewered on top of the drink which was surprisingly delicious and the perfect compliment to the tomato based drink. While I loved the drinks, I was a bit disappointed in their breakfast burrito. I'm not sure if they were trying to go healthier with the burrito and the potatoes, but it tasted pretty bland and I had to dump a bunch of salsa on it for flavor. Overall a cute spot to enjoy brunch in a nice location.
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: Fantastic brunch spot on the iconic Sunset Strip in West Hollywood.Best coffee, great food, superior service from all staff.Love BBCM!
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: Great brunch spot. Good good options and the drinks are good too. The outdoor seating is nice- right on sunset. And the back patio is nice and quiet too. Plus there is parking in the back which always makes a difference
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: The food here was pretty good! I ordered a strawberry salad ($25) along with the mimosa flight ($25) which included the flavors wild hibiscus, original (OJ) and strawberry, the wild hibiscus was the best tasting and they came out cute however it wasn't worth $25 to me because there was not enough of the base juices when served as you can see from these pictures the server pours the Prosecco for you and about half way. The salad was good but there should have been more dressing or a wow factor...I guess it is a salad but it does not need to be bland! I loved the beautiful seating (plenty indoors and out) and service. There's also valet parking in the back. Parking can be difficult in the area.
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: Good atmosphere and the food was good, just a little pricey. But that's West LA! Recommend to go at least once if you're in the area.
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

RestaurantName: The Butcher, The Baker, The Cappuccino Maker
Comment: love coming here! the service is always great and the servers really know the menu! they run it down in a way that's easy to understand with honest opinions, not just restaurant favorites. i always get the banana fresh toast with a side of bacon and it hits every time
Address: 8653 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: This is my favorite restaurant of all time. I grew to erring here and so I'm sad that it's gotten so expensive .If you don't like things like intestines, salgogi (beef brisket) is the way to go! And make sure you mix in the radish kimchi ;).Parking is usually valet~The service is always nice and the ambiance is a classic Korean restaurant. 11/10.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The best Korean soup outlet. Their Sul Lung Tang is #1 both in terms of quality taste and generous serving, check out their other offerings and will not disappoint you.My go to comfort food lunch or dinner.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I've been coming here for over 20 yrs and do love the food. Their sulungtang is consistent and always hits the spot. The simple sides - the giant bucket of green onions you can add up your soup, the two types of kimchi, is minimal on the eye but perfect with the soup. The price has been creeping up fast though. It's flat $20 per bowl with tax, before tip. So for 2 bowls, they brought a laminated total bill of $40. I don't know if they will go back and redo such things once inflation for the cost cools down. If it wasn't so pricy, I would go more regularly.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The sul lang tang is so yummy here. I've tasted so many and in CA, I'd say this one has the richest smooth broth. Bummer that they raised the price of soup and rice as much as they have in the last 2 years. In Korea you can get more meat and just as good if not better for half the price or less. Nevertheless, this is my dads favorite place to go and he's picky old school Korean dad so that says a lot. Service is quick and easy.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Time: Thursday 6pmParking/Wait: Free Parking right in front (sometimes theres a small valet fee if it's busy). The lot is a little narrow, and there weren't too many available spots left. My party of 2 was able to be sat right away, but I've heard that there sometimes is a long line.Food/Drinks: I always like trying places that have a specialty dish, and this place's was seolleongtang: a hearty bone broth made from ox bones. They give you a HUGE bucket of green onions, and there are also accompanying rice, kimchi, and radish kimchi. This is the best seolleongtang you can get in LA. Nice simple broth with a great selection of meat topping options so you can get whatever you're feeling that day. Add salt to your preference, and you are bound to have a perfect meal on a cold gloomy day.Ambiance: The place was a very mom-and-pop shop. Nothing fancy, but clean and comforting.Service: The waitresses were very nice and quick. Order came out fast since it's basically the only thing on their menu (just with varying toppings).Take-Out Packaging: Styrofoam bowls and plastic bagsSummary: Simply put, if I'm craving seolleongtang, I'm making my way here. My only complaint is the price. I can't quite remember exactly how much it was, but it was almost $20 (plus a potential parking fee). While this dish is a classic, I feel a little hesitant dishing out that much for this dish. Yes, this place has the best seolleongtang, but is a bowl of seolleongtang worth $20? Maybe. I feel like I would only come here if I'm really in the mood for it or if I need some hot soup on a cold day.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Must try KTown staple...with speedy service your bowl of amazing broth will fill your senses...it really is like slurping up silk
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Love this place so much. I crave it pretty often, but I don't think I can ever go back. Too many good memories.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I didn't know I wanted it, but robots and KBBQ is the perfect combo to experience the restaurants of the future.Our robot summoning waiter deftly dished the plates from the robots while expertly wielding the tongs to cook our meat to perfection. I think even the robots were impressed.Come here for the robots, but stay for the food and chaos.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Han Bat Sul Lung Tang is a hole in the wall Korean restaurant that specializes in one thing. Sul Lung Tang, or ox-bone soup. Once we got seated, we were immediately attended to and were given the banchan of cabbage and radish kimchi, both of which were delicious. I opted for the Beef Brisket Sul Lung Tang and each soup comes with a bowl of rice. These were served in a matter of minutes, all steaming hot and smelling delicious. Sul Lung Tang is a dish that prioritizes on having a clean, beefy flavor and is served with salt, pepper, and chili on the side to be seasoned to each person's palate. The soup was amazing, one of the best ox-bone soup broths I've ever had and you can truly taste the quality of it. This place is very busy and feels like it is more of a come in, eat, and get out kind of restaurant so be wary of that. Other than that, this restaurant is a must-try for those craving the homey feeling of a warm bowl of soup.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Read about this place from so many articles. Finally had a chance to try it.  Upon arrival, the line was already out the door. But don't let the queue scare you. It moves pretty fast. And the reason for this is because their menu is limited. It's really just one page. No fuss. You sit down, order, and in under 5 minutes, the food is brought out to you. You eat, and then you get out. This is not one of those places you sit around and chat. So if that's the ambiance you are looking for, this is not it.I ordered the tongue and flank.
