Added lots of green onion and salt to my preference. It was delicious. However, you will not be so full that you would have to undo your pants button. I left with plenty of stomach space for dessert. It's great if you have a hangover or wanting something light. Not so good if you are starving.Parking: Valet parking or park on the street.Line: Please note the queue starts at the back of the restaurant, where the parking lot is. So don't think you got lucky when you open the front door and there isn't a line.
Address: 4163 W 5th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Sad to give Mother Wolf 3 stars but it must be done.We arrived and were seated at the table. The waitress goes over the menu then disappears for so long!She recommended the artichokes and squash blossoms. Squash blossoms are ok, a bit salty. Artichokes were awfully overly salted and not good.The pizza was delicious and the oxtail Ragu were the stand out. Carbonara and other pasta dish was also salty.The veal was not good. The cook on it was very uneven and didn't look very appetizing when it came out. The lamb chops were good.Dessert: we got the chocolate torte and ricotta cheesecake. They were out of decaf so no coffee to enjoy with our dessert.There were 2 times when random servers came and dropped off food that wasn't ours. Not sure if this is a common occurrence with other guests.Also, when we were still enjoying our dessert, they asked us to move because they were backed up. I don't think it was our fault that we had to wait to order both our order and our dessert and then they ask us to leave while we were still finishing up dessert.I think this place is more hype. I don't think I would be back.
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Amazing dinner spot. Every course was ten out of ten. Would come back! Make reservations on resy.
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I have been to almost every major restaurant in West Hollywood and Hollywood area. Unfortunately mother wolf was a bit disappointing. Over priced drinks and food. The food quality was average. In a great location. No view. Busy on the weekends.Not a favorite.
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was divine! Service impeccable. My dining experience here was a 10/10 would recommend. In actually very surprised I was able to swing a reservation here.
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The food and atmosphere was phenomenal... perfect for a great date night. If you are an Italian food lover than this is the place for you. The staff were amazing and didn't miss a step. Will be going back
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The food was so delicious and the service was impeccable. The lamb was not gamy at all. We had the zucchini blossoms, the mortadella pizza and a few other dishes. Even their bread was good.
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Ah, Mother Wolf in Hollywood, the place where dreams of a great wine experience go to die. Picture this: we're there for a work dinner, wallets padded by the company expense account, ready to splurge on some fine wine. We thought, "Let's get fancy and talk to the sommelier about the vintage differences between some of the older Barolos."Enter the somm, who seemed as knowledgeable about Barolos as a fish is about mountain climbing. We asked questions, and the answers we got were the verbal equivalent of talking to a used car salesmen bs'ing their way through a pitch. Confidence shattered, we settled for a bottle of Brezza Barolo, which tasted like it was still in its awkward teenage years.The wine list at Mother Wolf is, for lack of a better phrase, a hot mess. It's like they took the concept of "wine selection" and replaced it with "let's see how much we over-charge these Hollywood dumb dumbs."
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: First time at MW. The meatballs and mortadella sandwich were good.My husband and I were on a date night. We ordered too much food so we could take it to go for our kids. We had three plates of pasta that were barely eaten and lamb chops. They gave us a (to go) number to pick up our left overs as we left. They ended up giving our leftovers to somebody else!! WTH!!!Also, I wasn't done with my wine and they took it away. it was half full!!very grabby. Did not appreciate that at all!!Went home with none of our left overs.Not ok! They need to SLOW down and actually pay attention. Wish they actually cared about what happened!
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The food was delicious, and the service was excellent. Shout out to our server Sean, he was awesome. Everything he recommended was great. The lamb chops were my fav ohhh and I can't forget those oxtail meatballs. I'll be back.
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The food was great. Just beware that the waiters will add gratuity to your bill and not tell you. So your group is then adding gratuity onto an inflated bill as well. Pretty crappy of them to not tell you. They probably just assume you won't notice as everyone is throwing their card onto the tray.
Address: 1545 Wilcox Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Yumm! Came for to celebrate a friends birthday and was not disappointed! We ordered off the 4 course prix fixe set! Everything was delicious! I really like the baked Brie and the salmon! The white chocolate bread pudding was also really delicious! Our server was very helpful in answering all our questions! The view amazing and the live music was great!
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Brett was so wonderful. He was the best mangeger. He took care of us. He made sure we got our food & drink on time. He made my m friend birthday very special. He i the best. He makes this place so special. Thank you we will be back soon
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Good drinks, great views, chill vibes when it's not too busy.  Haven't had the food yet. Next time. Parking sucks, but the views make up for it.
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Perch is an LA staple: The type of place that is consistently cited as a destination for tourists, the glitter-on-cheek crowd, Instagram influencers, those trying to land the gig, and those who want to experience the promise of Perch and determine for themselves if Perch merits its august reputation. I fall into the last category, and I can say that Perch fulfills its promise, kind-of, but not really, but at the same time it kind of does, if that makes sense. Like imagine that you have been wanting to taste this cookie and finally you do, and the cookie is everything you hoped it would be but not in the way you expected it to be. So you build up expectations in your head, that the reality of the situation does not deliver. I guess that is the problem with having a robust and notable reputation, you could never live up to it because you can never measure up to a person's imagination.My partner in dine was my friend Carlos, the epitome of a Peter Pan type, old enough to know better, but stubborn enough to remain young at heart. He credits his youthful charm, perspective, and look to his regular visits to the gym and eating right. Note that he did not order the fruit plate of Perch, which means that he is not too strict.I opt for valet. It cost 16.00 dollars. If it it seems high, it is not for downtown LA prices. When we got close, the Valet asked if I could park a car in a nearby spot. I sternly, said no, "you can park it." I did feel a certain type of way for being asked to park my own car, even if the spot was close. I go out to be pampered, to be a princess in the world of dining, and quite frankly, a princess does not park her own carriage. Carlos made a joke to the Valet, on how I needed my car parked because I did not know how to park that well. I was annoyed. I stood up for myself, and for that I was the butt of a joke. I paid 16 dollars, I did not want to park my car. Am I right reader? or Am I wrong? Truthfully there is no right or wrong answer. I told Carlos how I felt and it took a cocktail from Perch to my mellow my nerves.The cocktails were not only effective, but tasty. I am someone who does not like to taste alcohol. I informed our server of this fact. I cannot remember their name but they read female to me, so I will be using she/her pronouns to refer to them. I asked our server what recommendation she had for a super sweet drink, she suggested a drink, I cannot remember what it was called but it was pink- fruity for sure, and it had a rim of brown sugar, maybe. It went down sweet-- just like I like my cocktails. This was the cocktail that softened my nerves enough to forget Carlo's blunder of joking with the valet at my expense.Carlos and I started off with the avocado toast. It was solid. I especially appreciated the citrus taste afloat the avocado toast. I also appreciated that the toast was sliced into three slices. I hate when I have to wrestle with my avocado toast; either while cutting it, or when picking it up. I also appreciated that Carlos did not wrestle me when I had two of the slices, and he only 1. Still that did not atone for his faux pa.The rest of the food was simply solid. I had the burger, and the potatoes. He had the classic breakfast: Two eggs, chic ken sausage, and potatoes. He cleaned his plate, he left a small bite of the sausage. I had that small piece before it was taken away by the server. Glad I did--- it was really good sausage!There was a bus-person, she read female to me. She preferred to speak Spanish to me. She had a necklace that was half a heart and half an infinity sign. I asked her, who gave her the lovely gift. She replied her husband with a smile that my heart saw. We shared a moment. She felt it too.As she was cleaning tables, our eyes met and she returned a sincere smile. When I left the joint to go to the Perch Bar, she said in Spanish, thank you for coming, in the most sincere way, like a mother's kiss on her child's cheek- pure love. This is the type of service I expect, customer-centered, sincere, and like I was welcomed guest. Now you see, why I ddid not park my car myself, because that made me feel like I was a number to be processed, and I needed to help in the processing progress of my own turn around the revolving door.Of course, Perch is nestled in the heart of LA. You sit amidst LA's famous skyline. That is why for those who want pictures, go here. Our dining neighbors did. It was two women and one got up three times to take pictures of her partner in dine. Then the server tried her hand at the picture taking. The women did not come together for the server. The same woman who was photographed by her partner in dine, was now being photographed by the server. So, I get that good pictures are important for people, so if pictures are that important for you, come here. But I guess everyone needs to go to Perch to experience its promise and decide for yourself if it was fulfilled or not. Its lofty reputation demands it!
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Loves this place so much. It was cost, very romantic and nice place. We celebrated my husband's birthday there, and it was so beautiful day. We tried seafood soup, steak and potatoes with truffles. I can't explain which one was better, as everything was perfect. Server was so kind, as when our friends wanted to join us hosts didn't want to give another table for 4, but the server helped us with that and moved to another table immediately.
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Went here for a friend's birthday! Service was great, view was beautiful and the food was delicious! Would suggest making a reservation to avoid waiting.
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: The food sucks. The view is great. But there are way better rooftop bars and restaurants. This one is way over hyped. Most of the people there are squares and not real Angelinos. And I warned about a dress code. What restaurant has a dress code? Only to see 2 guys there with OP shorts and flip-flops. The place is a pretentious joke. Don't waste your time.
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Bachelorette brunch! Personalized price fix menu. Very fun for all twelve of us! Service, drinks & ambiance was perfect for this occasion although pricey...but isn't everything now.
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Beautiful setting, great views, very good food.  Love this place. The ambiance at sunset makes it all worthwhile. Will return.
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Great Place. You pay for the viewService was good. Food was ok but chicken was dry. All in all fun evening with friends.
Address: 448 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Wow!  My son and his family treated us to their new favorite restaurant, Cento, and what made it special was they reserved six seats on the counter facing the chefs!  For the grandkids, and the grandpa, it was a 90 minute show of professional skill, energy, and teamwork that can't be beat!  For some, just having a quiet dinner with conversation is the point of going out to eat, but given the hustle and bustle of the dining areas, I'm not sure that this is that kind of place!We had six pastas, four starters, and two desserts, and everything was great; especially when you can see it prepared for you!!!  The touches were great, for example the basil oil for the pomodoro, the egg yolk for the carbonara sitting majestically at the top of the beautiful mound of pasta.  The smoky, blistered octopus and heaping pile of clams and mussels in a dreamy broth.  The only thing I could have wanted was some sourdough bread to sop up the rich, creamy sauces (then again, by the time we were done, we were way over-sated!).  Can't wait to come again when we are in town!!!
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: such a beautiful space with amazing food & service! the staff were so attentive and all the food blew us away! definitely would love to come back next time i'm in LA.
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Excellent food and great atmosphere. Don't let the visually unimpressive neighborhood deter you from trying this special restaurant. We sat at the counter next to the open kitchen in what is a very attractively designed interior. We had charred octopus (tender with a tasty sauce), spicy pomodoro (delicious), sweet corn agnolotti (unique and interesting), and grilled orta fish (perfectly cooked but needs more flavor). Aside from the fish, which would benefit from having a more penetrating sauce instead of or in addition to nesting in a bunch of tiny tomatoes whose flavor doesn't integrate into the fish, all the dishes notably provided tastes that are complex and sophisticated.
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: The outdoor space is really nice and creatively built around a tree in the center. The music was a little loud for our taste, but I'm not going to knock a place for not being exactly what we wanted.We were coming in from out of town to attend an event after and were running a little late. We called, and they pushed back our reservation. And later the owner (I think) stopped by our table to ask what we were in town for.Our waitress was great and helped make sure everything moved along quickly after we told her we needed to leave in a little over an hour. Our appetizer (a special tomato salad over whipped feta) came out almost immediately and was SO GOOD.I also enjoy my berry+mezcal drink. It was simple but tasty and refreshing. We got the famous spicy pomodoro, and it lived up to the hype. The carbonara was also delicious. I appreciate the noodles themselves.The famous beet spaghetti wasn't available because they're out of season. We'll have to come back for it!We finished the evening with the banana pudding tiramisu (which we've been thinking about for days) and a nice Americano (loved the glass it was served in).When we paid and walked out to hand over our valet ticket, we were surprised to see our car was already being pulled up. Great communication amongst the staff and great service!
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Very good pasta but our visit was weird. The owner/manager made a weird comment about us not being allowed to take photos when the food came out and if it was meant to be a joke, then it wasn't funny.Five star rating for their spicy pomodoro. I could eat the entire thing without thinking. The shrimp malfadine was too salty. The broccoli bucatini was very good as well. Highly recommend bucatini and pomodoro. I would not get the malfadine again. The shrimp was rubbery. The pea starter with yogurt sauce was delicious with garlic on top.They have issues with pricing on the menu. The starter was 18 on the menu and on the bill it said 22. Same with the malfadine. It was 28 on the menu but 33 on the bill. Then the same owner/manager makes a comment about catching the mistake on his menu but it was like weirdly sketch. luckily they took the pea dish starter off which was kind of them but we left the malfadine since they already took the starter off. Aside from the weird owner's vibe, the staff is attentive and I was surprised about the little detail of storing your leftovers before you leave. I've never been to a restaurant that essentially has a coat check for your leftovers. Overall I would definitely come back for their pomodoro and to try the corn angliotti.
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: And just like that...after one visit to Cento, it's now one of my favorite restaurants in LA.Cento has a beautiful patio, built around a lovely tree, and draped in tiny white lights. The patio has a sandy floor, and it feels like you've been transported to a beachside Italian village. (Or, well, someplace other than the block of West Adams that it shares with an auto repair shop.)The service is exceptional. Attentive but not intrusive, with lots of lovely little touches, like storing your leftovers in their refrigerator until you're ready to leave.The cocktail menu is small and creative. I tried the Espresso & Date martini, with vodka, oat milk, aquafaba and orange, and it was superb--well-balanced and very unique. I also tried a sip (and then possibly three more sips when someone wasn't looking...) of the Fig & Walnut (with Scotch, sweet vermouth and apricot) and it was excellent. I'm excited to return and try the other four cocktails on the menu.Cento's menu is pretty seafood-heavy, so as someone who can't eat seafood, I worried that I wouldn't find much to eat. But in fact, I found too much to eat. (See the note about leftovers above.)We started with the Heirloom Radicchio Salad--with dates, pecan, and raspberry vinaigrette--and the presentation was astoundingly beautiful. It tasted even better.  Next up was the Farro Salad with roasted eggplant (that's blended into a sort of baba ghanoush and mixed into the salad), dill crème fraiche and pomegranate, and that was amazing, too. It looked very simple, but the flavors were astounding. I could eat vats of it.Then, it was time for pasta (!!!). We ordered three pastas for the two of us, because we simply couldn't decide (again, reference note about leftovers...). The Bolognese was my favorite--a super comforting dish of ricotta gnocchi in a phenomenal meat sauce. I also loved the Sweet Corn Agnolotti (charred corn, crème fraiche, Old Bay and chervil). Definitely don't miss that one. And finally, the Spicy Pomodoro (which was not very spicy at all, and I'm a spice wimp), because I saw it going to several other tables and had to try it. While it was my least favorite of the three, it was still great.And finally...dessert. DO. NOT. MISS. DESSERT. The Banana Pudding Tiramisu (a combination of things I wouldn't normally be into) was one of the best desserts I've ever had in life. It's their specialty. Just do it.
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Came here on a first date and had an amazingly great time!Upon entry, the ambiance was immaculate. I loved the outdoor patio seating area and wished we got to sit out there and enjoy the night sky  Don't get me wrong, inside was lovely as well but it was def on the smaller side. We were seated by the bathroom which was a hit or miss lol our waitress was sweet and offered recommendations for wine and food! All were amazing.We got their most popular pasta dish, spicy pomodoro. That was actually really good. It's not a dish I usually reach for but I truly enjoyed it! We also got their carbonara- also good! For appetizers, we opted for their octopus and raw fish! Love it!Overall, this was a great place to dine in and have great conversations! Would def come again with my girls for a GNO. Also, huge thank you to the staff cause we stayed past closing time to finish our wine and continue our conversations!
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Food: 8.3/10Ambience: 9/10Service: 8.6/10The outdoor seating at CENTO is beautiful. We went for a weekend dinner and the lighting along with the sand textured floors made for a unique experience. Our server was friendly and personable and gave excellent recommendations for the food. Must try for pasta lovers who want a refreshing twist.
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: A little hidden gem with a fun vibe, great food, and good service. The Caesar salad was my favorite, they took the beet spaghetti off the menu unfortunately.
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: My friend and I enjoyed our meal here last night.The steak tartare was decent 4/5.The farro salad was outstanding 5/5.  I love the flavors and textures.  It all blended sooooo well.I liked the black ink pasta with shrimp, but could also easily pass on it 3/5.My favorite dish was the duck confit 5/5.  Well, that and the farro salad.  Those two would also go well together.My friend enjoyed the snap green peas, while I thought they were decent but not great 3/5.We had the banana cream tiramisu 5/5 for dessert.  I'm not a big dessert person.  However, I loved this.The ambiance 3/5 leaves something to be desired.  The outside tables are on dirt.  Inside is communal style and super tiny.The wine and drink menu is limited.  Although, I did like the suggested pairings.Overall, it was a decent restaurant worth checking out if you're close.  We drove an hour, so I would probably skip it unless I'm in the area.
Address: 4921 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: I came here on a Saturday with my friend and we had a wonderful experience! I had an espresso and a Honey Bee cocktail (yum and yum!) for food we got the Little Gem Caesar (vegan!!!) cacio e pepe and the bread. The service was spot on. Chef Ryan is amazing. Ayshia is amazing. Thank you Superba
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: My brother and I met our uncle and cousin here last Sunday for a late lunch. We had reservations, but the restaurant wasn't that busy during that time. We started off with cocktails. I got the olive oil martini, which was a very different taste at first, but I think I'm kind of obsessed with it now, reminded me of a dirty martini. I also ordered the Hass avocado toast! Very good! We sat outside and the place was very cute. I definitely recommend coming here for lunch. I hope to try them out for dinner sometime!
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: My boyfriend brought me out for a date night at Superba and everything was wonderful. We first noticed the warm, welcoming outdoor ambiance and made sure to get a table outside. We ordered the half chicken and the chicken schnitzel; both of which were amazing. The highlight of the night was Grace, our server. She was full of helpful suggestions, a positive attitude, and a kindness that isn't always found in LA.We will definitely be returning soon!
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Stopped in last night without a reservation at 6pm to grab a bite before a show. Short on time, our party of 4 was seated instantly by a friendly hostess. I've eaten at Superba in Venice many times, but mainly brunch. I wasn't sure what to expect dinner wise. Wow. First of all the bread... Can we talk about the bread. Actually I can't talk about the bread because I'll start craving it again so therefore I'll just leave it at--get the bread! Food wise, we did not have any starters, but ordered 1 main per person. Chicken, Steak, Burger, and Fish. For a while it felt like we were playing musical chairs with our dinner plates. Moving them from person to person to make sure everyone tried each others yummy bites. Every dish was excellent and full flavor. If you are looking for a solid preshow dining option or just in general a delicious dinner experience in that area I highly recommend Superba. We will be going back for brunch and dinner soon and I seriously cannot wait. I want too try the whole menu!!!! Also noticed an oyster bar to the side of the main dining room. Not sure what that's about, but another reason to come back asap, along with a gorgeous outdoor patio.
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Summary: 3-3.5 stars for nice ambiance, decent service, good drinks, shareables/entree hits and misses, okay dessert***Our party of 7 had reservations on a weeknight at 7pm. I arrived early and saw open street meters in front of the restaurant, but I opted for valet parking which was $15 (+$1 additional charge if paying with credit card). We had drinks at the bar while waiting for the rest of the party. Since we requested outdoor seating, we were eventually led to the patio surrounded by greenery. Our server was humorous and mindful of our dietary restrictions. However, their attentiveness waned as the restaurant got busier.DRINK ORDERED- The Sustainer ($15 - coconut, rum, turmeric, cinnamon, nutmeg). A nice tropical drink with slight sweetness. The warm spices added an unexpected and welcome twist.FOOD ORDERED- Bread + All Four Spreads ($28). We received three varieties of fresh baked bread: a small baguette encrusted with poppy seeds, a chewy bread with sunflower seed topping, and a sourdough with olive oil inside and salted butter on top. My side of the table didn't get a knife... we struggled to tear the loaves with our hands. My least favorite bread was the baguette, since it was mostly hard and dry crust. The other two breads had better texture. While the sourdough had nice flavor, the olive oil didn't really work with the spreads.As for the spreads, I preferred the cheese with salsa macha and honey. Plain butter and salt was solid, but one bread already had ample oil and butter on it. The trout and artichoke dips were okay. Neither tasted much like their namesake though.- Roasted Beet Salad ($18). Warm roasted beets served on spring mix that was lightly dressed with a smoky vinaigrette. The salad was topped with pickled onion and mini toasts. Caramelized Spanish goat cheese contributed tartness and creaminess. I made a little toast with cheese, beets, and onion which tasted excellent.- Asparagus. Each spear was long and thick, cooked through, and retained a snap. The dish was topped with a creamy sauce that tasted fine, but was a bit oily.- Red Curry Mussels ($24). The mussels were just okay: soft, but not exactly flavorful. I liked the Thai-ish coconut milk curry, which had lime and garlic notes. The crusty baguette made more sense here, but it didn't soften in the sauce as I had hoped. It was nevertheless a tasty bite.- Hearth Roasted Mary's Half Chicken ($28). I was pleasantly surprised by the enormous portion of a dark leg quarter, white meat breast, and a wing. The chicken was juicy, and the skin rendered crispy. I enjoyed the spicy piri piri sauce that tasted like red bell pepper. My side salad didn't seem to have dressing on it, but there was enough flavor on the plate to assist.DESSERT ORDERED- Dark Chocolate Cake ($11). The cake looked promising, but unfortunately did not taste chocolatey. The sponge was not too sweet, which balanced the sweetness of the frosting. I appreciated the fresh whipped cream. Chocolate pearls added additional texture, but not much flavor.- Honey Creme Brulee ($12). The creme brulee was a smooth, loose custard pudding with a bruleed sugar crust. The custard had a strong vanilla and bourbon-ish flavor that I'm not sure was intentional. I also couldn't tell what the crumble was. At least the macerated grapefruit was good.
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was excellent! Service wasn't stupendous and it wasn't even that busy but our meals made up for it.
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Atmosphere was wonderful! Food was delicious and interesting! Service was great! Only complaint I have was one slice of their bread was $8 and an entire loaf was 6-8....that seems kind of ridiculous. That said the bread was sooooo good! Can't wait to go back and try more!
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Am I the only one still dreaming about that albacore confit sandwich??? I mean truly, the most satisfying sandwich I've had in a while. Would eat it for lunch every day.BUUUUTTT, they took it off the menu  bring it back...please?Super cute vibes, outside and in.Since I started this review, ate there again and tried new stuff. Everything was pretty tasty. The shrimp salad comes with 3 shrimp (maybe 4), not worth the price given the rest of the ingredients are pretty typical salad ingredients.Will definitely go back here though, It's a solid lunch spot especially for meetings.
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Superba is my go-to place in the neighborhood and I really would have loved to give it 5-star, as I previously wanted. Let's face it, the setting of this place is hard to beat. I used to sit on this gorgeous patio way back when it was still Cat&Fiddle, an unassuming British pub with a simple fare and cheap drinks. I won't be able to count times how many first dates I have had on that patio. I was really sad when it closed down. Never got to try The Hearth&Hound as it came around the pandemic, but I was elated to find the patio decorated with lots of trees and festive umbrellas and bougainvillea, the presence of which makes any which place look magical. But back to the food. Most things Superba makes is of good quality, especially the bread and bready things. However, as many many places in the city, the establishment's efforts to cut corners (and even bask on its laurels) becomes noticeable, which is terribly disappointed. Case to the point: I ordered an heirloom tomato and burrata dish, which I assumed would arrive with a sour dough toast. My mistake. But then again the dish said "burrata", not traces of burrata, not a promise of burrata, or burrata whisper, however, if you did not read in the menu that the white smear on the tomatoes was burrata, you would definitely miss that reference. Quite disappointing, yes. Further, a second server (not the one that took the order) brought out my Americano, which half spilled on the saucer. Without skipping a beat or turning her head she said passingly, "Sorry about the spillage", plop it on the table and continued walking. I was grateful she did not spill it on me because it felt that she would have said the exact same thing and left. Thankfully, seeing that I am taking pictures of the poor state of the coffee, the head waiter told me he would replace it and brought out a to-go coffee cup as if presuming that I wanted to take it to go, which I did not, but I was still grateful to get a hot cup of coffee instead of the lukewarm mess of the coffee that arrived earlier. Just because the service is casual it should not be careless, me thinks, because, you know, in the end, casual or not, you're going to put down 20% of the service charge. Other times I came here there were other small mishaps and imbalances but they kind of faded from my memory already. I really like the place and I want it to try harder to please the customers rather than to cut corners and save a buck.
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was okay, nothing to die for. I got the Double Cheeseburger which was pretty good, but my girlfriend got the rigatoni bolognese which was under cooked (the pasta not the meat). Ambiance was pretty cool it had a good vibe, and patio seating was really nice. The service was nothing spectacular, not great, but also not horrendous. On a scale of 1-10 it'd be a 5. Overall it's a cool restaurant in a cool location, but it seems like it may be a little over hyped. Although side note the french fries that had some pepper which was included with the double Cheeseburger was definitely the best part.
Address: 6530 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Guess we had an off night as I read these other glowing reviews. The service was great and they were extremely friendly. But the food - almost completely flavorless! I've never had thai food with such a lack of seasoning or classic thai flavors. Even the "hot" sauces on the side were devoid of spice.  The garden rolls were nice and fresh, the peanut sauce was the only aspect with at least some taste - hence a score of 3 - but only for the rolls.
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: We love Good Goose! We've been ordering both take out and dining in for years and have never had a bad experience. Their spicy basil rice and their broccoli angel hair dishes are our favorites. You can't go wrong with their menu and the service has always been superb. If you're in the Larchmont area I highly encourage you stop by for a cozy meal in their dining room.
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Came for lunch on a Wednesday!FLAVOR (5/5):1. SPICY BASIL FRIED RICE: I really liked the spicy basil fried rice! It's a mild spicy and next time I would probably ask for more spice, but it was a good pairing with the tom yum.2. TOM YUM: The tom yum was super flavorful and delicious. Perfect amount of salty and sour... might be the best tom yum I've ever had. It reminded me of a similar dish in Vietnamese culture called canh chua. I'm salivating just thinking about it.SERVICE (5/5):Service was good; you order at the counter and they bring it out to you.AMBIENCE (5/5):Lots of plants indoors - makes for a very cute atmosphere.PARKING (3.5/5):It's Larchmont, so.... street parking is either on the main street or on the residential streets a block over. It's every man for themselves.TAKEAWAYS:My coworkers claim that Good Goose is the best Thai food they've ever had... the Tom Yum and Spicy Basil Fried Rice seem to back that statement.
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: We had a craving for thai and decided to stop in to good goose cafe. We ordered the wings, pad thai, and karee noodles and were so happy with everything we got. The wings were crispy and flavorful, the pad thai was fantastic, and the karee noodles were flavorful, too! The interior was very cute and had a good vibe for the restaurant. The employees were helpful and kind. Stop by for some great Thai food in Larchmont :)
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: This is a cute little Thai restaurant. You order at the front counter and find a table. They'll serve your food to you when it's ready.I got the Jerky Set w/ Beef. It comes with sticky rice and papaya salad. The meat was well seasoned and it was sooo delicious as a lettuce wrap. It comes with sweet and sour sauce. The papaya salad was refreshing.
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I've been eyeing this place the last couple of times I went to Great White up the street and I finally got to try it today!It's very cutely decorated with a bunch of plants, and their specialty drink menu is very expansive and affordable ($4!!!)I ordered the matcha latte with coconut milk (it usually comes with oat milk but I love coconut), which was AMAZING and I will make the 40 minute drive again and again if it means I get to drink it. The coconut cream is flavorful and the drink is not too sweet at all.My boyfriend got the mango lemonade which was very refreshing and also not too sweet! Make sure to mix the drink well to incorporate the flavors.Will be back to try the food next :))
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I got my order to go, the first person I was introduced to was the cashier who was ridiculously friendly. I did leave late for lunch, and this being the Larchmont area, parking was an initial concern, but leaving late, around 1:40pm, I found a parking spot immediately. I ordered the fried cauliflower and Pad Thai with BBQ Pork, and a Matcha Thai Ice Tea. The Pad Thai was so fresh, it was one of the best Pad Thai dishes I have had, and I thought I had some good ones.  All the ingredients were fresh. The fried cauliflower was so light, it was not greasy and the sauce provided was perfect. The Matcha Thai Tea drink was very good. Since I did not eat there, all I can say is it looked very comfortable and clean, and I hope one day to actually sit down and have a meal there, something different, because the menu has a lot of items I now want to try. I can see why this restaurant has a 5 Star Yelp rating. Delicious.......
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I agree with all of the reviews saying that the food is extremely fresh and flavorful. I ordered Uber Eats and got the pork jerky, the salmon garden rolls, and the yum salmon. Taking off one star since the pork jerky portion was extremely small & skimpy and I've had better elsewhere. The yum salmon was incredibly fresh and tender, good quality fish with a refreshing sauce. The salmon fresh rolls were HUGE, filled with crisp herbs and crunchy veggies, tender, fresh salmon, and a really great side dipping sauce. I also got a side of peanut sauce for these, which I highly recommend. Definitely a solid choice for takeout.
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Delicious food and always fresh and high quality ingredients. I usually get the green salad (highly recommend getting it with the yuzu dressing) and the chicken kra pow + fried egg. My fiancé loves the spicy basil fried rice. We also love the mango sticky rice.I've had takeout from Good Goose about 5 times now and they never disappoint! Highly recommend!
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: The Good Goose is good Thai! My mom and I came in for an early dinner and ordered pad thai with chicken, garlic pepper shrimp, and the cucumber salad. All the dishes were delish and the veggies, crisp! The staff is super kind and the service, quick. A huge plant fan, I fawned over the lush greenery throughout the restaurant. It will definitely be a hangout spot for me as I'm in the neighborhood. Thanks for the excellent food and service, Good Goose.
Address: 5210 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: When the warmth and ambiance of a restaurant really hit you, it's a must you write a positive review and this is exactly what I'm doing. My buddies have been raving about JnV's for some time and I had to go and check it out myself. The restaurant itself is very pretty with an open kitchen and chefs that smile once you enter. The Fairfax location is the only one I've been to and it's usually busy with a lively crowd.For food, we definitely gravitated toward the pizzas. My personal favorite was the White Lightning pizza which I absolutely loved and had I not eaten it so quickly, I would've shared a picture of it. We have some mushroom lovers in the group and they also raved about the "Super Shroom" pizza which gives a more than generous amount of mushrooms.To finish, we had to order the ricotta cookies which are the definition of a nice petite dessert. It wasn't so petite when my friend decided to order more and ended up eating 16 cookies in 20 minutes. If ricotta cookies are your thing, I'd be sure to call ahead to make sure JnVs has enough ricotta cookies available as we happened to catch them on a lucky day.The last part, which I really want to emphasize is how great the service is. Calling to make a reservation is very easy but the service once you're seated is so above and beyond. Our table was greeted not only by the hosts, bussers and servers, but also happened to meet the chef, manager and GM as well. Service is quick and friendly, always checking to make sure that you have your food and drinks but also having a good time as well.Thanks Jon & Vinny's, we'll see you soon for your pizzas and ricotta cookies very very soon!
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Honestly really enjoyed the gem lettuce dish but everything else was pretty predictable. I wouldn't say it'll be my go to place but it is a nice place to grab a quick lunch with a friend.
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: My pizza was burnt an soggy! This was my first time coming here, a former client recommended it to me and was unimpressed.
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Absolutely love Jon and vinnys. Never fails to disappoint. And their pasta is CONSISTENTLY Al dente and just perfection. Chefs kisssss also to the chicken parm which is so crispy but also perfectly sauced. My go to place to impress anyone with la food!
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Can never go wrong with Jon and vinnys. The music is bumpin and the food is CONSISTENTLY impeccable. Brava brava!! You HAVE to try the linguini with clams and the spicy fusilli. I just tried the bolognese for the first time and the pasta was perfectly Al dente fresh. My go to for years now!!
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: My favorite restaurant!! Never disappoints and is consistently amazing. Highly recommend the spicy fusilli, chicken parm, calamari, and lil nats pizza!!
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Everyone that's complaining about the price = Bidenomics. As far as the food goes it was outstanding! Had the pizza, pasta, chicken parm.
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Came here with a couple of friends - we ordered the corn agnolotti with browned butter and sage, ricotta bruschetta, and marinara braised meatballs with garlic bread, and tiramisu to share. Was surprised how flavorful the pasta and meatballs were, loved the browned butter sauce and it went so well drizzled over the the bread, which was already perfectly toasty and buttery. Bruschetta and tiramisu were mid/not notable. Service was great, super attentive as we got checked on by multiple people throughout our meal and made sure our water glasses were always full. It's not the most authentic Italian place (why do they have wings on the menu?) but it was good for what it is!
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: came by the other day while shopping at Melrose Flea. place is super delicious and while may be thought of as a bit over-hyped, I'd say it lived up to be a pretty good lunch. Their pasta is cooked very nicely and wasn't too over or underdone and the sauce was delicious. The atmosphere and service were also great. If you're in the area I would make a stop and try it at least once. I attached a photo of what I got, the vodka pasta, super super good!
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Giving it two stars because the food is not worth the price and the service was bizarre.Initially when we arrived, we were told we might not get a table. It was 4PM, they close at 9PM, and when I asked they told me there were only three parties ahead of me. I then asked if they mostly run on reservations, and they told me no that they also do stand by. So in the 15 minutes we waited while trying to figure out if it was worth it to wait and see how long it was going to be, we got a table. So I don't understand why we were told we might not get a table.Then they sat us in a booth that was way too small for five people. My group consisted of three smaller teenagers, if we were average sized people we would have fared worse. I asked if we could please sit somewhere else (there were several empty tables, and no one else was waiting), but I was told no.Then we were told that patrons usually order tapas style. So we all order something with the intention of sharing. This was a mistake, the entrees were way to small and we had to order more food. Again, my group had small people in it, so we don't normally eat a lot and we left hungry.Lastly, the bill was way too high. And on top of the overpriced food, there was an additional 18% gratuity charge that was added onto the bill. I'll never return to this place again. The hassle, the weird vibes, and the price is not worth it for just 'ok' pasta. There's better pasta to be had at better places.
Address: 412 N Fairfax Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Service was quick and friendly. I'm obsessed with rose tteokbokki, so it really hit the spot. Loved that they also included wide glass noodles and small sausages. Will def visit again!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Food is five stars. The flavor, the taste, the quality. They sell really great Mandu here, I had the chicken Mandu and the rose ttoekboki which was so good - they had cheese and sausage in it and it was delicious! Would recommend this place if you're looking for something not pricey in ktown, with parking (it has a garage where you can get validation) and something light and not heavy. They have other dishes besides the Mandu if you're not wanting that as well. The interior was clean and open, the seats are hard and not comfortable but overall the taste experience was really great. Also it's pretty central ktown so you can also walk to hmart across the street or get dessert nearby.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Really great spot for some Korean staples. The interior is minimally modern and clean. I love the long concrete table that stands in the middle of the space for communal seating. There are booths and standard tables along the walls as well.The food was great and I actually can't wait to come back and have more of what I loved... which is:1. Fried mandu. Get the sampler. My favorites are the shrimp and jalapeno. Non standard, but they were so delicious. They fry the mandus so well - the outside is so crisp and the inside is fully packed with a generous portion of filling.2. Perilla buckwheat noodle. This is such a simple dish, but the perilla flavor was spot on and there was a hint of sweetness that brought out the flavor even more. The noodles are topped with a generous heaping of seaweed. The portion is huge and could be split into two different meals. The noodles themselves are cooked to just the right tenderness. Would definitely order again.3. Cold kimchi noodles. The bowl is GIANT. It's actually deceivingly huge. The broth is delicious, noodles are very chewy, and the kimchi doesn't actually make it too spicy.For two, we ordered the steamed mandu sampler, the fried mandu sampler, and the 2 noodle dishes. Both of us were extremely full and had leftovers to take home.PRO TIP: if you order an entree, you can add 3 mandus to your order for $3. This is a much better deal than ordering one order of 6 mandus for $9.99. And you can pick the type of mandu you want too! I recommend going this route for best value.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Yum!! Food is so yummy. I live in NYC and have had good Korean, but this is next level. The staff is super nice and the place was clean, too. Also, the price point was perfect for the quality. I had the tteok-bokki with cheese. So good!!!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Only had the takeout mandu sampler, but every variety was delicious! Especially recommend the jalapeño -- not sure what ground meat was in there, but the subtle spiciness took it up a level.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I had the steamed pork mandu which was good. I tried some of my friend's kimchi fried rice which was very flavorful-- a little on the strong side for me. The inside could be a bit more cozy but overall a solid restaurant.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I was expecting this place to be good. With that said. Never coming back. Service was atrocious and they took forever. Food was ok but made it worse due toothed lack of how long it took. Never coming back. Just not worth it.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I was honestly very impressed with every dish we ordered.  Mandu has never been a craving, but the fried version sampler (14.99) that CHD provided was perfectly crispy and flavorful.  You get 10 pieces all with the perfect crunch.Though I would come back specifically for the non-dumpling items.The space is spacious, modern, clean and bright.  The energy made me just happy to be there.The buckwheat cold noodle (13.99) looks very basic, but it had a balanced flavor that was dynamic and more complex that just using soba broth.  I enjoyed this a lot and surprised by the perfectly cooked noodles.  The perilla oil worked well with the soy and it wasn't too salty.  Thought this was great.The rose Tteokbokki (14.99) is so creamy, perfect chew and includes some bits of fish cake.  My partner wanted his own dish, he loved it so much especially with the cheese.  We're definitely ordering this again.The spicy cold noodle (13.99) was also great, nice kick and good flavor.The wonton noodle (14.99) was interesting, a lot of citrus and was very refreshing.  It was different from what I was expecting, but had nice pieces of shrimp.The Steamed mandu plate (9.99) were okay, ironically my least favorite dish.  The skin was a bit thin and you get only 6 pieces.  They were honestly very standard and not as memorable as the other dishes.Love it.  We always walked passed, but never got a chance to try it.  Glad we did and we were all very surprised by how good it was.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: food + price : we got the rose tteokbokki & i rlyy liked it hebe it was p good except i wish there was fish cakes instead of noodles :(service : service was meh .-. we got everything v quick tho !ambiance : the shop is rly spacious :0 and i rly like the vibes in there cuz there r a lot of tables + the tables r rly pretty LMFAO*btw they played a lot of blackpink SLAY
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The kimchi cold noodles are good, but the kimchi dumplings were below average. I'm downgrading my review.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Pao Jao at the Korean Town Plaza on Western has my favorite steamed kimchi dumplings. CHD Mandu LA is relatively new, and I was curious if this place was better. It's located at the Brown Derby Plaza where Boiling Crab and Wako Donkatsu is located. Mandu is Korean for dumpling, and I ordered the steamed kimchi dumplings along with the cold Kimchi noodles. The cold kimchi noodles were great, and CHD's steamed kimchi dumplings are 2nd to Pao Jao. Overall, I was very pleased with this experience. Would love to come back.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 104 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Instagram-able Cheese Fire Show. Interesting. Food is ok. Soup is flavorful. Huge portions. Comes with brown (more like purple) or white rice. Multiple locations, but 6th street seems to have the most reviews. Complimentary Kimchee and Radish banchan with free refills. Complimentary hot tea. Free soda with Yelp check-in. Valet parking a lot, metered street parking, or nearby self-parking at H Mart parking garage across the street for $5.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Just your average old joe. Classically well advertised korean food in ktown. Known for their galbi jjim that you share amongst people. As a korean, I think it is okay. But for those starting to dip their toes into korean food, this isn't a bad option.Parking: $4 valet (we went on a weekend night)They have multiple locations and this is the smaller one out of the two in ktown.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: When you eat here you can taste the authenticity. Had the Sulung Tang or the Bone Soup with Beef Brisket and the quality of the meat was so good it surprised me. Came here with my boyfriend almost 11:00 pm, we called and asked and the place is open 24 hours. When we came there was no wait time and maybe one other group eating at the time so the staff were super attentive to us and helpful. Staff and environment was friendly and kind. If you want a smaller and more intimate space as well as delicious soup and meat come to this Sun Nong Dam location. If you want a bigger busier environment best fitting large groups or a family dinner go to the other Sun Nong Dam location on S Western.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Came in from Texas needing a change. Absolutely blew my mind! Best comfort food in any culture! The service by Mike was top notch! Provided every bit of anything we needed and some. Small intimate ambiance absolute perfect place to take a small family or group and enjoy every second. Memories were made and this place will always be my go to whenever I'm in the city again!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Best Korean Cuisine in Los Angeles! Great customer service, quality ingredients and the best atmosphere in Koreatown
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Love it delicious af love this places to eat and I am going out for dinner with the kids and I am so happy for them to come back and visit with me I am very excited for you guys and I'm very happy that you're coming
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Service was horrible once again unfortunately. Only reason I go is for food . Even if it takes an hour to come out . Oh and they will make h feel really uncomfortable if u don't tip them 18 percent lol
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: We called 30 minutes in advance asking if they can accommodate parties of 11, and they eagerly told us yes over the phone.We show up and write our name down on the queue and there are about 3-4 small groups ahead of us but we don't mind a short wait.A male worker walks out to check the list multiple times and doesn't say anything about our party size being 11 people. There were 2 people on the list named Rachel which caused confusion, so I even spoke to him in person about our table of 11 and he didn't question it.A few minutes go by and another female worker comes out to check the list and she sees our group of 11 and sends us away. She recommends the Western location to us instead because it's bigger and basically tells us they cannot accommodate 11 people at this time.Disappointed that they told us over the phone that they could seat us. Even more disappointed that it took them 15 minutes to say anything to us, so we waited all that time for nothing.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food was incredible and super authentic. Service was quick and the staff (especially Mike and Julian) was excellent~Will definitely come back
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This place is clean and inviting. The service is above and beyond many local restaurants. Mike and Zoey do their best give customers the best experience possible. The food is mouth watering if you like traditional Korean eats this is a must stop place! The music is pleasing to the overall environment!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 7 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: OMG chef Antonia Lofaso you're AMAZING, we absolutely love Scoppa and our first time at DAMA. Wow every single item on the dinner menu and cocktails was absolutely AMAZING.  This is why you're so special because you focus on perfection.  I mean everything we had was perfect.  Location I'm not crazy about but once you valet and walk to the DAMA it's a different world.  Our amazing friends and us were on a food coma and we couldn't stop eating.  Now let's talk about our amazing waitress Diana, she was extremely professional, hardworking, knowledgeable, courteous, very kind and beautiful kind personality.  I will definitely ask to be seated at Diana's table section.  We enjoyed our various cocktails, appetizers, entrees and coffee and most delicious desserts.  Please enjoy the pictures
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Drinks are delicious. Food was pretty good. We enjoyed the Lamb chops, Empanadas, Aqua Chile, Crispy Potatoes, Calamari, Camarones and Churros for dessert.  Everything was very fresh.  Sat in outside terrace area each time and was decorated nicely and fully covered. Inside reminds me of being transported to Tulum with a full size bar centered.  Food is served tapas style and comes out as ready. Very cute for date night or girls night out.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Tried it for the first time. Everything was very tasty and well seasoned. The service was nice and friendly. Very lovely ambiance.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Love the food drinks and ambience plenty of parking on the street or you can valet. I tried the chicken and steak it was great i forget the names of the appetizers but they didn't disappoint don't hesitate to try DAMA.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Food is delicious and fresh. I totally love the decor and setting! Definitely one of my favorite places. Just wish it wasn't so pricey.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Dama had some tasty dishes, but overall it feels like an Americanized take on Latin American cuisine with a splash of stodginess. The pork big plate was quite scrumptious. The oysters and drinks average. The empanadas felt apart a bit and the arepa was decent, both to me just not dishes meant to be fancy. The environment wasn't much to call home about. The hit was the fluffernutter desert -- hot, textured, crunchy, airy, yum! Not a place I'd return to for the price. The menu itself just didn't come together for us even when selecting dishes.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Located in Downtown Fashion District, DAMA is a popular restaurant and bar. Indoor and outdoor seating is available. There's plenty of seating but I highly suggest you make reservations as this place tends to be busy.My party and I ordered the  Aguachile, Calamari, Empanadas, and cocktail drinks. Our waiter was great, drinks were ok, food was served quickly. The aguachiles were my favorite. They really had a kick to them.The decor is really cute, but parking can be a bit challenging. They do offer valet parking.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: We went for just a snack and drink but were underwhelmed by the service. After not ordering a second round of drinks, we were ignored by the bartender the rest of the night. Once the bill finally came we paid $70 for two Tito Martini's and a side of fries. Should have asked for an itemized receipt, I feel we were up-charged for a more expensive liquor. Unhappy with our experience, not going back.
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: The ambiance was very lovely and the food was delicious. I would have given it 5 stars if the service had been better. Our waiter forget one of our main courses and the time between meals was a bit excessive. Other than that, it was a lovely restaurant! I just wish it was in a better location
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Really beautiful place and great service. Unique food options, most of which we really enjoyed!Food we ordered listed in order of preference below (favorite to least)Clam toast (5 stars) - delicious and super unique! LovedAguachile (4.5 stars) - very yummy!Whipped beans (4 stars) - really enjoyedCharred octopus (3.5 stars) - octopus was great but the accompaniments were just ok and kind of overpowered the octopusLamb chops (3 stars) - too charred for us, but sauce was good
Address: 612 E 11th St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Latin American, Cocktail Bars, Wine Bars

Comment: Perfect little spot & good original sandwiches.The staff were welcoming and willing to make my substitutions on my sandwich. & the branding is very appealing! We ate half of our sandwich on the car ride home from LA to the Bay and got full. Ate the other half when we got home, traveled well!I ordered the Pastrami Mami (got it cold) and my boyfriend got the Uncle Nikki. Both packed with meat (no skimping) and veggies, they both get a 9/10. The flavor was solid! Definitely will be back when we are in the area.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Sandwiches are huge. Packed with so much meat,veggies and flavor !I would most definitely recommend pre-ordering as the lines start to get pretty long and wait time is is 50 min ‍-street parking
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Food: The Sandwiches are delicious and PACKED with high quality meat/cheese. They have a wide variety of sandwiches to choose from, but you can also customize  your own. The bread/ condiments used are great as well.Service: Good service can't complainAmbiance: Cool Shop with good seating options
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Cool little spot amazing sandwich get the melrose! for cold cut sandwich don't think there better
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Food is amazing, tasty and to order. They do get super busy at times so expect a wait during the rush hours.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: If you love sandwiches, you will love Ghost. All I've got to say is, the MELROSE, the MELROSE, the MELROSE.Pros:- The sandwiches are huge and if you upgrade to a larger size, they add more meat on the same size bread.- it's on a Dutch bread and they use Boar Head Meat. I do wish that the bread was warmed up a little but that's a personal preference- Service is always great, friendly and fast- The interior is mint blue so that's funCons:- Parking may be a little tricky sometimes because it's facing the street so you may find meter parking on the side-- but that's LA for you- The shop is extremely small, so seating is limited but they've got benches in the front (just not ideal in the summer)- Head's up, there's no restroomRegardless of these cons, I'd still give Ghost 5 stars. (Ghost also has a Pizza Spot next door)
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Sandwiches here are incredible!!!!! Service great but pretty slow. Mostly because they seem really really busy. So order way ahead.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Great sandwich!  Busy but worth it. A must stop whenever we're in the Melrose area. Taken friends there and they loved it too. Awesome bread. Melrose is the go to sandwich, but the Santa Monica is great too.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: It's better than Jersey Mike's. I don't mean that as an insult Jersey, Mike's is better 99% sandwich places in Los Angeles. This is for sure one of better Italian sandwiches.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Very impressed. The food was of the highest quality. The sandwiches came out fairly quick. Additionally, the atmosphere was excellent- put a smile on our faces as we jammed to various 2000's hits while enjoying our sandwiches. I ordered the Howdy and absolutely loved it. I also had a chance to try the Melrose Sandwich, which was superb, the Phoenix, which i also loved, and even the Veg Out was excellent. Overall, a great experience.
Address: 7801 Melrose Ave Ste 1A Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Dine in review.Trendy, visually loud Thai restaurant. They have a sweet decor with flowers covering the walls and hanging from the ceiling.Dishes and cocktails are very distinctive and flashy.  Drinks tend to be sugary. The food is excellent but expensive.  Excellent choice for an outside patio, but watch out for bees in the daytime along the hedge.  The restrooms are tidy. The staff is welcoming!
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Worth the hype. Everything is delicious. Pricey but worth it. Very cute little spot but the drinks are not great. Everything else so good. Can't wait to go back
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Food was fantastic, but didn't get to enjoy it because we were rushed out as soon as we sat down. The food came out immediately after we got our drinks. I'd love to go back and get to enjoy it. We wanted to order a second round of drinks but they wouldn't even let us do that and there was no warning. It was a stressful experience.
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Food was great. We had pad Thai, broccoli, yellow curry, rice too. Service was great too! Very friendly and accommodating staff.
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: A very welcoming process on arrival. The interior sign very romantic with cultural arrangements on the ceiling and walls. Also perfect for outdoor space in the garden with water feature. The restaurant's valet parking fee is $7. It is expensive, but worth it for a nice romantic evening.Vegetarian Uses: You can order lunch and some cheap side dishes with tofu. However if you are a vegan the options are limited but what was on offer looks good.
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Girls night out was good. This beautiful restaurant has it all! Kookoo was so nice and helpful answering all our questions about drinks and food on the menu. I ordered the calamari twice it was so delicious. The fish was juicy with amazing texture. There is a sauce for everything here. I had the beef roll the cucumbers are sweet. Crab fried rice needs salt and pepper still very delicious with the sauce. The drinks were very unique. I enjoyed "Hello Gorgeous" "Lod Chang". The lemon water while you wait is also refreshing. Enjoyed my experience I'm taking my children there today.
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Food was great! Plenty of choices, but can be pricy and well worth it. They are pretty busy so recommend reservation online. We reserved ahead, once we checked in, we got seated, but took forever for them to take our order. Once the food came out, it was great.
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Good food and great patio/ambiance. Their whole fish dinner was tasty! I highly recommend this restaurant.
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: This restaurant is 10/10 for me!Myself and my friends came around for dinner this Saturday. For the decor, as soon as you walk in, you are amazed by the decor of the restaurant. It has an absolutely gorgeous interior. We were sat outside which was equally beautiful as well with the trees surrounding the area and the lights. The tables and chair are comfortable and spacious with pillows for extra comfort.For the food, everything we had was amazing. It was three of us so we agreed on 3 entrees to split and share. We ordered the lobster Pad Thai, the volcano cup, and the crab fried rice which was absolutely amazing. Each dish was seasoned so well and the portions were big. There are few restaurants in LA which gives you amazing aesthetics and the food actually being good and this place checks that box. For drinks, we ordered the Trouble in Paradise, the money drop, and the Hello Gorgeous. All were amazing but the Hello Gorgeous was more of my flow.Service was super quick and everyone was super nice. Our waiter explained and answered all of our questions perfectly. The food also came out pretty timely! I will definitely be back!
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: The atmosphere is so beautiful, we love all of the pink. Food is tasty a bit on the spicy side so make sure you're into that. Seating is both gorgeous inside and outside as well. Waiters are lovely and make the dining experience enjoyable. 8/10 would definitely recommend
Address: 5560 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: I had the pleasure of having brunch at Enchant LA recently, and I can't say enough about the exceptional experience I had, thanks in large part to our outstanding server, Eugene Jang.From the moment we were seated, Eugene's warm and welcoming demeanor set the tone for the evening. His extensive knowledge of the menu and wine list was impressive, and he guided us through the selections with expertise and enthusiasm.Throughout the meal, Eugene's attention to detail was impeccable. He ensured our glasses were never empty, and his timing in delivering each course was impeccable. His recommendations were spot-on, leading us to savor some of the most delectable dishes I've ever tasted. The flavors were a symphony of delight, and each plate was a work of art.What truly set Eugene apart was his genuine passion for hospitality. He engaged with us in delightful conversation, making us feel like cherished guests. He accommodated our dietary preferences with grace and ensured that every aspect of our dining experience was perfect.In the end, our brunch at Enchant LA  was not just a meal; it was a memorable culinary journey, thanks to the exceptional service provided by Eugene Jang. I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough, and I am deeply grateful to Eugene for making our visit so extraordinary. Thank you, Eugene, for an unforgettable dining experience.
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: the cutest brunch spot  the pasta was amazing and everything was super aesthetic  there was no wait time when we went on a sunday
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: The taste of the food is nothing special. The lettuce on the sandwich was not fresh and was partially discolored brown.
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: [FOLLOW ME @teaseats ON INSTAGRAM, TIKTOK & YOUTUBE FOR MORE!]If you're looking for an instagrammable brunch or dinner in Los Angeles, look no further than to the newly opened (and aptly named) Enchant in the Garden Suite Hotel in Koreatown! Enchant serves Korean fusion food in a stunning Barbiecore space. I went for dinner, and here's what I got:Drinks: Blue Coconut Margarita, Yo-Berry, Elderflower Tonic. The Elderflower Tonic was a little too spirit-forward for me, but I loved the sweet Blue Coconut Margarita and the Yo-Berry which tasted like an adult Danimals in the best way!Crispy Crab and Spicy Tuna: Unique twist on spicy tuna crispy rice but with a crab cake instead of the rice. Well spiced, huge pieces, super delicious.K-Taco Trio: The bulgogi taco was my favorite, would recommend this!Seafood Cioppino Pasta: Pretty average execution of this dish, but loved the fried crab on top.Kim's Kimchi Pasta: My favorite of the mains, spicy and flavorful, but wish there was more bacon.Born to Be Beef and Cheese: I was the most excited for this one going in. Really cool presentation, delicious sauce and potatoes, loved the tableside cheese brûlée and KBBQ-inspired flavors. The fondue could've been creamier and meat could've been more tender, but overall I enjoyed this!Cheesecake: Our slice wasn't fully defrosted when it was served to us, so the inside was still a bit frozen. After letting it sit for a bit, much better! Pretty average cheesecake but this spot isn't known for their desserts.Latte: Nothing to write home about, but a good (and pretty) latte!Overall, Enchant is a promising new restaurant with a creative menu and great drinks. You come for the ambiance, but the food is good enough to warrant a stay.
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: If I could give this restaurant negative stars I would. They sat us 25 minutes later than our reservation(had to go up and ask about 3 separate times). It took 15 minutes for a server to come to my table (because I got up and asked if we had a server. It took 45 minutes for two of the three of our meals to arrive. After an hour, and asking 4 separate people (again, having to get up and ask for that and our check), the third persons food never came despite all 4 servers saying it was coming, and then they said they'd give us a to go box. This is probably the worst service I've had at any establishment ever in all my years on this earth. Avoid this place if you want actual service and to eat.
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: Dont come here on Sunday at around 2-4pm . They get really busy and will sit you but will take an hour to eventually take your order . My boyfriend and I waited over that and no one came to take our order ( the severs were a mess ) we just got up and left .
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: I came here while visiting LA. The place is so beautiful, very IG and TikTok worthy.I came for dinner, we were the only ones there. We ordered the corn cheese, spicy tuna, bulgogi quesadilla, garlic butter squid, kimchi pasta and the fried chicken.Everything was delicious, my favorites were the kimchi pasta, friend chicken and the garlic butter squid.Staff was super friendly. This place is easy to miss bc it's inside a hotel. But there's a parking garage right across the street.
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: Difficult to order. Mimosas are not listed on the menu, but they have juice and sparkling wine. We wanted grapefruit juice which is one of the juice options, but they came back and said they were out. I wanted a matcha latte, but I didn't want whole milk and I asked for a milk alternative. They said they have oat milk and then they came back and said they don't have any milk alternatives.Kimchi pasta was really good.The avocado toast was weird. Why is there a CHOCOLATE hazelnut spread with avocado & an egg? My friend did not like it. She had to scrape off everything and just eat the toast with nutella.Crab & spicy tuna toast was good. It's small, but pretty filling if you order it for yourself. It's like a take on crispy spicy tuna except the crab replaces the rice.The waitress also took away my drink before I was done without asking. There was a little left, but I guess it was enough for her to assume I was no longer drinking it.
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars

Comment: This place is a instagram trap.Came here with a reservation Sunday. Place was fully booked. We were promptly seated and our order was taken within 5 minutes. So far so good. But that was the end of the quality experience.We ordered a blue beach and a cocktail. The blue beach (given it's a soda mixed drink) foamed so much it caused a mess on the table. We had zero napkins and tried to flag a server (there were only 3 working) down for about 10 minutes before giving up and just getting up to grab our own. We ordered the spicy pork lettuce cups and the korean fried chicken to split. We got our lettuce cups about 15-20 minutes in. Not bad, just fine, nothing special about it.As my friend and I talk, I notice the general vibe of the restaurant. Many tables were either being ignored or missing items. The table next to us (who was there before we sat down) got one dish (the avocado toast) and seemed to be waiting on other items. From the time I started noticing them, they tried to flag the server to ask about the other dishes (they were told they were on the way) but never came out. The family eventually left 15-20 minutes later, just paying for the avocado toast and left. A while later, a couple came and sat at the table behind that one and waited for I'd say a good 10-15 minutes before their orders were taken (and they looked ready to order: they weren't looking at the menus, they kept trying to eye the waiters). I saw food being brought out to tables but items either going back (as the order was wrong/for another table) or people asking about other items. I noticed a pattern with the dishes being brought out: Fries, avocado toast, panini sandwiches, and seafood spaghetti. I didn't see any other dishes being brought out and weirdly those are also items I am not seeing in any of the review photos or mentioned in reviews except for if the restaurant or a soft opening review posted them. The table behind us had arrived at the same time, received their seafood pasta a little after we had received the cups, and I overheard them ask how much longer for the Donkatsu.At this point, mind you, my friend and I have been chatting this whole time. We've been done with our drinks and appetizer for a good 30-60 minutes now but are wanting to 1) order more drinks and 2) now feeling distracted enough in our conversation to realize we're missing our main dish. We are trying to flag down a server to order more drinks and ask about our order. The table behind us is also trying to flag down a waiter and we smile at each other in acknowledgement about how difficult it is to get their attention. I have never been at a restaurant where the servers actively look the other way. Like they were trying everything they could do not meet our gaze. My friend and I were now realizing we had sat there 1 whole hour without getting our second dish, had noticed the above behavior and patterns mentioned, and realized we're in Ktown, there are sooooo many other places around us with good KFC if that's what we want. So I end up just getting up and going to the bar to ask for a receipt for the items we received and mentioned we never got our fried chicken. The table behind us also gets up to ask for to-go boxes for the pasta and a check for just the pasta and drinks, no donkatsu. We end up leaving and going to Goltong Chicken where we were promptly seated and served within 10 minutes to delicious KFC.The servers are obviously extremely overwhelmed but instead of being honest with patrons (like "hey, fried dishes will take longer than expected") or saying they are out of items like previous reviews have mentioned, they are instead letting multiple tables walk out without their full order (without even an apology mind you).TLDR: Good drinks and instagrammable vibes but lot of tables (including our own) walked out because full orders weren't received and horrible service. There are plenty of other Ktown spots for brunch that have good food and service.
Address: 681 S Western Ave Los Angeles, CA 90005
Style: Asian Fusion, Breakfast & Brunch, Wine Bars
