Comment: I have been wanting to visit this place since I saw it on one of the episodes of Someone Feed Phil.  I was surprised on how much smaller it was in person.  It is such a cute eatery cafe type place.  We ordered avocado toast and the tuna tartar, both very good.  It was pretty pricey though I thought for the 2 orders of the toast and the tuna & 3 oj's ($122) plus there's a health wellness charge of 4% added to the check ( I read that if you ask they will remove it).  Other than that I'll consider returning but maybe just for some coffee and their cinnamon roll.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Absolutely disappointed with my experience at Openaire :( It was my first time here and I was excited to try it. It has a gorgeous ambience with the greenery and I love how the pool is right outside. However, everything else was terrible.I made a reservation on OpenTable for 1:15pm and we arrived around 1pm. They kept telling us our table would be ready about 4 times and we were finally seated at 1:45pm. It took 15minutes for the server to give menus. Everything just went downhill. We even ordered drinks at the pool since the server was taking forever to get our order. The server finally took our order...The food was NOT good, we all ordered rice bowls and all my friends said it was salty and unappetizing. It was not an enjoyable meal, nobody finished their food. The frozen drinks at the pool were good and I also ordered the midnight margarita which was good too.I'm not sure if the food is better during breakfast or dinner, but the lunch was unappetizing. Overall, 1 star for the pretty ambience other than that I have nothing good to say about Openaire. Very disappointed.
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Every single thing that we tried, we loved! I cannot believe that I waited for so long to try this place! I can't wait to come back to try the brunch! The waiter was so helpful and did great recommendations! We try the ricotta fritters, tuna tartare, the kale salad (with peaches, it was amazing) and the albacore (one of the best I ever tried) all the flavor and textures combine perfectly! The dessert was another staple! Chocolate cake and dolce de leite ice cream!
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: A late review but I had such an amazing birthday brunch here. The servers were so accommodating and attentive, the decor and ambience was my favorite part being a plant lover myself. I would definitely recommend reservations for secure seating!
Address: 3515 Wilshire Blvd Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Long over due post.... Really wanted to like this place but the service was so miserable. Our waiter was so so so rude it was really disappointing. Left still hungry and had such a bad experience. Almost everything we wanted was not available, it wasn't that busy when we went and our food took so long to come out. Waiter checked up on us once to give the check and that was it... we were super patient, polite, but yah so many better places in the area!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Saffy's is fantastic all around. Food is to die for and I will be dreaming about that red snapper for weeks. Can't go wrong with the skewers. And the sauces? I could drink. Staff is top notch. We were seated outside but it was a bit chilly and the host kindly moved us to the bar cause tables were going to take a while. But Chris made us feel very welcome and explained the menu so well. Drinks are killer as well. Had the sour and a Collins and could've kept going but they strong lol also had a great wine pairing for our snapper. Also can NOT forget to mention how beautifully simple yet elegant the design of this restaurant and bar is. Can not recommend this place enough but obviously go here hungry and ready to drop some dough.All worth it and will be back!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Saffy's is Bavel's sister restaurant that takes a more casual approach. Wonderful, delicious food, but service when we went was pretty mediocre and ambiance was just okay.Every single dish we tried though was delicious and we were impressed by the quality and execution. Especially loved the lobster kebab (so unique and great flavor) and the beef kebab and beef shislik. The kebab was visually more the traditional beef kebab you'd expect but the quality was more like a high grade steak and so juicy and yummy. The shislik was made from ground beef and heavily seasoned in the best way and had a unique flavor. The two contrasted each other nicely, and we loved the laffa (super fluffy but chewy) and the sauces that were served alongside the meat. Really enjoyed how flavorful everything was and the slight kick of heat found in the food/sauces.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We had the best experience! Service was so kind, food was amazing, drinks also delicious, be prepared to make this a splurge dinner but the food and drink was quality. Can't wait to try their other restaurants after this night!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Food was great quality but very slow service with poor communication between the kitchen and the wait staff.Even with a reservation we waited at least 20 minutes to be seated, which was fine. Our food came out so slowly that my friend canceled his order and ended up eating some of our food.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: INSANE INSANE INSANE !!! This is the best restaurant I have been to in years. I kid you not.  We ordered about 6 items and were licking the plates.  The food is sublime, delicious, ridiculously good!!!OMG !!! And the banana cake is made for royals.  It's exquisite.  Our waiter Jessie was absolutely lovely and terrific. The bus staff were so sweet. The service is seamless and swift.  The room is buzzing and beautifully appointed.  This is now my favorite restaurant in America.Congratulations to the husband and wife team who have created a very special thing.  I may go back this week.I want all my friends to try it.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Incredible food. Truly a culinary experience! Would definitely come back many many times
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: There's nothing I ordered that I wouldn't love to eat again!! Bustling atmosphere! Loud environment, so much so it was a little hard to chat, but even so the food was worth it!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: I came here for a birthday dinner, and had an amazing time. The service and wait staff were top notch. The ambiance was also very hip, energetic, and lively. The food was also decadent. I particularly loved the hummus ful - which came with such soft and fluffy pita bread. The lamb kebab was also tender and moist as well. The green falafel was also savory. The favorite that was recommended was the red snapper, which was tasty and not overwhelmingly fishy. Finally, we finished the night with banana cake, which was soft, spongy, and not too sweet. Would recommend for a date night or nice occasion to anyone looking for a special event!
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: This was my second time going to Saffy's and man, it doesn't disappoint. The service is always top notch, the decor is modern art deco, and the food!! Everything we ate was impressive to say the least. Smaller portions so the richness does not over whelm. The cocktails are all curated to enhance the flavors.Could be dog friendly if you request a table outside.I asked about the service charge and my waiter said they are receiving healthcare.
Address: 4845 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: While the food and the ambiance were good, I can't say the same thing about the service the staff wasn't attentive.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Went to celebrate my co-worker's retirement and received exemplary service.  The hostess and waiter were kind, attentive, and service oriented. Not to mention, the food was awesome. Looking forward to returning to this establishment.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: The outside vibe is pretentious yet the service was great the food was good and the cocktails where just right. Always busy so try to make a reservation
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Dinner last night was awesome. Our girls' night out was a success. Our waitress Yasmine provided excellent service.  She made sure we had everything we needed, answered all our questions and had such  great energy which was very contagious.  The food was a bit pricey, but overall, it was a great time.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: My recent dining experience at Joey Restaurant was truly exceptional, thanks to the outstanding service provided by our server, Robin. From the moment we were seated, Robin's warm and friendly demeanor put us at ease, and her recommendations exceeded all expectations. What stood out even more was Robin's infectious energy and genuine passion for her job, making our evening not just a meal but a delightful experience. Her attentiveness without intrusiveness was perfect, and I can't recommend dining at Joey enough. Thank you, Robin, for making our night at Joey Restaurant truly special!
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Decided to treat my girl here before the Jonas Bros concert... waited for 15 minutes, totally fine. But i noticed everyone waiting was getting free champagne. I was kinda looking forward to getting a glass too, but we were the only ones waiting without a glass... We finally sat down at a high top for 20-25 minutes BEFORE someone asked us if we've been helped already. At this point, I was annoyed and furious and just ready to go get chipotle across the street. The person who checked in on us wasn't even our server. After she left, one of the bussers finally brought us water... 5 minutes later, we left. And the person who checked in on us earlier apologized to us and totally understood why we left. She was nice and offered us a free bottle of champagne if we decided to stay, but at this point I was just furious and hungry and on a time crunch so we left. I wanted to give my girl a nice dinner and make her day special because she was soooo stoked for the concert. I was so disappointed especially because I used to work at a restaurant during college. The restaurant wasn't even packed with people, just somewhat busy. I honestly don't think I would ever go back and give this place another chance. I hope nobody gets the the same experience we had.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Have had Joey's on my list to visit when my wife and I take trips to LA. We have been a few times to LA but never had the time to make it to Joey's. However this trip we (Jonas Brothers Concert) we made the decision to meet here with the group we were going to the concert with. The food was quite tasty! I had the double smash burger (not pictured) and it was very well made and I finished it extremely quick even for my standards! My wife ordered the Spaghetti and gave me a little bite, I have to say the lemon that is used in the dish makes this spaghetti quite a dish. It was a flavor I have not had before.Both drinks my wife and I got (The Watermelon Drink - wife) and the (espresso martini - myself) were very good.My wife's drink was very good, it was a type of slushy and had tons of flavor. The espresso martini also was very good, I make it a point to try an espresso martini at just about every restaurant that has one. The ingredients intrigued me as i believe this is made with Kahlúa but it is not overly sweet but the right amount to still taste good with your burger or pasta.The next time my wife and I are in the area we will be stopping by for drinks. Joey's is a bit expensive so just make sure going in that it is on the pricier side. But happy hour deals are pretty solid and they have happy hour every day!
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: We enjoy coming to this place. The food is very tasty. Always have good service. Also a good place just to come for drinks and chill with friends.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: I had a great time at Joey's. It's a lively place with an energetic social atmosphere. The bartenders are highly skilled at this establishment.
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: Joey DTLA is my go to for corporate lunches primarily because of the excellent service provided by Nicholle!!! She has always taken amazing care of us even under the most rushed circumstances. Food and vibe is also always a hit.Thank you Nicholle!
Address: 700 W 7th St Ste S430 Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: First time here and immediately one of our favorite restaurants in the city. The atmosphere in this restaurant is amazing. First you walk in and the courtyard feels like a hidden oasis. You go into the restaurant and it's chic and chill. The light  fixtures were one of my favorite parts. Then you have the staff! Lexi was our server and was so much fun. It was like we were visiting our bestie who just got a new job. We got to meet Chef Shenarri who was so down to earth and passionate. She made the night one to remember.AND THE FOOD!! I am not sure what I was expecting but I was so happily  surprised with e everything I had! It was familiar but so new. I can still taste that jollof Arancini.Not only will I be back but I'm bringing everyone  I know!
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: When I picked this place I wanted something unique and this place did not disappoint! I love going to try Vegan places even though I am not Vegan as well as trying new cuisines. So this was a win win in my boat! The dishes definitely have a kick and you don't ever miss that there isn't meat in them. We tried everything but the white rice. Highly recommend going here and being open minded to try something new!The service was amazing and food came out so fast!Another reason I picked this place was the decor. The restaurant is so beautifully decorated that it sets the mood for the perfect evening!
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: omg... Ubuntu is such a vibe!!!my brother's best friend saw this place on Instagram & we had to go. it's literally so cute on the inside, lots of plants & decor.this is an all vegan restaurant by Chef Shenarri Greens , West African inspired cuisine & tapas.such a cute spot directly on Melrose Ave in West Hollywood. service is immediately amazing, everyone who works here is so nice!they even rolled out the heat lamp for me. we made a reservation for 8:45pm on a Sunday night.there was 4 of us so we ordered the whole menuthe flavor in these dishes were everything !my fav was def the palm bisque soup & trumpet mushrooms. it was my brothers birthday & they threw in 2 free desserts! so sweet
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Went here last night for dinner & I'm so happy I found this place! The decor is beautiful, it's a big space with very friendly staff. We sat at the bar & were  greeted  by the nicest bartender. I had a glass of the chilled red & my husband had an old fashioned. To eat we tried the jollof arancini (absolutely delicious, this is a MUST), the palm bisque (also great, loved the mushroom) & grits (these had more of a couscous consistency & tasted great). To finish we had their version of beignets (puff puff bread) which came with a ginger habanero chutney-very unique! I just wish they had some hot sauce bc I like a little kick, but nothing lacked in flavor.I love that Ubuntu uses real ingredients, no processed meat. The food tastes fresh, light,& delicious. I'll be back!
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The food was delicious. We basically had one of everything on the menu. Our impression was that it's a pretty new restaurant and they were going through some growing pains in terms of efficiency. The servers were very nice but we had two separate servers and that made the made things a little less seamless and slow. The indoor and outdoor setting was cool and west African music was authentic. I'd go back and highly recommend the okra passion fruit dish and the trumpet mushrooms. Definitely avoid the rice - it was overpriced for a tiny portion and tastes very bland.
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Tried Ubuntu in a group of 4 for a celebratory dinner and had a wonderful experience. We all left full and happy, will definitely be coming back!The food is meant to be shared family style with a recommendation of 2-3 plates per person. We ordered one of each food menu item and our favorites were:- Jollof arancini - well-seasoned, perfectly fried and the sauce on top was so delicious, we got a second order- Grilled cabbage - smoky, savory- Fonio grits - love they use Old Bay with mushrooms- Palm bisque - it's got some great heat- Lion's mane pie - perfect crust and yummy fillingWe also enjoyed all the other dishes, the only one that was a miss was the SUYA. I love celery root and was looking forward to this dish. Unfortunately it didn't come together for any of us. The celery root was grilled perfectly but wasn't seasoned enough, the tzatziki seemed like an after thought - not much of it and also wasn't well seasoned - and we didn't get where the tomato confit was (ours was served with fresh micro greens, red onion and tomato). Great concept, I hope they work out the execution of it bc I'd love to try an improved version of this dish.Both desserts were delicious. The plantain cardamom tart was served warm and gobbled up quickly. The puff puffs were fried to perfection but the chutney was a tad savory for a dessert course, and that generally seemed to be the consensus - we left a bunch on the plate.Not taking a star off for any of the slight misses, bc we had a great experience overall.They have a full service bar with wine, beer, and a great cocktail and mocktail menu. We each got a cocktail or mocktail and it's so nice to have a yummy grown up drink for anyone who doesn't want to drink for personal reasons. I got the viridescence and would recommend as a light summer refresher :)The decor is beautiful with trees and overhead lights on the patio, and inside fiddle leaf figs, plush banquets, etc. A nice place to dress up a bit and go have fun.The service was warm and attentive from upon arrival until we left. Several of us were running a few minutes late, they didn't guilt trip us and sat us as we arrived, ensuring each person got water and drink orders started. They were kind and attentive throughout and showed genuine appreciation for our patronage. They even initiated an offer to take a group photo for us which we appreciated!Parking was easy - my partner and I found street parking on Melrose, our friends got valet ($10). Again, they don't make you wait for the whole group to arrive to seat you, so you can have someone look for parking while others get seated and order drinks if you prefer to save on valet.
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Overall, ambience was super cute. We loved the customer service and most dishes were tasty. But one issue I would say that came from our visit tonight was food portion. We ordered 6 dishes for the night. Now I get that this is a more upscale restaurant but the portion size was extremely small. So if you come know you probably won't get full. The entrees are the size of appetizers. It felt like everything was tapas basically. I was really taken a back by the grits dish. Considering this is usually a hearty dish, I was thrown off by what we received. It looked like we had a scoop of grits smushed down to the shape of the bowl they came in with a few mushrooms and raw tomatoes with a bit of a sauce. Considering that grits are such a cheap dish, one would at least think that you'd have enough to share with the table. The rice and black eye peas portion also very small to share.  Lastly, we loved the Lions Mane pie. But when you realize you paid $14 for a small one it makes you question what you're doing. The Jollof arancini was tasty very diff than jollof but was really good. My friends ordered the non-alcoholic hibiscus drink. They loved it. Mine I ordered the gin drink called Nyaniba but it tasted like it was also non-alcoholic. Was tasty if it were a drink without alcohol. If you have money to burn to taste appetizers I'd say this is def a cool spot to try but honestly if you thought you were going to get more of the filling West African food with a vegan spin, you're not going to get that here.
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: I discovered Ubuntu on Instagram and was immediately excited due to dwindling variety and volume of plant based restaurants in LA. Amongst Between 4 people, we shared 7 plates, average of $50 pp. we enjoyed the Arancini, cabbage, grits and trumpet mushrooms but my favorite was the lions mane pie. I'd definitely come here again for good drinks and light eats. I loved the location in Fairfax area as well; a very cute vibe.
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: FoodReally goodJollof and grilled cabbage is a mustServicePerfect , I will be back ! Everyone is so kind and welcomingAmbianceBy far one of the most beautiful places I have ever beenGreat for date night, birthdays , solo dates , literally anything . It's beautifulDrinks -  Ask for the Gil special . . This drink was so tropical and flavorful that it's a must !!! It's not on the menu , so you will have to show him the picture and ask him to make it .
Address: 7469 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: My go to. I'm a bit biased because I live near by. However the rooftop has great views with an amazing staff that can mix like masters. The restaurant downstairs is ok...and the bar/music venue is a must for any local.
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Dope spot . Great atmosphere, the vibes where A+ . Don't forget to got to the rooftop bar around 10 for music and drinks
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great vibe! Amazinggg potatoes!!!Came here for a Saturday morning brunch and it was so great! The views were nice from the roof, and the overall ambiance was cool up there. My favorite part was exploring around the restaurant after we ate on the roof though. The place was big and full of history, so it was cool to see all of that along with how they decorated the place. I definitely want to come back to eat on the main floor level for a romantic date night.As for their food... The potatoes were (and every single one of us stated) the best potatoes that we have ever had. They truly just melted in your mouth, and we all said we would go back just for those potatoes. The avocado toast was good but nothing special at all, I could've made it. And the breakfast sandwich was also just basic. The espresso martini that I had was delicious!!In conclusion, I will be back for the potatoes, the vibes, and the espresso martini!!
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I am definitely a big foodie. I also invited an other foodie to join me. He and I absolutely loved it. The food was incredible. The service was amazing. And the ambiance was perfect. It is an experience with great food. This is going to be one of my favorite spots. We ended the dinner by going up to the rooftop and having a drink. I can't wait to go back.
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Thank you so much to this amazing rooftop as fun bartender Gavin and very wonderful Chase made my birthday incredible for my ever rotating amount of incredibly talented friends. This weekend brunch here on Saturdays runs from 12-3 and then there was a great dj - on Sundays there is the same time frame but that day is dripping with some hot jazz. The restaurant is phenomenal and books up fast - get the tiramisu dessert (because its shaped like a record) The downstairs bar 71 is so very great and golden and we have been drinking whiskey sours served up with egg white there since they opened in late 2021 - the disco ball is from Dancing With The Stars and the studio has recorded major artist such as Steve Wonder, James Brown, David Bowie, Ringo Starr, Bonnie Raitt, Chaka Khan, Blondie, Billy Idol, Tom Petty, Motley Crue, The Black Cowes, Red Hot Chilli Peppers, Rancid, Danzig, Liz Phair, No Doubt, The Foo Fighters, Tool, Queens Of The Stoneage, Jack Johnson, Ben Harper & Kanye West have all recorded here. As you can see I am obsessed with this place and so happy to be able to call it home - we are lucky to have you!
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We started on the rooftop, ordering fun appetizers and interesting, creative craft cocktails at sunset. Our cocktail waitress was helpful in ordering and knew the menu well. When our party of four moved into the restaurant, we were greeted by another skilled server and a knowledgeable sommelier. The menu was eclectic, pulled me out of my comfort zone, and every bite was well worth the risk.  We chose to share, tapas style, because the food was interesting and presentations were beautiful; we were were not disappointed. Ambiance was industrial, with high ceilings, open space, but very comfortable. As a guest, I felt well-taken care of, and the service was thorough and well-timed. Looking forward to returning.
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Impeccable service, amazingly delicious food, gorgeous dining room and so cool. Recommend 100%
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Just hosted my husband's 50th birthday party for 90 guests on the rooftop and it was fantastic! The team was wonderful and went above and beyond to work with my budget, while still making the event extra special. Nothing but high praises from all our guests. Extra thanks to Jacquelyn, Eric, James, and Billy for their assistance. We will look back on this night very fondly.
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I attended a birthday celebration at Grandmaster Recorders, with a fixed menu which was Italian-ish.In order:1. Scalloped potatoes with whipped cod roe2. Focaccia with whipped balsamic butter3. Prosciutto and melon4. Buffalo burrata with a chili crisp sauce5. Chicory salad6. Gnocchi bolognese7. Vesuviotti with pesto8. Cornish game hen9. Breaded cod10. Ricotta gelatoThe food was overwhelming in amount, but it was delicious. The service was very attentive, and I liked the atmosphere.
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Came here after a movie around 2pm on a Saturday. The restaurant was not busy at all. The hostesses were great and full of energy. But that is all the positive I can say about the service. We were greeted by a not so friendly bartender, seemed as we were inconveniencing them. The rest of the staff seemed pretty occupied eating in plain sight of customers and didn't offer any silverware or water before and after getting our food. The food was very average, nothing to rave about. Over all I think this place is pretty average and heavily relies on their location and aesthetic.The drinks were alright.
Address: 1518 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The pork ribs are amazing. Tender, flavorful, seasoned to perfection. Highly recommended
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Favorite new spot in the neighborhood. Naengmyeon is perfect. Lovely folks as well. Bonus points for on site parking that never seems to be full.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Their beef mandus are to die for. I can eat this whole plate by myself.Nyeongmyeon was too sweet for me but the noodles were amazing as they hand pull it themselves.And ive never had cleaner tasting seol lung tang in my life. I think its because the dont use shrimp jutgalOverall amazing!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Good cold noodles and ribs!   The wait wasn't bad on a weeknight.  You can either get valet parking in the lot or look for street parking.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Came here for dinner on a Saturday night. I think we got there at around 530PM and there were maybe two parties a head of us? We had a party of three and didn't have to wait long.The parking is valet only but it's only $3 so it isn't too horrible.We decided to order a few dishes to share since it was our first time here:Mul naengmyeon combo with kimchi dumplingsSeok pork spare ribLee ga guk bapThe Lee Ga gukbap was super delicious, flavorful, and came out piping out. There were so much meat and veggies in the soup and it went great with rice! It gave me such a homey feeling. Definitely would recommend this!The seok pork spare ribs were very good too! The marinade they used wasn't overly sweet and it was just super delicious! But they do put this on a portable stove at your table so it keeps cooking. The meat may get a bit tough later if you don't turn off the stove.I read an article saying that Lee Ga makes their own naengmyeon noodles. They even have a machine that makes it, which is one of the reasons we got it. The noodles were great -- texture is chewy and bouncy. I feel like the broth was a bit under seasoned? There wasn't much flavor to it and the broth wasn't icy. Maybe it's because we had the gukbap first and the gukbap had so much flavor that the naengmyeon seemed bland.The kimchi dumplings were pretty dry though. I didn't enjoy those as much.Overall, it was a very good meal. I really enjoyed it and wouldn't mind coming back here!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: My boyfriend and I were visiting LA from NYC and stumbled across this amazing Korean restaurant. It had some of the best Korean food we've had, and our server So Young was so kind and helpful. Can't wait to tell all our friends about this place!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The naengmyun!!! Loved that I didn't need to add anything to the bibim naengmyun and I don't think I stopped to eat anything else until I finished the bowl. The noodles were thin, chewy, flavorful, and the sauce was spicy, sweet, slightly tangy. I dropped the dumplings in the leftover sauce and ate them. Dumplings were lacking in flavor, the filling was watery and bland, and did not hold together very well. The oxtail soup, oh man, delicious and enough for 2 people. The broth was rich but not greasy at all, the kimchi was perfect for it soup. Service was good even for being so busy. A little difficult to find seating for more than 4 people, we did have to wait quite some time even though the lunch rush was over. No big deal because the naengmyun was worth it. Prices were very reasonable for the quality and quantity. This will be in the book for places to revisit. Delicious!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Of course the food was great and exceptional BUT I wanted to praise the two female servers working on 8/23 lunch time. I took my parents who are in their 80's yesterday for impromptu lunch. What really blew me away was how understanding and caring both servers were. Their service was phenomenal. Thank you both.. you made our family lunch awesome!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I love love naengmyun, korean cold noodles. Prefer the spicy version. Lee ga's were chewy, and generous in portion. I got the combo with 3 huge galbi ribs which was delicious but couldn't finish..taking it home for my dog
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food is really good. We got beef cheek soup, a couple of cold noodle dishes, and dumplings. Portions are big. They give you a lot of meat in their soups. Service was prompt and attentive. Highly recommended and definitely coming back.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 106 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This place was such a good find, the ajumma that was working there was so kind! We got the large combo with cheese fried rice and we destroyed the whole thing. My fav was the large intestines. Def recommend, will be coming again!! Thank youuu :)
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Amazing beef tartar!!! Amazing service. They prepare the food in front of you and the waitress even fed me! Such an authentic Korean restaurant. There is valet parking available
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: A unique dining experience with great flavors. Came here with a group of friends and was blown away by the quality and quantity of food you can get from here. Located in the same plaza as some other really popular restaurants, sadly it looks like this place gets overlooked. I would argue this place is one of the better choices in ktown if you like intestines! They are cooked to perfection, perfect balance of crunch and chew. If you were ever hesitant about intestines, here is a great place to start your journey eating through the inside of a pig haha!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: BEST ARMY STEW! Me and my boyfriend ordered an Army stew and a small intestine. Everything is great the ramen, the flavor, the soup. Good portion and great price. We have been to so many place for army stew and most of them have that ramen flavor or seafood taste. But this place, they got it spot on.The korean lady was helpful when she tried showing us how to eat the beef intestine, she also gave us compliments lol cuteThe ambiance is great for group and casual dine in. Valet parking. Walk across the street for boba while you're there
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Small intestine was sooooo good. Also loved the brisket and rice cake dish. Everything was delicious and the staff was so nice :)
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Place is still yummy, still a great value, but the food was slightly worse than last time. Beef brisket, which was sublime, was in slightly smaller quantity in the soup, and the spicy soup base was a little salty. Regular brisket hot noodle soup was flawless. Still, a great value in the area, and I like that the interior is not too loud.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Comically good - because, typical of LA, the place was empty while there were lines to the buzz places next door. The beef brisket is the star, and the soft tofu stew and beef risket soup were just delicious, each tasting different than the other. Bottomless banchan, only a few varieties but particularly good kimchi. Very, very reasonable prices and fine value.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Been there twice a couple of years apart. I really like everything they serve. The soups wether for one or more persons are big portions.This last time I went I had the Korean ramen and it was superb, the noodles and meat were cooked to perfection the soup itself was flavorful, not too spicy but that was ok. My first time all I remember was it was a red soup base as most are but it was very spicy and I cleaned the bowl up.Tried the beef brisket and the pork as well, the brisket was left too long on the hot plate but other than that it was very good and the soup had a very familiar flavor to it like if it was a Hispanic style soup with I enjoyed. We got the fried rice option at the end where they get your left over from the soup and combo it with rice. It's really good. Definitely recommend.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Yelp says they're open till midnight but I got there at 11pm and they were closed. They apparently close at 8. -_- Drive 25 mins for nothing. Please update your hours!
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I've dined in few times before pandemic and did only to-gos after the pandemic. Either dine in or to-go the food is consistently good. All the servers I've had were nice and when I do to-go there's been same lady helping me at the counter who is so sweet. I will return for dine in once my kids are older enough. They have booths and tables which seems to be clean every time I go in. Haven't dined in in few years so I don't know how their bathroom situation is.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food:  food was accepted or decent at best.  My soft tofu stew with brisket was ok - the brisket was nice and tender but the stew itself was a little too bland for me.  The banchan was probably better than my entree - I liked the pickled radish and fish cake, but they didn't really refill those.Service:  the lady who took our order was nice but didn't back to check on us to see if there was anything else we needed.  And it didn't help either that she didn't speak any English.  Even ordering was difficult.Ambiance:  the inside of the restaurant looks pretty nice  but there were a lot of tables that were not cleaned up with dirty dishes on them when we were there.Overall:  to me this restaurant was skippable.
Address: 3470 W 6th St Ste 3 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This place is a really diamond hidden in the rough. We just happened to drive by while checking out Historic Filipinotown and I'm glad we did. The people working in there could not have been more friendly or attentive. It's a super small place but was really cozy and smelled amazing inside.But the food! Really great. We had a bunch of things even though it was only 3 of us because everything looked so good. We had the fried chicken, the lechon kawali, the chicken adobo, the pork skewer, the pancit palabok and their filipino menudo.They also gave us some bilo bilo, which was the perfect ending. Can't wait to go there again.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Tita Lina- all the Tita's and Tito's in this restaurant are so sweet! Food is very delicious and I love her turon. Will be coming back here again for Filipino cravings!
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: So so so good. Thought I'd take half home for dinner but had to finish the whole meal right there! Definitely get the ground pork stew with quail eggs
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I ordered 100 lumpia shanghai for $50 for a party.I placed my order a week in advance and was able to pick it up 30 minutes before closing at 5PM.Great catering and a party pleaser!  Good crisp, nice filling and lots of dipping sauce!
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: The food here is always fresh and delicious.  The service is friendly.  The portions are generous.  I will detour to this location when I want amazing, home style Filipino food.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Food is bomb! I'm filipino and Kapampangan, So yeah I know a lot about culinary and all I have to say is this is some authentic amazing Filipino food! Stopped by here coming home to the Bay Area from a Disneyland trip, and the food was super good. My wife and kids liked it too, service was great, very helpful staff. This will Forsure be on our stops whenever we go to LA
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: This is a basically counter buffet. You point at the food that look most appetizing. It's Filipino.food. When I get nostalgic, I go to take home the food I like. Perfect for a 1 person household. My favorite is the deep fried pork rind.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: This place is a heck yeah!I had  just finished my appointment downtown and I had not eaten Filipino food in awhile, so I looked up a fast turo-turo place.  I did not have any expectations  but I sure will come back!  Aside from being cheap-$13 for a double combo and was not greasy.  I had the ukoy ,dinuguaan, and a turon and it was gooood!Plus,  they give you a lot of food...so worth the money!!
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Ive been living here for 42 years and Im so glad Tita Lina is in the neighborhood. They have great filipino food and the staff is very friendly.Ive met Tita Lina and shes a wonderful person.May God bless her restaurant and her staff.Loyal guest,Ferdinand L. "Ferdie"
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Nice staff, huge portions, and a great price BUT if you have any food allergies or dietary restrictions i suggest avoiding this place. Otherwise if you can eat anything it is worth a visit.
Address: 2532 W Temple St Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: this place is so dank!the ambiance is immaculate, a great spot for big groups or date nightfood is so fire, they gave us free food on the house cus we're cute or sumn :3they have a LARGE alcohol menu, including hard liquor and cocktails as wellthey also give free soft drinks & mock tails for designated drivers which i think is super coolmy friends and i ordered sm food.. we got 2 of everything: the steamed egg, johnson budae stew, stir fried octopus, bossam, and pa dakall the food was absolutely delicious!!!! the steamed egg and johnson budae stew was my favorite. but literally everything tasted amazing. like i couldn't stop drinking the soupydefinitely a great vibe here, service was great! they were super accommodating for our big sized party and gave us free dranks & bottles of soju on the house xDhighly highly recommend to anyone looking for a nice spot to drink and eatthere's a parking structure located within the building and they offer free validation too
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Bacchus Tables is this new Korean pub hotspot in LA.  This Kpub-Pocha is a total vibe! Filled with good music, K-pop videos, large screens, neon lights, booth seating, cocktail bar, and a fun vibe to dance, drink and eat with friends. What a fun place!They serve a variety of signature K-cocktails, fruity slush drinks, soju, sake, beer, rice wine and more. The menu is vast and there's so many good things to order from Asian fusion dishes to authentic Korean food. We were seriously blown away at how good the food was! Every dish was well prepared and presentation and taste were all on point. The drinks were yummy too! Definitely a great place to hang out with friends or go eat/drink late night since it's open until 1am daily (2am on weekends). There's not a lot of good food places late night, but this is one def one of them.What we ordered:- Smoked Salmon Appetizer - Omg smoked in-house and delicious!!! Must order.- Korean Fried Chicken Wings- Pork Belly Bossam - Very well done dish! Delicious.- Seafood Pancake- Pineapple Kimchee Fried Rice with Cheese - Yumm!- Johnson Tang Soup Stew - Very good! Shareable.- Mayo Shrimp - Similar to prawns w/honey walnut- Wangkalbi - Giant Beef Bone Kalbi. WOW! So tender and tasty.What a wonderful night with great friends, delicious food, and friendly service. The owners are so sweet and gave us great service and food recommendations. We'll definitely be back.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: My favorite pocha in k-town! Food is on POINT, service was super attentive, and ambiance was great (I personally loved all the figures used as decor)If you're looking for a nice place to eat and drink with friends this is the spot for you! I would even come here just for the food that's how good it was! We got the jokbal and pineapple kimchi fried rice, huge portions!! We left satisfied and filled to the brim!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I'm giving two stars for the ambiance and if you want a lounge. However, I came for the food and was famished and was super disappointed with the speed of the food coming out and taste.We had fried chicken, odeng soup, dduk bok gi, and jae yuk lettuce wraps with rice. Everything was just okay. The ddukbokgi was bad, and didn't look like anything in the photos.Overall, come if you wanna drink with your friends and want to pick at food. Not for dinner.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Newly open Korean food spot that you must try! It's perfect to come with friends for some drinks and unique dishes! I love the spicy chicken feet! Lol Prices are reasonable too !
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Decided to go here on a whim with a group of 10+ and the entire staff was so accommodating and kind. The fried chicken is one of the best I've ever had - would definitely recommend. The ambience was so welcoming and my group had nothing but good things to say about the service.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This is THE place to go to for a night out in K-town for amazing drinks and food!If you want to go out drinking with your friends at a place with a great vibe and tasty food, then you need to head to Bacchus Tables ! They have it all from fried chicken, to jokbal, to jiggaes, and fried rice! They have a wide variety of cocktails and of course beer and soju as well to pair with your meal. I love the atmosphere here and it's great to come with a big group of friends! They're located in the heart of Koreatown and I highly recommend you stop by if you're ever craving pocha! My favorite was their huge portion of banchan, and their tender wangkalbi. Their house smoked salmon is also tasty as well as their stir fried gizzard!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Love love love this place and the kind people that works here. Hidden gem on the top level of the iconic Brown Derby building at Koreatown. We have been here three times so far and will definitely visit again when we can. Their food is always amazing and fresh. And their service is always exceptional, making us feel very welcomed. Interesting decor, kinda a mix of our kind of quirkiness with robot figures and toys, plus techno or house music. They got a cool DJ booth, too, definitely has the potential to be a great event space.Our repeat order:KBBQ Chicken - Super crispy and juicy fried chicken coated with a delicious sweet and savory sauce. Portion is pretty much about a whole chicken! The breading they used tasted like sweet potato, which I love. 10/10Other things we're tried:Ginja Odengtang, added beef tendon and boiled egg - perfectly seasoned dashi broth soup with fish cakes for late night or cold weather comfort. The beef tendon was very tasty! It comes with a side of house-made pickled daikon, carrot and pickle. And again, the portion is great. It can probably feed 3-4 people. 10/10Johnson Tang (Korean Army Stew), added ramen - yum yum yum! The soup stock is so flavorful! Lots of sausages, ham, kimchi, onion, and topped with cheese. They pre-cooked the ramen to perfection, and put it on a large separate bowl for us so we can dig right in without waiting for the ramen to cook. Whatever sauce they made for the stock is amazing, adding a nice depth to the flavor. Great portion size as usual. 10/10Pork Belly Bossam - tender pork belly slices, yet again perfectly seasoned and great portion size. Love love love the stir-fried kimchi side 10/10House Smoked Salmon Plate - thick slices of smoked salmon topped with shaved lemon peel, diced onion, capers, fresh lemon slices, and a house made dipping sauce. Very yummy! The shaved lemon peel is a very very nice touch. 10/10Karaage Salad - very crispy and juicy fried chicken pieces and salad with a yummy ginger-ish dressing 10/10+ an assortment of beer and liquor, plus delicious soju highball mixed drinks.++ sometimes they give us a side of thin, sweet potato friesIdk, we just love this neighborhood place so much. It's one of our happy places to visit for sure. Highly recommend!!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This place might be my favorite new hangout spot in Koreatown. Just had dinner with a friend and everything was great from start to finish. The food was amazing and the portions are surprisingly generous. The service was top notch from start to finish. I live in the neighborhood and I will definitely be back soon! Definitely a great place to check out!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Bacchus tables had an awesome variety of interesting dishes!! We came in a group of 9 people, and the staff were very kind as people trickled in in the span of around an hour before everyone arrived.  The restaurant It is filled with fun, quirky decorations and fun music (lots of blackpink!!) The pig trotters was a collective favorite among the group, and the portions are very generous! We may have ordered a bit too much for a group of 9 (12 dishes), but trying everything was well worth it! Will likely order #of people - 1 dishes next time-#A4 Beef Tartar: someone said its raw beef served with avocado with some sauce to go with it! It was fun to try, but was a controversial dish amongst the table.#C3 Pork Belly Bossam: crowd favorite! The pork is easy to share#A6 Karaage salad: another crowd favorite, not only was the chicken nice and juicy on the inside (and a deliciously crunchy ¿beer batter?), but the salad complemented the fried foods and heavily flavored dishes! (And the sauce tasted great!)
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 200 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I loved the outdoor area. The pasta was delicious and our server, hilarious! I had the papardelle boscaiola, and the polpette for an appetizer. The sauces were so good and savory. Definitely would come back! Thanks to our server "Eminem!"
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Extremely rude Hostess/ waitress Arie & Michiko (not sure how to spell their name) called earlier today and Arie must have been having a horrible day because she spoke to me as if I was stupid & Michiko pretended to be the manager, mocked me then hung up on me... Horrible customer service. I'm disgusted with the people this beautiful restaurant hired.*also just read another review about the server Michiko being awful*
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: One of our favorite neighborhood spots to have a nice dinner. The last couple times we have gone we've had the pleasure of having Michiko as our server. They go above and beyond in making dinner feel special. So thankful to have had the pleasure of eating in their section when we've gone. Great food. Great service. Fantastic to bring out of town guests to show them a good time or celebrate a special occasion.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: One of the best pasta dishes I've had by far. The place is cozy with a vintage feel. They also have the best Prosecco wine and Italian beer. I'd definitely come back again.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Incredible cuisine and outstanding service! A charming gem nestled in LA. Cant wait to come back!
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Best pasta in LA. Laid back and charming space, perfect for casual or nice night out. Service is warm and also laid back, perfect amount of letting you enjoy a dinner/ not interrupting and checking in on you. Food will always be brought to your table fresh, though go there expecting to take your time and enjoy the food- not to be enjoyed in a rush. Oscar is the best!
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Best handmade pasta in all of LA. The burrata salad and tiramisu also top tier. Exceptional service, cozy casual atmosphere. We are always in good hands with Oscar or any of the staff. Favorite restaurant in town, hands down.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Cute Italian restaurant that feels family-owned. We sat outside with our dog. The server was kind enough to bring her water. The service is impeccable. I overheard one of the servers say they were severely understaffed, but that was not apparent to us. I felt out server was very attentive.I ordered the mushroom risotto which was a bit more al dente than I like it (not their fault!) and could've used a bit more salt. They didn't skimp on the mushrooms which I appreciated. I think next time, I'll order pasta which is handmade!
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Evef since Cafe Luna on Melrose closed in the early aughts I have been looking for gorgonzola gnocchi. I found a version of that on the La Pergoletta menu and was determined to try it. I was not disappointed. It was cheesy and creamy and melt in your mouth perfection. All the food eaten that night was fab. The staff is great. This is a lovely little hidden gem in Los Feliz that I highly recommend.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Very cute little restaurant. Has really good food from the bread, salad and pasta, everything was fresh. I would recommend getting the burrata bruchetta. The service is quick and friendly.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Really nice romantic atmosphere and perfect to take a special date. Their ravioli was great and so were the drinks and appetizers. The service was also great.Side note on the dessert: we ordered a tiramisu and it was bad, like spoilt milk. Almost like they opened the fridge too many times or left it open. I believe that made me ill the following hours after leaving.I am leaving 4 stars even though I got sick- I would definitely take my date back here and just skip dessert and take her somewhere else for that! Really pretty restaurant overall.
Address: 1802 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: So biased because when I visited yup dduk. i only had frozen ddukbokkis for few months. So i was more than happy to have yup dduk!!!!The ttukbokki was huge. We didn't really add things into ttukbokki but it was more than enough for two people. Had mild spicy level and i think it was spicy-delicious enough! I wouldn't be able to digest anything spicier than that lolOverall, glad that i had ddukbokki. Can't objectively judge because i was just in sheer joy to have korean ttukbokki!!!!!!!
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I've been wanting to come here for a couple years or so now. First time I'd heard of this place the line was out the door and long so my friends and I ended up at a different restaurant in the same plaza. Since then, every time I pass through town and research Yelp for yummy places to eat, this one seems to keep popping up. But then, I'm usually alone and it seemed like too much food for one. Boy was I right!We were a party of three this time. It was close to 8pm on a Tuesday night so the wait was maybe 15-20 minutes. After reviewing the menu, I realized this menu did not offer diet food. There were no fresh vegetables in their offerings. Sometimes, you just need an indulging meal.The space is quite small. Depending on the table configurations there were a maximum of 4-5 table sets possible. But this tinyness of the space added to the charm. People came in and out to grab takeout while all the tables were filled. It amused me that all the customers at the time of our visit were probably all under the age of 25, except us.And then I saw all their bowls of Tteokbokki on their tables. They weren't regular bowls, they were GIANT bowls full of sticky noodles covered in spicy gochujang style red sauces, covered in gooey cheese. We ordered Yup Dduk, Set C. In our order there was yam noodles (the kind Japchae is made of), fried onion rings and fried zucchini, fish cake, a couple small pieces of sausage and maybe some other things. Being an "older customer" my body can't necessarily handle such a carb loaded meal. But, my eyes and taste buds feasted on this dish! It was delish! I think this bowl could have fed 6 people! We had plenty of leftovers. On the side, the only vegetable to be considered was pickled radish. Does that count as "balance"?One of my favorite things about the meal was making seaweed covered rice balls. I'd never done this before. So much fun and delicious too. I'll be trying this at home!And when they advise "extra mild", I recommend you take their suggestion. No shame in extra mild.I can handle a decent amount of slickness. No joke! This was spicy! It definitely inched to my borderline.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This is probably the best spicy rice cake place I have been to!For the price, the portion was so big and the leftovers lasted me and my roommate for the rest of the week. We ordered the extra mild and it was still quite spicy for us, but was still really good. The location was a little small, but we went on a weekend around noon so we were able to be seated right away.We also ordered some yogurt drinks on the side, but they were a little small and not sure if I would have them again other than for the fact that it helped calm down the spice.Would definitely go back next time I come down to LA!
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Great place to grab a bite with your friends when in K-Town. The location is quite small though with only a few tables and limited parking. Something to consider if you are craving rice cakes (ddukbokgi/tteokbokki).I came here with a group of 4 and we were able to fit perfectly by combining two tables. We split two bowls of rice cakes. In hindsight, one bowl would have been sufficient. The portion sizes here are really big! Also beware of the spiciness levels. I am pretty comfortable with spiciness and the mild was too spicy for me. If this is your first time here, I'd recommend to start with extra mild and then work your way up the spiciness ladder.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: super yummy. 10/10! will definitely come back again. service was delightful. ambiance was perfect.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: SO GOOOOD i had such a good experience. Our waitress so sweet and her black and white claw clip was such a serve. much love
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Easily the best dduk boki in all of LA.  There I said it.  But dayum it's always consistent tasting and always on point.  Btw extra mild spice level is like a 7!  It's still spicy!  Be careful!  And enjoy!!!
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food was good but definitely prepare for the spice. We got mild spicy and it was spicier than expected. But the fried veggies and other toppings were so good. The rice cake and fish cake was soft and chewy. The sauce was really good as well. Service was quick, the place is kind of small so theres not a lot of seating but we got there at good time.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Yup Dduk is the best place to share dukbokki with friends! We came here at 4:30pm on a Sunday and was surprised that there was a wait - but after 15 min nearly everyone left the restaurant so 5pm is the ideal time to visit LOLWe ordered their standard with fried spam and ramen at mild spicy. Don't take their spice level for granted though - I love spicy food and eat it a lot but their mild was definitely more of a medium. For two people, this is definitely enough and more for another takeaway meal. I would highly suggest getting other things to help with the spice levels like banana milk and rice balls just to cut the meal - I didn't need it but my friend definitely did LOLIf you add a lot of sides, the bill will rack up but I found out meal to be the perfect amount! May opt for more cheese next time!Parking: valet during the time we went at $3 which isn't too bad.Restaurant size: slightly smaller which is why there was a wait. Tables are also really close together so you'll smell the perfume of the person sitting next to you lol
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: After hearing about this place from friends, I finally had a chance to stop by. This place did not disappoint! The dduk was soft and chewy and the sauce was super spicy. If you have a moderate spice tolerance, I recommend going with mild. I liked the spicy kick but after a certain point all I tasted was the heat haha. I want to try the mild version next time to see if I can taste more of the sauce. Service was great.
Address: 3603 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Friendly service. We were able to get in quickly with a reservation on a Saturday night before a show at the Greek. Great salsas, good chicken, enchiladas were not good.
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Fiancé and I absolutely love this place and not just for the food, which is delicious, but also for the service. Johana was our server tonight and she was great. Everyone that works here is incredibly friendly and attentive. I don't know how else to say it, but they really make you feel like they're happy you're there. Which seems like a given, but unfortunately is not always the case.As far as food recommendations, we had the halibut special, skirt steak and sword fish taco along with tequila sunrise and classic margarita. Everything was delicious and everyone was friendly. We're very happy this restaurant is in our neighborhood. We were sad to see Mexico City go, but we like Encanto better!
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Super Delicious:  Cadillac Margaritas, Queso Fundido, Branzino, Swordfish tacos, Caesar Salad, and flan.  The flautas were good, and so was the guacamole (although it was small for the price).The service was excellent, and our server had a great sense of humor.I always like a booth, and their booths are cozy and private.  The ceramic room divider is an interesting and colorful touch that brightens the dark space.It's hard to understand why it wasn't full on a Saturday night!  I could tell, though, that if it were full it would be extremely noisy.Anyway.  I highly recommend Encanto (even if I miss the diner Mexico City!) and I'll be returning.
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Yummy guacamole and delicious branzino! The servers were very attentive. I enjoyed the Albariño white wine also.
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great time at this restaurant! Food and ambiance is amazing! The service is superb and every dish I tried was on point. Try the quesadillas, short rib, Tacos, and Seabass for dessert the Churros are must!
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Before a Greek Theater event, we found this gem. Fabulous dinner and drinks!Joanna always had a smile on her face and a great attitude!  Wonderful service...love her!! We had the braised beef tacos and swordfish fish tacos...fantastic!! Really good guacamole, beans and rice! Delicious Cadillac margarita and a great glass of Chardonnay. Great job on your management team!!! We'll definitely come back.
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I am so glad we took a chance on this place last night. I had been hesitant after looking at the menu because their tacos seemed kind of pricey, but now I see they're worth EVERY penny. They're a pretty big bang for your buck!! I LOVED the braised beef and the swordfish taco melted in my mouth. But I will say surprisingly their frijoles side was my fave item.. wow. Zesty flavor and I could have JUST had a bowl of that and walked away saying "that was one of the best dishes in Los Feliz". The fingerling potatoes were great too. Service is impeccable, loved our waitress. Sooo bubbly and kind! Do yourself a favor and try them out!
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Wow Chef Chris is amazing!! I followed him from Newport Beach to here because of his smooth suave delicate cuisine. The pork cheek tacos and the chicken quesadilla just melts smoothly and like a firework in mouth. Smooth delicate and fine cuisine.The ambiance is so homey and the service/people are kind. His creativity in his flavor with some fusion and care.
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: One of my real goto spots in Los Feliz. I often get my steps in by walking from Hollywood to Los Feliz. When I do, you can usually find me at the bar taking a small "break" between miles with some chips and guac, a couple of margs and a taco at Encanto. Gorgeous food, gorgeous restaurant. Seriously one of the best collections of art in any restaurant in LA.
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This place exudes a fantastic vibe. Visited on a Friday night and it was just right. The ambiance is hip and the drinks are both delicious and visually appealing. Ruben provided excellent service - attentive and friendly. With a DJ spinning oldies jams, the experience was top-notch. I highly recommend this spot and definitely plan on returning. Cheers!
Address: 2121 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Newman Twins is the best thing in this spot ! They are so sweet so patient and gave the best service!!! Respect!
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: The food was good but a limited menu.  Service was nice and attentive but I think the prices were high for what you get ambiance was nice but they need to increase the menu. Going downtown and paying $27 for parking the car. Is not worth it.  On the ala cart menu there wasn't any fish
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: We had an exceptional experience at this new LA restaurant. From the warm and welcoming staff to the exquisitely prepared meal, it was truly unforgettable!Opting for the Teppanyaki Dinner was a fantastic decision. It was a great 3-course meal followed by dessert and allowed us to savor a variety of flavors. We also indulged in a few of their individual dishes, and they exceeded our expectations. We even had a magician appear at our table to perform a few tricks and next thing you knew the first course had arrived!Maison Kasai offers a beautiful ambiance and our group loved how you can explore all that Level 8 has to offer after your meal. Whether it's a visit to the Wanderlust Bar or the Golden Hour Rooftop, there are plenty of options to extend your night and make it truly memorable.
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Such an amazing experience! The food was high quality, unique, and cooked perfectly. Not only was the food delicious, but the staff was also very friendly and attentive.We were greeted by the host and an aerialist upon entrance and were pleasantly surprised when a magician came to perform at our table while we were waiting for our food. This immersive experience made Maison Kasai a restaurant that I definitely will be visiting again.The Teppanyaki was amazing and the appetizers were  flavorful. Some of my favorites were the black sesame tofu and the lobster!
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: All around amazing! The staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was very high quality and the presentation and live preparation followed suit! You can tell the menu was thoughtfully created.The ambience was unique and highly curated. As you are greeted by the host there is an aerialist performing and in between drinks and dinner, a magician came to the table and performed a few tricks. Perfect upscale hibachi experience!Great place for dates, celebrations, and more - will absolutely be coming back!
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Everything was so delicious! I was sure that i would be disappointed by SOMETHING, but nope, everything was out of the park. I had the tepanyaki dinner, which came with all kinds of delicious goodies. my favorite thing was the soft sesame tofu which came at the beggining. I could eat a big bowl of that.The chef, who cooked our proteins at the grill in front of us, is a man of deep skill and was so warm and informative. Our server, Freddie, was so nice and helpful. A magician showed up at one point? If you want to splurge on a big fun meal, with very beautiful people all around you, this is the spot!
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I gotta give it to you guys - great execution on all the restaurants at Level 8.Now this teppanyaki has both a prefix and an a la carte menu. You can choose apps and entrees or a protein to go with your teppanyaki.The grill master was awesome. Very professional, knew what he was doing. Austin our waiter was incredibly attentive and made our experience so much fun.I took away a star because of timing with the food and pricing for the style of food you're getting but you know, I get it.Can't wait to come back.
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: This restaurant experience surprised and delighted me from start to finish. You start off entering through a speakeasy bar filled with wonders from around the world. They lead you into the restaurant and you are transported to a world of french and Japanese teppanyaki fusion. The servers are so friendly and informative about the menu, and made sure to ask about allergens. Freddy was our server and he took care of our needs all night. The food wow where to begin. The tofu sesame starter, the lobster, my dads steak, the veal shortbread, was all spectacular and cooked right in front of you. I will definitely be bringing my friends and coming back. Amazing opening of the restaurant! I'd recommend making a reservation ASAP as it's filling up quick!
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: This is my second visit to Level 8, I attended the soft opening of Maison Kasai. We had reservations at 8:30pm, howeverwe arrive a bit earlier to make sure we had plenty of time to have a couple of drinks before dinner. We decided to start Mr. Wanderlust for appetizers and pre dinner cocktails with our server Julia who went above and beyond, this is the most beautiful library with the most amazing collection of books and artifacts from all over the world. They have live music and like anything else from the Houston Brothers a aerialist performance which remind me of my first time at Pour Vous, the library is plush with plenty of space to gather with friends. Next, we had our host walk us through a secret door to Golden Hour, this is the carrousel outdoor bar which is simply beautiful with cabanas and the most amazing views of the sunset. We had an aperitif at the carrousel where Josh help us with our concoction's, which were on point delicious. Now is time to walk over to Maison Kasai for our dinner, we got greeted and seated by the marvelous twins (sorry ladies I forgot your names, but not your service which was excellent). We all decided on the the Red Snapper teppanyaki which is a must, the first course is a black sesame tofu which was very unique and delicious. Overall my experience at Level 8 has been out of this world, make sure you come with ample time to enjoy every single experience as each is very unique, by the way the Cocomelon cocktail was one of my favorites.  I would like to mention Kingston Chan, he made sure our experience was unforgettable.
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Great service, food, ambiance!! You feel very valued as a patron, cared for, cherished with amazing food, drinks and attention!
Address: 1254 S Figueroa St Fl 8 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: The crab Benedict is not as should be! The sauce the put instead Benedict is a sour and sweet, it doesn't much with egg and crb at all! The worst Benedict!The waitress was so rude when I told him that it's not a real crab cake Benedict! The manager was so sweet, she know how suppose to be a real Crab cake Benedict. I used to live this place,  but no more come here.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Bottomless brunch was really great! As was the truffle egg sandwich that's on the brunch menu.Only con was we had a 1:30 reservation and didn't sit down until after 2. Thankfully we weren't starving and the staff was very apologetic but kinda annoying how a reservation didn't get any "priority" in seating order. But seriously not too serious imo, great place and vibe for sure, I'd definitely go back.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I love this place they have great food and a great atmosphere weather it's during the week or the weekend and the bottomless mimosa is to die for you won't retreat going there ‍
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Don't go when they open. They need about 40 mins to get into the swing of things. Pancakes were good, crab cakes eggs benedicts were meh, potatoes a bit over done. Service lacked. I'm thinking they must have gone out the night before and we're feeling it Sunday morning. Flies galore inside.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Good foodGood servicePerfect for mimosas on a weekend.The ambiance is great, def a go to spot.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Food was pretty good! Service was great. Potato was were a little oily. Glad they had some vegan options.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The last experience at Eat This Cafe was excellent. While the prices are slightly on the higher side, they are in line with what you would expect in Los Angeles for a small establishment like this, making it acceptable. The brunch was fantastic, and the staff was very attentive.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Loved this place! From the staff, to the food, to the bottomless mimosas. Street parking wasn't too difficult and everything here tasted so delicious!! Can't wait to come back
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I work next door to this place and eat lunch here all the time! The staff is always so nice and the Eat This Salad is the best salad I've ever had! I don't know what they do to it but it's so good! It can be busy depending on when you go but that just goes to show you how good the food is. Highly recommend this place!
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Rating 10/10 !Food : Everytime I go we get breakfast food but this trip we got sandwiches. BEST DECISION EVER, the sandwiches are sooo big and so juicy. They are not stingy with toppings or deli meat at all. Must recommend the turkey club, had me stuffed !Ambiance : Such a good time always, with bottomless mimosas you can't go wrong !Service : Our waiter was very attentive and on it!Bottomless Mimosas : Sooo fresh and ice cold makes them so much better to enjoy!
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Went for a second time today. I got the buttermilk pancakes and was disappointed. They were hard and not fluffy at all. Potatoes were amazing and tasted yummy. The eggs were not cooked long enough and were a bit watery for scrambled eggs. I was expecting to never see the bottom of my mimosa because I paid for bottomless but was disappointed with watching an empty glass for long portions of time regardless how empty the restaurant was. Overall, definitely a place I recommend for bottomless mimosas just wish the waiters would be faster since you only have a 90 minute time frame there.
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Amazing mimosas ! Amazing food, if you are seated outside beware of outdoor smells like garbage. Waiters were on it and never let me see the bottom of my mimosas!
Address: 6547 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: FIRST TIMER REVIEWER HERE! I was craving sushi and my bestie quickly recommended for us to go to Santo. She was raving about all of the sushi she and her boyfriend had eaten two nights ago. We had several sushi including Hamachi Negi & Truffle, Crispy Soft shell Crab, Double Dragon roll and a few more that I can't remember alongside cold sake and Sapporo! I typically take pics of all of my food but we were so darn hungry that we couldn't wait...lol! Each sushi and hand-roll we ate was delicious! The service was great too! There was always a server or waiter walking around and was also knowledgeable about their menu too. The reason for a 4 star review and not a 5 star review is due to us having to sit outside. We weren't able to get reservations for any inside seating. So, we opted to sit outside and it was noisy, cars honking their horns, panhandlers, and an occasional entrepreneur trying to sell their hand made soaps. I'm sure if we had the opportunity to sit inside, this would have a higher chance of being a 5 star review. Oh! Off topic but their restroom is big and clean too! Would I come back? YES! DEFINITELY! Would I recommend Santo to others? YES! FOR SURE!!
Address: 3822 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Wanted to check out this new Japanese/Mexican sushi bar.The experience was lovely.....They have great quality fish, fun and creative fusion recipes like the HAMACHI CHOCO NIGIRI, definitely a MUST! The place is well decorated, they play good music and even the lighting is perfect.These guys have pretty good taste and know how to create a great ambience.I went with a group of SAKE drinkers so we tried some of their high end options and also the house one..... very good and the price are more than fair.And last but not least, they really made us feel at home, very friendly staff, all of them the servers, the manager and we even chat with of the owners from Mexico City who sent a couple of treats to our table.We'll definitely come back soon!Highly recommend!
Address: 3822 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Great restaurant, food was delicious, very fresh. Service was amazing. Space was moody and romantic.
Address: 3822 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I'm a sushi addict, I could eat it for every meal and still crave more. Santō, who is originally from Mexico City, has now opened their first US location in the heart of Silver Lake. The menu is rather limited, but the space excels at fresh sashimi and nigiri with a few interesting roll options as well.Making a reservation was beyond difficult, we couldn't book a spot until October via Resy. I don't believe they listed a phone # so we couldn't call either to inquire. My friend and I decided to go right when they opened at 5pm hoping to grab a spot, which we did as there were only 4 other people dining when we walked in.The space is beautiful, but VERY small. The only dining is sushi bar, window sill, or 2 tables outside -- in total I think the space holds less than 24 people. Below is what was tried:SEARED O'TORO SASHIMI - 5 Stars. Could not have been more fresh or delicious, beautiful presentation as well. They actually sear the Toro in front of you which is a nice touch.SANTO TIRADITO HAMACHI - 5 Stars. A perfect bite! Fresh, tasty, and so delicious!DARUMA ROLL - 4 1/2 Stars. Soft shell crab and avocado, this was quite good!DOUBLE DRAGON ROLL - 5 Stars. This is quite the complex roll and works perfectly! Packed with flavor and the texture of the shrimp tempura adds a nice touch to this roll.SALMON HAND ROLL - 4 Stars. The salmon quality was excellent, and overall this was quite a solid hand roll.CRISPY SOFT SHELL CRAB HAND ROLL - 4 1/2 Stars. This was the best hand roll of the two, and quite good!The food presentation was excellent, the service was friendly and attentive, and the overall vibe was great inside. Beer, wine, and sake only, so if you're looking for a cocktail this is not your spot. I wish the menu was a bit more expansive, but what they do offer they do extremely well!
Address: 3822 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026
