Comment: Great atmosphere in the heart of K town. Parking was a pain but you know what you're getting yourself into when coming here. I ordered the spicy tonkatsu. The broth was savory and the noodles were on point. I asked for the chachu pork to be torched and it was great. Did not come with an egg which was a bummer. Overall it was a good bowl of Ramen.
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: So good - pork melted in your mouth.  Broth was so flavorful.  Will definittely come back
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Stopped here quickly for a quick bite. Had a great visit. The food was delicious and staff was very attentive
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This is my ramen spot service is great the food is amazing nice and clean environment and definitely a place to go out and enjoy the food
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The best tbh. Foods fire. Get the chashu fried rice it's amazing with the pickled ginger
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The best spot for late night ramen, I always stop by for their cheap but so filling lunch combo and always leave satisfied with whatever I have
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Ramen was good. Real good brother. We got the chefs special and it was the star. The appetizers were a big miss. We got the bugolgi egg rolls? That was not good at all. Neither was the fried rice. Tasted awfully familiar to the Trader Joe's one.
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Not too bad!  Service was a little slow because we were there at a busy time.  We will add list one to our list !!!!!!
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This shit was not worth the wait when I tried it with my vegan bitch 5 years ago. I highly doubt it got any better. Do not eat here, ramen with a fat egg on top is better at home
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Excellent Ramen fairly priced. Located in a nondescript strip mall in K-Town. Worth a visit!
Address: 3500 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: This place is a solid 5-Star Coffee/Pastry/ Food shop- and it's in the middle of Hollywood Walk of Fame!!! Location is a Killer.. I've been coming here almost everyday now for a month or so and never has Float Hollywood not meet or exceed my expectations for coffee/pastries!! The food quality is amazing and the staff is fun, attentive and caring! I highly recommend everyone coming or living in Hollywood to come and check this place out, grab some coffee and go enjoy the Walk of Fame on Vine & Hollywood Blvd.P.S. Special thanks goes to Edwin and Jules for always making my day and visit feel special, warm and fun! I'II be back for more guys!!
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Wow! Such a cute coffee shop with great vibes! Staff was so friendly and welcoming. The food was great too. Had a chicken pesto sandwich that was incredible. My new go to spot in Hollywood.
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Stepped into Float Hollywood after discovering them on social media with their awesome videos of their food and location. I tried the veggie wrap with a fresh side salad for this hot day and let me tell you *chefs kiss*. The wrap was so filling with a soft spinach tortilla, smooth hummus and the cucumbers add for a nice crunch. This wrap paired with their Vanilla Cold Brew made for the perfect pair! Next to try is the Banh Mi!! And after speaking to the friendly staff they told me about the Pasadena location which is so close to my work!! I know where I'm going for lunch now!
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Decent coffee. Has a nice start and finish. Real coffeehouse. Bright and upbeat decor, clean. Friendly service. Definitely worth a stop.
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Ordered the Picnic turkey sandwich.  Ciabatta bread was soft and the whole sandwich was just delicious.  It also came with a side salad of greens and shredded carrots which was a pleasant surprise.  I recommend this place.
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: My new favorite cafe in the heart of Hollywood!! Excellent customer service and an amazing atmosphere / vibe.  So far Ive tried their Banh Mi sandwich and it is delicious and fulfilling!  They have big selection of foods, grab n go and much more.
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Our first time here. This was a great place to stop for lunch before the matinee at Pantages. We were warmly welcomed by a very friendly staffer behind the counter. She answered our questions and smiled the entire interaction. The house lemonade is like none other - must try! The sandwiches are made to order, although we were told there are sometimes some premade in the case for grab-and-go. We ordered the chicken pesto and The Picnic, both came with a side salad. The food was REALLY good. The chicken on the pesto seemed like it was sliced from the breast. Love that! There was a slight hint of mayo on the sandwich that blended extremely well with the pesto. Creative! My spouse loved The Picnic, repeatedly mentioning the ciabatta tastes fresh.  There is plenty of seating, even an indoor balcony with seating!The restaurant was very clean. Every table was clean and quickly cleaned when guests left their table. As we left, all three front of the house staffers wished us a good day and thanked us for stopping by.Thank you Float for a great experience today! We will definitely be back!
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: When I'm out exploring I want something different... so I looked up coffee shops in the area and found this gem. Clean, welcoming and cozy cafe with a nice seating area and even a loft overlooking the cafe. The staff was friendly, and helpful, greeted us with a smile... never a bad way to make a first impression.We had a mocha, cappuccino, coffee cake and croissant. The coffee is well balanced, not too sweet, not too bitter, and a good temperature -- I hate when my coffee gets cold after 5 minutes. We ate here, so everything was served in nice plates and glasses. Utensils were the wrapped plastic disposable type, but then I suppose you don't need to worry about how well they were washed.The pastries were fresh, moist, flavorful but not overly sweet. Overall very pleasant spot, perfect for a quick morning bite to get the day going.
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Joyce and Eddie, the owners, are some of the kindest people you'll ever meet. And the food, atmosphere, and service match their passion for fun times. The Creamcicle Float is to die for.
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Unfriendly from the jump. The drinks are so pretty in their online photos- like they were made with care. But today they came in plastic cups, and no flare.  it was a bit of a let down for the coffee meet up I planned.
Address: 1635 Vine St Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Place is a little pricey but you're paying for the view. The best drink is the mezcal watermelon sour patch. It's intimidating by the name but it's delicious!!!
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: Gorgeous new rooftop in DTLA. I was reluctant to go after reading some negative reviews here but ended up having such an amazing time with my friend. Food was delicious, staff from the hostess to the waitress were all very friendly and helpful. The beautiful sunset is definitely a Instagram post win Highly recommend if you want to enjoy the refreshing cocktail with summer breeze and beautiful city view.
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: Overall a beautiful and relaxing rooftop. The view is simply AMAZING! I highly recommend.
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: The view was the greatest part of this experience. Food was great, but a bit over priced. The drink were ok.
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: had a 1pm reservation, didnt get seated until 1:45pm, people ahead of us with no reservations got seated first. When we got seated, it was under the sun with no umbrella and they had empty tables with umbrellas and a reserved sign on some of them.we stood up and quickly left. yeah, you're not getting my money
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: Super impressive views and amazing service!! If you're looking for a place to see LA from an aerial view, this is the place! It gets a bit chilly after the sun sets, so bring a light jacket or scarf. They provide heat lamps, and they're helpful.
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: We came to Lucky Mizu for dinner and then stopped by La Lo La for drinks. This is our 1st time here  so we were amazed by the secret entries the 8th floor offered.  When we were at the bar at LaLoLa for our next outing (diff elevator, BTW), we did 1 round of 4 cocktail drinks and found some seatings and enjoyed the great view. After 40ish mins or so we then went to the bar and ordered the 2nd round. I asked the bar goer/s what were they drinking and they recommended the Palomar. I looked at the ingredients of the drink and asked if there were any cotton candy (which is on the menu) and they said no. So I jokingly asked the bartender ((Rob (shift around 10 ish 11pm) on 08/31)) if there were any discounts for the drinks due to the lack of the missing ingredient, cotton candy and he made a remark to me of having an immigrant mentality.  I find this is super offensive. What kind of remark is that just because I am Asian?  QUESTION, would he have said that if I was white or any other race (?). I hope you will address this with your team to build a better customer service within your establishment. We are living in LA and is a well diverse community.  So choose your words wisely, there are many bar goers with different ethnic, race, backgrounds, and gender, pls RESPECT.1 star for attitude4 stars for drinks3 overall
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: Great view, but typical LA with overpriced, weak and small drinks. Service was ok, definitely recommend having a reservation.
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: This place left us wanting more. Starting with the positives, the views are amazing and the drinks were good.The rest of our experience was subpar. When we went up to the host stand it took her 10 minutes to find our reservation. At first she said we didn't have one or that we came on the wrong day, but eventually she found it. The music was so loud it was almost unenjoyable to be there. You had to shout to be heard by the person next to you. Our server took our initial drink order and never came back. Our first round of drinks came quickly, but our appetizers and desserts took over an hour. We ordered the dates and gelato. The dates were cold when we got them and the gelato was half melted. Our new server comped the gelato but the situation was still bad.We were celebrating a birthday and the bad service really ruined the mood of the evening.
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: The view from La Lo La Rooftop was absolutely gorgeous from sunset to nightfall. Totally loved the vibes and the setup. Super comfortable for lounging to have quite a few number of drinks without feeling like you're being rushed to leave for the next party.Aurora + Joshua were friendly and attentiveWe only stayed for drinks. Their tapas menu was super small and we wanted to have dinner.Totally recommend coming for drinks and to enjoy the view!Parking: We pulled into the self parking lot next to the Valet. It's $20 til 2AM or $55ish for overnight. I *think* valet is $25 with validation, but we liked getting in and out and not waiting lol.
Address: 1260 S Figueroa St Los Angeles, CA 90015
Style: Tapas Bars, Tapas/Small Plates, Cocktail Bars

Comment: Not even sure how we found this place but the Kimbob is outstanding. Like a delicious work of art. Anchovy pepper kimbob? Yes please?
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: They make truly vegan kimbob, so in a pinch when I needed appetizers for a dinner party, they were there to save me.  The owners recommended that next time I call directly rather than order through one of the apps.  I also tried other varieties of kimbop and was very happy.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I reached out to them via Google chat through their business profile, during non-business hours and they were so quick to respond! Within minutes. I was able to submit an early morning order at 7am with no issues. Other places that I called told me that order would take a bit since they open at 7. Ggor ghap came through and had my order ready for me.Now the kimbobs. I had the tuna, rainbow, meat and spicy squid (work potluck). First, you can really tell that the ingredients are FRESH. You notice all the crunching of the veggies. The kimbobs are larger than other places. They were a hit and everyone enjoyed them esp with the current social media craze. Would definitely return to get more!Forgot to take photos since everyone jumped at them but they were soooo pretty and well wrapped.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: UberEats- ordered 4times now.  Meat, veggie kimbaps and the cold salad...always the same three items, always happy w/them.  Fresh ingredients- yes.  Generous serving size- yes.  What I love is that it's so beautiful...vibrant colors, perfect slices, tidy packaging.  Love that the seaweed is dark and shiny...overall, a really good product.  I love food rolled up...taquitos, eggrolls, summer rolls, sushi rolls, kimbaps.  When I'm in the mood for Korean ToGo, this meat kimbap is usually the first image that pops up in my mind's eye. Luv it!
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Spicy Squid Kimbap is massive in size and perfectly seasoned. Not that spicy, a hint. Just this order alone is very filling. Service is on point. Will be regular. Only wish is that they open at night and maybe customize option so I can have two different kimbaps.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Just back from an excellent first visit for lunch! My Korean wife and I each had combos - she had Cold Noodles/Anchovie-Pepper Kimbob and I had the Udon/Squid kimbob (we shared the kimbob rolls - both were amazing, as was the udon.) I'm not a huge fan of cold noodles but my wife said hers were incredible.Huge portions. It's very rare I leave anything to bring home, but I couldn't finish the squid rolls, and my wife took home half her anchovie/pepper rolls.  Still, we both left feeling very full. But beyond the size of the portions, the quality was genuinely excellent. Fresh, perfectly seasoned and balanced, and the kimbob, as others have pointed out in their reviews, were not overstuffed with rice - each roll was packed full of the good stuff. The combos come with a Dijon (I think)-based dipping sauce that was perfect.The service was cheerful, prompt and helpful. Prices are very reasonable.Parking is a little tight, but there's an additional lot in the rear and we were able to park with no problem. It's free for an hour.The only very minor negatives I would point out are the hours - they close at 2.30 pm, and are closed completely on Sunday. Hopefully demand will require that they expand those hours soon.We're definitely coming back again soon and encourage you to try Ggor Ghap!
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The best kimbap in town! They also have them available in H mart in Torrance and oc locations and I've been wanting to try the restaurant in ktown and it' did not disappoint
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I'm a big lover of kimbap, so I was excited to see this place open down the street from my apartment. I was impressed with the quality and size of their kimbap. They're not over stuffed with rice, which I appreciate, and their fillings have been pretty good. I like their meat kimbap and the tuna kimbap.I usually order to-go, so there's usually a bit of a wait (nothing more than 10 minutes) because they make all their rolls fresh and to order. But the service has always been very good. The last time I was there, they included a menu for me, so that I could just call in the orders and don't have to wait as long.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Got the rainbow kimbap. It's so huge! I love how they minimize the rice and jam-pack it with a lot of veggies and meat. The dipping sauce is ok. It is quite pricey though.
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Best kimbap in LA!Had the vegetable, spicy octopus, and tuna kimbaps and they were so yummy! Packed with lots of ingredients and little rice, which makes it so filling and pretty to look at! Also, their wasabi inspired dipping sauce that comes with the kimbap is addictingly good!Must go kimbap place when in Los Angeles!
Address: 3959 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Don't order delivery from this places because they simply will not listen to any requests and just make you wait and hour and a half for whatever food they want to give you. Thanks a lot.
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Delicious ! I tried their three birria tacos that come with beans and rice also consume if you enjoy it! Packages super well for a delivery setup! Make sure to ask for enough napkins as the crispy cheesey ones will leave you covered in flavor all over your fingers. So if you're worried about making a mess or getting clothing dirty maybe another option on the menu would work better. Super soft mean packed with favor ! I've recommended it to my coworkers and they love it as well.
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: PICK UP ONLY SPOT!! Upon arriving I didn't know that this was a LOCKER pick up only & this establishment had orange other restaurants combined. SUPER BUSY. Waited over 45 minutes for the food to be ready for pick-up.I suggest if you want any of the restaurants that are combined at this establishment, ORDER AHEAD! They did have a window service to help if you were struggling to place an order or if you had trouble viewing the codeThe ambiance was busy, many people were waiting around for their foods.Now for the food rating3 Quesabirria Plate/ rice and beans 7/10: there wasn't much cheese in my tacos & very quite sad about it. The meat was tasty, but a bit dry. Flavor was all there thoughSalsa verde 6/10: honestly, didn't really have much flavor & wasn't spicyConsume 10/10: absolutely amazing. It was amazing to dip the tacos in $ I even drank it afterwardsI recommend maybe even ordering pick-up service once the food is ready because waiting there for the food felt forever lol
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Love the pozole. Found on Uber eats and was delivered on time. Great value for the cost
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Bad news for breakfast today - I took two bites of my delivery Chorizo Egg Burrito and started choking, because I had sucked in one end of this massive...thing...lodged inside my burrito. Is it a casing? It's slimy and extremely tough. Absolutely disgusting. This was my first time trying this restaurant, and it's definitely my last.
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Got birria tacos, consome, and carne asada fries. The first two were great. The fries were good but not made the way I usually enjoy them. Overall I'll definitely eat from here again.
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Good birria tacos and they have a b1g1 free promo online. Only thing is sometimes the quality is off and on. Last time there was barely any meat but all the other times it was great
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Issue: I texted the number the owner provided and the issue been resolved! I originally called the basic contact number and the automatic message kept repeating a phrase that weren't related to the restaurants such as "refer to your friend to download the app ___" or so which got me frustrated to write the first review along with the forgotten items n other reason. If theres ever an issue with your order I suggest texting the number he just listed.Food:The birria tacos are delicious!!The horchata was how we like it, not too creamy and not too sweets.Their red sauce is really good, a little spicy.Torta was also surprisingly good.I think I prefer the birria chicken quesadilla over the "birria quesadilla", it's a little bit easier to eat and melt in your mouth.The star of the show: the consome!! They're flavorful and delicious and not too oiley. They make all the food taste even better.I recommend trying their birria tacos with consome, red sauce, and horchata as your first order.
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Spent over $80 on food, they forgot a whole meal. The food took over 30 min already which is understandable, it's just frustrating that there's no way to contact them for a refund on one of the item they forgot or to get store credit for it. This happens a couple time to other people, feel very SCAM ISH.The area is not that great.
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: abuelitas birria puts me to sleep every single time. it is amazingly good. its a must have for dinner, b/c if i eat this at work ill be sleepy for the rest of the day lol
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: BELIEVE THE REVIEWS!!! PLACE DOES NOT DISAPPOINT.just close your eyes and order this food dude. You won't regret it.Best late night food you'll get.
Address: 615 N. Western Ave. Hollywood, CA 90004

Comment: Service was incredibly fast and friendly. Vibes were great, food was good and price was good. No complaints here.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: HomeState is a great little spot for tex mex breakfast. We went on a Sunday morning. It is a popular spot so be prepared for a bit of a line. There is limited outdoor seating.I enjoyed the vegan potato taco very much. I also tasted their lemonade soda which was delicious.Recommend.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Delish all the way around! The Migas are my favorite.Hibiscus lemonade is also delicious.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I've always been a fan of home state. Who doesn't like breakfast tacos???I've been to the highland park location, but it was my first time at Los Feliz. I arrived at opening, and didn't have to wait long. The staff is quick and efficient with getting food out, and it is a cozy restaurant with indoor and outdoor seating.Each taco is fairly substantial, so 2 is a good place to start if you don't want to be stuffed. Tempted to try multiple different tacos, we order 6 for a party of 2 and had leftovers for later. The pics don't look amazing, but I promise they're good paired with the hot sauce they provide!!!
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Reminds Me of TexasHad lunch plans with a friend and stumbled upon this gem. HomeState serves Tex-Mex style food, and as someone from Texas, I can confidently say that this place delivers on that premise. The menu itself is pretty straightforward -- they have tacos, chips, salads, quesadillas, side dishes, etc. They also serve booze which is a major win in my book. I ordered their frito pie, a brisket taco, and Ranchwater to drink, and none of it disappointed. The frito pie came in a frito's bag and immediately took me back to being high school in Texas.The place itself is small, but neatly organized and definitely has a Texas kind of vibe and ambiance. The place gets full pretty quickly depending on the time of day.Whether you're homesick for some Tex-Mex style food or just want delicious, cheap food you can't go wrong with HomeState. I definitely want to come back and try all their other tacos.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Love! Tacos are great and so is their loaded queso! I typically always get their Tijuana Panther, and it's amazing each time.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Yummy food.  Great service.  I have had the chicken taco 3 times now.  A friend had the brisket taco and she said that was tender and very tasty.  Another friend had the chorizo Andys Migas which was delicious. I will be ordering that next visit.  Probably best to split it.  Great guacamole and chips. Frozen margarita is very good as well.  Great salsas too.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Good Tex mex tacos. Everything I've had was tasty. I love that there are vegetarian options. I've been back several times already.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Drove down to East Hollywood for a concert at the Greek, and this was a great spot to hit before! They have a good variety of Tex-Mex inspired cuisine. We ordered a few things to try on the menu, but the potato's and cheese dip deserved honorable mention. A very unusual dish that was pulled off extremely well! The service was extremely attentive and helpful as well! The water was interesting as it definitely didn't fit the vibe of the restaurant as it was an igloo cooler, and some of the dishes could of used a little less spice and more seasoning, but other than that, this place was very solid and I will definitely be visiting again!
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Good, not great. Staff are very friendly but the food is lacking. I went for breakfast recently and the tacos were so bland, even with their sauce. Additionally the bacon in the taco was so hard it was inedible.
Address: 4624 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Nice ambience, good presentation, tasty food, expensive prices, small portions. Good for a night out with friends but nothing I would really crave, especially at these prices.Boozy Suzy: get this if you like sweet fruity drinks. Good amount of alcohol.Tuna tartare*: was a favorite. I do feel like you can find something similar at other restaurants.Fire-baked focaccia: delicious because of the honey/cheese it comes with.Bubbling shrimp: nice Thai red curry shrimp. Small portion. Not enough bread, which is why we got the focaccia.Roasted eggplant: we thought it would be like baba ganoush, but it was more minty, less creamy. Eggplant was a little tough. Unique but I wouldn't get it again.Marinated golden beets*: so so good. Probably my favorite of the night. I have had something similar before, and you can totally replicate something similar at home.Diavola pizza: get this if you like pepperoni pizza. It was a little salty for me.Artichoke pizza: my friends liked this one.Yogurt marinated chicken*: creamy, delicious, and unique. Second favorite dish.Tiramisu eclair: good, but not something I would order again. A little dry and was missing something for me.Service: friendly and attentive.Ambience: beautifully decorated and busy. Pretty dark so it's hard to read the menu.Parking: there are parking lots nearby, just be prepared to pay. If you are willing to park, you will find cheaper street parking.
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Really great restaurant located in the heart of Culver City. The customer service was top notch, food was incredible, and the overall ambiance was really upscale. Parking although is a nightmare; it's best to just valet or uber. I highly recommend the meatballs, focaccia with dip, and the chicken dish as an entree. All excellent options!
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: i'm SO bummed they recently permanently changed the noodle shape in the alla vodka pasta! it ruins it!! i was so excited to try that pasta at my birthday dinner, and upon ordering i was told they were out of the lumache (short curled tube) shape and that it would be served with oriechette (large, thick, round) , and this shape was far too thick and undercooked, as well as it didn't go with the sauce at all. the sauce is SO good too, and it seemed promising with the right noodle shape! i understood for the time being and was excited to return to the restaurant to try the dish again with the correct noodle shape, as a lumache seems perfect for a vodka sauce, only to discover that they permanently changed the shape to orriechette and it again wasn't great :( i'm so disappointed this was a permanent change, and i don't think i'll be returning for this dish again, i wish they would change it back. :((
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Lovely place if you're trying to impress a date or take a gf/spouse for an elegant night out.Make your reservations early!We have tried taking our family (with kids) here and it worked out, but would recommend trying to enjoy the ambiance and experience without the kids.A great option for Italian in Culver City!
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Love swinging by when we're in town. Mushroom pizza, fresh salads and vodka pasta are always crowd pleasers.
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Awesome food and drinks! A bit pricey but very good!  Ideal for to catch up with friends or a date night!
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: My wife and I are there over the holiday weekend.  I made an east reservation through yelp for an early dinner.  Everyone was welcoming and kind when we arrived and were seated.  Our waitress and the supporting staff were excellent and we were well attended to.We went with beet salad, the half chicken and the margarita pizza plus dessert.  Everything is meant to be shared although it looks like proton sizes vary depending on the dish.  We ordered plenty and took some home. My wife loved the beet salad and we had to have them box it up to save room for the rest of the meal.  The pizza came out quickly and was delicious.  This was probably our least favorite of the dishes but still a great option.  The half chicken was the star.  It was deboned, juicy, flavorful with a crispy skin.  It was some of the best chicken I have ever had.  Highly recommend it.  For dessert we had the budino and the chocolate  cake.  The budino was amazing and I would get it again.  The chocolate cake wasn't anything special but was lack luster compared to the budino.  We will be back. I hope it will be consistently this good. Prices are high but it was one of the best meals we had this year.We parked off national in the garage next to the metro. No validation but there aren't many options in the area.
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Etta does not disappoint. The service was great, along with the ambiance. I've earen here inside and out on the patio, and both experiences were good. They have a chill ambiance with music. The food was amazing! I would 100% recommend the baked Focaccia!! It's one of their dtaples, I believe, and It's definitely one of the best starters I've ever had. The branzino is so well marinated with olive oil and confit tomato, among other zesty ingredients.  We also ordered the Margherita pizza, which was also delicious (feel free to dip it on the oil of the branzino). As for drinks, I would recommend the house margarita, it taste almost like a twist between passion fruit and mango drink on the rocks. As for dessert, we ordered the strawberry mousse.  It's savory, not too sweet, and just right to end the night.
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Dog friendly, great food and drink with nice ambiance. Valet parking available at hotel. Check out their goat cheese cocktail.
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: Etta has been a favorite dinner spot for a while due to their pleasant, homey ambience, great service, and exquisite menu. Tried brunch here for the first time a few months ago and will definitely be doing it again! My partner and I ordered one sweet and one savory item and I can comfortably announce etta has mastered both with elegance, style, and creativity! Didn't get pictures of our drinks but those were standouts as well! Big drinks!! I felt prices for brunch were very reasonable. Highly recommend checking out etta for brunch! They also have several great options for group mimosas.
Address: 8801 Washington Blvd Culver City, CA 90232

Comment: he food was fantastic and service was superb! The way that outdoor dining experience is set up you feel like your in an Asian Village. The ambiance is cozy and lively. Eli and Harley hats off. Our server Mr. S  was great and  front of the guy who is a sneaker head really made our night.
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Interesting ambiance. Food was standard fare for a Chinese restaurant and did not warrant the high price point.
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The ambiance is amazing. You're not coming here for the food, unless Americanized Chinese food is your thing. But if that was the case, go to PF Chang's and pay less. Service and staff was great. Probably see a celeb if you're on the look out. Trendy places like this aren't in my wheelhouse.
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: A feast for the stomach as well as the eyes. Stunning look. Delicious dishes. Attentive servers. Fancy. Expensive. Busy. Lots of photo ops.
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: this place has the best ambience, hands-down. The big statue to the small decorations, it truly feels like an experience coming here. The staff were also very kind and welcoming.I had the chicken pad thai. It was pretty good, definitely not the best I've had but it was still very good. They put a lot of thought into the food and small details. It was surprisingly not very pricey either. definitely will be back
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: this place has the best ambience, hands-down. The big statue to the small decorations, it truly feels like an experience coming here. The staff were also very kind and welcoming.I had the chicken pad thai. It was pretty good, definitely not the best I've had but it was still very good. They put a lot of thought into the food and small details. It was surprisingly not very pricey either. Definitely will be back.
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: One of the best!!! Ambience .. Food ..  Service  .. perfect! coming from the bay area.. we had fun!!!
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: TAO is a must when in LA. I have came here many times and am never disappointed. Service is great, I recently had my bday here. The sake bombs are fun, and be prepared to do some yelling lol the crab fried rice is SO good! The sushi selection is good, the steak is so delicious and tender. The big fortune cookie for dessert is the best. And I'm hooked on their lychee martinis.
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: One of the best places to have a date in LA! Star off by having a drink in their lounge/bar area while you wait for your table. Then you will get greeted by your server who will walk you down to your table! The decor is breathtaking, you're definitely transported somewhere in Asia. Can't express how delicious and amazing the food was! From the appetizers to the main entrees and to finish it off with an espresso and one of their famous desserts! Definitely try their sushi, freshest fish I've had but the filet mignon was on another level! So juicy and tender of course very flavorful with an Asian twist! We enjoyed our time celebrating our friend's birthday at Tao. You also get a free souvenir, iykyk  lol
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: While visiting LA this week, I decided to stop in Tao for foid & drinks. I usually visit Tao Chicago all the time when I'm home, however, my experience at Tao LA on today was AMAZING.  The overall customer experience was white glove and top tier and the ambiance was cozy & intimate!  We were seated as soon as we arrived, the food followed shortly after and everything was superb. Our server Stephanie was awesome. She was kind & extremely attentive and we even had an opportunity to meet the General Manager, Alex, which explains why the service is nothing short of immaculate. He was an absolute pleasure, making his rounds to ensure a good time was had by all and made our night even more amazing. Thank you Tao LA, we shall return!Robin
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I've experienced Tao in NYC but tonight was my first night experiencing Tao in LA. My husband made the reservation for a pre-birthday dinner. I've been wanting to experience this Tao for a minute now since I've loved the Tao in NYC & Vegas. It did not disappoint. The Chilean sea bass and the Wagyu beef was amazing as well as all the rolls our server recommended. Alexa was assisting tonight and I could not be more pleased. Five stars for Alexa. . She is an absolute asset to Tao! My husband and I were extremely happy and satisfied with her attentiveness. We will certainly be back. Thank you for a great night and a great experience.
Address: 6421 Selma Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Excellent food with great service. My fiancé had fun celebrating her birthday here. Valet parking available in the front.
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: Celebrated a special occasion here. From the outside, the restaurant looks very lowkey. When you first enter, you'll see the bar where you can order drinks. Walk a little further and then there is the library lounge. If your table isn't ready yet, you can hang out there.We got seated at the outdoor patio. To start, I had the Pineapple Express cocktail. It was pretty good. I also tried the Western Sour cocktail, which was not bad. It was kind of unfortunate though that they did not bring us any water and we had to end up asking for some.Considering this is a nice restaurant, I was expecting better customer service. But the service was just average. They initially brought our cocktails to the wrong table. Then brought our appetizers to the wrong table. Then again brought the rest of our food to the wrong table.For appetizers, I tried the Meatballs and Bigeye Tuna Tartare. Both were delicious. The meatballs were perfectly cooked and full of flavor, while the tuna was fresh.The Mushroom Pappardelle was defintely my favorite dish of the night. The pasta had a delicious truffle cream and lots of mushrooms. The Steak Frites was much less enjoyable. I requested the filet mignon to be cooked medium rare of course. The meat was not tender and kind of bland even with the sauce. At least the frites were nice and crispy and came with a yummy garlic aioli dipping sauce.Got a side of Garlic Smashed Potatoes, which I really liked. The potatoes were soft and the saffron aioli was unique in a good way.To end the meal, I had a Molten Chocolate Cake. The taste of the chocolate was very strong. Eating the cake together with the horchata ice cream was a perfect combination.Valet is your best option for parking. It only costs $10, pretty inexpensive for valet parking service in my opinion.
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: Came for my birthday dinner and had a wonderful service/time!First - the patio is beautiful, very serene especially when the sun goes down and lights come on.We were seated in the "alcove" areas that were semi private from the floor seating.Brought a tasting of a red moscato on their menu before deciding on our options.Went with the pre-fixed menu which was the perfect option (app, entree and dessert for $78/person). The salmon entree was excellent! (The chef even prepared the eggplant puree to my liking without hesistancy)The molten lava cake was to die for. So rich and good.Will definitely be back!
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: Last Thursday was my good friends 80th birthday, Brady( hostess) treated us with her beautiful smile and gave us a cabana to my request on having a great table.Shortly after that Chris who took care of us brought us a complimentary wedding wine as welcoming and took care of us the whole night. What an amazing service...The whole experience was amazing... thank you for making a memorable night for me and my good friend.
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: I'm pretty critical with places when the price is high and can set a high bar. In this case it's a 4.75. Disclosure: I read reviews where people complained about waiting a long time after being seated for food or service. Let me say that you can wait awhile BUT stop and take in the atmosphere, vibe and company you came with and that won't matter. For what you'll spend, relax and enjoy your time.Waiter was very nice, attentive and genuine. We got the Mac and Cheese, Meetball appetizer, Shrimp fettuccine and Pappadella Mushroom pasta. All the food was great. Only recommendation is the Shrimp Pasta only had 3 shrimp. The meatball appetizer SHOULD definitely be a pasta dish on the menu! That sauce is amazing! The sauces and pastas were great. The sauces were the kind you want to dip your bread in and take in every bite. (Foodies know what I'm talking about) Being Portuguese, we're VERY critical about pasta and sauce and what is "wipe the plate clean status".The bread comes with a butter and sauce on top of the butter. Texture, taste and presentation made this place I'd have special occasions at for sure.The ONLY two things that were disappointing is parking and the bathroom. Parking does not exist and is on a very busy street. Your only options are Valet at currently $10 or park a distance and walk there.The bathroom is a unisex bathroom with three sinks located to the left, 3 stalls and one bathroom at the end with a men's urinal. Twice I had to use the restroom and the seat of the toilet was up. No big deal but something I'd like to avoid having to deal with.Overall great place. Hope to see the meatball appetizer be a main dish with pasta AND will definitely come back day one it hits the menu.Note: Didn't post pictures of the food because the pics already on here match what I'm saying. Plus I have to leave a little to your own imagination.
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: Great ambiance, delicious food, perfect for drinks or full dinner! Definitely on the pricier side, but the space is gorgeous and is definitely a full experience!
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: Very disappointing. We were so pressured into having a main course meal. I wanted to start off with some appetizers and drinks but the server was so rude to us. I've never experienced something like that. Came 100 times to bother us to take plates when we clearly said NO. Nate made us feel uncomfortable. My friend was ready to leave just because of a very bad atmosphere he provided. No thank you , so unwelcoming. Never be back.
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: This is my second time at Firefly and it's been so amazing both times. They aren't only knows for having the most amazing interiors (you literally feel like you're inside and outside all in the same setting) but they also have amazing food and exceptional service. We came for my mother in laws birthday and everything was top notch. We made a reservation (I don't know how hard it is to get a walk in table since I haven't tried it) but they do offer bar seating (not sure if you can order food there) but it wouldn't be bad to wait for a table while you sip a delicious cocktail. I will attach all the pictures I took that night because we all got so much food. I highly recommend anyone looking for an intimate dinner or a celebratory feast to check out Firefly. They also can accommodate large
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: We came here for dinner to celebrate our anniversary and had one of the best dinning experiences ever.  The restaurant has valet parking that made it extremely convenient to get into the resturant.I made reservations and requested a cabana in the garden patio dinning area. We were greeted pleasantly by the hostess and she acknowledged our anniversary. She mentioned that there would be a short wait till our cabana would be ready so we took a seat at their bar. The Bartendar was engaging and took our drink order, I had my go to drink a Moscow Mule and my wife had their signature Hot in the City drink. Both cocktails were delicious and very well crafted. We also ordered the Spanish Octopus ti enjoy at the bar, it came on top of an herb salad puréed in ingredients that made the dish very flavorful.  Our table became available and the waiter was nice enough to take our unfinished appetizer to our table and also offered to take our picture while at the bar.Our waitress, Alexandra greeted us with complimentary wine and also acknowledged our anniversary. She was amazing, attentive, and made recommendations that we loved. We ordered from the prix -fixe menu, I had the Atlantic Salmon and my wife ordered the Steak Frites. Both entrees were delicious, delectable, and simply delicious.  Our waitress brought desserts with candles to continue the anniversary celebration that just made the evening extra special.This restaurant is top notch from their service, ambiance, decor, to the food being serviced. It's very apparent that Management has incorporated a culture of excellence.The ambiance here is so lively and festive with up beat music playing in the back ground loud enough to hear but not loud enough to drown out our conversation. The decor is vintage meets contemporary with a candle lite romantic garden patio with a fireplace.This was our first time here but not our last and I've already recommended Firefly to family and friends!!
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: I want to start off by saying Britney the bartender was AMAZING. She was so kind funny and just gave such a inviting aura to her. And she made us some killer drinks not too strong but not watered down they were literally perfect!!! When we arrived our table wasn't ready yet since it had rained and some tables weren't available so we sat at the bar and met the lovely Britney. She recommended us to get the French bagguette with steak frites and the mushroom pappardelle! And she did not disappoint it was one of the greatest meals I've ever had no joke. Then we got sat and our waiter Mayron was so friendly! He brought us some cute little wine samples they were delicious and he recommended the toffee cake for dessert and it was amazing!!!! He asked my boyfriend while I was in the bathroom if we were celebrating anything and my partner said "just love" and Mayron put a little sparkler on our dessert and I just thought that was soooooo cute and sweet! It's the small details like that, that really make an experience so much better so shout out to Mayron you were amazing!!! The ambiance of the place is so romantic and the customer service was top tier for me. And the food was incredible this place is an all around 10/10 for me!
Address: 11720 Ventura Blvd Studio City, CA 91604

Comment: Made a reservation to try the LA outpost if this Paris restaurant and it was divine. We did small plates do we could try more things.What we had:Crudo: get this! Light and deliciousTomato salad: loved the combo of arugula, in season tomatoes & peachLumpia: OMG! yes yes yes and the calamansi sauce was next level goodCroquettes: Very rich and deliciousMac & cheese flambé: It's a rigatoni with basic creamy mushroom sauce and flambe'd cheese. This was delicious but basic.Cocktails were yummy:On the run: so goodThe new danger: deliciousMr. T: also greatDessert:Berries & pearls panna cotta: light & deliciousPeach cobbler: Do not miss this! So goodDefinitely recommend. Fun vibe with both indoor & outdoor seating. We loved the patio. Great for date nights or group dinners.
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Went with friends here on a random Wednesday . The food was amazing. Everything we ordered and we ordered a LOT! Also everyone working was such a pleasure. I can't wait to go again. I'll take pictures next time!
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Nestled in an unassuming corner, @mrtlarestaurant was charming and had an inviting ambiance 6.5/10. While its location might not be the most prominent, the atmosphere within was certainly a highlight. The professional staff and attentive service added to the experience.However, the culinary journey took an unfortunate turn. Though each dish was nice on the eyes, the taste itself left much to be desired. The flavors seemed to fall short of the visual promise, leaving us with a sense of disappointment. While the restaurant excels in ambiance and service, the underwhelming taste of the food meant that we would not be coming back.Ambiance 1.5/2Creativity 1.5/2Presentation 1.5/2Service 1.5/2Taste .5/2
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Came here for a friend's birthday and we loved it! The ambiance and service are outstanding. We became adventurous with the menu and cocktails based upon our server's recommendations and everything was delicious. Can't wait to return!
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I came back from a work trip and thought driving up from San Diego to LA on a Friday night was worth a bit of a splurge for dinner. Mr. T was near my place and I had it down as a 'one day soon,' place, somewhere that needed a bit of an occasion to go to and not just a regular place. The minimalist interior, the neon sign it definitely didn't have that 'Tuesday night dinner' kind of vibe.I gambled that it wouldn't be packed on a Friday night and while it was busy it was very easy to get a table on their patio which was open enough to be mellow but seemed to magically block out the cement plant across the street.I wasn't driving so when the server came by I ordered their twist on an Old Fashioned, the Double Up. I've decried a 20 dollar cocktail before and I will again here-but it was tasty, that can't be denied. I think fat-washed spirits are a bit much, or I did until here, it wasn't just the flavor but the heft of it. The coconut oil was a better call then say bacon fat, which I think leaves too much residue. Look, it's 20 bucks, I still think it's a bit overpriced but I'd get it again while grumbling that it might be 2 bucks more than it should.What I'm definitely more comfortable splurging on are appetizers/small plates/shareables so the lamb kebab, chip n' dip and the croquettes were all ordered and devoured. The kebab was delicious with the lamb being right at the edge of tender/game-y. The chip and dip was like an upscale version of a basic starter but not overly so, a little tartness, a little savory. Perfect. The croquettes though, all veg, but still so rich.I figured if they could do chips and dip up why not have their burger. I have a clip of the flambe which was a nice touch but without the theatrics it was still a very well-done burger with a bonus of char and that spicy aioli that came with the fries.Our server was so great that it didn't take much convincing to get their desserts which also seemed really simply but done well. All in all it's a great place to go to, make up an occasion, just go.
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Loved the total package, food, service and atmosphere.  You definitely need reservations for this restaurant if you want a table either inside or on the beautiful patio. I made my Open Table reservation for a 8:00 Saturday dinner for 2. They do have a fairly large bar seating for walk-ins. Street parking for those who don't want valet for a fee. When we arrived we were greeted and seated right away. Love the open kitchen, bar with the loft ceilings. Alan our server introduced himself. He was excellent, friendly, informative and attentive.My friend and I ordered the craft cocktails, Temperatures Rising and the Mr. T...so good! Food is ordered family style. We had the Mr. T Lamb Kabab, Burgundy Prawns and the Bistek Tagalog. Presentation and taste of all the dishes were fantastic.Atmosphere: really great feel, trendy. Service: excellent. Food: excellent.
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Great ambiance and decor, friendly and attentive service, and most importantly delicious dishes, desserts and cocktails. What more can you ask for? Each dish was meticulously put together, perfectly seasoned and a complete delight. Our favorites were the uni, prawns, lamb kebab, short rib pastrami, crudo and peach pie. A must try in Hollywood, we will be back! Thank you for the memorable meal.(Plus: street parking in the area as well as valet.)
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Great food and service. The vibe is really chill and we liked the music a lot. It's nice that they offer valet for $10 but we were able to find street parking right in front of the restaurant. The menu was great and our waiter Alan was very attentive. Either the owner or the chef came by to ask how things were going and we appreciated that gesture.Overall really tasty food. The presentation of the food was great. I had the short ribs and my husband had the chicken and both meals were excellent.Definitely check out Mr. T's. It's a great Friday night dinner spot. You won't be disappointed.
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I only have positive comments to say about Mr.T.The food, the service and the Vibe, the music has always been excellent.This, thanks to a very well trained staff and an owner and manager who are always pay attention to the well being of each patron! The vibe is great and discreet and you feel part of an inner circle.If you haven't tried Mr. T yet you are missing out!!
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Overall a very good experience! The was really good, the mac and cheese specially was amazing!!! The crudo was good too. We got the short rib which was great by a bit sweet. The ambience and decor is nice, they also had a private room in the back with nice decor.
Address: 953 N Sycamore Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Omg why haven't I come here sooner! The food is absolutely outstanding, this is the best meal I have had in a while. Standouts were the eggplant skewers, black pepper tofu, and soft shell shrimp. But based on everything we ate, you cannot go wrong ordering from this menu. Staff was also super accommodating for our party of 5 (it's a small space), attentive, and didn't rush us at all. I will be coming back soon!
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: My husband and I found this place on yelp. The food was pretty good!! Everything was a little heavily seasoned but other than that the service was very good, and the ambiance was nice.Only thing was that service charge, but we understand, we work in the industry so nothing is worse than being stuffed on a 200 dollar bill. Only reason why I didn't give it a 5 was they heavily used this herb , maybe was a sweet basil, I'm not sure. But it seemed to find its way in every dish which kinda threw me off.
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Amazing food and atmosphere! Liz recommended some great dishes and sake choices we would have never ordered otherwise. Great service! We had the summer squash, eggplant, and shrimp! Thanks Liz!
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: We came to Ototo on a Wed night ~ 8 pm on a non-game night.  We were able to find street parking ~1.5 blocks away, an easy walk over.  We were lucky to snag the last table walking in.Both the food and sake was good!  We especially loved the chicken katsu sando and the rock shrimp okonomiyaki!  The okonomiyaki is on par or better than the ones we had in Osaka. Wings were good. We'd skip the Sakura/sashimi dish next time.Service was friendly and comfortable. The ambiance is chill and welcoming. Do check out the sake menu cover, so fun!Little fun fact:  On our recent trip to Japan, our local friend explained to us that in Japanese culture, when someone pours sake for you (probably other drinks too?), you're supposed to say ototototototo... so the person pouring knows when to stop. I wonder if that's the namesake for this place?  We had much fun saying it to each other then, and also tonight!
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: They're playing the BS game of "surcharge". Is the food good, yes. Was the service good, also yes. But scamming customers out of money with their "surcharge" is unacceptable. I was under the impression it was some kind of city fee, but after being educated, it's complete BS. I regret tipping them 30% on top of the surcharge. DO BETTER OTOTO!!!
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Came across this absolute gem in Echo Park! My group and I were new to sake, and had no idea what to expect. The sake menu was extensive, but shoutout to Fabre for her amazing service! She walked us through the different types of sake, made recommendations based on preferred taste profiles, and was very knowledgeable on each type of sake we were curious about. My favorite that was recommended by her was the Junmai Ginjo.Although there was a bit of a wait (~30 minutes for a group of 4 on a Friday night), it was worth every minute. The setting is very welcoming, whether you're on a date, or hanging out with a small group of friends. Good vibes all around. Will definitely be returning to try out new sake and food!
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I felt so honored to be invited to Ototo by a local friend of mine. Wow, this place was just amazing, and it is literally Japanese Tapas done right. As a person who loves Japanese food and the culture around it as well, this place just rings true and the food was just something that is extremely memorable.I met Courtney, one of the owners, and she was introduced by my friend who seems to frequent their bar. And that Ototo is the lilttle brother location of their main location, literally beside it, Tsubaki. Their story seems extremely interesting and it really speaks through their food.The vibe and the aesthetic of the bar is very trendy while at the same time it reminds me of when I was in Japan with their bar setting. I love how it is categorized as a sake bar and the amounts of sake they offered was just emaculate! I couldn't say no to sake!!If I remember the menu that night, which I kinda don't but I took pictures of them so I think I'll try to describe them. Their food is just delicious and off the hook though. I wish we had something like that in Vancouver. I know, this coming from the city of sushi abundence..... This is so rare.Soft Shell Shrimp: 7/10Fish paste skewers?: 8/10Tomato Flavour bombs?: 100/10 (Yes 100 out of 10, these are fucking amazing. The way they created a tomato umami condensed jelly to put right on top of the baby tomatoes, holy cow)Croquette: 8/10Chicken Katsu Sando: 10/10Was kinda sad I couldn't have their MOS burger because me and my friend decided to go for late dinner, but still, everything on the menu is just DELICIOUS!! Learning from Courtney, their menu is changed literally almost weekly to fit their sake bar drinks. Anyways, I will be coming back next time with my friend as usual, and come earlier so we can drink more and just vibe more in the area.
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Had a dream meal here - the Shaki Shaki Salad was incredible and each and every staff member was so warm and lovely to a couple of visiting country bumpkins. Awesome atmosphere too and perfect meal before a Dodger game.
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Great food and loved the umeshu selection! The place is also very cute and the staff was super friendly and helpful.
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Great food, restaurant and service feel quite pretentious. Mandatory 18% fee that is apparently not tip but is still used to pay their worker's wages. They seem to expect tip above that...Always feels wrong and greedy to put the burden on patrons to pay for wages when we are already spending so much money on the food/ supporting the business.As for food, I tried the menchi katsu, amberjack sashimi, prawns, eggplant tempura, and half dozen oysters. My favorites were the katsu, prawns, and tempura. Servings were very small (small plates) but all of these were tasty and had great textures and balance of flavors. I would probably skip the oyster because it was nothing special for the price and they serve it with a basic boring ponzu dressing.We had to wait about an hour to be seated and I think that is usually expected. A lot of people come here for the alcohol offerings and there were tables that were there for the entire 3 hours that I waited and ate. They don't make much of an effort to turn tables if you are ordering alcohol consistently but we did feel pressured to leave as soon as we stopped ordering drinks. They also started rushing our food orders out about this time too.Parking is quite difficult in this area, heads up.
Address: 1360 Allison Ave Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Ordered the chicken dish and the crispy rice salad. Both were delicious and the portions were very large. Would return.
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: We were visiting LA when we found this place. It was near our hotel so we had to try it. We got 2 A la carte with chicken, sausage, steak, papaya salad and sticky rice. They were all delicious! Chicken was very flavorful, sausage were home made and the steak was perfectly cooked. We got papaya salad with medium spice as well and it was for sure real Thai peppers coz it had a punch and a kick.  For sure for sure a must eatery to visit when you're in LA.
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Small multi tenant restaurant spot at the edge of Chinatown.  Good covered parking and authentic menu items.  Seating is limited with little to no service.  Worth trying if you've never tried this cuisine or region of food.    The lower star score is just the very very small dining area.  The drinks are ginormous and pricey but much appreciated
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: If you want to add Laotian food to your bucket list, this is THE place for you. I didn't take pictures of all the food we tried because it all came out quickly and we couldn't wait to dive into all the flavors. Yum Salut boasts a menu called Authentic Lao Refugee Food, that in itself should make you head straight over there. It is in Chinatown sharing a location with Soulo's Kitchen inside Lokels Only. Parking available in a structure as well as meter and the hours are Thurs - Sun 11:00-7:00; Mon 11:00-3:00. There are 2 registers, Yum Salut is on the right hand side. Seating inside is a little limited if you have a large party. There are also benches outside. Don't let this place slip out of your radar. A true hidden foodie gem in Los Angeles.
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Wow!  I've probably had 100 versions of Thai sausage, but this is next level! The Laotian version has more herbs and a very complex flavor. And their fish in banana leaf, I've had the Thai version but theirs has coconut milk and some different spices that make it really special.Really incredible stuff, I'm not sure I can eat at our regular Thai places any more!   This is worth the trip from anywhere. Can't wait to go back and try everything on the menu. Highly recommended.
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Best Lao Food in Los Angeles. So much flavor and complexity. If you haven't had Lao food, this place is a must try. It's so healthy with fresh vegetables and lots of herbs. I have a friend who is a picky eater and gluten-free blah blah and she's obsessed with this place. She makes me come here with her at least every other week . You get that spicy, salty, savory and sweet flavors in each bite. It's similar to Thai food but BETTER!!! half of Thailand used to be Laos until the French Colonization divided the Territory at the Mekong River. Well that's another story!  What most people don't know is Larb and Papaya Salad are Lao national dishes. I am beyond ecstatic that there is finally authentic Lao food restaurant.  I am Laotian and Thai so I can vouch for it!
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I came here with my family while visiting LA area. It was a recommendation from a friend and so glad we gave it a shot. Very authentic LAO food and it was delicious. Enjoyed the Crispy rice, Spicy Lao Sausage, and the Sweet Sticky rice with Mango. He also had this side chili paste that was YUM and I sopped it up with my sticky rice. SO GOOD! Chef Tip touched our table. He was super nice and was very accommodating. He shares this pop up kitchen with a soulfood place  but hope he gets his own space soon. If you're looking for a new spot to check out and you're in the area, check this place out!
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I ate here with my daughter a couple of weeks ago. The food is gorgeously presented and delicious. Going back soon with a bigger party. The chef is on his way to super stardo.
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I came here on a Sunday around 12:30 and I just first want to say that this place is delicious!! It's located in a community kitchen so there's actually two restaurants located here (Laotian and Soul!). There's inside seating but there's not a lot of tables, especially if you have a large group. Luckily my group of 10 came before the lunch crowd so we were able to snag some tables. Both restaurants located in this shop seem to be super popular!The service was amazing and our food came out pretty quickly. The portions are pretty generous and the grilled steak is absolutely amazing. Their Lao crack sauce (the orange one) is a little spicy but so tasty. The other sauce was more on the bitter side so I wasn't a huge fan of it. Their sticky rice came in a huge portion, however, it's more crispy than sticky. 10/10 would recommend!!
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Sunday brunch at 11 am- Lao fried sausage platter, lao fish lettuce wrapService: direct order from the cashier, friendly staffAmbiance: casual, little loud because of the tv and indoor musicPrice: okFood quality:  the fried sausage was pretty good, moist  but not too dry , the shrimp paste was outstanding and unique, the Lao fish was terrify, loved the fish  texture and the fluffiestRemarks: indoor parking lot , both indoor and outdoor seatings were availableWill come back  to try other dishes. Highly recommend
Address: 635 N Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I liked the atmosphere, very cozy. The food was also very good, although a little overpriced. The service was good but it was a bit hard to call the waiter over.
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Best of best!!!! I thought of going back the next day. I shall revisit soon. The portion was so big, too
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The food was so gooood!!!It is also good with spicy buckwheat noodles!Add cheese!! :)
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: A unique dining experience in the heart of ktown, this classic Korean dish I haven't been able to find anywhere else but here specializes in it so we had to try it. This place serves by the portion, and their portions are pretty well measured. The chicken was very flavorful and all the vegetables were cooked well. The meal came with lots of sides that added a great touch! The fried rice at the end was a bit of a let down as they didn't let us cook the rice into the rest of the sauce. Overall, a unique experience that is definitely worth going to if you are with a large group of friends! A social meal for the ages
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: overpriced. bad service. server/manager was literally yelling at her workers in front of all the customers. would not come to this restaurant again.
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: TLDR: HORRIBLE service for overpriced average food.The seasoning for the dakgalbi was okay-tasting but the texture of it was soft and tender! Given the price, they definitely skimp out on the amount of chicken and rice cake they can give you. Taste-wise I don't think I would go here again though, even if I'm craving dakgalbi. It was just so average.I'm mostly writing this because of the service and ambiance. Probably one of the most UNCOMFORTABLE dining experiences I've ever had. I walk in and the waitress frowns and looks unwilling to seat me while shes staring at her watch. (I got there more than an hour before closing)She tells me the only item available on the entire menu was the dakgalbi. She also forgot about the cheese add-on, is wearing AirPods so you can't get her attention. When we first ordered, we asked for the fried rice you can get at the end  and she never brought it, and upon asking her she says sorry she forgot and she can't do that for us anymore...She was also yelling at her workers, straight up yelling for A LONG TIME and hitting them with rags. And kept on sighing so loudly and yelling "so annoyed" in Korean. In front of all of the customers.
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Really satisfying Ktown joint that's another winner. I can't speak to their bbq chicken dishes, since they're a minimum of two orders, and my wife and I each wanted to try a different dish. But the kimchi fried rice was the best I've ever had of it - it chars as it sits at the table, and has interesting flavors, including smoke, seaweed, and sweet pieces of kimchi. And the homemade dumpling soup was so comforting, where the dumplings were the star and not just something you could buy in Cali Market and drop them in. Portions were enormous, giving us enough for leftovers and making the meal well worth it. Highly recommended.
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Today (8/12/2023), I wanted to have dakgalbi with my friends for dinner, so we decided to visit this place which was a terrible mistake.There was no wait since it was after dinner time. (Around 9pm ish). There were so many empty tables.As soon as we entered, we asked for a table for 6 people to this server lady and she said we should take the table where only 4 people can fit in.So we asked her if we can sit at the bigger table since it was too small, she said no and this table for 4 would fit perfectly for 6 (it was NOT AT ALL!!! And there were only 4 chairs with no more space to place more chairs)The smaller table that she wanted us to sit was at the corner of the restaurant which was closer for her to serve (seemed like she didn't really want to move that much and if we had the bigger table, she needed to walk more i guess/ other customers were sitting at the same row) so we appealed again if it would be okay to sit at the longer table which about 8 people can fit and she had those rolling eyes and said "yeah- you can sit over there if you want to" with sarcastic voice and face.Seriously? It only seemed like she was too lazy to serve. If those bigger tables were reserved or there was a wait behind us, we would have understood, but in this situation, her laziness is the only explanation.Everyone in my group got so offended so we decided to leave. Thank you lady! Because of your attitude, we don't want to here never ever again!!!
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Clean, nice ambience, friendly, delicious food = perfect for our korean friend's bday!!
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Best dakgalbi in ktown! It's 28.99 per personYou can order more than 2 people. No waiting on Friday night :)
Address: 3601 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Ryann is the absolute best. Loved the mimosas and brunch. I will definitely be back!!
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Genuinely one of my favorite restaurants in LA. The food is so good and I love that it's small plates so you can share and try a bunch of things. They have a great drink menu and the service has always been great. Plus the location is so cute and central.
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Through the cute little archway you'll find a secret garden that opens up. You'll want to go with a few people and order lots of plates so you can share and get a variety of things to try.
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Bacari is delicious and such a cute wine bar. Perfect for date nights or cocktails or dinner and is hip and lowkey. I especially love how hidden the place is - if you walk by you might miss them! The bread is also to die for honestly everything is tasty. Highly recommend!!!! Ambience and food is A+!
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: honestly very mid and expensive food. also didn't like sitting inside bc it's sooo loud and u have to YELL in order for anyone at ur table to hear you. the parking situation is pretty much valet only bc the street parking in the residential area is very finicky (only free at certain times).service was great, but the food was just.... ok. i know it's tapas and meant to be small bites to share but my god the portion sizes were so tiny and priced so high idk i can't justify coming back.. the best thing were the fries and that's ... honestly quite sad. the pizzas were just okay and the scallop dish literally only came with 3 small scallops i was so boggled!! i literally stopped taking pics of the food cuz it was so mid. the cauliflower dish was big but so intense in flavor and kinda not in a good way.i only gave 2 stars bc the service was good. the food was very forgettable and expensive for what it is and i will not be back unfortunately :~/
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: The food the was really good and the audience is so so so great! Got the french toast and it was so'My server is literally the BEST SERVER IVE EVER HAD!!!!Daniela was so attentive and just made us feel so atHome and well taken care of. If u ever go please ask for her or to be seated w her she made our brunch so special
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Worst ever!!!!!!!!Literally waited from 6:20 pm till 7:20 pm only to be told the order was not sent. Then we were told at 7:30 that the order wasn't inputted the second time.LOL RIDICULOUS!Who does that?!Get your staff in order.Thanks.
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Lovely servers. I brought a cake for a friends birthday and they happily stored it before our table arrived then brought it out with a huge sparkler on top then cut and served it to everyone. No extra charge.Food is delicious and easily shareable. I love the falafel and kale salad. Drinks are also delicious.Can't go wrong! Great for big groups- no prefix menu needed.
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: I love this place! Their mushroom pizza is amazing and a must try. Nice place for a first date.
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Is there a way to give half a star?This is my 2nd trip to this location.The first time we were there for 1 hour and 30 min.  For dinner.This is all tapas style and normally fast eating.Unfortunately this trip was 2 almost 3 hours.  This was after brunch and before dinner.The food was good the drinks were great.  But the service negated all of the good things.I won't be back to this location.
Address: 8030 3/4 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Always reliable amazing food and the staff is friendly and the drinks are so good!! Will come again
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing service and amazing food but only thing is there so many flys when eating maybe something to keep them away does get in way of eating conformity!!
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Walking into Home feels like a breath of fresh air, and I don't just say this because of the outdoor seating. Service here is superior from the moment valet greets you to the moment you walk out.The food is great, fresh, and feels very homey. I had the pancakes, Turkey bacon, fruit, and home fries. To drink I had a peach mimosa. Though I couldn't taste much of the peach given the subtlety of that flavor, it was delicious.Home is a great place for breakfast or brunch as a solo diner, for a date, or for a girls day. The location is in the heart of Los feliz. You can take a stroll and pop in the neighboring shops or simply pull up to valet and drive off when you're done.
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: TLDR: 2 stars for service; 4 stars for foodThis 3 star review is targeted at their bar set up. Dropped by for brunch on Labor Day weekend around 11am for a party of two. Parking is strictly street parking in the area so give yourself time to circle around the neighborhood. As I put my name down on the list and was quoted ~30 min wait I was also advised that the bar area was open with no wait. My friend and I walked into the bar and saw some high top tables open. We sat on one after confirming with a waiter walking by that those too were considered the "bar area". We could see the bartenders making drinks and assumed we would be given menus shortly.About 10 mins passed and nobody had approached us. Behind us was another couple and we leaned over and asked if they had ordered at the bar since they had menus and we weren't sure if that was the expectation. They told us they had been waiting for 20 mins and nobody had come up to them either. They were given menus when they first sat down and told someone would come up to them. They had even walked up to the bar and asked if they needed to put their order there and they were told that again someone would come up to them.That nice couple offered their menus and all four of us continued to wait. At this point it's been 20 mins for us and probably 30 mins for them and despite waiters walking back and forth nobody stopped to check in on us. At this point the other couple goes up to the bar and they let them put in an order there (which if you ask me they should have let them do that when they first asked). At this point I get a text my table will be ready in 5 mins and to confirm I'm still there. The couple tells us that we should just go up to the bar and I tell them we waited long enough that our table was now ready - so much for no wait time at the bar! We left the couple inside the bar area with no food or even water offered to them!!My friend and I were taken to a table in their patio which is really cute and shaded.
