We ordered the French toast and the green chilaquiles with avocado and medium easy eggs to split. I also got an iced latte.The food was awesome which only makes the whole experience so disappointing. Your service can really tank what was a really tasty meal. The French toast was super fluffy and not too sweet. The berries on the French toast were very fresh and the syrup was warm.The chilaquiles were incredible. I would definitely get these again - they had a nice kick and there was a perfect amount of sauce so the chips weren't soggy. My latte was also very good - it wasn't bitter.Our server was very pleasant and the service once we were at the table was very fast and efficient. Out the door about $50 for both of us which is a great price for food in this part of town.Overall, I wouldn't recommend the bar area if it truly is always this dysfunctional. I was genuinely shocked at how horrible that whole bar experience was and I felt terrible for the other couple who didn't put their name down for a table and were just waiting for service that never came. Just wait for the table if it's always this bad because the food is honestly worth it!
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Saturday 8/9-Wife and I stopped here prior to a show at the Greek theatre.  Food and ambiance were fine but I/ we got really poor service.  The server took our order, got us drinks, noticed that it was taking a bit and went to check on it and assured it'd be at our table shortly.  Once the food was delivered he never came back.  I normally order a beer while I wait and one with my meal.  Well- I had to eat my meal with water as he served people around us but I could not flag him down.  "Sir! Excuse me!" waving ...he didn't even look our way.  While getting my water refilled, I ask the bus-person (busboy sounds kinda rude to me) if I could order a beer from him b/c the server wouldn't come.  He said he'd tell him.  Well the server brought me a beer when I was finished eating.  I told him, "I don't need it now, I wanted it with while I was eating-could I just have the check".  Now my wife thinks I'm being rude b/c I didn't conceal my frustration well enough and she, much kinder than me, is getting mad at me.  Thanks! just what I needed before going to a comedy show.  Anyway, to his credit-the bartender brought the beer back to our table and offered it w/o charge- again, I told him I wanted it with my meal and we had to make it to a show.  It was a little  mistake or oversight on the server's part, but it had a real negative affect on my experience.
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The food was amazing! Their calamari was delicious and we all wanted more! And the plate I got I forgot the name but I was soo good!
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Terrible service throughout the entire staff. Once we entered we were immediately brushed off and told we could seat anywhere, as we watched other guests be escorted properly to tables. Our 1st waitress kept rushing us to order, and didn't accommodate our needs after we placed our order. She then gave our table to another waitress. I noticed how different we were treated as African American customers versus how customers of other ethnicities were treated. I wouldn't recommend this restaurant to anyone. I suggest a course of action in educating the staff on diversity and inclusion.
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great service and nice ambiance. I took my mom for her Birthday, she's 78 and they were very accommodating. The French toast was amazing will go again.
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: We hit this place before going to the Greek Theater and it was great. The outdoor ambiance is really cool and they have lots of comfort food options. The drinks are also pretty good.
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Awesome vibes. Their food was decent, drinks were better (get the banana hammock!) Staff treated us well and made us feel at *home*
Address: 1760 Hillhurst Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I'd probably only go back for the hooka, food was basic, and drinks weren't good at all. Waitresses were so sweet and kind tho, very understanding and didn't make us pay for what we didn't like which was almost everything
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: If a half star was available, it would be the appropriate rating. We came for the paint and sip, which turned out to be a poor experience. The instructor asked us to wait outside and started 30 minutes LATER than the original start time. The end product by the "instructor" looked absolutely NOTHING like the actual photo she referenced. The price was way above asking for this terrible quality of an experience. I would NOT recommend this paint and sip experience or establishment. The health rating of this establishment is also a B!! The pictures online do not look like the actual place. This was a scam.
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Can y'all imagine them playing Nav whole albums all night long... there's no vibe. Food is ok. Hookah is overpriced.
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I love it here Sunday brunch is chill and always a vibe.   Being from LA i like a low key vibe
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Definitely not the rooftop bar I was expecting. It's just a restaurant with an outdoor patio in a strip mall in a shady part of Hollywierd! But despite the not-so-ideal location, the staff and crowd were awesome and the unexpected comedy show was actually really super hilarious!!! And the mojitos were strong and sweet!
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Will be giving this one star as they are racist and unfair to people of ALL nationalities, In favor of foreign workers you cannot submit nor be considered for employment here if you don't NOT speak SPANISH, and this is why I will be reporting to labor agencies and anything else I can do make sure that EQUAL OPPORTUNITY employers stand by the word.
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I had the most wonderful experience with Gia, the painting class instructor at Sunset Rooftop! I was pretty clueless about painting and lacked confidence, but Gia's patience and positivity made me feel right at home. She encouraged me every step of the way and helped me discover my artistic side. I can't believe how much progress I made under her guidance. I'm definitely going to recommend the Sip and Paint with Gia to all my friends because she made me feel so good about painting! Thank you, Gia!
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The wait to be seated was ridiculous! No host/hostess there to greet you. I would give negative stars if possible. We watched servers walking back and forth ignoring us. No one spoke or made eye contact. Needless to say, I won't be going back.
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: My friends have been here before, and recommended it. However when we arrived it was clear that the ambience was much different than the photos. We didn't end up eating there so I can't review the food, and the workers were very pleasant, but the vibe of this place is definitely like dive bar and hookah, not really what the pictures show. It would be awesome to hang out with some friends and smoke some hookah, but if you're gonna sit on the patio you kind of can't avoid the smoke, which is the main reason we left.
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: These racist broke goes really thought we wasn't gonna pay for our hookah & mad me pay before we left. All because me & my friend went outside twice. We literally still had our other friend at the table. The white lady with blue eyes literally looked like she was about to panic all because we stepped outside which we are allowed to do. I'll be damned if I spend money at a place where they think ima going to not pay for something when I literally make more than the staff out together. Fuck that yt b* & this place. Hookah is subpar anyways
Address: 6099 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was great!!get the shrimp pasta......oh and the drinks were good too...not to strong but very goof
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: It's not the best food ever. I wouldn't crave it or go back. I think it's more of a vibe and take pics of the patron tower vs actually enjoying GOOD quality food. (Social media is taking over, the bar for food quality has gone down significantly, it's now more about vibes and videos)Also they charge a 18% service charge for everyone (per there menu it's applied usually for a party of 5 or more, or for the patron tower (neither applied to us)). Our waitress did not say anything until she gave us the bill. At that time (end of august) it wasn't written anywhere. When we asked her why not? She said "they just started". 2 stars for that alone! Communication is key, especially when it comes down to "new unwritten rules" that make a difference on what you pay. This is something that should have been updated in writing prior to the start.Service fees are taking over. Doesn't even make sense that's there's a service fee for the patron tower. And of course employers can do as they please w service fees so you're still expected to tip bc in some places the owners pocket the service fee. It's not split amongst the employees. (Can't speak for this place just putting it out there that it's not considered a tip)
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The staff and food were great. Not to mention there was awesome music be played by some killer DJs. They have some cool specialty mix drinks as well. I recommend the wings. The Thai Chili wings tasted great.  I will definitely be back.
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Still very consistent. I started ordering shots because the drinks were weak a little tonight. Great spot to meet people and get some good bar food
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Very cute venue. Spacious with cute decor. Food is good, love the Acai Bowl. Bar is huge and their is a nice size overflow room. I see them doing great things soon!
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: One star because I have no choice. Horrible service. Was told that if my food was given to wrong guest there is nothing they can do about it which is complete non sense. Ladies are rude. Horrible. Will not recommend!!!
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Enjoyed the margarita tower and the nachos were absolutely delicious! We visited on a night where they were showing a boxing match and it was packed but the food came out fast. The waitress was also very nice. The ambiance was great, they played music, which created a good vibe.
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Went in on a Friday night. Great music, mostly r&b and hip hop that night. i always love it when the DJ looks like they're having fun. Strong drinks, clean, great service. Our cheesesticks were delicious. Stay away from the cheese steak fries. They look yummy but those tiny fries get cold fast! We asked for them to be replaced and the replacement ones were also cold within 2 minutes of being dropped onto our table. Either way, appreciate the effort!! Super fun night!
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Had a great time, visiting from Chicago and I highly recommend. Valet accept cash, Venmo and cash app.Food was prepared and served hot and quantity was great. Staff was amazing and music was a good R& B vibe.....
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I give the margarita tree 4 stars but the food was very mediocre for the price. I had chicken and waffle sliders and the waffles were soft and didn't taste fresh. Service needed work but it wasn't the worst service we had! We have tons of friends and family that travel and ask both me and my husband for recommendations. This won't be one of our recommendations unfortunately.
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The best happy hour deals I've found in LA yet!  & food is very seasoned & delicious!!
Address: 1562 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Ugh, the food in general was so good I miss this place. It's one of the best marinated crab I ever had. They bring the crabs all the way from Korea and put a lot of care to ensure that the crabs remain fresh and are marinated just right. It can get a bit pricy, but it's worth it. Will def come back here if I visit LA.
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food overall is decent...we come here quite often.  As the original place we wanted to go was closed.   Raw crab ($40each...with order 3 $120)was good...but not like I remember from the last time.  Pork belly wasn't bad...it's a bit overpriced at $69.99.I guess when you're craving for things that you can't get you'll pay for it right?The food over was tasty we also had the crab stew.Service were very nice and fast...they were very accommodating as we had kids that didn't eat what we had.  They were nice to let us bring in a dish for the kiddos.Ambiance:  it's a total mom and pop shop so don't except anything fancy.  But the staff was super nice and attentive.
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Best raw marinated crab I've ever had in my life. My friend and I ordered the B combo and 2 extra soy sauce marinated crabs and every bite was literal heaven. Definitely my favorite spot and I recommend to everyone! The owners were so incredibly kind as well! They provided bibs and gloves and kept coming to check up on us. They also made us fried rice at the end which was SO good! The food and service of this place was absolutely perfect and I can't wait to go again!
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Our first time trying korean raw crabs. The food was amazingly fresh. Customer service was excellent. They were super nice and sweet. Will definitely be back.
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: A little surprised about how expensive the soy marinated crab but it was definitely fresh! The spicy marinated crab was also amazing! The service was amazing and they explained how everything works. The spicy stew we got was so yummy it was so different and special that I've never tasted it from anywhere else before. The restaurant itself was clean and easy to find with lots of street parking. Id definitely visit if you're craving marinated crabs!
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: (Revised) We had a terrible experience at Soban (Rude server), so we left & found this place. We called ahead and they were able to prepare a table for us (8ppl) & only 7 minutes away.Upon entering, and throughout the whole time, the elderly couple and server were so welcoming and warm. They interacted with us and were very helpful. They answered questions we had and accommodated our substitution request. (Nothing big, just asked if we could have 2 spice crabs in the combo)Pancakes are thinner than usual but yummy. Texture is crispy and not soggy and great flavor. Definitely could have eaten 2 of them. Lol!Food was delicious. Everything we ordered felt so wholesome and made with love. Thank you for the best experience and delicious food. Will definitely come visit again when we are back in town.
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Decided to check out Rich Crab since Master Ha's is closed on Sundays.It was my first time trying raw crab and I don't know how I feel about it but I don't want to discredit the cuisine just cause I'm indifferent.Their kimchi pancake was bomb! Smaller than expected but it was really good. Not like your typical kimchi pancake that's overly thick and soggy.The banchan was 10/10. Really enjoyed just eating the banchan with rice. That's how good it was.Note: their combos only include 1 crab of each, regardless of the size you choose. The only difference between the combo is the soup size. Which is disappointing because how are 5 people supposed to share 1 crab.I'd want to try master Ha's next to see how it compares.
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I'm not a crab connoisseur so maybe take my review with a grain of salt. First off, I love seafood and I love to eat crab but to caveat, I've never had a general liking for the crab/shrimp heads - and eating raw crab was fairly similar to that delicacy.This was my first time eating raw crab. I wasn't sure what to expect so I came in with zero expectations, but I also walked out unsure of how I felt about the meal.I came here with a party of 4. Since it was our first time, we tried the combo so that we can try both of the different flavors. We ordered a size S combo A for $119. Note that the different sizes of combo refers to the stew size. Everything else comes as 1 count.The service was great. Food came out SO fast, it literally felt like we just waited for 5 mins. As soon as it came out, we dug in. I want to say I did enjoy the soy sauce marinated crab but at the same time also wasn't sure if I liked the flavors. The spicy marinated crab was marinated VERY well and spicy too! Loved that there was definitely a hot kick to it. You forsure need to work to eat this though and unfortunately, I'm not a huge fan of peeling crab/shrimp and really digging deep to find gold. Despite all that, it tasted super fresh!The banchan was exceptionally good, and also refillable. Kimchi was great but honestly felt like I got jipped. It's so thin and hardly had any kimchi pieces - it was like eating kimchi paper, not pancake. It was also smaller than what I expected. I've had better kimchi pancakes.We ordered the spicy crab stew for our stew option. Spicy? No. Crabby? Yes. It had a very good depth of flavor in terms of crab. I wish there was more garneses/veggies but the crab pretty much filled up the pot. I didn't get to eat the crab from the pot but I was told by my boyfriend's parents that it wasn't fresh.To be completely honest, I left feeling so unsatisfied. It wasn't that I wasn't full but I think I needed something that tasted more satisfying. I think this delicacy is something everyone should try but I wouldn't consider this a meal I'd crave and want to eat for dinner. To try and experience different types of cultural food? Definitely. But not something I can expect to eat every month. Also, I felt it was super pricey for what it was even though I know these crabs are imported. I'd prefer to eat omakase sashimi for the price.Update: After reading some reviews, I found out from other yelpers that ordering the combo, the crabs would be significantly smaller than ordering a la carte. The waitress failed to mention that to us...which now makes me realize that portioning sizes like this is incredibly unfair to the customer AND super misleading. Not to mention that most people who order combos expect to have a fair ratio amongst the number of people that the menu stated to feed. If your size M combo is supposed to feed 3, give more ratio of crabs rather than your stew, especially if you know people come to your restaurant to specifically try your raw crab.Warning: Any size combo, whether S, M, or L, all combos only comes with 1 small crab per flavor. That's bogus and definitely not worth the price. Had I known, I would've just ordered a la carte. DON'T ORDER THE COMBO.
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This restaurant offers a delightful culinary experience, particularly when it comes to their generous and flavorful crab dishes. While the prices may be higher compared to Crab House, the quality surpasses that of Mr. Ha. The convenience of valet parking at a cost of $3 adds to the overall ease of dining here.One of the highlights was the speedy service, ensuring that the food was promptly brought to the table. In addition to the exceptional crab, the potato pancake was another pleasant surprise, with its satisfying taste and texture.Overall, I found the dining experience to be quite enjoyable, with no complaints to speak of. The combination of delicious food, efficient service, and appealing offerings like the potato pancake makes this restaurant a notable choice for those seeking a satisfying seafood meal.
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Came here since we have been looking for a new raw crab place and it was a hit for my party! We walked in as a party of 5 on Sunday at 845. The old couple were so nice and truly made the experience. We got combo B and a small bossam which was perfect for our group. The crab was perfectly seasoned and not too salty. The soup was an unexpected hit and was a nice ending to our meal. Ending it with a 5/5 definitely coming back
Address: 4253 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90020

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: Luv this place... ambiance is cute... foods r reasonable and delish and service too.. ..the appetizers r very good well be back for more
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: We came on a weekend evening for my birthday. We shared the lemongrass chicken salad rolls appetizer, chicken crepe, and chicken curry (not pictured). I got the Thai ice coffee and my cousin got the Thai ice tea. Service was great. They don't do anything special for your birthday though, so keep that in mind if that's important to youEverything was incredible and reasonably priced. Parking is okay, they offer valet for the small lot behind the restaurant. We opted for street parking and didn't have trouble finding it in the area.
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: This place is very delicious... the service was amazing as well and Tasha was a great server. There was a short wait and I loved the vibe. Will definitely come back
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: 8/03/2023I had chicken phoEgg rollsShrimp spring rollsThis place was nice and very clean.
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: FoodSpicy chicken wings was amazing. Takes about 20 minutes to make, right amount of flavor with sauceMango sunrise - this was a complete miss, very aesthetic but the mango is mango compote from a can. Didn't taste like mango at all.
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: Good food, fair price.  I am vegan so can only comment on vegan choices, but tasty. I had the summer rolls and a stir fry.
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: I love Sister's Cafe! It's a go-to spot when I want comforting Vietnamese food. My favorites are their pork belly banh mi and the tofu bun noodles.
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: Found this place by accident and now I'm in love! Large portions of Delicious food! Worth traveling to! Writing this review makes me want to get in my car and go right now!!
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: DISGUSTING FOOD. The rice was cold, the chicken was cold, the sunny side up egg was cold, YET the salad was lukewarm.HORRIBLE service, and it was not busy.
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Sisters Cafe Vietnamese Asian Fusions
Comment: Delicious Vietnamese food, yummy crepes, banh mi, egg rolls, shrimp spring rolls and hot sizzling seafood plate- we all delicious . Service, super friendly. Oh Vietnamese coffee is awesome
Address: 5910A W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I was quite disappointed in the brunch service. First during brunch it is counter service, which you order at a cashier before getting a number and finding a seat.  Well after getting part of my order I was informed they did not have the Stout Pancakes, which I had ordered. Granted it was not on the menu but after I heard the couple in front of me  successfully order them I ordered them as well. Not sure why they didn't address this with me when they brought our the first part of my order, the bacon and bread with butter.When they were looking into the posssible price adjustment for the French toast vs the pancakes they tried to tell me the French toast was more expensive (per their computer) at $24 than the pancakes at $17 and saying they wouldn't charge me the up charge. Well the French Toast on the menu is actually listed as $14. I'm glad I had pics of the menu and a copy of my original e-receipt and after showing it to them they credited me the difference. Weird thing is when they gave me the corrected receipt the French toast rang up as $14. Is it dishonesty or just an honest mistake?The food was good but not amazing.  At the price point for brunch ($50 after tax & tip), it should have been table service with better service over all. Little things like a refill of water you have to get yourself from a community pitcher.  Also to note there is an additional 5% service charge on the bill aside from the gratuity.If this is the service for brunch I can't fathom what it would be like for dinner. I don't plan to return & I regret not going to Jose Andres' restaurant across the street from The Broad for brunch instead.
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I don't even like to write reviews. But I felt the need to let people know why I visit Otium every 6-8 weeks.First of all the environment is lively; you're encouraged to cut through the kitchen to use the restroom to feel the energy and love all your food is being made with.As every trip it's mandatory to start with the Naan and my two favorite dips (since they retired the Chicken Au Jus) are the truffle butter and the bone marrow emulsion.We had the market cucumber salad that looked like a piece of artwork. Followed by (in season) Street Corn Agnolotti that makes you feel like you were on stage of the final table.Some new dishes this time around for me were the Marinated Trị Tip which was divine. And the star for me tonight was the Roasted Chicken over potatoes. Easily one of the best dishes I've had.
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I have now been here probably 8 times now and I'm never disappointed it's my go to when I'm down town everything taste amazing !! U will not be disappointed and everyone is very nice always
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Just had dinner at the Otium for the first time and it was an amazing experience. The restaurant features a very rustic and cozy industrial look and I personally loved the lighting of the place. The fireplace in the waiting area before you get seated was a nice touch as well.The food was great as well but there were definitely certain items on the menu that were better than others. For example, I personally wouldn't recommend the duck neck appetizer which we ordered. There was barely any meat on it and it was subpar overall. I would however highly recommend the beef tartare, and lightly recommend the soft shell shrimp as it was good but didn't live up to my expectations. I would say overall the appetizer menu could be a bit better.As for the main items, the gnocchi was phenomenal and some of the best we've had and the duck breast was very hearty and delicious. We have no complaints there.The drinks we had were good, I would recommend the Otium and more so the teatime gimlet if you want more of a refreshing drink.The service was where the Otium really shined. Between the pacing of the appetizers and entrees coming out, the attentiveness of our wonderful waiter who constantly switched out our dirty plates and provided warm towel wipes, and the overall care from staff I was deeply impressed. The staff here truly sets the example of an ideal dining experience.Food: 8/10Service 10/10Ambiance: 9/10Drinks: 8/10Recommendation?Highly recommended
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: After passing this restaurant twice a day on my way to and from the new Grand Ave/Arts A line metro stop, I finally got to eat here for lunch with some coworkers. The ambience is really nice and modern. The kitchen is wide open so you can see everything being prepared. The fridges have glass doors so you can see the meats hanging in there. The fresh focaccia and desserts are in a display counter by the register. The bar area has fresh ingredients all lined up. Normally you would grab a menu and order at the register before sitting, however they let us sit and took our order at the table.   I opted for the burger. Note that it comes diced pickled peppers which give it a really nice subtle kick...not spicy at all for those sensitive to spicy foods.  This was a really solid burger. I  would order it again. The fries however were not that impressive...kinda basic. I expected more from a $26 burger. Other than that, I got to try one of their 3 freshly baked foccacia breads. The potato focaccia was equally as amazing as the burger. Note that there are no reservations for lunch.
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Went there for my fiends 40th birthday, we ended up having 2 more people then planned, and coming from someone that works in hospitality that could be a problem when busy. They made the accommodation easy. The spinach Bucatini ,dry aged beef  was amazing as well as everything else we had.The restaurant was beautiful as well just a all around great experience. The server was very knowledgeable and fast. All around great experience.
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Otium is one of my favorite restaurants in LA. Great quality cooking, fresh ingredients, upscale ambiance, and knowledgeable/friendly servers. It's located in a nicer area of DTLA, right next to the Broad and Walt Disney Concert Hall. Parking is a breeze and I feel safe walking around after dinner, unlike many LA restaurants these days.The Naan bread is to die for and a must order. Our favorite pairing is easily the caviar, but when we're not splurging, the chicken liver mousse is our go to.Every entree we've ordered has been delicious and plenty for 2 to share, but I'm a steak guy so the ribeye takes the crown here.Their pastas are also great, but I've found them to be very heavy, and could probably stand as an entree on their own if you're a lighter eater.Some of their dishes are rather small for the price, like the duck croquet (pictured). The quality and flavors are there, but small portions make some of their pricing not add up.Overall, Otium is a great choice in DTLA for a date night splurge!
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: The food here is fine dining and the price is really not bad at all considering the artistry going into the food. I normally don't order chicken when I go to a restaurant but this chicken was incredible. Excellent ambiance and service.
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Food was OK, but vastly overpriced. Not interesting enough for a return visit.Food: 3/5  |  Service: 3/5  |  Atmosphere: 3/5
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Otium in DTLA serves delicious food, but it comes at a price. The high prices may not suit everyone's budget. Also, parking can be a hassle; you'll need to find a spot near a metro station and walk to the restaurant.The service was good
Address: 222 S Hope St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: We were looking for a new Thai restaurant and decided to give this spot a try. The food tasted really good but the prices didn't quite match up. For example, we started with steamed shrimp dumplings that were $11. We received 7 tiny shrimp dumplings... like one bite and it's gone. Yes, it tasted good but not $11 worthy. Maybe $7? Even the edamame appetizer was $10.Our main dishes were also tasty but the prices were off again. $16 for a plate of stir-fry veggies and shrimp without rice. The Kra Pow was around $13 for a smaller portion with rice.Did the prices break the bank? Absolutely not. However, I feel as though the food and prices did not match up. I'm more than happy to pay a little more for a dish that is out of this world... even if the portion were small.The service was awesome. The kindest staff with constant smiles on their faces. The 4 stars are for them. Thank you for making our afternoon a bit brighter.Tips:- Plenty of street parking (meter free and with meters)- Small lot in the back (1st hour is free, $5 after)- Entrance from the back lot and street side- Clean restrooms
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Five stars for service and the kindness everyone showed, specially Chris. I arrived a bit late (about 30 mins before closing) and I was feeling bad about it. I was also starving. I had quite the day and hadn't eaten for over 12 hours at that point. I ordered a vegetarian tom kha and fresh spring rolls. My brain was only thinking about "finally something to eat", but Chris kindly reminded me I could add veggies and other veg-friendly protein to my food. When the bill came, they were already closed and starting to clean, but they came to let me know it was okay to take my time. That was very generous of them because I have been in restaurants that are pretty much just kicking you out when they're close to closing time. In any case, the food is good, but to me, it was the service what has made this place worth visiting again.
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: For the price the food is good.  I don't like sweet food, but oh well.  Some thai reasturants go more on the seeet side.
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The driest chicken curry I've ever had... I've bought store prepared chicken curry before and it wasn't this dry. Do not recommend them for curry.
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Fresh, amazing drunken noodles, the sticky mango rice was a must have! We liked the green curry, we will try another kind next time!
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Celebrated my birthday with an intimate dinner at this spot. I loved the set up with the meaning explained above us up towards the ceiling. We all ordered the duck curry, yellow curry, pad see ewe, shrimp spring rolls, and Rangoon. Food was full of flavor and happy to say we took leftovers home. Hit the spot and not bad prices ($121) for a group of 5 (included gratuity). I will definitely return! Service was nice and quick. When you enter it immediately makes your mouth water. The one thing I didn't get to try was the Mango Sticky Rice. Although my visit was highly satisfying.
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Very good service, polite and considerate. The food is flavorful, delicious, presented well and taste great. The look of the restaurant is nothing special but it is in a great location far enough from the tourist and close enough to everything where you can Uber, walk, and yes find parking!!John Legend among others dined here. It was good enough for them and good dough for me. I highly recommend.
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Excellent food.  Had their Hoy-ka noodles and boat noodles to go. They out the noodles in a separate container from the broth so the noodles kept their texture. Both dishes are unique compared to other a Thai restaurants; both were delicious.  I want to go back and try the more common dishes to compare. Service was fast and polite despite being pretty busy.
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: There was surprisingly so many good Thai restaurants to choose from on Yelp in Hollywood, but we wanted to try this one since it seemed like the highest rating one! There luckily is a small parking lot in the back and we managed to park there. We entered the restaurant from the parking lot and was surprised how modern and cute this place was! There were also plenty of seats available so we were seated rather quickly.We ordered a panang curry with chicken, boat noodles, and a side of crispy pork. I was a bit disappointed with my curry because it seemed a lot more coconut heavy based? It looked very white and milky than I usually have at other places, so I wish I could taste the curry spice more. I wish I got beef instead of chicken too because the chicken tasted kind of cheap? The boat noodles were pretty good, the broth was heavier than I thought but the flavor was nice. The beef was also better as well. The side of crispy pork was also pretty nice and crunchy, although, some pieces tasted like they were cooked for too long that it was too hard lol. The thai tea here was also a bit too sweet, but still pretty okay.The service here was good! The servers here were attentive and pretty nice.
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Cute Thai spot in Hollywood. Taste super authentic. The Thai curry hits the spot everytime . What a great place for Thai comfort. Staff is coo...they're just there to work not mingle. But  def okay with that. Recommmend :)
Address: 5908 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Cool place! Have inari and photo booth. The food is a combo of Korean and Hawaiian and has no affiliation with any LA Clippers player.
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Staff was friendly and very quick service. I got the chicken bowl and everything was great
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This place was amazing, cashier was very friendly and they have an easy to read menu. The place has a Photo Booth which is very cute and a nice mirror and overall this place is really clean. Food was amazing and we'll prepared!
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Great spot to grab lunch!Wide variety of options and great service!I'm happy to see that they have a salad menu that goes well with traditional Hawaiian dishes.
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This stuff is straight FIRE!!! The mac salad is perfect, great juicy chicken, love the spicy cabbage. This is my second time this week ordering it cause it was so  good. Definitely will be coming back more and I feelLike the portions are huge for the price!!
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Love the food and service they gave super good recommendations, me and my friends loved it! The aesthetic creates a great vibe and workers were very friendly!
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I visited Khawaiian for the first time yesterday and was greeted by Zen, one of the owners, and his staff were very friendly and helpful. I saw the menu online and decided on the Inari sushi with tuna plus a side of seaweed salad, both were very good and filling! Zen gave me a complimentary lychee iced tea which was perfect because it's sweetness balanced the savory tuna. I definitely will go back and try the rest of the menu! The ambiance was cute and bright.
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: good food, service, and presentation! love their cute little musubis and their giant circle mirror is perfect for pics!
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Food is great and the employees are super friendly! I love how the portions sizes relative to the prices of each dish. The interior is also super cute :D
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Food is amazingTaste super good !Great ownership ! Super friendly and welcoming!100% will go backGreat interior feels like home welcome !
Address: 3438 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This place was so great when it opened - just went back for the first time in four years and it's now truly disappointing. Our food - thin, tasteless cobb salad, bland-ass tuna sandwich, an oatmeal cookie that tasted like it came from Safeway - was sub-mediocre at best. Must be under a different management?
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Went to meet for coffee/food at 358pm the other day as the company showed 5pm close. The server and manager both said I couldn't wait one minute to decide what to order as they were "closed".  I mean come on, it's your fault the closing time was wrong and just give customer service for a couple minutes. Guess they don't want/need the business. 2 stars for nice patio, zero stars for customer service.
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Believe the hype!Perfectly located because it happens to be walking distance from me. Street parking can be a bit of a challenge so walking here is always a nice option b.I dropped by a couple weeks back, but we got a bev and dessert to go. Our plan was always to come back for a proper meal.We dropped in after a Sunday hike so we were sweaty and hungry. Unfortunately for us some of the items on the brunch menu were no longer available. Our intention was to get 3 items, but we got two instead with the game plan that we would get something else if we were still hungry. I wasn't sure how big the portion was going to be. It totally worked out that we only got two items. The three tacos were pretty hefty and the salad was packed. We got our desserts to go.The vibe here is super chill. I love the outdoor area. It's definitely a plus when you have a pet with you.Not pictured is the order of cold brew iced coffee I had that was so damn good I almost got another one to go.
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Food.  Delicious. I had the pork belly eggs benedict and deviled eggs and both were excellent. Extensive menu options and plenty of vegetarian choices.Ordering Process. Similar to Urth Cafe, this is not my favorite set up. You have to stand in line and order and then go find a table and wait for them to bring your food.Prices. Reasonable for the quality of food.Service. Excellent. The staff brought more hot water for my tea and refilled our water glasses. They also clean and turn the tables quickly.Parking. Street/metered parking is available or, if you  can find it, there is 2-hour free side street parking on 1st street (about a block away). To stay more than two hours, you must have a permit.
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I've been to this place a couple of times. It has Avery cute outdoor seating.The Fried Egg Tartine was interesting as it has avocado hummus and almond pesto on the side.It comes with a side of salad which is ordinary.The vanilla Latte was delicious and not too sweet!Overall good is healthy and service is fast.
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Always terrific food in a wonderful off street oasis on busy Sycamore. The service is friendly and the desserts are dangerously delicious!
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Meh! Went to meet a friend for lunch... there are way better places to dine. The essence of food( meaning slices of chiffon and air) for a fairly Hefty price is such a disappointment.
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Cozy, friendly, and the food was amazing. The outdoor seating was perfect for a late lunch. Don't forget to try one of their pastries! Beautiful and delicious!
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Fun environment. Healthy portions. Great variety of menu. We went at 10am on a Monday and it wasn't too busy. I've seen it busting at the seams on a weekend. Neighborhood find. I'll be back.
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Pretty good. Came here with a friend on a Friday afternoon and the line was out the door! I thought wow this food must be good, however I was slightly disappointed by my short rib sandwich. The meat, cheese and bread ratio was off, too much bread not enough cheese.I ordered a speciality latte w rosemary - pretty good. I'd come back but would Order something different. The outdoor seating on a sunny day is the perfect LA café.
Address: 143 S La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: Tasty home style Korean food in the style of a Korean taxi driver's cafeteria shown in the movie Parasite. The main dish changes daily. Today was pork ribs. They have bulgogi on weekends. The salad corner was super fresh. An easy quick meal.
Address: 4220 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: he Korean food was incredibly delicious, with a variety of side dishes, soups, stews, meats, and fish. The owner was very kind and welcoming. I would love to visit this restaurant again in the future!" ,............................................................youtu.be/Bnu8j7gMnG0
Address: 4220 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Delicious place! Great all you can eat BBQ. Not anything too fancy, but it's cute and homey. The service was nice and friendly as well. Yummy!
Address: 4220 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: It bills itself as LA's first home-style Korean buffet, and boy am I glad I tried it. The owner greeted me when I walked in and when I confirmed it was my first time visiting, he gave me a tour of the buffet and explained what all the dishes were as most of the signage is in Korean.Dishes rotate daily, apparently, and when I went they had two types of rice (white and purple), bean sprout soup and Korean curry in the back section. Lettuce leaves, hot peppers and ssamjang in the refrigerator. On the hot bar, they have Spicy pork with baby octopus, a spicy yam dish, fried mackerel, Korean pancake, sundubu tofu, a fluffy egg dish along with a couple other dishes I think I've missed. The cold bar had spicy crab, bean sprouts, japchae, daikon/carrots and a very nice variety of banchan. There was more that I can't remember but it was all delicious!If you're looking for super authentic homemade Korean food, this is a fantastic new option. The owner was very friendly and even though I'm only in LA for a couple weeks, I know I'll be going back soon!Highly recommend!
Address: 4220 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I was given an order of their oven-roasted spicy chicken, and I was pleasantly surprised! The coating is crispy and at first bite, you're tricked into thinking that it's not as spicy as it is. But by the third piece, you start feeling that slow burn on the tip of your tongue.The spiciness is not unpleasant - I actually found it to be quite addicting!Needless to say, my first introduction to Rice Chicken fared well. I'll definitely be returning for another order soon!
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Honey Garlic wings are so good and the churros. Didn't expect the filling in the churro but it was good.  The cashier was very friendly and the inside is small but nice and clean
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Was craving some fried chicken takeout and this newly opened store was conveniently near our place. We were attracted to the rice flour the store boasted to use, and wanted to compare it to other popular fried chicken chains.We ordered the 20 pcs Ruby Jade (soy garlic) along with the Deokbokki. The chicken was packaged nicely for takeout, with holes for ventilation and radish provided.Upon first bite, first notice was the crunch of the chicken skin, and the unique flavor the rice flour added to the wings. Combined with the tenderness and juiciness of the flesh, we could tell immediately that the wings were cooked with detail and care. The soy garlic flavor was not overwhelming, and at times felt like could use a little more of the garlic flavor for the hardcore garlic lovers.The Deokbokki was a nice and welcome addition to the meal. Not much to say here, except it was a solid dish that provided a little spice to the meal. We did not add the ramen noodles, but would definitely consider it in a future visit.Overall, the chicken was the best I've had in a while, and felt a lot less heavy and greasy than other chicken places do. I wish they allowed 50/50 on flavors, especially with higher wing counts, as I would have definitely wanted to try the Crowing Rooster (Yang Nyum) flavor. For a newer, less reviewed chicken spot on the block, this place is an undiscovered star.
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I thought it was good, but not amazing. Not sure if maybe I got the wrong flavor (got the soy garlic) but it wasn't a home run for me. Still very good though.
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: All were excellent! I tried the regular 6 piece fried chicken and loved it! Service was great and the atmosphere was clean and comfortable.
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: My new gluten free korean fried chicken spot! This crunchy fried chicken tastes almost the same as the regular flour fried chicken, and might be actually better. Service is always great and timing is pretty accurate from their estimates.They have plenty of seating so will dine in next time. Parking lot is valet at certain hours on the weekends.I got the Crowing Rooster and the Soy Garlic Chicken full chicken. This is a lot of chicken, I think approx 12 pieces each and we had this for about 3 meals. I love both sauces and would recommend them both.  Also you can make them spicy!They also have rice on the side if you want as well!
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Rate: 9.7/10!The food was absolutely amazing! The customer service was also very good.As soon as I walked in, the owner & coworkers greeted us with a big smile and a warm welcome. As soon as we sat down, we were served waters and menus. They were very patient and enthusiastic while taking our orders.Food came out quickly and looked so delicious. Really enjoyed the cheese powder (costs extra but worth it). The chicken with the cheese powder combo is amazing. Would come back just for that.Overall, amazing store with great food but even better customer service & environment. Highly recommend!
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Super delicious Korean fried chicken!! I'm so happy I've found my new favorite KFC place in K-town! The fried chicken here tastes really light and crispy, and honestly...healthy?? I come here with my partner and so far we've tried the Moon Rabbit, Sweet Goblin, and Cheesy Tiger flavor for the fried chicken. They're all delicious but my favorite has to be Cheesy Tiger!!Last time we came here, we ordered the Moon Rabbit with tteokbokki as recommended by Paul (the owner). This combo is super yummy especially when you dip the fried chicken in the sweet and spicy red sauce!I also highly recommend the Cup Bap with spicy pork! It tastes like a cozy home cooked meal and I especially love the kimchi in it :'3The service here is also very attentive and friendly and I really appreciate the welcoming good vibes. Definitely looking forward to coming here often to get my KFC and cup bap fix in the future~
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Rice Chicken is a gem of a restaurant. The original spicy chicken is perfectly flavored and came out steaming hot. The service was really nice and our waiter looked the same as the logo!! The restrooms are also very clean. Very nice vibes and you can even draw/write on the wall!
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Goodness gracious. The fries were crispy and had a good amount of flesh in it! The chicken was so darn crispy. The size of each piece was a little small but that's been happening a lot these days I think. So overall pretty good!!Interior was clean and nice. I think bc it's newer the wait wasn't bad but I really think the food is gonna make this place stand out.Service was friendly and helpful!This is gonna be my new place
Address: 3065 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Japan House Los Angeles is part art gallery, library, restaurant, and event space all in the heart of Hollywood, California. We're so lucky to have so many museums and galleries in SoCal and Japan House is a great addition. It currently has an amazing Pokémon X Kogei exhibition featuring art like sculptures and ceramic pieces inspired by Pokémon. It is quite incredible as I've seen exhibits like this in Japan, so it's super cool to see in the states.I made reservations in advance, but they also accept walk ins. The space takes up two floors, specifically the gallery and store on the 2nd floor and the library and restaurant on the fifth floor. Parking is at the Ovation parking structure. Parking is $3 for two hours with a validation. They also provide complimentary green tea on the fifth floor.
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: I went to special event that George Takei spoke about his Star Trek days and Frank Buckley interviewed George Takei
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: The Pokèmon exhibition was nothing short of amazing! They were so detailed and cute and intricately crafted! Security is strict on wild kids, touching artwork, videotaping, or flash photography. They don't sell much here besides expensive chopsticks and crafts from Japan.
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: A Small Yet Fascinating Peek into Pokémon WorldI recently visited Japan House for their Pokémon exhibit, and while it was on the smaller side, it was undeniably captivating. The display featured numerous items, and what really stood out was the fact that many of them were out of their display cases. This allowed visitors to get an up-close look at each item. Note your are not allow to touch the pieces!The attention to detail on these pieces was truly extraordinary. Personally, my favorite part of the exhibit was the evolution of Eevee. Being able to see all three forms of Eevee in one place was a treat for any Pokémon fan! Additionally, the kimonos on display were exquisitely designed, showcasing the rich culture and artistry of Japan.The presence of guards throughout the exhibit ensured that no one touched the items, which is especially important if you have curious kids with you. They also provided reminders about this, which I totally understand.To visit, you'll need to secure a time ticket in advance, which you can easily book on their website. The validation they offer for parking is a nice touch! It comes to $3 for 2 hours. The exhibit took less than a hour.Overall, my experience at Japan House's Pokémon exhibit was a good one. While it may not be the largest exhibit, the quality of the items and the chance to see them up close more than made up for it. If you're a Pokémon enthusiast or simply appreciate fine craftsmanship, this exhibit is worth a visit!
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: Been meaning to visit this place for a long, long time. Finally made the trek over after eating at Smorgasburg for the Pokemon x KOGEI exhibit and it was 1000% worth it. I hope everyone gets a chance to visit before the exhibit ends in January 2024! It's really rare we get such amazing work imported over from Japan, especially a Pokemon collaboration like this one.The Pokemon exhibit is located on the second floor, you can get validated parking for the Ovation Hollywood parking structure. Don't forget to bring your ticket!I recommend you reserve a time slot for your visit to this exhibit. They have walk-ins available, but it depends on the traffic inside the exhibit at the time. I'd say it wasn't overly crowded, but there was definitely a decent amount of people within the entire time. My friend and I spent roughly an hour in the space, as it only spans two large rooms.That being said, the work that they brought over was absolutely stunning. There's a good mixture of Japanese ceramics/pottery, metal work, fabrics/clothing, and more. I'm aware they're rotating a few pieces from the exhibit and will be stopping by to see what they swap in. There are also a few employees there to watch and make sure not one gets too close to the artwork. They're stern, but not rude about it. Just don't lean over the table line or roping and you'll be fine.It's a small exhibit, but worth the trip. I can't wait to come back! I didn't get to check out the 5th floor (which contains a library and event venue), but I'll be making sure to stop by there next time just to see what it's like.
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: A special thank you to my yelp buddy Quintin E. for sharing this great find! Love Q and his Q tips!I made a reservation for the Pokemon x Kogei exhibit (July 25, 2023-Jan 7,2024) prior to my visit to Japan House Los Angeles. The reservation and visit was FREE. I thought it was required, but on the day of our visit I saw a long line waiting to enter, so I'm glad we had the reservations.PARKING - Underground parking at the Ovation Hollywood structure. Japan House LA will provide validation so it is $3 for the first 2 hours. It is $2 for every 20 minutes after. From the structure take the elevators or escalators up to Level 2 for the Gallery or Level 5 for the Library.My boyfriend and I started off in the Gallery since we arrived near our appointment time. I presented my reservation email and we were immediately welcomed into the gallery. I'm really grateful that it was a free experience, but I was surprised to see how small the exhibit is. Nevertheless the art they had on display was incredible.The Pokemon x Kogei exhibit is a playful encounters of pokemon and Japanese craft and the amount of details and intricacies that went into every piece displayed is incredible. Staff was also friendly and passion and excited to tell us fun facts about some of the art work as we explored. I could easily recognize the original pokemons but I'm not up to date with all the new ones. It was a fun visit.Then we were off to their Library on the 5th floor of Ovation Hollywood. It was a bit hard to find. At the library staff offered a sampling of matcha tea that was nice and refreshing for a hot summer day. The library was small but still interesting to visit.Nice fun FREE adventure if you are in the area, but it's such a small exhibit I don't know if I recommend it to someone who is coming from far... unless you super love pokemon. Also I would have enjoyed it more if it was less crowded.
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: Always interesting rotating  exhibits and  items  for sale--crafts, art objects, utensils, incense, other highly authentic  traditional and contemporary and less-traditional Japanese.Pokémon X Kaigo (craft) exhibit very interesting objects and shows multiple artists' interpretations of Pokémon imagery, and great breadth of Japanese traditional crafts--cloth, ceramics, metalwork, sculpture, paper, etc. A new group of these specially created objects is coming soon. .
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: I had visited Japan House many years ago but this was their 5th year celebration held feet away from their store.The celebration had many performances including a taiko performance by Asano Taiko. Amazing drumming!I got to check out the Pokemon exhibit which was really amazing!Definitely worth coming to check it out!Store promotes traveling to Japan with many flyers and guides to Japan. There is also all sorts of Japanese decorations being sold, incense, handbags, and more. A boutique Japanese store :)
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: Japan House LA... You so cute!!This ever rotating themed/exhibit art and cultural space houses two levels at the Hollywood/Highland Ovation Shopping Center. On the second floor you can enjoy the amazingly layout though limited space collection of the season(s) as well as amazing authentic products, home goods and more from  Japanese culture.For the current Art Exhibition - Kogei x Pokemon you need a reservation (much like previous others). It's 100% complimentary with parking validation and a very more than reasonable time window to enjoy this amazing assortment of beautiful pieces made with metals, wood, silks and various creative materials to showcase a 27 year old anime that has capture the hearts of so many.I definitely went pitcure wild as they didn't allow for any video or flash photography for this exhibit. I did compile a fun photo reel via TikTok and Instagram after to capture my experience with Pikachu, Rookidee, Charizard, Shaymin, Gengar and quite a bit of the now over 1k rest!It's best to arrive early if possible though they have a 20 minute grace period before you'd have to try for a different time slot anywhere from 11 AM - 7 PM  in increments of 30 minutes though you're welcome to stay for 45. I was truly impressed with the kindness of all the staff, including security and  personability as well as professionalism.I got turned around and ended up 10 minutes later than planned but was truly grateful for that 20 minute loop hole (thank you frequently asked questions).... Weekends are definitely the busiest days to go, but also the most fun.Previous groups/parties and those proceeding will come and go during your time, but they do limit capacity. They do have some metal ropes in front of some display you should not cross as well as signs for things or areas not to be crossed or touched including the art which is a given for an art collection.You can also enjoy more of Japan House on the 5th level which features a wonderful library, event venue of the multi-purpose variety, high views of the city and pop up restaurant that's done some crazy amazing pop up experiences like Saido's Vegan Way w/ Chef Katsumi Kusu, Defining Modern Kaiseki with Chef Hiroo Nagahara and numerous others.I absolutely want to explore more and come back with friends or family soon... But I have to admit a date day with yourself, taking the train/Metro B Red Line and getting off at the Hollywood/Highland station, less than a 3 minute stroll away is just as fun.When making a reservation for the exhibit online you can add up to 5 guest and must have/input their names though you can make changes up until the time of your schedule visit. Give them your name in front at the reception desk and enjoy your visit. It's as easy as evolving a Caterpie, evolving an Eevee or setting off on an adventure with your starter mon of choice.
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: Love this place!!!! First time ever visit and I didn't expect such amazing place to go appreciate and see artists incredible work of arts especially its free and this amazing exhibit was my all time favorite Pokémon theme!!! Japan House LA is a hidden gem which I will definitely come back for more great experiences and bring more friends and families with me.   Love that my nieces and boys are all fans of Pokémon and they all said it was so fun and amazing to look at!!!!
Address: 6801 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Cultural Center, Art Museums, Pop-Up Restaurants

Comment: The fried chicken is consistently good. it is succulent with a crispy skin. The Mac n cheese is quite tasty. The staff is nice and efficient. And if you sit down rather than take out, you'll enjoy a comfortable chill space.
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: This place never fails. If you don't like it... skim thing is wrong with your pallet. Ok okay not that serious but it is delicious! The service is fast and friendly! Casual spot in LA! Can't go wrong with a leg + a breast + some fries!
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The chicken was great,  crispy on the outside &  juicy on the inside. The Mac & cheese needs work because it had that Kraft Mac & cheese from the box flavor but other than that everything was great. The service was great from the time we walked in & was greeted & the environment was chill.
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Came here to eat in the afternoon on a weekend. I was meeting with a friend to eat at another place, but this place was so good I made my friend meet me here and we are here instead! We ordered dark meat and a few beers. Overall the experience was great! Great food, great service, and great beer! Did I mention they have beer? Yes! Beer! The 40oz kind. The inside dining experience was exceptional, clean tables, friendly staff, and good entertainment "tv and music". Will be back with the whole family next time! Only thing is they have a small parking lot for carry out only, so inside dining is strictly street parking.
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Their fried chicken is delicious with just the rite bite.   Had my first fried green tomatoes and I've already been back for more.  Great home brewed tea sweet if you like.
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Just like the original outside of Memphis! The service, food and people were all excellent!
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: On the go, to & fro' during work runs. Decided just grab a few pieces of chicken, hadn't had Gus's in a long while. The chicken was good, hot, crispy & a little tang' on the palate. However, the sides were ABSOLUTE TRASH!!! No really I mean c'mon Gus's! the small scoop of potato salad was flavorless & watery - it literally looked as if they sat a scoop of potato salad in dish water in my to go container! The greens were tender, but a little spicy but they didnt have any other flavor just straight spice, could've used some salt or something.  Going forward I will only order the chicken pieces a la carte because $18.57 for 2 pc of chicken, 1 slice of white bread, small scoop of runny/inedible potato salad & 'just OK' greens??!!! Really? Not worth it at all! Sorry Gus's - you can do better!
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Food was amazing as always but what made our experience here more amazing was the customer service. Angel was helping us tonight and was honestly the best! We appreciate how friendly he was and we appreciate the tasty food. We will be back
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The food lives up to the hype!  Chicken very good. Okra was delish! I ordered takeout and loved that the chicken was in a brown paper bag. So Southern!
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The fried chicken here is very incredible me and my family love it. Service could be better but overall great. Ambiance is very spacious and wait time can be alot.
Address: 1262 Crenshaw Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: I was super excited to check out Howlin' Ray's one of the last few spots that serve hot chicken that I've been wanting to try. First of all amazing amazing amazing customer service, they walk you through everything so well. I went with the chicken & waffles - since it was only served on the weekend I figured why not, and I paired that with a side of fries & Mac & cheese. And a side of their special sauce & honey mustard. All of this for $30 bucks. I opted for the chicken tenders with my waffles - and the chicken itself was amazing I got medium+, thank you to the cashier for putting me on the secret heat level because I was contemplating between medium & hot and it was amazing. The waffles tasted like cheap hotel self serve making waffles I did not enjoy. The fries were kinda all crunch, there was no potato on the inside. And the Mac and cheese needed a lot more seasoning. No inside seating l, outside vibes for the ambiance. Overall I would give this place a solid 3.5/5 because the chicken is go good. I will also be back to try the sando.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Better than Dave's Hot Chicken by far. I got the 5, which was spicy (at least for me). I noted some sweetness to it, so sweet and spicy - the perfect taste combo. Limited seating, so you'll need to stand and eat, take it to-go, or find some common area seating outside.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Figured we'd stop by one of the most well-known hot chicken places in LA while there for a concert. Got there around lunch hour and the line was out the door! Took around 20-30 minutes to get to the front, where they had a couple people taking orders at both the counter and on an iPad to maximize efficiency. Staff were super smiley and offered us some really cute pins and postcards while we had our orders taken.There is no interior seating, but the restaurant is situated in a little food hall of sorts with lots of little shops to check out if you can get a friend to wait in line. There's some seating outside the restaurant, but it can get full pretty quickly.I ordered the chicken and waffles medium hot for $16. Took around 15 minutes which was surprising considering the line. Tenders (3) were sizable and came with waffles, butter, and syrup. I think they use a drier spice rub, so I recommend getting the dipping sauce on the side for an extra charge. The chicken itself was cooked well, still juicy and steaming hot. The waffles were surprisingly good, with the perfect crunchy-soft texture difference. I tried my friends' sandos and fries and would definitely recommend those more though. Solid spot, lives up to the hype.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: It was good but not worth the wait. Start with the regular spice level, the mild does not do it justice.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: After much anticipation I finally got to trying Howlin'. It did not disappoint. The quality of chicken was excellent! It's a small spot with outdoor dining only. You stand in line the waiter calls you on at a time to the booth to place your order then you wait out front.It's located in the heart of Chinatown so as you can imagine parking is nonexistent or metered. So be mindful of that.I ordered the Sando in medium and I have a high tolerance to spicy but mannnnn it was spicy! My friend got the tenders and she was equally dying with the medium spice level lol it was like burning but i also couldn't stop eating it. What I found annoying and the reason for 4/5 stars is everything is sold separately. For example if you order tenders it comes with no sauce you have to pay for all the dips you want.Overall, it was great to finally try one of the OGs of fried chicken and I hope to come back and get the Sando in mild lol
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: i expected so much more, chicken lacked flavor and their fries are like dave's or any other place, DEFINITELY NOT worth the wait.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Food is always great.  Often long lines so order ahead.  A must try place when in Chinatown.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I've heard so many good things about this place. There was a long line but that's go be expected here. The service was great and very friendly. I ordered the Luis medium spice with fries. The sandwich was very tasty and had just the right amount of spiciness. The chicken piece was huge! I'm glad I had a chance to try it out. A shorter wait and outdoor seating would be nice.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I didn't understand the hype but now I do! Howlin' Ray's is now my favorite spot for chicken sandos. I've heard that people waited for 2 hours to get the sandwich so I only stopped by because it was convenient.I went at 3pm so there was much less of a crowd than usual. It took about 20 minutes from the start of the line to actually orderingIt was surprising to find Howlin' Ray's in the middle of Chinatown in LA but at least it was near some familiar shops. I was tempted to get the spiciest sandwich but got a mild sando to be safe. I could've probably handled a hotter sandwich but it was still good. The chicken was crunchy but juicy and there was a really nice depth of flavor because of the spices.  The sandwich is also a moderate size.There wasn't much space to sit besides a bench outside the shop. No seating is inside. Most people seem to take there orders to go.I would come back if I was nearby again. Wish there were more locations but I can always call ahead next time to order.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: The time finally came. I f i n a l l y tried a Howlin' Ray's hot chicken sandwich and fries. I was impressed. I always wanted to try it at their brick and mortar location in DTLA, but having a take-out and delivery option from Pasadena made it just so much more convenient and less time-consuming.My husband and I split the mild Luis and Sando 2.0 sandwiches with their crispy fries. The quality and the consistency of the tenderness with an equally distributed spice level with every bite wowed us. The cheese and bacon were decent ratios with the tenders. The slaw was slightly sweet and not too soggy. The fries were crispy despite the 20-minute commute it took to be delivered to my apartment. The aioli was delicious as well.I think this would have been a different experience had I tried the food while dining out rather than getting it delivered. This was good, the quality was great and I would be up for trying it again.
Address: 727 N Broadway Ste 128 Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Delicious Ukrainian food!A little sketch getting here if you're using Google maps. It IS inside an apartment complex area. You don't need an access card to get it. It's by the main office.Food is absolutely delicious! You can tell things are homemade, and made with love and care.I tried lunch here after arriving in LAX. It's not a long drive, maybe 10-15 minutes. And so worth it.I got the mushroom and chicken crepe and their mushroom dumpling. I cannot spell the actual name of the dish, but it's amazing. The dishes are a perfect myriad for sauce, texture, quality, and flavor.It is a TAD expensive, but the food is more filling than you'd think. If you're not into dumplings or crepes, they have these farmer market pancakes that remind me of mini souffle pancakes and they also have desserts and pizza. Cherry pie seemed amazing.I 1000% recommend this place. I've never had Ukrainian food, but the servers are really friendly and will recommend dishes. I'll definitely be coming back here (:
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: Came here on Friday around 11am. Last time we had varenyky with cherries and borsht (they were fire!!!) so this time we decided to try something new. Ordered mlyntsi with chicken and mushrooms - they were incredibly fluffy and delicious! Then we had syrnyky with custard and medovik. Syrnyky - cottage cheese with lightly sweet custard is amazing combo and medovik is layered honey&cream cake that had the  perfect amount of sweetness with a fluffy texture. Not to mention that this family owned restaurant has very cute pottery and a beautiful layout . The service was incredible! The food came out very quickly but with gorgeous presentation. Our server Kate was very nice.Mom, Please is a charming, peaceful, and delicious place to have a brunch date. Definitely will be back again!
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: In a city with a dearth of Ukrainian food - I seriously couldn't name another Ukrainian restaurant with 100% certainty it's Ukrainian - this small cafe serves up what I believe are the staples of Ukrainian cuisine. You walk in and stand in line to order from some really friendly people and you find a table either inside or outside. The vibe, much like the area it's located in, feels lively and bright.I feel like I ordered well, even though I'm not really familiar with the cuisine. I got the borscht, syrnyky (pancakes) with berries and custard, and the pelmeni chicken dumplings.I loved the comforting, earthy taste of the borscht. I'm a big fan of dill, which I believe it's an underrated herb, and it really shined in this dish. It came with some bread, slices of pork, and a side of sour cream. I really thought this was just really well done.The pancakes were great. There is almost a tart flavor to it and love the texture and the mix of flavors from the custard and berries.I'm a big fan of dumplings in any culture. The pelmeni were structurally sound and had great flavor. Super well cooked and lovely with the side of sour cream.I would say a tad bit on the pricey side, but overall just a great experience and great food. If you're hankering for Ukrainian cuisine or just want to try it out, this place is the place for you.
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: This restaurant sits between an apartment complex and a business building: it serves those who live/work here. The food and service are excellent; however, unless you live/work here, it's hard to visit due to the complete lack of parking onsite. You can use the guest parking at apartment complex: but they are always lacking and very compact. Once you get over "getting here", the food is fantastic. I am not an expert on Ukrainian or Eastern European food; I can't tell authentic from fake. But, the food here is tasty and sincere. I really really like it. Most of the food contains milk (cheese of some sort or sour cream). My Russian friends explain that is how you should enjoy home cooking. Hence, the reason it's not a five start is that it didn't match my flavor profile. But, when I got through the butter (I avoided the cheese and cream) I found fantastic flavors in the food. Even the simple potato dumplings elevated potato and mushroom flavors to the foreground: fantastic. And borscht; who doesn't love an intense soup. We were very happy we visited.
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: So happy we finally tried Mom, Please, been aiming to go for a few weeks now.  The food is delicious and fresh and everyone who works there was so friendly and attentive.  We tried the potato, chicken, and turkey dumplings.  Personally I thought the chicken were the best, but the potato were a close second.  Also tried the mors fruit drink - not quite a juice, not quite a tea, but absolutely delicious.Can't wait to go back and try the pancakes!
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: Tried this place for the first time today and the food and service was amazing!! Would definitely recommend their chicken and mushroom mylintsi and their pelmeni dumplings!
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: I kept getting ads on Yelp for this restaurant; I'd only ever had Ukrainian food once prior to this many years ago, so now there's a Ukrainian restaurant in LA? Yes, please, "Mom, Please!"Tucked away in a neighborhood apartment complex, the restaurant feels almost like stepping into a family home. Many of the clientele also seemed to be Ukrainian (and Russian-speaking).
