I ordered syrniki (cottage cheese pancakes) and medovik (Russian honey cake) to eat at the restaurant, and I bought some frozen potato varenyky to-go. I also ordered an iced lavender latte, which is by no means Ukrainian, but it was delicious: sweet, fragrant, and not too strong on the coffee flavor (which I like).The verdict:-- Syrniki (8/10): I'm personally not a huge fan of cottage cheese, but I was impressed by how smooth the inside was and enjoyed the crispy outside layer. Not too sweet, either.-- Medovik (10/10): I know it isn't Ukrainian, but I couldn't resist ordering this. I LOVE medovik, and "Mom, Please" did it so well: soft, slightly spongey layers with naturally-sweet honey and cream. I could eat slices of them!-- Potato varenyky (9.5/10): I bought them frozen and cooked them at home. So good! The dough was wonderfully al-dente, and I loved the simple, but flavorful potatoes and cheese inside. Only thing was that it was just a tad too salty, but otherwise delicious.Given that "Mom, Please" opened just months ago, the prices were expensive to keep up with quality and maintenance costs. Food was delicious, though, and I'd love to come back to try other dishes, including borscht and other varenykys!
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: Really yummy food and great service!Def will be coming back:)Yuummmmmmmmmmyyyyyyyyy
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: The place on the outside is small quaint and feels very family oriented. I would say a lot of the clients were large groups of families. Not a very diverse clientele, but it seems family owned which is a plus. The clientele and the staff came off a bit rude, rushed, and cold, to my partner and I. Felt like we were looked at oddly a ton, nonetheless i this isn't an uncommon thing so I usually don't care but this felt a bit unwelcoming.Nonetheless, the food was pretty underwhelming, haven't tried everything on the menu so perhaps I just ordered something that didn't work for me however, once we were hurried into a chair - (mind you we did come 1 hour before closing) - however worked in food so I get it but... still. A warm hello and some eye contact would be cool.Anyhow we got the Borscht, Cherry Vareniky, Chicken Crapes.Food came out cold, which I'm not sure if this is how it's supposed to served here but - I like crapes or chicken... hot. The texture felt reheated and not too fresh. The temperature of it felt hotter in some areas than the other. Not it for me.This dish was served with sour cream which I dig, but I got the idea that that may be traditional which I respect. Just not for me.The Borscht, was probably the best thing we had out of the three, but even then it was pretty plain tasting and the meat was tough. I'm usually a huge fane of simple soups - it wasn't bad it was just lacking some kind of flavor... but what I did like about it was how it was simplified dish. Almost like a birria but stripped down.Also served with sour creamAnd for the Cherry Vareniky - idk - the texture of the encasing was a bit rubber and there just wasn't a rush of strong flavors.I was a bit sad because this place had ingredients mixed together that I had yet to see some in that way but when we got to it it just didn't hit.I appreciate being exposed to a different cultures food tho - I would want to try it out again but, I probably won't because of the atmosphere.
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: Quaint little restaurant with a very homey feel serving up classic Ukrainian dishes. The vibe here is great if you are fortunate enough to get a seat inside as it gets pretty busy and there is not much space inside. The food is delicious and service is very welcoming. We had Borscht, Syrniki, and Pelmeni and they were all great. This is also one of the few options for Eastern European fare in the area and definitely a spot to hit.
Address: 13151 Fountain Park Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094

Comment: Food was not good at all I thought with all these review it must be but I feel tricked everyone was just not pleasant over there and I certainly will never be back
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Food excellent service great ambiance greatDefinitely going back. Highly recommend.
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Came for dinner with a big group and had a great experience! I tried:+ Tamar cocktail+ Aria cocktail+ Hummus - borlotto masabacha+ Hummus - duck 'nduja+ Baba ghanoush+ Chicken liver pate+ Fried quail+ Oyster mushroom kabob+ Grilled prawns+ Yellowtail crudo+ Slow roasted lamb neck shawarma+ Hawaij cauliflower+ Peach cobbler+ Roasted strawberry pavlova+ Persian mulberry ice cream+ Strawberry sumac and sweet cheese pastry+ Salted cashew and chocolate stracciatella ice cream bomb+ Cherry clafoutisThe aria was my favorite cocktail, and the standout dishes were the quail, prawns and strawberry sumac desert.Overall one of the better meals I've had in LA (and I liked it better than their sister restaurant, Bestia).
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Bavel is one of those solid restaurants where you know you're in for a quality meal. I don't know how they manage it, but every single dish I had was out of this world. Each dish is bursting w flavors and somehow harmonious w other plates. The servers were so kind. They do have valet parking. It was surprisingly easy to get a reservation.I strongly recommend this place and cannot wait until I come back.
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Food is exceptionally full of flavor. Every dish had its own charm and everything tasted fresh. Ambience is great for a dinner or brunch. We opted for indoor seating.. Family friendly as it doesn't that rowdy at the end of the night. Service is too notch.Getting a reservation can be challenging but they do take walks in, but be prepared to wait.
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: The perfect date night. Cheerful and young ambience.Delicious food with great service. You'll want to bring your date, friends, and even enemies here.
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: My coworker and I decided to try this place out after work so she made reservations in advance. The line wasn't too bad right at 5pm but it got super packed starting 5:30pm/6pm so make sure to come early or make a reservation in advance. We joked that we wanted to not like this place since it's on the pricey side but wow we had such an amazing time here that we're recommending our other coworkers to come with us next time.The food here is truly the best Mediterranean food I've ever tasted and each dish also looks perfectly plated like a piece of art. Their hummus was super smooth, creamy, and flavorful. The pita bread comes out freshly hot and soft. Their ginger ale was good and their Lilith mocktail was a nice elevated drink to the meal too. I thought the lamb flatbread and fattoush salad (slightly overdressed) were both good but didn't blow me away like the other dishes.Last but certainly not least, the oyster mushroom kebab with the avocado sauce was the best thing I've tried here. The way it's cooked enhances the earthiness and sweetness of the mushroom. I can also dip anything in that avocado sauce and make it a 10/10 meal. Highly recommend this one dish.Service was good! They made good recommendations, explained what to eat first, and didn't overly check up on us which was nice.Parking was a bit tricky - we parked at a nearby public parking structure and paid $16 and they don't validate.
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Went for a anniversary with my wife.Valet parking was great and definitely worth it.The hostess/greeter barley acknowledged us when we got there (6pm reservation) she just told our server where to seat us.Server was mediocre and didn't seem very interested in us or our experience. Obviously it's a very successful restaurant but hospitality was lacking and this very much surprised us. Bill was delivered at the same time as dessert, even though we were considering one more drink.We were seated outside which was a lot quieter but had a lot of flies- definitely recommend to be seated indoors if you can.Food is very good and worth the price.To sum it up: food is great, service is not good for the price and no acknowledgement of our anniversary or greeting at all.
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: If I could only eat at one place for the rest of my life, it would be Bavel. If I could only have one meal for the rest of my life, it would be the lamb neck shawarma. I've been to bavel at least 10 times and every single time it is a 10/10. I'm so impressed that they are able to maintain such a consistent level of quality! Don't skip the farm cheese - it's amazing. And their cocktails are super fun too. The entire restaurant is beautiful. The perfect date night
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Some of the best Mediterranean food in town. We were ever so happy with everything, from the service, to the wait time and the food.The place is so cute and comfortable. You will not be rushed there.  It is in the Arts District which is fun. Their hummus is great.They serve Tapas style plates, which we love. We just kept ordering.Parking is a bear, but you will find a place.
Address: 500 Mateo St Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Parking is valet ($3)I got the lunch deal (bossam and daenjang jjigae and it's so much food for such a great price!!!The service was great and attentive and the ambiance has a nice old style Korean restaurant :-).This is my go to for bossam bc it is so flavorful and a great deal! Non-lunch special items can get a little pricey!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Came by for dinner on a Friday later at night and thankfully there was no wait that day for 3! We were seated and served very quickly. From ordering to receiving the food, everything was fairly quick and service was friendly.We ordered the medium bossam as well as the kimchi jeon for the table. They say medium serves 2-3 people but honestly I think it could be 3-4. The portions are very generous, the jeon as well. This was my first time having bossam, and it was delicious! The boiled pork pairs very well with the veggie sides that it comes with. The pork is sliced perfectly in my opinion, not too thin and not too thick. The jeon was delicious, but I will say it was on the oily side.Ambiance is pretty traditional vibes, a nice change from all the modern/chic places in Ktown. Recommend coming here for your bossam fix!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Simply the best Bossam in all the land.  A top 10 dish in Ktown.  Must eat with soju.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: In a corner of a pretty packed shopping center sits this traditional Korean cuisine place!The interior is simple and small - service is good!The food is extremely mediocre. The side dishes were fine.The dolsalt bibimbap was extremely plain - no flare to its seasoning or anything that made it actually taste "good".The seafood paejeon was pretty good but extremely oily ~Overall, would give a 6/10!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: My friends and I came here for lunch.  The food was amazing with all the flavor possible. We had the Bosam stew, pancakes and Kimchi bulgogi. ALL WERE SO TASTY  and did not disappoint. The staff were very attentive to me and my friends. The ambiance was very cultural which made the vibe so incredible.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Authentic Korean spot with bossam (pork belly). Came here with a couple of other friends and it was about a half hour wait on a Sunday around 6pm before we got seated. Had the medium bossam in addition to kimchi soup. The banchan provided included a beef jerky (a first for me), kimchi, potato salad (some of the best I've ever had) and a noodle thing. Rice was extra and they do have purple rice available ($3 per person). The medium was good for the three of us even though it says it's just for two - it's very filling and the pork melts in your mouth.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: The food was very good. My favorite was the sliced pork. Service was ok parking was a nightmare. Expensive!Ambience was ordinary. Nothing too outstanding.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Come here for the lunch special! Wow, this place seriously hit the spot for a good deal too. I got the Bossam & Doenjang Jjigae + the bibimbap and both were excellent. I really appreciated the number + quality of side dishes as well.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Kobawoo House lunch specials are the bomb. The lunch size bossam was plenty to satisfy my cravings, for a great deal. The pork belly was savory and had just the right amount of fattiness. We also ordered the bulgogi lunch special (a bit dry, great portion size). The ban chan was amazing, especially the dried squid (so yummy! I've never seen this as a side before). The restaurant was very cleanly and thoughtfully decorated, and the service was great.
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Came here for dinner and had a good experience. I think this place is well known for bossam (boiled pork) which comes with many side dishes. I'm used to thick slices but this place slices the meat super thin, which was pretty interesting. We also ordered 청국장 (fermented soy bean paste) soup. Smell can be tough to handle if you are not used to old school traditional Korean food, but I personally really enjoyed it. Service was also great too. They have a button on the table that you can press whenever you need something.I think the highlight was their muk gul lee, which is traditional Korean rice wine. It came in like a stone jar and it tasted very delicious. They must brew their own because it didn't taste like those cheap commercial ones.Overall, I think this spot is a great option if you want to just chill, eat, and drink with friends and family. Definitely give this place a visit!
Address: 698 S Vermont Ave Ste 109 Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Got sad eating this - came here because I missed taiwan and this place really missed its mark. I was craving a simple taiwanese bfast that usually includes a rice roll (fan tuan), egg pancake (danbing), and cold soy milk.Purple rice roll was small, dry, and not sticking together well. Egg pancake was more doughy. Soy milk tasted rubbery and bland despite the sugar, which is a first.I think it's fun for small businesses to play with traditional menus from time to time, but I didn't think the purple rice and marinated egg was necessary in the rice roll. Neither was the corn in the egg pancake.
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I ordered my food to go here, and when I went to pick it up I kinda wished I didn't because the space was beautiful. There was tons of natural light and a breezy patio. The staff was very prompt with helping me and friendly.Here's what I ordered:Pan fried pork buns: fluffy buns with a nice crispy sear, and flavorful juicy pork inside. I just wish the meat to bread ratio was a little better. 8/10Beef rolls: the beef was tender and delicious. These were tasty overall but I wanted a bit more browning/crispness on the wrap and it needed a touch more hoisin sauce inside. 7.5/10Wood ear mushrooms: these were unfortunately a little lacking in flavor. Needed a bit more saltiness so it tasted a bit bland. 6/10Shrimp wontons: even though I got these to go, the wrappers still held up and the shrimp inside was still juicy and had a nice bite. The sauce was tangy and had great flavor. 8.5/10Dan Dan noodles: these were bland and I was disappointed. I tasted the sesame but found it overall lacking in flavor. It was definitely lacking in saltiness and umami. 6/10Overall there are some tasty items here, but some not so much. I wanted to like this place a lot more since I live so close by. It's a solid spot for the area if you order the right things, but it's just not as good  as the Chinese food from the 626
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Stopped by for lunch with my dad and immediately loved the ambience-- such a cute and cozy outdoor courtyard with lots of lovely greenery. We came on a relatively quiet day, too, so food came out quickly and service was efficient. To my surprise everything here is extremely affordable, cheap, even!Regrettably, after seeing the food other people got, we did not order any appetizers. I got the Dan Dan noodles which were only $11 and definitely worth more! The noodles were nice chewy texture, and the sauce was smooth, garlicky, slightly spicy and sweet. The peanuts added a great crunch, and the cucumbers provided refreshment and perfect combination with the peanut sauce. I would have liked some more veggies in this dish because it was overall a bit rich; I make a similar dish at home with shredded carrots and bok choy which I think would have made good additions.My dad's wonton soup broth was clean and clear, yet quite flavorful. I enjoyed it in today's cool weather.We finished the meal with the traditional shaved ice with grass jelly (my favorite), little taro and sweet potato rice cakes, red bean, and boba! As a self-proclaimed boba connoisseur I was actually quite impressed with the balls and I bet they have an amazing bobarista in the back! The ice itself was way too sweet for me. As for the texture, it was a bit icy (I'm not sure if Taiwanese shaved ice is supposed to be that way) and not silky soft like Korean bingsu. The portion was HUGE-- definitely could have been shared by 4-5 people.I'm glad I finally got to try Pine + Crane-- great ambiance, great taste and even better prices. A great lunch spot in DTLA.
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Shout out to Vivian and her team! The food here is amazing and customer service is just as great. Pine & Crane has been one of the best additions to South Park. As a local, you want to eat well without breaking the bank. This place checks those boxes. I will continue to visit.
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I like the tan tan noodle n spice wantonFood serving is ver fast but not warmI think other place is more tasty
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Favorite dan dan noodles in LA! This space is bigger than the Silverlake one. I also like the hakka mochi for dessert.
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: This is the BEST modern Taiwanese food spot in LA. The beef roll, spicy wanton, lotus root, bamboo shoots and woodear mushroom are to die for. And the best of all - they're not that expensive considering the high quality of food
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Wow, I really hate to do this but I had one of the worst experiences today at Pine and Crane. Came in expecting to get breakfast, granted I showed up at 11 which is when breakfast service ends and I was told breakfast was no longer being served. After I place my order for Dan Dan Noodles I overheard the manager offer another customer breakfast, didn't make a big deal out of it just sat and waited for my food. My order came out a couple of minutes later so one star for fast service (mind you they gave me no utensils, no napkins, no condiments) but I live literally next door and when I tasted my noodles I'm not lying when I say these noodles were literally still slightly refrigerated/lukewarm. So I do what any normal person would do and went back and asked for another order which they politely agreed to.However, when my food came out the manager asked me if I had ever had the noodles before, to which I replied yes I have. Then she proceeded to try to justify that the noodles are quoted a 10 minute ticket time but that they typically take 2-3 minutes to cook, to which I replied well I don't understand how that applies to this situation because I walked in and ordered to-go and received my food right away. She went on to try to explain that maybe between the time the food was packed and when I ate it got cold. Yet I've had fast food stay hotter over a longer period of time. I explained to her that food should always be served hot, bottom line. She then called me aggressive and hostile, and I said sure I am a little upset because of the aforementioned experience with breakfast as she kept saying "yeah" "uh-huh" in a very condescending tone.On top of that there was a filthy terry towel in plain sight where they place everyone's to go orders, which I made her aware of and I pointed out how gross and dirty all her furniture was, which she didn't like at all. Her workers then started to harass me and tell me I was being rude. So I apologized and took accountability for my behavior and asked her to do the same about her condescending tone, and she literally told me it was "in response to my behavior".Again. WOW.Maybe I was just hangry, but this place has taken a complete nosedive, and I'm pretty sure like I'm most cases it's due to poor management. Went home and had to microwave my noodles Top Ramen style.Good luck and God speed Pine and Crane.Wipe down your furniture but don't leave the dirty towel out for everyone to see once you're done.
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Easy to find seating and love the open floor plan and outdoor areas. Food is very affordable for the area, the beef roll was great as were the woodear mushrooms.
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I was in charge of selecting lunch for my group before going to an event in the LA Convention Center. I am honestly disappointed that this did not live up to the high ratings I have seen on Yelp and Google reviews.I ordered the pork pan fried pork buns, wok tossed eggplant and basil, and beef roll. The pan fried pork buns were not as juicy as other ones I've tried. I was expecting a lot of hot soup to pour out as a I nibble a piece of the dumpling. The wok tossed eggplant and basil dish was a bit better. It was some good flavors, but I can tell that the eggplant was not soaked enough longer to absorb flavors. Some aspects of the eggplant was blander than other parts. The beef roll was actually the one I was most excited for because I have been craving for it. It was the worse ones I've tried because there is a high cucumber to beef ratio so it felt more like a cucumber roll than a beef roll.The service is pretty good and the ambiance of the place is just like any DTLA establishment. I like the concept that you should order and pay first, especially when going with a large group! It saves a lot of mental math but honestly, with the food not living up to my expectations, it really made me feel disappointed.
Address: 1120 S Grand Ave Ste 101 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: A few things I would recommend that they clean up the food menu because it's all over the place and doesn't feel appealing. The air conditioning vents seem not to work and needs cleaning. The staff is great, friendly and very helpful. I am a browns fan and I love that this bar reminds me back home in Ohio, so for that reason I would give them shot. Hope that they read this and at least try to fix some stuff.
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I would say the food and service were good. The place was just a little outdated and the vibe wasn't as I expected on a Saturday night. The angel hair pasta and short rib were probably some of the best things on their menu. The Hollywood location is right across Beauty and Essex so it's a good place to maybe start off a night around town.
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Beautiful ambiance, the food is absolutely amazing, a fantastic wait staff.... I can only give this a PERFECT 5 star experience. And WOW! The Churro Waffle dessert is a must. This is my new favorite local hangout!!!
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Such a great gem in West Hollywood! I love Saint Felix because it's right on the WeHo strip so all the clubs and other attractions are right near you and yet they are serving up yummy food and drinks to kick start your night.I have tried their burger, their mini sliders, and the quinoa grain bowl with chicken. The burger and sliders were so good, the meat is perfectly juicy and well seasoned. Their fries are crispy. I really liked their quinoa grain bowl it tasted fresh and delicious and I didn't feel so bad after eating it since it was so healthy.I also really love this one drink they make the Cucumber Dilettante. Made with vodka St. Germaine and cucumber, it's so refreshing and also packs a punch.The service is also phenomenal! The waitress/bartender/manager Marcia is amazing, she gets all the drinks out in minutes, she knows a lot about the menu, and our food came out quick as well. She was also super friendly and helpful when it came to deciding on menu items, she totally does it all and puts a lot of love and care into managing this restaurant.Highly recommend you go if looking for a bite for dinner in the WeHo area.
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Made a reservation. Showed up, they were closed. I'm supposed to write a longer review but you can't really fail any harder than that.
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We arrived for a 6 pm reservation on a Wednesday night...only a few tables were occupied and yet it took SO long to prepare our food. We ordered right away and yet our party of 2 was there for 2 hours.And, Sadly, the food is just not good.Appetizer: truffle popcorn - terrible. It was cold, about half popcorn and half Parmesan cheese...just piles of cheese. Weird, and not especially appetizing.Entrees: Mac and cheese - SO MUCH nutmeg. Not terrible if you like nutmeg, but weird. Seriously, SO MUCH.Blue cheese salad - a strange combination of toppings and a big pile of very weedy arugula with minimal dressing. Not bad, just eh.Jalapeño soup - it's not potato soup, it's a bowl of cream with added flavors and 2 small chunks of potato. The flavor was good, but it was really just like eating a bowl of flavored heavy cream.Dessert: churro waffle - I didn't think this could be messed up, but I was wrong. It seems like the waffles are SOAKED in a very sweet maple syrup, then cooked and covered in cinnamon and sugar. Daughter and I both thought they had a very strange flavor, we left more than half untouched.Out of coffee...no espresso and no coffee of any sort. Annoying.I was hoping for a nice dinner with my teenaged daughter, and sadly I feel like I wasted $100.
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Horrible experience at an event that was billed as "drinks and heavy hots d'oeuvres." There was not nearly enough food--nothing for the first hour, then occasionally ONE server would bring out ONE tiny tray for about 80 people, and one of the options was a basket of popcorn?! I gave up on getting food and left early. Never again!
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Came here for drinks after a show at the Pantages on a Wednesday night on a recommendation from a friend and was pleasantly surprised! Good drinks, nice staff, and a cozy booth for our group. The Truffle Popcorn wasn't on the menu but we were still able to order it and it did not disappoint.We expected it to be more crowded but enjoyed the chiller vibes.Would definitely come back!
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: A WARNING: THIS RESTAURANT HAS ANOTHER WEST HOLLYWOOD LOCATION NOT LISTED ON YELP. BE CAREFUL MAKING A RESERVATION!!! I made a res for my friend from Santa Monica, we were going to see music at hotel cafe, a few blocks away. I sent the res to my friend, not knowing they sent the reservation to West Hollywood. I went to the Cahuenga address, my friend to the West Hollywood (which she said was a tiny bar and not a restaurant). Our dinner plans were totally messed up as she had to grab another Uber and meet me by the music venue so we weren't late. The stars I'm giving was for the hostess who was very apologetic and said she'd call open table for to " check us in"  but I got a "no show" notice anyway.Totally ruined our dinner plans .
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Keala is such a wonderful bartender - extremely friendly, attentive and creative with cocktails! The interior is so stunning with plenty of bar seating available but also lots of tables (high tops and low tops) surrounding the bar offering more than enough seating. Parking is scarce, but there is a parking lot around the corner that is closed off and secure. After all, it's Hollywood. It's better to Uber anyway!
Address: 1602 N Cahuenga Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Excellent food, ambiance, and service! Loved all that we ordered. We had the Fillet mignon, mushroom, and potato side.
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: Celebrating our anniversary with dinner and a show, which took us to Hollywood. Sauté's salmon, julienned French fries and creamed spinach. Pictured is our meal that had been divided. If you follow me you know we appetize with dessert, shown is the 1919 sundae. Vanilla ice cream topped with caramelized bananas and caramel sauce. The whole meal was delicious and the service is always top notch at Musso & Frank Grill.
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: Review is for 7/27/23 dinner. Our 1st time here for a wedding anniversary celebration. We were seated immediately at our requested reservation time. There was a nice "Happy Anniversary" card that they gave us upon being seated at the table. Waiter service was professional and knowledgeable. We ordered a lot of food since we wanted to try everything!- Prime Rib: Huge portion (18 oz); prepared medium with a loaded baked potato. Tender and flavorful. (9/10)- Rib Eye Steak: The BEST rib eye I have ever eaten! I would just go back for this steak alone! It was perfectly grilled on their 100-year old grill and you can taste the oak wood (or whatever wood they use in the grilling process). If you're a steak eater, definitely get the rib eye! (10/10)- Boneless Garlic Half Chicken: Very moist and juicy chicken. Garlic was perfect and not overpowering. Perfect for non-red meat eaters! (9/10)- Caesar salad: Lightly but perfectly dressed caesar salad; they will split it for you (no charge) if you're sharing. (7/10)- Truffled Mac and cheese: Very cheesy and creamy! (10/10)- Potatoes Au Gratin: Very creamy and potatoes are perfectly soft! (10/10)- Apple cobbler with scoop of vanilla ice cream- the perfect end to a fabulous dinner! (10/10)Drinks are strong (Apple Martini and Moscow Mule)! Metered parking on the side streets (you may need to drive around a few times!). Would definitely return for another unforgettable meal!
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: Service has always been 10/10 from the musso and frank team. the food for me has been hit or miss - I surprisingly not a huge fan of the fettuccine alfredo even though it's one of their best sellers. i like the chicken parmigiana, the truffle mac and cheese, and the french onion soup. overall consensus is that the stuff is good, not terrible. food is fine. ambiance was very old-hollywood. they give a cake on your birthday too!!!
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: Must get their prime rib with horseradish sauce. Not only is it a perfectly sized helping, it is so rich and tender you will love every bite.
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: The place feels like you're in a different state and time zone I loved the food I love the waiter I spent a really nice anniversary thank you
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: I wont go back and here is why.Terribly expensive easily 125 dollars per person for dinner. 5 dollars for a small coke that may cost them 50 cents. 18 dollars for a glass of wine that may cost them 3 or 4 dollars.Very very loud waiter had to bend over to hear guest order. Person sitting at table kept having to repeat. Service atrocious waiter was never to be found waited for ever for requests.Hence why 2 stars because food was very good. I look for total package when I dine. If you only care if food is good then you maybe satisfied not me.
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: This place is so classic and whimsical. The white table cloths and an all men staff feels like your transported to classic Hollywood. I felt like Dorothy Dandridge.Service was impeccable. I'm not a meat eater but I wanted to have an experience and the history drew me to this staple in Hollywood.My BF really enjoyed his prime rib. I had the avocado salad & side of mushrooms.If you want a beautiful classic experience it's a must try!!
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: Feels like you are going to a different world when you step into this restaurant. I had the fettucine alfredo with chicken, and a dirty martini. Both were good. The restaurant is huge and full on a Tuesday night. Service was a bit slow but I assume it's because our waiter had a lot of tables.
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: I have been here a few times now . Always a good vibe and atmosphere . From just having apps and cocktails at the bar to dinner it never dissapoints . Such a cool old Hollywood feel. When I had dinner I spilt everything with a friend and we still took leftovers ! I would highly recommend to check it out ! Reservations always good . For the bar it depends when you go but it can get busy as well
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: Always a pleasure coming here ! Such great history and great drinks ! Love the freshness of drinks and bartenders always funny and great ! I have not yet had the full dinner menu but definetly will be going this next coming week ! Can't wait ! Updated review soon !
Address: 6667 Hollywood Blvd Hollywood, CA 90028

Comment: Great food actually. Everything is yummy! BUT they hate their customers that they find the worst chair in the world and make everyone sits on it.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: I was craving wonton soup so I went here to see what they had to offer.  OMGeeee!!! I'm so glad I  stopped in. They didn't have wonton, but they made me some super uber yummy concoction that was close enough to it. I got the golden chicken soup with dumplings and lemme tell u it was freaking awesome! The broth was smooth and chickeny. The dumplings were so good I could have eaten a dozen of them alone. I was in chicken soup heaven. Next time I will try it with the fat noodles just because. Unfortunately,  my only gripe is that they use breast meat for the chicken, and it was tough, but I shoved it aside and devoured the rest of the yumminess. The queen d golden special. Lol!  oh, and I loved how the broth was packed separate from everything else. So I could make my portions as big or small as I wanted when reheating separately.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: A new favorite in my neighborhood.I LOVE Ramen.  But sometimes I don't want Ramen Ramen I want like Ramen, but different.  That's what this place is.  And it's WONDERFUL.My girlfriend and I were looking for late night (9:15 PM on a Friday) grub, and I remembered there were a bunch of places nearer to my casa on Adams I hadn't gone to yet.  They were open, and not too busy, but people were eating and having fun.  So we stopped.I got the Spicy Beef Noodles, my vegetarian GF got their Rice Noodles.  they were EXCELLENT with huge portions and just the right amount of spice.THe meat and veggies were plentiful as well and really well cooked.The atmosphere is just like a ramen place, only maybe a little more laid back and upbeat.  The decor is post-modern and lovely.Will be coming back, thanks!
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Loved my first time here. We were treated to a complimentary appetizer upon being seated. I believe it was the beef in chili sauce. Pan fried dumplings were crispy on the outside and juice on the inside. For my main I tried the Chengdu Zajiang Noodle with low spice and low numbing. The dish was so flavorful I devoured the whole thing. I appreciated the gentle numbing of the mild option (standard for the dish is high per the menu). The iced mungbean tea was the perfect accompaniment to the meal. Reasonable prices, flavorful dishes, come give this spot a try! Street parking only.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Great spot in Culver area if you're looking for that malaa spice! Lots of great options and everything was really tasty. The Chengdu noodles were very tasty, but my favorite was the Beef Noodle soup! Broth was flavorful, and meat was very tender. My party got seated fairly quickly and the food came out pretty quick! There's also instructions on how to order and what the different spice levels are which were very helpful.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: I went here for lunch with a friend on a Monday afternoon. The service was really fast and our food came out only a few minutes after ordering.We both ordered the spicy beef soup noodles and wow were they great. The beef was extremely tender and everything was so tasty. It was a bit on the salty side but I still really enjoyed me dish. It was quite large and lasted me two meals.There is only street parking, which can be tough as it is located on a street with a dead end. I found 1 hour street parking on Adams.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Service was good but food was pretty disappointing.Pork chili oil chaoshou (2/5): The wrapper had a gummy, plushy texture and lacked a snap, which is a sign the dough was underworked. Pork filling was so-so, marinade is heavy on the cooking wine. I've had better frozen dumplings tbh.Chengdu Zajiang Noodles (4/5): We enjoyed the level of spice and numbness but it was pretty oily.Spare Rib Noodles (1/5): Awful. I get that Szechuan cuisine is heavy on the oil but this was smothered in a half inch layer of oil. We could barely taste anything besides oil. Rice noodles were undercooked, but also weren't rinsed with cool water after cooking so they were really sticky. Spare ribs were tender but didn't have much meat on them.During the meal we realized this was the same chain as the San Gabriel location and both are equally lackluster. Unfortunately I really doubt that any Szechuan food enthusiast would recommend this spot.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Captivated by the graffiti dragon art inside, we opted for Spicy Beef Soup Noodles and spicy wonton soup. The beef noodle soup stood out with its tasty, flavorful broth and soft, chewy noodles. It featured beef, soybean sauce, green onions, coriander, celery, and baby bok choy. While the meat had a slight firmness, it remained delicious.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Not very busy on a Saturday afternoon. We sat by their floor to ceiling glass walls overlooking a busy street.The noodle and soup qualities are both good. Nothing amazing, but this places seems to deliver reliable flavor. So it's my new go-to for Chinese noodle dishes.Pretty uncomfortable, angular wooden seats though.
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Went for my birthday. It's a cute spot with nice art work on the outside that matches the inside. The service was great and the waiter was on point. The food was ok. My wife had a spicy beef noodle soup but there was no spice there. I had the clear broth beef noodle and it was missing something. Overall I would go back to this spot
Address: 5263 W Adams Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90016

Comment: Excellent service and ambience. Cynthia took great care of us. I am so happy they reopened after closing during the pandemic.We had the steak tartare, diver scallops, duck liver, soba with shitake, pork jowl, cavatelli pasta with crabs and pecorino cheese. Everything was great including the sour cream panacotta dessert, which was heavenly. Side bread was also good i had to ask for more (Extra bread was $3 though, which I felt was unnecessary). Most outstanding were the steak tartare, pork jowl, and sour cream panacotta with blueberries.I would definitely come back for the cheeseburger available only during the 8:30-10pm happy hour, it looked very scrumptious.Heck even the bathroom was beautiful & clean, and kept clean too.Minus 1 star cause of two things:1) 4% "kitchen love" mandatory fee is ridiculous; it insinuates we're lousy tippers. The $3 for extra 2-small pieces bread, again, isn't so cool too.2) Portioning was too small, it's like a serving a bunny lol!
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Always dope when the bartender remembers you! Danny is the man. Great vibes great drinksDon't need a menu, I'm just here to drink. Packed house, full of happy people. You won't regret that green drink with the foam!
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: My new fave cocktail bar. Food is fab. Highly recommend aguachile hamachi, steak tartar and crab pasta. Drinks are fantastic-- love the mezcal watermelon drink and marg w foam. Service was wonderful-- highly recommend
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Amazing bartenders! The food is fabulous and the place is so cute. Parking can be tricky but there's a valet lot next door, and it gets crowded so come early!
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Cute spot, delicious food, but portions left much to be desired! Maybe it's because I'm not used to smaller portions, but generally expected more on each plate.With that said I loved the flavor in each dish. Standouts to me were the beef tartare (savory flavor especially with the aioli spread) and the yellowtail collar! Also loved the scallops.Service was wonderful! Our server was very attentive.I just wish everything I ordered doubled in size as that to me would have matched up with the cost of each dish (hence 2 stars off for lack in value and for leaving me hungry). I think in order to feel adequately satiated, you would need to spend $80-100 on dishes  per person (not including tip, not including drinks).I still recommend trying this place but perhaps only go for a light meal!
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I had just finished ranting about how good is expensive and nothing is very memorable when I stepped into HLAY for dinner that night. I was blown away by everything I ordered and their cocktails. Ratio me 1:1 is a super refreshing light drink that tastes like juice and understood the assignment was a smoky savory cocktail. I loved both! The squash salad was THE BEST, the diver scallops was an interesting take on chili mango (imo), pork jowl was amazing and tender, and the crab cavatelli was insane. Service was great and the ambiance is unexpected on a corner in k town. There are unique decorations everywhere that make it fun and quirky. I will definitely be coming back to try more and partake in their happy hour that's 8:30-10:30 nightly!
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The food and drinks were really good, but the portions? Not so much. I understand that it's a shared small-plates restaurant, but it breaks my heart a little to pay $28 for really thinly sliced hamachi on a plate the size of my hand.I came here mainly for the duck liver and steak tartare, and both were on point with the seasoning and flavors.- Steak tartare: The spices in this gave the dish an extra crispy kick to it that tartares usually miss out on, which was really nice. The steak itself was really soft and really easy to eat by the spoonful and spreading it on the bread, which was also really good.- Duck liver with chips: Their newest iteration (no longer with bread). I really liked the coconut caramel glaze they put on top, but I wish there was more duck liver so that I don't have to skimp when I'm spreading it on the chips.- Tsukune: A little less seasoned and a little more bouncy/chewy (like fish balls) than I would have liked.- Hamachi: The flavors didn't really meld together for some reason, and I could only taste the hamachi even though it was seasoned with fresh herbs, cucumbers, and aguachile.The cocktails matched up with the better food items really well:- Ratio Me 1:1: The melon foam was slightly too sweet, and needed the drink to balance it out. It was really good still.- That Sh*t Bussin': This tasted like Thai coconut curry in a good way. A tiny bit spiced, coconutty, and satisfyingly savory while still sweet.A note about pacing: I was slightly disappointed that the tsukune came out 1 minute after the steak tartare, so there was a sacrifice in taste when we ate the room-temperature tsukune since we wanted to eat the tartare with the bread when it was still warm and crispy. Maybe I'm being a little picky, but I wanted to taste everything at it's best.A lot of other reviewers would agree by saying that the portions are really small, and I would suggest the restaurant to take in the feedback since their menu changes daily, meaning that things can change based off of customer feedback. Their servers are really nice, but I wish their small business would take in the feedback that I've been seeing quite consistently across reviewers.
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This was my first time at this spot. I don't know why I've always thought that this was a cafe but it's actually a really vibe-y restaurant.Music is hip, but not too loud, drinks are frikin UH-MAZING, huge shoutout to Danny and Damian. They walked me through the drink menu, super knowledgeable and well versed (the drink names are HILARIOUS) ((see attached photo)) . I tried the Ratio 1:1 which is crazyyy- never tasted anything like this before 10/10 recommend !!! Christine was a great host, quick service, and Marc (who i think is the manager) was really attentive ((not just to me but the whole restaurant)).The space itself is not that big but the way the tables are set up is really roomy and you don't have to worry about elbow room. Lighting is perfect, service is perfect, vibes are perfect- you couldn't ask for anything more.
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food was great! Tasted delicious I could tell they were made with quality ingredients by a quality chef. I would not recommend coming for dinner, because I just can't see how you get enough food for the price to fill you up. I think this place thrives in the "stop by for a fancy cocktail and have a few shared dishes before heading to the show". I came with an appetite and I definitely paid for it. But quality if price wasn't a concern!Service was great! They check up on you and keep your table clean. All the staff were super great.Ambiance felt cool, kind of like a hidden gem vibe. The seating I got didn't have the best lighting so I really didn't feel any of the pics of the food I got tbh haha.All in all I think the highlight was the food. They got $10 valet in the back, not a ton of parking otherwise
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: One of the best meals I've ever had in LA!  Extraordinary service (thanks Elliot) and incredibly interesting food that bursts with flavor. Every dish tells a unique story. I'm excited to go back and try more. Oh... and best playlist of any restaurant period!!!Must go back for the special late night happy hour menu too!Make a reservation now!  Thank me later.
Address: 3901 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The place to go to if you're looking for the most authentic ddeokbokki ‍ suitable for all ages and taste buds :)
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Food - meh. Service - meh.There are much better places for tteokbokki than here. The tteokbokki is meh but they charge you a lot for it and for the toppings you want. I do not recommend this place.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: So excited to visit.. Unfortunately overrated & overpriced..Flavor was just plain, so were side dishes.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Their tteokboki tastes actually a way better than any other Korean chains like yup dduk, and the staff is very friendly, but their ordering and sitting system is  so inefficient and confusing.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: I had the most heartbreaking experience today. Quick backtrack my partner and I found out about this restaurant on insta.... We've come over 12 times driving 45 min and spending $70+ each time. The food is amazing, the flavor the spice everything is there! You can't deny that! But today the person taking my order misunderstood me (it happens) and added extra to my order. I let her know within 2 min that the order was incorrect . They brought the food out regardless but the server said "the first time it's okay, the next time it's not". After visiting so many times that all the workers recognize me it was really unfortunate to hear such a unnecessary comment.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: My friend and I decided to give this a try over the weekend! Keep in mind it's located in a plaza with another famous cafe so parking can be hard to find if it's a busy time. The waitresses were super sweet and greeted everyone with a smile. Make sure to order your food before you sit down.It was busy as soon as it opened (12pm!) they don't have that many tables but it's great for groups of 4!If you're craving the chewy long 떡 this is a great place. It's a bit on the pricer side as our toppings came out to 6.49.. if you dine in you can get as many toppings as you want but beware the price is by weight. our total came out to 36.99 no drinks included for our main dish and side.We got spicy level two and for me it was the perfect amount of spice if you can handle it. My friend however could not and was slightly struggling.I wish they gave us 반찬 to help cool off the heat. At least pickled radish.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Halgatteok LA offers a delightful variety of traditional Korean rice cakes that are both flavorful and beautifully presented. The menu showcases a range of options, from sweet to savory, providing a range of culinary experience.I ordered the Mayak Gimbap (8 Pcs) + Jjajang Tteokbokki + Sweet Potatoe Tempura.While trying out the Jajangmyeon Dukkboki at this restaurant, I found the rice cakes to be good, though the overall dish wasn't exactly stellar. The black bean sauce had an expected flavor, but I would recommend ordering the regular flavored Dukkboki.The highlight of my order turned out to be the Mayak Gimbap. The Gimbap was incredibly enjoyable, with a perfect balance of flavors and textures. The rice was well-seasoned, and the fillings were fresh and delicious. While the Jajangmyeon Dukkboki was good, the unexpected delight of the Gimbap made the meal enjoyable.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Delicious food and amazing prices.But the staff aren't so friendly and a little bit rude.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Really easy to order and you get to add additional rice cakes, sausages, and fish cakes which is weigh. The portions are already big by themselves so be careful not to get too carried away when adding additional items. The had a great selection of sides to order as well. The only downside is they got my order mixed up with my friend's order. Other than that, it's a good place to check out!
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: A really solid spot for tteokbokki in ktown! We had the rose tteokbokki and the sauce was savory and flavorful. We also ordered the fish cake gimpbap and it paired really nicely. There is a self serve bar where you can pick your own toppings and I highly recommend adding the thick glass noodle because it added a great texture! This spot is a bit pricier but everything was delicious. I came on a weekday late night and paid $3 for valet parking in their lot.
Address: 3524 W 8th St Los Angeles, CA 90005

Comment: Stopped at new spot at original farmers market off Fairfax called thicc burgers. Staff are were very friendly and knowledgeable on their menu. Ordered the lil og burger. Meat was juicy and flavorful. Alittle pink inside so make sure ask for well done if that's how u you ou like it. Wish it had pickles. It's very tiny but hit the spot. We also ordered the big og! Thicc fires were just ok. Taste frozen could be at little longer in the fryer. Everything was clean tables along inside and outside of market. Would stop again if I'm in the area.
Address: 6333 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: I love this place. Its cute, well lit and clean. Service is excellent. menu is small and easy to order. Burgers were juicy/delicious and fries were tasty.  Competitive price points and Validated parking at FARMERS MARKET. Give them a shot!
Address: 6333 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90036

Comment: You can't make a reservation! They do not answer the phone. I tried to go in and make a reservation, but they told me  to make a reservation on the online. Online is also problem.  I end up to give them a tip for a table, then everything is possible.
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Currently a hot and trendy place to go out to. Let me start off my saying the place is beautiful and the roof top is gorgeous. Great places to take photos, there are 3 levels. Our waitress was great and good but the service was slow the night we went, Thursday. So let's get to food. Ordered a skinny, spicy margarita was great. We shared everything and had the focaccia and burrata salad which was so delicious. We ordered the caccio de Pepe and a red pasta and they were a bit disappointing, not hi g amazing and small portion. But the chocolate hazelnut dessert was amazing. A must. The manager did cover our dessert and some drinks due to the slow service. So maybe next time it'll be better.
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Funke Yeah!  If you can get a res, order all the things and revel in the great service, delicious everything paired w unique wine list and order all the suggestions, especially the focaccia. You're welcome!
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: This review is in regards to the rooftop bar that is walk-in only. I had higher expectations of this place overall. The move top was nice, surrounded by many hedges, and to be expected many people over a typical Los Angeles scene. Although it seem like it could be a nice place to grab a drink at, The food was not as good as I expected it to be in pricey. The tuna tartare was probably the best thing on the limited menu, price at $38. They have a limited selection of pizza. You can order at the rooftop as well that are not listed on the menu, and tonight they had a lemon pizza. It was different and tasty, lemon, slightly overpowering, but the pizza was burnt, and there were some parts of it you really couldn't eat. We ordered one of the focaccias as well, and it was way too salty, and possibly a little too oily, although it was fluffy. Lastly, we ordered the Arancini, just be sure to know it has ham in it, which we didn't realize. It's funny for such a nice place that at the bottom of the Arancini plate they put almost Pizza Hut Parmesan sprinkles. The music was loud, rap music, and as much as I love rap music, it didn't really seem to go with the place and almost made it seem like the place was trying to hard. At max, I would return here for a drink, but I was otherwise unimpressed, and didn't see the hype compared to all the other great places LA has to offer. As a sidenote, they said the rooftop would have a view, and I wouldn't really count it as much of a view.
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Beautiful dining experience with delicious food and excellent service.Thank you Leslie for making our experience memorable and wonderful.
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: I had first come without a resy so had a drink at the rooftop was kinda mediocre.  Months later I did make a reservation...it was a nice civilized experience.  The lower dining room is nice and not too loud to have a conversation with your dinner guest.  My favorite dish was the linguine vongole (clams) but everything else was delicious and perfectly done.  Artichokes/carciufo recommended too...those were delish!
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: 3 floors...Really pretty new restaurant in the heart of BEVERLY Hills.  Great rooftop ambiance.  Easy to get to roof area without reservations.  I already ate prior so wasn't able to try the food but appears pricey even for Beverly Hills standards.   There's a counter/bar area on 2nd floor as well that appears to serve food.... ...I will be back to dine soon.
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: last night we had dinner at the bar. everything was fine until I asked for a decaf coffee, they said they didn't have decaf coffee but can serve decaf espresso , unfortunately it wasn't because I was awake till 3.00  AM. So you should know they don't serve decaf  coffe or decaf espresso, but they never tell you that.
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Everything about Funke  is wonderful except the pasta is so al dente that you can hardly chew it. I've asked to have my pasta more well done and apparently the chef refuses to do it. There's al dente and then there's a dent today. Besides, if a customer requests it a little more cooked, what's the big deal?
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Friendly greeters, clean beautiful balance of glass and wood decor. Elegant wine display. Dishes were rich and flavorful. Knowledgeable server who displayed confidence and effort to provide the best pairings for our meal. Most respect for Chef Evan Funke for his recommendations.
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: amazing food and service, we set at the bar and loved it !  Thank you for your hospitality
Address: 9388 S Santa Monica Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90210

Comment: Food was great, cocktails good, nothing different from what other Korean pochas have to offer. Guess it was overwhelming with all the commotion and games going on. There is a lot going on and it can get pretty intense and loud to the point where it's hard to hear the person you're talking to across the table. Definitely a hot spot for many people.
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: If you plan to dine at Chi Chi LA, remember this: Reservation is a must! This place gets incredibly busy on weekends, and it's no wonder why. Chi Chi LA is a restaurant like no other, offering an extraordinary blend of dining and entertainment.The atmosphere on a weekend night is positively vibrant and bustling. The reason? Well, it's all thanks to the special feature at every table - the personal ordering devices. These nifty gadgets aren't just for placing your food orders; they're a gateway to a world of fun and games.Each table has its own ordering device, which not only allows you to select your dishes but also provides a variety of interactive games. You can enjoy mini-games by yourself or challenge other tables. There are even spontaneous group challenges initiated by the restaurant. Plus, there's a chat room where you can strike up conversations with diners at other tables.Now, onto the food. Chi Chi LA offers a tasty menu, though portions are on the smaller side. The flavors are delightful, and I highly recommend trying their flavored Soju cocktails. They come with eye-catching glowing lights and adorable duck decorations that add a cute touch to your dining experience.The only drawback is that engaging in conversation can be a bit challenging due to the continuous sounds of excitement from people playing games all around you. But if you're here for a fun and interactive dining adventure, this might not bother you too much.
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This is a great place to go if you want to just chill and hang out! If you are wanting to have an intimate one on one here, definitely not the place to go though. The music was loud so it was pretty hard to hear each other (what you expect from a popping bar) and they have different music genre depending on the day.We went on a Saturday and it was definitely packed. Make sure to put your name in the waitlist and head to the back to chill until your name is called. You can buy drinks outside as well while you wait.Once inside, the food was okay but the concept is amazing! Being able to play against strangers for drinks was fun. Everything is done through the tablet; from games, extra services like water refills, to the bill. Definitely would come back again!
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Very lively and fun place. More meant for singles and party type of people I'd say. Limited parking since it's LA but they do have valet. There was a wait since it was Friday night and it was also consider edm night. Each night is a differ genre but it's listed in the front of the door. There is a back outdoor patio to hang out while you wait to get seated inside and also a bar too. The cool thing about this place is there is a tablet on each table and you can play against another table for drink/bottle of your choice and if you win they pay for it. There are also some claw machine games too! Service was okay had to ask multi times for things.
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: A new spot in Ktown that has been trending recently! The wait is usually long. Reservations can only be made before 8 pm. There's an outdoor waiting area, upstairs with claw machines, and lower bottom area. Each table has a tablet for you to order drinks, food, and play games for prizes. You can chat with other tables and play games to win drinks. The concept is different and the atmosphere is very clubby. It's fun to go in big groups to drink.
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Ordered spicy rice cake with brisket and wings. It was....very below average. Wings were similar to grocery store frozen stuff. Rice cake sauce was honestly grainy and also tasted like instant stuff:( did not hit the spot
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I didn't order food so no comments on that (except they were really pricey$$$)Came for the games and drinks and a fun time AND THATS WHAT WE GOTI've never been to a pocha with this concept before so it was unique! The tablet games are interactive-- you can play games with other tables (KEEP IN MIND YOURE BETTING ON REAL MENU ITEMS so if you lose you're paying for that bargained item that's going to another table). So you're basically gambling while getting drunk, worst combo ever lolMy advice is to go towards the end of their happy hour, order most of the alcohol for your party (for half the prices) and find a good seat and let the fun beginsThey also host an all-tables interactive game every now and then for everyone to play, and winner gets prizes!Great place to drink, listen to loud music, meet friends
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: BIG FAT FAIL!I wanted to try this place since it had great ratings. Idk where the ratings came from. The menu for food was limited, and so were the drinks. The food was edible but nothing to rave about. This place is a drinking establishment that had loud EDM music on a Friday night. I don't mind EDM, but it would have been nice to have a mixture of EDM music or different DJ sets. This establishment is basically catered to the younger crowd...Now... onto the staff. The staff here are the worst ever. Rude rude rude... I can't believe someone would hire such rude people. If it's our first time, please take the time to explain to us how to order. If there is a discrepancy on the bill, be courteous enough to respond without attitude. I asked what the 16.99 for Seoro was for on my bill. They said it was for games. First off, 1 game should not be 16.99 and Seoro is soju... So I paid for a bottle of soju I never got. Anyways, I just paid it and left. I won't ever be back here! Worst experience ever~
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Such a fun little Pocha in Ktown!I live in Ktown and have been to most of the popular pochas. This one is definitely the hot "new kid in town" for the younger generation.The crowd is mixed, and you get to chat with other tables through the machine which is a lot of fun.The only complaint is that it can get pretty loud, and the food selection is not large enough. We didn't want to keep ordering fried food but that's what they had.Great spot, will be back.
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The vibe is very much hunting pocha! If you want to make new friends, this would be a perfect place to get to know people, play games together, and share drinks as well. The service is really nice, the servers are cute. The food is a little bit highly priced, but considering it's in LA, I think it's pretty good. The food tastes good.
Address: 610 S Berendo St Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: margarita flights was so bomb the tacos was bomb I had a steak taco sweet and sour chicken was bomb good service everything was good I'm goin back
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: It was very cozy. Only outside seating but weather was nice and not too hot to seat out. The food was yummy and the waiter was very friendly and attentive.
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Tu Madre is a must visit every time i come to West Hollywood.. food is consistent, authentic, and the vibe is legit
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Stumbled upon this gem. Delicious food and presentation, and a good vibe all around. The patio is beautiful and aesthetically pleasing.
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Wonderful service  and the spot is very clean and also very good food. I highly recommend this spot.
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Came here a few years ago and the food/drinks were incredible. I was excited to come back for their street tacos and margarita flight and was very disappointed. Food was subpar - none of our food was hot and it lacked flavor. Drinks were decent. Only positive was our server who was friendly and attentive.
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Not baby friendly. No available ramp to wheel in a stroller. The host had to help me lift my stroller. My baby needed a change so I went to their restroom and it was dirty, smelled horrible and there was no changing table. The server told me there was a table in the bathroom where I could lay and change my baby. This was a very small table where any baby could easily roll out of. Sounds like a lawsuit waiting to happen. I came here on a holiday (Labor Day) for brunch. I specifically wanted Huevos Rancheros and since I saw them in the yelp menu photos I was pretty happy they offered them and the place had great reviews. When I arrived I asked for them and was told that they do not have them, nor had they ever served them..that maybe I confused the restaurant with another of similar name. But no, it's on their yelp. Lastly, there were a lot of flies around. You had to keep fighting the flies to stop them from trying to stand on your food. Very uncomfortable experience. The food we ended up eating was decent but the overall experience was not ok.
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Love this place! The vibes are great and so are the Margaritas!! Tip: you have to get the pitcher!! It comes in such a beautiful display--so instagrammable!!  And so good!! Also the food is amazing :)
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Loved their bowls ( I had the shrimp bowl!!) and my group ordered delicious mocktails that were just sublime. Definitely returning for more of their yummy food soon
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: My shrimp burrito was so salty it was inedible , the rice in the burrito was crunchy from undercooking (I hope that wasn't a choice)
Address: 1111 N Hayworth Ave West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I think cozy and moody are good words to describe this place... its a small space but gives off a really classy atmosphere. Be prepared to wait a little before seating as there are only a few tables and some spaces at the bar. Cocktails were refeshing. The food was an odd mix of burgers and sushi, but both were done equally very well. A great spot to get a bite with a friend mid week or fill that burger craving.
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: Ambiance was awesome. Really loved the vibe. Also, the food was excellent! I'd definitely would come back again.
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: Great atmosphere, service on top! Chicken sandwich is what they are known for, however seafood and sushi were also good
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: Nate and Jordan and the entire team are simply the best in service! It's hard to find a place with superior service, great food, noteworthy wine list, and incredible cocktails. We'll sure miss this place when we move, but glad to have had a place with a nice sunny sidewalk sipping spot and some really delicious fare.This was the 1st time my husband didn't order the fried chicken sandwich (still rated his fave in all of LA). We always get the deliver eggs and tried the tuna sandwich this time. Fries also always a must have.The sushi is memorable and you must try the fries with the super special salt! Thank you Chef and to the entire kitchen for the beautiful bites! Cheers.
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: Hands down one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I have had in LA. The crew is always friendly and attentive. I love the vibes, specially at the bar, having me a whiskey sour.
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: Love honor bar. Great spot for lunch with quality food and service every time. Can definitely get a bit noisy especially for meetings
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: Could not stress enough - stay far away from this restaurant!! The staff is extremely rude and unpleasant.  I had put my name down on the waitlist and went next door for a drink and waited over an hour. I called to check in on where we stood in line and was told they tried to contact me and I didn't answer. Turns out they took down the wrong phone number. They proceeded to tell me I was re-added to the list and there are 3 parties in front of me even though it was there mistake. When I asked to be put first she raised her voice and told me she is the manager and could deny me service. Unfortunately after this conversation I had no choice but to still eat there since it was already 9:30pm. Our waitress was very nice up until she charged my credit card twice, brought me two sign here receipts and did not even say anything about her mistake. I had to call back 3 times to get anyone who actually listened to me and finally returned my money. Stay far far far away!
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: Best food and good service  I recommend the chicken sandwich and the sushi everything is delicious there
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: amazing bar on a roof top with a amazing view.great cocktails,great bar but prices are a bit high ,but worth what you are paying for .
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: This is one of the of my favorite places to come eat. Their chicken sandwich is to die for. Their sushi is amazing as well. You can't go wrong at this place!
Address: 122 S Beverly Dr Beverly Hills, CA 90212

Comment: THIS PLACE IS A NIGHTMARE/FRAUD! I placed an order on a Friday at 11p, not knowing they were closed already. Arrived by 11:30 to pick up my "order" and the lights were off and they were closed. Over the last week I have gotten the run around on the phone on refunding my order that I never received and refusing to let me speak with the owner. I have finally filed fraud charges on my debit card. BE WARNED
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: We went there around lunch time on a Saturday, they had a parking lot so it was easy to park. They also had an outdoor sitting area. We ordered Manti and a breakfast sandwich with coffee. They only had one server at the time, and the food took 30 mins to come out, which was way too long for a breakfast place. They also forgot about our coffee so it came out after the food.The breakfast sandwich was like a premium quality for a McDonald's Sandwich and Manti was $25 and the amount of food I got was so tiny that I was still hungry after. Also Manti needed more seasonings because it was just the taste of the sauce.Ambiance is nice for family meal but I wouldn't come back again for the food.Service was very friendly.
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Delicious food! Great fresh falafel and gyros. Tried the yogurt soup and it was delicious! The thing is amazing! Turks waiting for health to cool down)
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: They were out of a lot of things on their menu, but didn't seem to know this before taking orders. The server seemed annoyed at having to go get the menus again because we didn't know what we wanted instead of our original order. Afterward he seemed annoyed the whole time he was serving us. The food itself was mediocre for the price. While the atmosphere was very chill, I would not eat here again.
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Really tasty egg dishes on the menu. Delicious. Excellent lavender latte. Very cordial service. Hookah at outside seating if that's your thing. Highly recommended for breakfast or brunch. I went once and returned a week later. It's that good.
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Racist spot with terrible food all mislabeled to appeal to the masses. This is not real Armenian food at all and is made incorrectly.LA has so many great Armenian/Middle Eastern spots it would be a shame to ever go back here.
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Top notch food, nice inside and outside. Bonus: they have a bakery. Best in So Cal. Authentic food and friendly service.
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Great Mediterranean restaurant , the food is delicious and freshly made. The ambiance and service is great as well, definitely a place to come back.
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Food is fantastic, presentation shows they want to make a good impression, service friendly and welcoming. better than I was expecting. middle eastern ambiance. nice.
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Wow !! Falafel plate is incredible!! And the rice omg so fresh full bodied and buttery. Tzatziki the best I've tasted! My husband's lamb kabob was outstanding! Oooo delicious cheese pastry roll!! We are hooked. Please try the strawberry lemonade!! This place is a keeper!
Address: 6258 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Management has 0 experience! Staff is rude and they choose who they want to let in and who they don't! Your basically going off the mood the manager and door person are in. I've been here once prior and the same waiters are rude no one is happy to be working! Then go get another job!!!Complete trash!
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Nice place with trash employees making it a 3 star restaurant at best. Only if they would get rid of the current staff maybe this place could turn around.
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Finally a restaurant that doesn't allow kids! If I'm paying high end prices, I expect high end experience . And yes that means no kids running around, throwing tantrums while parents aren't giving a sh1t, playing loud cartoons,movies on their tablets. That's what Chuck E. Cheese is for.
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: The Staffing is unprofessional in particular the hosting staff so it gets you off to a bad start. They are far from seasoned and keep you waiting and ignore seating requests.My Mother is undergoing chemo and we had specifically booked outdoor seating but they only accommodated indoor seating. We had explained the situation at the time of booking as well as on arrival.The design of the place is bright and lovely and the food is more than decent.If you can allow for the untrained hostesses not to bug the hell out of you, then you should give the place a shot.
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Bad service all around mediocre food. Pretty looking restaurant could not uphold the horrible service. The staff definitely needs to be replaced. Retraining is not an option given how they treat patrons. Whenever you go to restaurants as such in LA you can always expect to run into that one or two staff members who thinks they are better than the rest of the world and definitely don't want to be there, sadly every single employee at casa Madera manages to have that same attitude. Save your $$$ take your business else where unless you enjoy being disrespected and looked down upon ... someone needs to contact the department of consumer affairs so the owners can be contacted about the current situation of their business.
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Had reservations but was told they over booked however there were tons of tables available.Alie the manager was unhelpful ends up telling me that  my niece who's 13 months has a lazy eye and they weren't going to serve us.Will not be coming back.
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: I was just there and was blown away by the staff! Everyone was professional and made us feel special! Only negative was the rude customer next to us making a scene. Top notch!
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: I prefer street vendor tacos. Not sure who came up with this Mexican/Mediterranean style. Food was too average for my taste given the prices they have but is WH so it's kinda expected.  Service was average waited a little too long for someone to acknowledge us and take drink orders. It's a cute place, I'll give it that but I'm not going back for the photo ops. It just doesn't grab you as a good restaurant anywhere in LA should. ‍.
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: If I could give zero stars I would! Allie the manager will kickYou out if you have children! It's disgusting! Did they not see what happens when you discriminate against people? And she wants to discriminate against a family???? Their food is average nothing to be desired but it had a somewhat nice decor, the service HOLY cow is worth nothing zero stars! Do not recommend!
