Management is even worse!!!! Allie the manager will ensure you get kicked out or ignored if you don't fit her idea of the perfect ascetics! So forget this place if you are a family or notDressed as she thinks is hip! Lol sooo sad! There are many other places to try in la that welcome families do not go here!!!!
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Absolutely terrible place, probably the most overrated in all of LA. You'd have to be a sucker to go here
Address: 8440 Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Food took an hour, servers were nice when you have an opportunity to even say anything to them.Maybe they were short staffed but it doesnt excuse why all the food was so salty. We ordered a ceviche and seafood paella. You can see the salt crystals when peeling the rice back
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Rosaline is fairly energy-filled two-room restaurant that generally boasts different vibes depending on whether you are dining inside or in their inside garden. I usually prefer the garden although inside you can watch the kitchen do their magic. Having said that, if you join Rosaline for a meal be prepared to be sitting as close t your fellow diners as you can imagine, and participate in side bar conversations around you as they get louder and louder with the drinks progressing.I love their bar but find their cocktails to be unimaginative and bland. Even classic cocktails are not properly represented so I prefer to skip them.Food-wise, given the Peruvian theme of the restaurant there are tons of ceviches. Some are nice, but the ceviche crocante for example is pretty poor and delivered like a surrealist painting where the artist dropped a bunch of ingredients otherwise intended for different appetizers on a large plate. The dressing and zest in it was also under- and over-powering at the same time. I also disliked the coquettes but mostly because of their generalized unseasonedness.The octopus - despite traditionally a favorite dish of mine, here probably wins the spot of worst-in-town. It was overcooked but not in a chewy way; rather, it was an extra dose mushy. The tentacle had similar texture to Haribo gummy bears, so we left 2/3 of it.The scallops were probably the best dish of the bunch, and I thought the toasted quinoa on top with the sauce worked really well. Though again as before, they were a bit overcooked as well.In the end, while I have at previous visits enjoyed the family style paella, I would probably stop going to Rosaline. I had quite the underwhelming experience, service, and ended up getting a check with 20% tip automatically added, so maybe that's why service is a bit low-effort type.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: I love Peruvian food, I got to know it well in the 6 years I lived there. I was very excited for the chaufa paella and greatly disappointed when I got to experience it. Presentation was great, service was good, this dish was so Smokey in flavor I thought I was eating campfire tinder. I understand that one of the ingredients on it was bagoong, it's a fermented fish paste... our dish must have been lathered in it. O don't mind a little bit of Smokey flavor in my meals, but that was all we were able to taste. I almost always leave a plate clean, and if I don't leave it clean, I take the rest to go. Left more than half of this plate, I didn't take anymore home and expressed to our waitress it was so insanely Smokey it was inedible for both my partner and I. For a $49 dish I thought it was insulting, let alone the lack of care and attention when asked about the dish and informed our waitress that it was insanely smokey and rough on the palate. This occurred Friday 8/26 and our reservation was for 6:30pm, Rosaline was not busy by this time.The drinks were good, the paiche (jungle trout) was pretty good, and the atmosphere was lovely... I enjoyed basking under all the plants. However, the chaufa was rough, not sure if I could return here looking to enjoy an authentic Peruvian dish, and I'd humbly suggest the chef be informed of this if he wasn't the night we dined there.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Best paella spot!!! Service is attentive. Ambiance romantic and super cute patio! Also recommend the ceviche!
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Be careful ordering drinks here.  The food was great, but I found glass at the bottom of my cocktail just as we were wrapping up dinner.  I avoided saying anything since I was with clients and did not want to make a scene but it was extremely unpleasant to think you are biting into ice and instead find small bits of glass.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Beautiful interior with a nice date night ambiance, located in the Melrose area with street parking available close by. The tapas were alright, lots of random options like scallops with cheese (nice presentation but interesting combo of flavors that I wouldn't expect together) or olives or peppers etc. that don't seem that appetizing for filling. The grilled octopus was a tiny serving for the price. Paella was not as traditional as other options I've had in California but definitely saved the meal for us in terms of flavor and portions; but it took about 50 minutes. The service was super spotty even though they automatically include a 20% service charge for parties of any size. Took about 15 min for a server to bring us water and even greet us after we were seated, then halfway through our server changed after a long time without any attention. This spot is definitely somewhere you come for the ambiance/decor but not so much for the food or experience of dining.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Food was very delicious. Ambiance was modern. Service was OK. However, I was not aware that they charge 20% service fee (tip) + they tax me on the tip. This would have been OK if we had received a 20% tip worthy service. But we didn't because the server knew he is receiving a 20% tip no matter what kind of service he provides. I felt really bad for the table sitting next to us. They received absolutely no service. I will not visit this establishment again.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: This place was wonderful. Great atmosphere with a great service staff. Our kids tried a bunch of new food and loved every minute of it. Definitely recommend.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Delicious food, (ceviche and salads are excellent) , beautiful dining area. Service was okay. Cocktails are not impressive but do the job. Paella pretty good. All in all a decent experience and decent value considering current prices. Recommended.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: This is one of our favorite restaurants in Los Angeles and has been for a while.Well, they just got better. Starting on July 19th they started Happy Hour service from 5-7, every day I think! We went last night to check it out and it was amazing. The small bites are crazy good, as good as their regular menu, just scaled down. Really, the best Happy Hour food we've ever tasted. The HH wine was really good as well as the Guava Divina, a tequila cocktail.It's a beautiful space and the staff is exceptional.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Rosaline is easily one of the best restaurants in Los Angeles.  My wife and I have been coming since they opened in 2017.  We're a short walk away and enjoy making a special night of it every 3-4 weeks.  Their paellas are wonderful, tasty and great to share.  But lately we're hooked on the costillas, short ribs with grilled figs and apple coleslaw.  It gives new meaning to meat, tender and flavorful.  We combine that with the camarones, grilled wild caught prawns  with an amazing salsa.  A perfect meal.But equally important is the hospitality and service at Rosaline.  The whole staff is attentive, friendly and accommodating.Cocktails are killer, wine list is strong.  Like I said, one of the best restaurants in Los Angeles in a beautiful venue.
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Ate here last night and it was amazing!We've eaten here a few times when they first opened but haven't been back for some time.We ordered and shared the seafood chaufa paella, causita crocante and pimentones.  Check out the online menu for exactly what these dishes entail.The paella was cooked perfect and the flavors exciting.  Rosaline is a beautiful space and the menu is interesting and flavorful.If you think you've had a bit too much of steak houses, pasta and chicken, break out of your rut and try this Peruvian gem!
Address: 8479 Melrose Ave West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: A great place in K-town to come with a group.  Portions are on the large size which is why I recommend coming with a group. Prices aren't bad considering the portion size.  My favorite item is their crab & seafood pasta.  So good!  The braised beef ribs (galbi jjim) is also tasty and great dish to share. The sauce on the tomahawk pork chop katsu is a little to sweet for my taste. The rose Seoul night Tteok Ppoki is a yummy bowl of comfort, it has a combination of rice cakes, dumplings, fish cakes and noodles in a mildly spicy creamy gochujang sauce.  I've noticed a lot of different restaurants by chef Kang  come and go,  I hope this place stays!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Got a groupon and wanted to check this place out, since Chef Kang has a reputation.I got the octopus and the cheese corn. There were complimentary tortilla chips dusted in sugar (a bit too sweet for me) with pico de gallo. The pico was not fresh and was underwhelming. I'd give 3 stars for the octopus. It was plated beautifully, but the sauce and accompanying ingredients were not fresh. The cheese corn was just an oval iron skillet with sweet corn and melted cheese - not worth the price.Ambience - for me, 2 stars. It was not particularly welcoming and too dark inside. I sat outside, a bit better.Service - 3 stars. There was only one other table occupied, server was a bit slow.I went during the week at an off-peak time. The place probably has a more club-like vibe late at night on weekends, but that's not my jam. Will not be back.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Reserved for a party of 18 people on a Saturday night and had a great time! The food was delicious and came out quickly. Our waiter Daniel was the absolute best and definitely made our experience memorable!Will be coming back again :)
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Had two dishes: brisket salad had a chance to be excellent if not too much dressing; deep fried chicken in Korean source was of Panda Express quality, two dishes only before tips -$55.30 (no drinks); overpriced for this type of food. Was the only guest at 6:30pm; must be more of a late night place  rather than a traditional eating restaurant. There were multiple cigarette butts on the outdoor patio in front of entrance.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The food I currently tried:1. Seafood Soup $33- The soup is well-balanced and is delicious and probably goes good with rice.- The balance between protein (crabs, clams, muscle, prawns) and vegetable is off.- The crab meat was way too brittle and soggy I couldn't taste the crab.2. The Grilled King Octopus $33- Price: Uncertain- The sauce and the grill on the octopus is good- Quantity/Amount of octopus provided for a gastropub can be debate-able. (The portion size felt like a fine-dining portion size where you only get 1 king octopus leg - which is pretty small once cooked)3. The smoke crust salmon salad $24-Price : Good-Buy Again? : Yes-This taste really nice and there is good portion size would buy again.-Quality/quantity for price matches up4. Honey Garlic Chicken Wings - Half $14-Price : Good-Crunchiness: Not to my expectation when compare to other K-chicken.-Taste: Not to my expectation compare to other chef kang location from before.-Quantity for price matches up-Buy Again : Perhaps not5. Volcano Popcorn chicken - $26- Price: Uncertain- Taste : Decent- Extremely Spicy- Crunchiness : Not to my expectation compare to other popcorn chicken.- Quantity for price does not match up-Buy Again : Perhaps notI think they do better in the specialty menu. I haven't ordered that before but the pictures looks good.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Came here with some friends and felt the food was decent, but would not go out of my way to come here. The parking lot gets packed too since the plaza generally has a lot of foot traffic.We had the army stew, ddukbokki and kimchi fried rice.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This bar is huge and has multiple areas for seating! The service is good and the staff is friendly!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I had David and Daniel as my servers. They were both incredibly kind and patient given how turnt me and my partner were. Food came out quickly and everything was delicious! We were even given water bottles to go!Thank you again for being so nice to us, we'll definitely be coming back to Seoul Night as our pre-game/late night spot :)
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This location seemed to have gone through many different drinking spots, and I've gotta say this current spot has the best food and drinks by far. It's a cute place with outdoor seating, bright indoor area with tables, and a darker indoor booth seating area. Tried a few different things to eat and everything's been pretty consistent and good. It's good vibes. Pretty decent for a casual night out with friends
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Our very first visit here, located in Koreatown. The food was amazing. Our table service was a little on the slower side, so I'm not sure if the young gentleman was new and in training, but there was at one point in time we had to reach out to who I thought was the owner or manager had a location in order to start our order process. The location has a cool concept with multiple dining rooms. We sat on the side that would be considered, possibly more family style oriented based off of the color scheme in the larger tables. The other dining area may be geared more towards more of a outside ambience starlight Ambience the way that it is designed. They have these very unique chips and salsa and the chips have a little sugar sprinkled on them, as this gives off a very fragrant flavorful vibe with the salsa. I would definitely like to revisit this location to try out a few more of their plates from their menu. there are also a lot of different types of international beer selections, whether it be Japanese or Korean beer.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 209 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Great food and service.  Didn't even know about this place until a local friend suggested for lunch.  Parking lot is a little small but street parking ok.
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I was a lil sad bc it was my first experience with the traditional Korean soup. It was fairly bland. My friend added salt to hers.
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The food is spectacular. For someone who likes Korean food, this is a must go place. The service is also great as well.
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Bad service, expensive food, we were waiting for some one to come to our table to take the order, it was 3 people in the front desk talking and no one was coming
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Completely yummy and delicious comfort Korean food! Great choices for drink pairings and small/intimate space. I've had a few moments where rowdy crowds have made an appearance there but generally this is a nice spot to have some good food with close friends or family!
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: First of all, I LOVED the parking situation. Korean restaurants in KTown parking situations can be challenging. There were plenty of parking spaces which made it so easy to come.The space inside is small but it wasn't as crowded since we got there early. The server was attentive and brought more refill banchan.Since the name of the restaurant is Yuk Dae Jang, I had to try Yukgaejang. It was good but nothing outstanding. However, their naengmyeon was so refreshing and delicious! I highly recommend it. We also got mandu. Kimchi mandu was pretty good but the pork mandu had this aftertaste I did not like.Overall, I would come back again for the ease of parking and Naengmyeon. I will try other items next time.
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Ordered the dumpling and the ice cake soup with oxtail broth. One of the best I've had.
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Great True Authentic Korean Food.If you are looking for real Korean food that actually taste like food from Korea, this is the place!
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The yukgaejang is delicious! The broth is so flavorful, the beef tender, the ramen chewy and fresh. Service was quick. I recommend
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: stopped by on a sunday around 2 pm and we were seated immediately. we got the kimchi/pork mandu, original yuk gae jang with fresh pasta, and naengmyeon and everything was delicious! the broth of both the naengmyeon and yuk gae jang were sooo good with the vegetables/add ins of the dishes and the dumplings were super flavorful. everything was super fresh and the side dishes served with them paired well. imo great place for a quick and reasonably priced comfort meal in ktown!*there is a small parking lot and there was plenty of spots when we went.*
Address: 3033 W 6th St Ste 104-105 Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: you wanna find a good place to make some brisket or top steaks. WHW was the best Korean bbq restaurant I've ever been to. The staff was amazing, the food was amazing and customers around you are always having a great time. The music is also another great thing about it too. I recommend bring your friend and family over there to get the best experienc. I've been to other Korean bbq's, but WHW felt like I was trying Korean bbq for the first time.
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Went here for with my friend to celebrate my birthday. I've been here before, and the food + ambiance never disappoint.This visit, we ordered Combo C since we wanted a set with beef and the marinated short rib. They had two options to cook the meat: they can cook it in the kitchen or cook it in front of you like the traditional KBBQ restaurants. We were served by Rose, who's very friendly and attentive to our needs. Sure enough, the food was great and they have great drinks selections which is perfect if you want to hang with your friend. We definitely enjoyed our experience dining here and are looking forward to coming back here again!
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Woo Hyang Woo was an unanticipated delicious surprise!My friends and I came back from a music festival and we were strolling through Koreatown looking for KBBQ. However it was already late night nearing midnight, and many KBBQ places couldn't serve us due to the time. Eventually we walked into Woo Hyang Woo and they were still accepting late walk-ins! We were a party of 9, but even with a large group they were able to get us seated quickly and we ended up getting a whole room to ourselves which felt like special treatment!My group split into two different tables. For my table we ordered one of the Woo Hyang Woo Combo D which came with Prime Beef Brisket, Prime Boneless Short Ribs, Prime Boneless Ribeye, and we chose to get the Prime Beef Bulgogi. All the meats were delicious and I liked the banchan that was offered. I think the other table group ordered 2 different combos as well.The service here was also some of the best I've experience in all of Koreatown. The young guy who sat us here had a likeable personality and felt relatable. We also mentioned about the promotion of leaving a yelp review for free soju, and in turn he gave us two free soju bottles for each table. And even though we were trying to cook the KBBQ meats ourselves, the staff offered to do it for us which was nice.All in all, I really like Woo Hyang Woo. I've only tried a couple of KBBQs in Koreatown, but so far this one is my favourite for the time being. I will say that this place can end up a little pricey, but honestly it was worth it.
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Good vibe people only! Tomahawk was well cooked and tender. Friendly service and great music selection.  Will come again!
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The wait is plausible compare to other places. Also the ambiance and the music is loud and it seems like an adult environment when sun goes down.We tried the marinated short rib bbq and spicy bulgogi. The side dishes are limited but the meat is so good that it's not important.Alex was our server and he showed up a good time and made us laugh a lot. Thank you.
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I'm so used to all you can eat places that at first I wasn't crazy excited to try this place. All the good reviews definitely made me want to try it. We came here for my sister in laws birthday around 5pm on a Sunday. We had reservations but the place didn't seem crowded at all. We were seated and ordered the package for 4+ people that comes with a few different meat options and we also added the tomahawk to our order. We were 6 adults and 1 toddler that can eat a ton! And this was enough food for us! All the meats were so tender and honestly the best quality compared to all you can eat places! They give you radish paper, pickles, salad , rice, kimchi and potato salad. That stuff is all unlimited! I must have ate 3 whole bowls myself of the pickles they were so good!Staff was friendly and quick! Definitely would come back.10 dollar parking lot across the street
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Came here for my sis-in-law's bday dinner. Not an all you can eat establishment, but man was it good! The service was great as well! We ordered the combo D for 4+ people. Came with prime beef brisket, prime boneless short rib, prime boneless ribeye and marinated short rib. We also added the prime tomahawk steak. All the meats were met in your mouth tender. And all the sides were amazing. Nice spot for a nice dinner! Ambiance was also very good. Parking can be a bit of a hassle, but plenty of paid parking available.
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Celebrated my bday here with a group of 10. Ordered 2 short rib tomahawks and 2 Combo D's which was just enough food. Everything was so good and our waiter Alex made this one of our favorite KBBQ experiences. Would definitely come back.
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Such delicious food-- the flavor was amazing!! service was great as well, and I love going there with my friends. We came for a special occasion and it was definitely worth it! Food did not disappoint  Out server Alex was incredible. Very professional with great energy. This is my favorite spot for Korean bbq. Will be back soon...
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I had an incredible KBBQ dinner experience at Woo Hyang Woo! Our server, Alex, was outstanding. From the moment we sat down, he provided attentive and friendly service. The meat selection was top-notch, and Alex guided us through the cooking process with expertise. The flavors were exquisite, and the ambiance was perfect for a memorable evening. I'll definitely be coming back for more delicious KBBQ at Woo Hyang Woo, and I highly recommend asking for Alex as your server!
Address: 3429 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I loveee this place so much!! Truly will always be in my top 5. Always an amazing selection and that short rib is soo amazing truly will take you to another dimension
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Never disappoints!   We have dined at Majordomo often and the service and food is always great.
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Do not make this a last minute trip to try the big steak dinner! Make sure you put in a request no later than 2pm for that. But since we made a last minute dinner reservation all of the other food dishes were DELICIOUS! Definitely get yourself the mushroom rice and the bone marrow dip. By far the tastiest food I had and we went in a group of 4 and easily shared all of the meals with each other. If you're a drinker, stick to their curated drinks and do not veer off the menu. The ambience outside was nice and quiet, it's right on Naud street and in a little cut, so it's a perfect getaway for a relaxing date.
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Food was amazing . Drinks were delicious. Recommend the short rib and the whipped bone marrow
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Finally had the opportunity to try Majordomo!Summary: Good larger group format dining with a focused menu anchored really by a few protein dishes. A few of the sides were really solid too. The protein dishes are more substantial and thereby best to go in groups and share. Be prepared to spend a bit. Recommend sitting in the patio!Details: we had a group of 6 guys and details below on what we ordered. We had a ton of leftovers.. for sure only needed one of the protein dishes, but still happy we tried both. If you had to do one, try the short rib if it's your first time. Potatoes and tomatoes were great. Bings were good, just a bit pricey for what it is. Oysters were very average.1) short rib (pre-order needed): definitely the star of the show! Smoked bone in, carved table side. Great flavor and quality bbq. Leftover carvings were used to then make fried rice. Accoutrements were pretty average. Expensive at $235, but does feed 4-5. Recommend for a special occasion if it's your first time!2) smoked bo ssam (pork shoulder): really great flavor, smokey and sweet. To me it was like high quality pulled pork with asian inspired flavors. Good for sharing.3) crispy potatoes: perfect pairing for the proteins to add some carbs. We ordered two of these4) heirloom tomatoes: super fresh and sweet, balanced perfectly with the sesame vinaigrette. They served this dish as appetizer, would have preferred to have this with the meat to help cut the fat a bit.5) bings: had the butter/honey and the ricotta/compote. Really really good.. freshly griddled bing paired and the dips were both really good. Assuming u are already there to splurge, I'd say get two to try.6) oysters: while fresh, nothing really stood out. Would have expected maybe a bit more at $26 for half dozen.All in all, recommend trying if you haven't been and go in a group!
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: This place is great & it's definitely one of those "been there, done that"The short rib was very pricy but good nonetheless and the presentation was amazing and the staff had great energy. CALL AHEAD FOR THIS.I recommend a big party because you will have left overs.Overall our experience was great. Be prepared to drop stacks.
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: My first experience at chef Chang west coast restaurant. The experience was everything I expected and the some. From the quality and details that Devon and Tae had with all of the drinks being prepared. To the exceptional presentation of all the dishes.
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: This finally happened!! When I was studying at UCLA, we tried making plans a few times, especially after our trip to Momofuku in Vegas - but ended up not happening! And, then covid caused all that pause!So, I was coming back to LA for a weekend trip, and I thought to give it another try. Asked a friend if he wanted to join, and both of us finally made it to Majordomo!Got reservation relatively easily a couple of days before, thankfully, and the place was packed on the Friday night!!And, then we started ordering things - from a bottle of sake to some starting dishes like tuna tataki and their famous bing flatbread (with bone marrow of course), and the crispy potatoes (a fun tip: eat these potatoes with the bone marrow dip and maybe add a tiny bit of that kimchi sauce that comes with oysters.. so yum ;)) Oh, and the clay pot rice - we got the duck one!! So yum! And, the pork! And, had to finish with pavlova! Gotta visit again!Also, our server asked which one we would give a higher rating - momofuku vegas vs. majordomo LA.. both are amazing! But, momofuku vegas wins for me!
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: I've generally had a decent experience at Majordomo for many reasons. I have been there a total of three times and I can tell one thing for sure is the consistency in the good service and ambiance. Everybody is very friendly and accommodating. I remember arriving early my first time and I was given a nice seat m at the bar where I ordered one of my favorite lemon ginger shiso mocktails before my party arrived.I also remember every one of our servers being very knowledgeable about the menu and being helpful with what to choose in terms of cocktails, appetizers, entrées, and desserts. The ambience from the open floor plan makes it very interactive and lively with all the tables filled with people, and sometimes close enough where you can have conversations with people next to you. We remember talking to our neighbor and sharing ideas over which dessert to share and I found that to be super fun and memorable.A number of things stand out from the menu at Majordomo. Off the top of my head I can confidently say that the Bing bread (or Chinese flatbread) is one of the most unique types of bread I've ever tried. We have ordered it every time and it's never disappointed. It's very difficult to choose something other than the butter and truffle honey but I hope that one day I can muster up the courage to try the other sides it comes with.The mushroom fried rice is a delicious entree with a very cool presentation as the server cracks the crusted layer of the rice and mixes it in front of you. Very flavorful.We had a subpar experience last time when we ordered the wagyu steak and did not at all have real wagyu steak in front of us. It was one of the worst experiences we've had with steak before. The meat was extremely chewy - so much that we needed to cut them up into diced cubes to be able to enjoy them. It would have been a choking hazard had we tried to eat them in the slices that had arrived in. Horrible experience. We told the server who was very empathetic and relayed the message to the chef. We got our cocktails taken care of. We will never order it again which was a shame since the marination was delicious.I had been told multiple times by servers in my prior visits that the chickpea mac and cheese is their popular one. We decided to order it and it was actually just alright. Nothing to write home about.The kimchi pasta was a decent plate which was taken off their menu the last time. The fries and steak in my past visits were also much better.If you're looking for something decent, you won't be disappointed here. Unfortunately the quality of the food has not been consistent enough for me to want to return anytime soon.PARKING:Valet across the alley or street parking
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Food:  the Shiso (amass riverine, ginger, lime) alcohol free drink was light and refreshing; the Little Gem Salad (anchovy, miso, smoked trout roe) was perfectly balanced and not overpowering with the anchovy, miso or roe flavor; the piece de resistance was the Smoked Bo Ssam (pork shoulder, ssam, condiments) - this was meant for a party of 4 or more for this dish aloneService:  great, timely & friendly serviceDesign:  interiors is a nice modern industrial warehouse with the warm wood touches from the built-ins and tables with the black accents from the chairs and back bar built-in shelvesOverall:  superb, creative flavors that seem familiar, but also paired/combined uniquely; so David Chang is not just hype; this food was worth driving all the way out to this remote spot in DTLA
Address: 1725 Naud St Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: This awesome spot is located in one of my favorite neighborhoods in Hollywood (Los Feliz). Did my birthday here. High quality food, and exceptional service! Had their steak frites and several appetizer salads with some friends. Everything was mouthwatering and finely prepared. The waiters are amazing here. They break everything down for you and give you great wine pairings for each dish. They also gave us complimentary (high quality) tea and dessert. What a treat!
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The food was good and the Latte drinks were very well made. The service was not to my expectations. Our server who was very nice and well mannered got my omelette order wrong. I had two bites of the omelette when I noticed that it was missing the mushrooms that I ordered to come with the omelette. No biggie I mentioned to my waitress and she said that she would bring the mushrooms on the side. I said no i prefer to have them cooked with the omelette. She said she would remove the order from check. I said please don't just make another one for me please and remove the one I got from my check. After about 10-15 minutes the correct omelette was brought to me. It was very good and delicious. After I ate half of my omelette with mushrooms i request for the check.The manager came by to ring up my check. I guess they must of misunderstood me because I noticed in my check that they charged me for two omelettes! I told the manager that they got my order wrong on the first omelette and requested to have them make another one. He said well you almost ate all of the first one so that is why I am charging you for that one as well. I told him I took two bites from the omelette plus the omelette there are European size. 3 big bites and the omelette is gone. He answered with a typical French attitude. He made a smirk and removed the first omelette from my charge. FYI they automatically charge 18% gratuity on your check. I told him if that I don't mind paying for the first omelette but I don't think it is fair. He said no it's fine . I went ahead and added to the extra tip for the omelette I ate in the beginning. Will I come back NO. But the food was pretty good so don't let my experience stop you from going to try their food or drinks.
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: How have I not eaten here sooner! I've wanted a place like this nearby for so long. I almost don't want to say anything about how reasonable the prices in case they decide to raise them in response lol. Crazy good value for money, friendly service, I'll be back!
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: They were out of a few items we requested that night. We couldn't order the cod, no ketchup for the fries, and you won't see your server until it's time for the bill. Ours forgot items we asked for and had to come back to confirm what we ordered right after she took the order in the first place. They also add a 20% service charge even though you're not getting the kind of service that rate should offer.This is one of those places that people are flocking to because social media got a hold of it. But it's not going to give you the same vibes you'd get in Europe. And the service is not what you'd expect for how much they charge.
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Loupiotte Kitchen is a charming and pulchritudinous petit restaurant in Los Feliz. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner. Furthermore, they serve wine, cocktails and juice. It's interior and exterior has a farm-like decor with plenty of wall frames and French artifacts. Their front outdoor and indoor seats were spacious and has a good French vibe.Menu has a good selection of lunch/dinner food albeit limited breakfast items. I selected the French Toast with berries, diced potatoes and iced coffee. It taste good-thicc, soft, and warm; not too overwhelming in sweetness or flavor. Iced coffee was modest. Potatoes were spicy.Staff were cordial, perfunctory and professional. Service was very satisfactory. Prices were slightly high compared to similar establishments albeit not all items.Street metered and side parking are available.Overall, I had a modest breakfast meal and experience. I'm glad I was able to check it out because it's always crowded.
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing experience! Owner was super kind and generous. Our server was also really kind and attentive. Beautiful place with beautiful people and amazing food.
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Restaurants in LA are getting out of hand. Video of my $25 chicken thigh meal (hand for scale). Sure, the 2 bites of chicken I had were alright (offered some to my bf to try but he felt bad taking any because there was so little there), but nothing mind blowing.Oh. 20% service charge to add some salt to the wound.Going out to eat used to be a pleasure but it's turning into what feels like a scam nowadays.
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Charming neighborhood spot with great brunch. Started by one of the former waiters from Figaro Cafe just down the street! My favorite food item is the polenta fries. And they're the only place around here besides Spitz that serves organic wine.
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: My favorite neighborhood French spot. Been here a few times for brunch (love the polenta with crispy egg or the soft scrambled eggs with tomato and pesto toast). Went for dinner tonight for date night and the mussels were divine. Sopped up as much as much as I could of the creamy white wine sauce with sourdough bread. The summer salad on the side was perfect for a warm summer evening. Have friends visiting tomorrow and of the five options I sent them for lunch tomorrow, they chose Loupiotte Kitchen, so I'll be back tomorrow. Don't mind eating hear multiple days in a row as the food is always delicious, fresh, with a mix of staples and seasonal faire. And the decor is so charming!
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: We had such a wonderful meal here. Delicious food, excellent service, and a delightful space.
Address: 1726 N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: One of the best food I've ever had. Period. Immaculate taste, great portions, and impeccable service. The staff even threw a sushi starter and a dessert in the end on the house. This is definitely the place you would think of if you're trying to have that special night out with that special someone.
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: OKAY. Let me tell you. This place is one of the best Japanese restaurants I've been to in the states. Their sashimi and sushi tastes so fresh and so good -- better than those $200+ omakase sashimis. I got the Kaisen don and the salmon grab roll. I originally came here to try their ramen, but their sushi caught me by surprise and exceeded my expectations. Their ramen is also very good (got the garlic black tonkatsu). Their noodles, especially, remind me of Ichiran's noodles -- thin but bouncy. I am DEFINITELY coming back to try everything else on their menu.I love how everything came out in a relatively short amount of time. Service was quick and attentive. I love the vibes of this store too. Quiet and pretty spacious for a small store.
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Iki in Hollywood is the spot fr. I would come here for the ambiance alone. It's like sitting in a pocket of elegance lol.Got the Tonkotsu ramen where the broth is very rich and hearty. The Yuzu Shio ramen is also a good option if you're feeling something a little lighter and brighter.Honestly can't wait till the next time come here.
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: After reading all the 5 star reviews we decided to try Iki Ramen for their Omakasi. And boy are we glad we did! This restaurant is incredible from the personalized service by the Manager, Brody, and his staff, to the amazing creative stylings of Chef Jeffrey.Don't consider this a "ramen" restaurant even though they offer it. What they really excel at is sushi. There wasn't one dish I saw pass by our table that I wouldn't want to try. Our Omakasi experience was off the charts and featured unusual fishes (and a Wagu course) with amazing preparations. Chef Jeffrey is truly inspired and the $150.00 per plate fee was a steal...especially after we paid $250.00 to sit at a table at Morihiro for an "ok" experience that cost $700.00 out the door (It's $400.00 to sit at the bar). We felt ripped off. The only negative I can offer is that the restaurant is EXTREMELY noisy with lots of hard surfaces...very difficult to have a conversation unless you're screaming. A good tip is to ask for a table outdoors so you can hear yourself think.We will be coming back to Iki Ramen for many more Omakasi experiences!
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great veggie ramen . Service is always great!  Try it!  They have pick up, delivery and east in!
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: OMG -- did a double date with my husband and parents and the omakase 15 course was absolutely AMAZING. the ambiance felt modern and new, service and attention to detail was outstanding BUT the food  was by far worth the 5 stars. So many flavors, presentation was impeccable. I have to give it to everyone here. Definitely will bring my entire family again !!THANK YOU IKI RAMEN and our server Jordey
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: It was ok.. Prices aren't justified. Very upscale Japanese fusion foods that seem interesting, but are only ok in terms of taste. Service was on-point and what you'd expect from an upscale restaurant. The food just wasn't good enough for me to return or recommend.
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I recommend this restaurant. The vibe of the place is so cozy and great people with great service. Recommend this place.
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Service are great and fast. Food are phenomenal as a sushi lover. Ambiance are very cozy. We will definitely coming back.
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Impeccable food and service.  The Ramen and Sushi are as good as you'll find in LA.  Clean and elegant restaurant as well.
Address: 6565 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Great brunch spot.A tad bit pricey, but it's worth it. Lovely views, great ambiance, tasty drinks, and fantastic service.
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Nice view, strong drinks. Server was super busy at first but then caught up and was very very attentive. | IG: Smackinfood
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Food was brought out really fast, and it was tasty. It took some time to get a waiter to take our order which maybe there wasn't a enough staff for a Monday night, but he was very friendly when he did take our order. The fries had some cajun seasoning which was really good and the Brussels sprouts were perfectly fried with a dark sauce. I got a LA girl which was super refreshing. The Pain Killer was all alcohol but you couldn't even taste it, and the mango unchained was so good my friend got two. The view wasn't that nice but it was still a mood to be up there. Overall the prices were decent and they do have a happy hour min-friday
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Good ambience however service was poor. After 45 mins of sitting at our table we were finally greeted by our server. He was nice but overwhelmed. Unfortunately it looked like they were not staffed well. Drinks were mediocre.
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: This rooftop is located in a fairly small hotel in downtown la, it can easily be missed if it wasn't for the attendants out front. The rooftop itself is a good size, it wasn't too crowded and my group felt comfortable. The food menu is very limited, we were all struggling on deciding what to eat but ended up figuring it out. I ordered the octopus and it was good, the octopus had a nice bite and the potato purée paired really well with the octopus. For drinks I ordered the LA GIRL, it had vodka, cucumber, peach, aloe and lime, it was a refreshing treat. All cocktails started at $17 which is pretty standard for LA but not sure if it was worth that price! I guess you're really paying for the rooftop ambience here, it's a fun little spot. 3 stars for the average experience I had and not sure if would return back anytime soon.
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Came for lunch and we were seated in a table that was barely covered. It was one of the hottest days this week too so it was quite warms and unpleasant. Another thing to note was that we did not have set server. So for the first 30 mins of being seated, we didn't have anyone come check on us and we're just cooking in the sun with no water. Eventually we waved down some other server and they came by to tell us they'll get our server.We then asked to move tables because ours wasn't cover and they were able to relocate us to the table under the plant canopy. One thing to note was that there wasn't much airflow so that area was quite stuffy. We then again, had to wave someone down to take our order because we didn't have a set server at the new table. It was quite unorganized and made the meal more uncomfortable and unwelcoming.After ordering, our food took a while to arrive maybe 30+ minutes. At the time the restaurant was quite empty as it was already 2PM. The dishes were interesting part of the chefs brunch. Portions are pretty small though, almost like tapas or for like 2 bites. They all had many ingredients which was interesting, some went well better than others. Half way through the meal, someone from our group wasn't feeling well so they needed to rest, luckily there was space but the staff rarely came over and when they did they approached us with a cold shoulder almost trying to kick us out and not offer any support to help. We stayed for a while until our friend felt better, and there was no one around us. When we did left on of the servers approached us very aggressively and spoke to us in a very condescending way. I understand the frustrating but there was definitely a nicer way to approach the situation.Food -- 7/10 small portions, a lot of different flavors some worked better than othersService -- 1/10 rude, non attentive, unapproachable, hostile toneAmbiance (daytime) -- 6/10 it was okay, there's an open roof, but a lot of plants blocking the view and tables are a bit cramped and music a bit too loud
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Holy fuck! Today I've had the worst experience ever. There's this bartender, his name is ().I set myself so I can place an order for drinks and food while me and my friend decided we did not want to sit at the bar. He made a scene on accommodating us instead of taking our order when we already knew what we wanted, he decided to move the shade that I had, stating I moved it . When I go to place my order for a Caesar salad with grilled chicken, he tells me no I can't have it the way I'd like it without kale, when the other server, the guy with the curly hair who works behind the bar that I come to see all the time accommodated me with no hesitation. The ambiance over all was beautiful
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: This place was amazing. William was our waiter and he made our day. He was so helpful with menu.  I will definitely be back.
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Highly recommend this rooftop bar experience because it truly is a foodies paradise here. Came here for Sunday brunch and it was an easy check in process with reservations. Sat at the bar and enjoyed a delicious guava mimosa. The guava is an in house made purée and was a perfect touch for my mimosa. Next I ordered the Mac Daddy Froze... if you enjoy Capri Suns then this is definitely your jam.I ordered the Breakfast Sando and it was very delicious. You can taste the quality of each ingredient and I truly enjoyed each bite. Now if you are a cookie lover like myself then you definitely need to order the 1/2 dozen cookies for dessert. They are incredibly well made and everyone very much enjoyed this treat. Overall, it was the perfect brunch spot.Lots of great views of Los Angeles and comfortable seating options. The staff was friendly and attentive. They made excellent recommendations and truly made my experience a memorable one. I look forward to my next visit.
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

RestaurantName: The Rooftop at The Wayfarer Downtown LA
Comment: Good management, nice employees. Great food, lovely atmosphere. Would definitely visit again.
Address: 813 Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90017

Comment: So I usually don't leave bad reviews and leave it for others to figure it out on their own but this place is just another Hawaiian vacationer who liked a dish and decided to promote an excuse of the real dish. This place is no kukui hut cafe (broke da mouth loco Moco) nor are they close island flavor in Vegas. Mac salad is suppose to be a scoop like an actual scoop not poured mayo and Mac. The gravy isn't fresh but I don't blame them I know it's hard to come by fresh gravy. Though my wife didn't like the patty I thought it was ok. Idk guys I don't mean to be an ahole I'm sure the owner is a nice person but the obstacle it takes to get the food and then to be disappointed really brings the ahole out of you.
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: OMG if you know anything about real Hawaiian food, this place really captures all of the signature dishes and elevated them to exceed my expectations. I lived in Hawaii for a few years and to learn that the owner is originally from there really made sense of why each dish did not disappoint!We wanted to order everything but there was only 3 of us so we had to stick to just these few dishes for now. We got fries and garlic shrimp as apps and then 2 of us ordered the longanisa moco and 1 ordered the bbq chicken all with garlic fried rice and let me just tell you that not one thing wasn't full of flavor and you could just tell they really put detail into every dish.The only thing that was a little confusing was finding the place as we went during off hours of only pick up and delivery so be mindful of that. You can have some of the items with drinks after 9pm at paper tiger. You have to enter the back parking lot through western Ave & then call to grab your order. You won't regret ordering extra dishes so you can try everything!
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Everything was fire! Compliments to the chef. The garlic fried rice was super ono and the Kalua pork was flavorful! Will definitely keep this at the top of my list in grubhub.
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Best authentic Hawaiin BBQ in Los Angeles. Located inside the nightlife hot spot Paper Tiger Bar.6-hour pulled pork roasts, fresh eggs, tacos, garlic fries & more! Amazing people and amazing story!
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Best authentic Hawaiin BBQ in Los Angeles. Located inside the nightlife hot spot Paper Tiger Bar. Intense flavors from family recipes! Amazing pulled pork roasts, fresh eggs, tacos, garlic fries & more! Definitely stop by and stay eatin!
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Garlic rice is so good!! Perfect proportions. If you're ever in LA go check them out.
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Honestly the BEST Hawaiian plates outside of Hawai'i. The chefs are authentic and know exactly how it should taste. The classic loco moco is a must of course, the gravy is perfectly seasoned and the egg was cooked to slightly-runny perfection. Do not sleep on this place! Ono kine grindz all day
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Amazing food!! The Kalua pig plate is so yummy. Was so full had to take a nap. Of course you gotta pair it with Spam Musubi for appetizer
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Stumbled upon this pop up spot on the way to work. They operate takeout only.Got the classic loco moco and new shrimp dish they said they added that day.Loco Moco: I've had loco mocos before before but this was certainly next level. Gravy tasted like it was from scratch. Beef patty tasted more like a meatball pressed into a patty. Super juicy!Kimchi Shrimp: it was a cold shrimp dish that was served with garlic and onions in a kimchee type dressing. First time trying this type of dish but it was straight GAS! SO GOOD! Solid balance, garlic and onions weren't over powering.I saved this restaurant on Yelp. You should do the same. I'll be back for sure. Well done.
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Food is amazing! I didn't get a chance to take a photo of the local Moco coz I just scarfed it down! From theSpam musubi to the Kalua pig, the gravy, the spicy pepper water, everything is just very tasty and delicious!Definitely coming back!
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Had the loco moco and it was booommbb!And the macaroni salad?! It was very tastySo glad we found you guys!
Address: 4574 Beverly Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: In the ever-echoing chambers of my mind, the eternal question reverberates, "What the hell am I in the mood for?" As I sift through the tapestry of tastes I've encountered, the sultry allure of Mexican beckons. Tacos from a street vendor? The hearty embrace of a burrito? Or perhaps the underrated charm of a torta? But then, a voice, dripping with sarcasm, chimes in, "Sure, but which Mexico are you talking about?" It's a gentle reminder of the vast culinary landscape of Mexico, divided into seven distinct regions: Norteño, Bajacaliforniano, Chipas, Jaliscense, Yucateco, Veracruzano, and Oaxaqueño. Each with its own heartbeat, its own soul. Today, my culinary compass pointed towards tlayudas - Oaxaca's misunderstood masterpiece, often dubbed the "Oaxacan Pizza."Tlayuda Los Angeles, a place where the art of tlayuda-making is revered, was my chosen sanctuary. I settled on their "Tlayuda Supreme," a symphony of flavors on an expansive toasted corn tortilla canvas, adorned with bean puree, fresh greens, and a trinity of meats - Tasajo beef, cesina pork, and the fiery chorizo.But let's get one thing straight - calling this a pizza is like calling a Stradivarius a fiddle. It's closer in spirit to a tostada or an open-faced taco. The tlayuda I had was a revelation. A dish steeped in Oaxacan tradition, its foundation is a tortilla, crisped to perfection. It's then painted with refried black beans, layered with greens, and crowned with Oaxacan cheese and a medley of grilled meats. A splash of salsa, a sprinkle of fresh herbs, and you're on a journey. Some might fold it, letting the cheese melt in a warm embrace, while others, like me, prefer it open, in all its glory. And to wash it down? A gulp of mezcal or, in my case, a refreshing mint cucumber lemonade.So, the next time the siren song of Mexican food calls, ask yourself, "Which corner of Mexico am I yearning for?" Today, it was Oaxaqueño, with its tantalizing tlayuda. And the warmth of Tlayuda Los Angeles? It felt like coming home to a family I never knew I had. Pure magic.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: This restaurant is such a gem! The staff is really friendly and helpful. They have vegan options too! We really appreciate they have options for my family's various dietary restrictions and allergies! Such a cute place with delicious, flavorful, food! Dine in or take away, and delivery are available
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: This place has some great food. I used to get the chicken taco kits to go with rice and beans and everyone enjoyed them. My brother doesn't even like chicken tacos that much and he keeps asking me when I'm bringing him more.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Couldn't say enough amazing things. Chicken fajitas are insane, the flautas are out of this world, the sweet bread, the cheesecake, the hibiscus tea, the guac, the salsas, the rice, the beef dish...seriously, some of the best food I've ever had, period. And it was delivered hot and amazing to studio city. This is officially the new regular.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: I'm really disappointed in the meal that I picked up from here. The torta oaxaquena was just okay and the beef tacos were not good and they didn't even make the requested changes that I confirmed, since I ordered in person. The guacamole too was also just okay. Nothing special.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Today was my first time here. I already loved the place.! Service it's great the two lady's took really good care of us.! Food was delicious never had a torta so delicious like the torta Oaxaqueña and Tlayudas are exceptional delicious. The drinks are Amazing.since iam a coffee lover I'll go with the brewchata bomb.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: So so delicious and many vegan options. I have enjoyed going there thoroughly, the customer service is great and the food is fantastic.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Where can I even start from the lemonade and the horchata, to the mole and chips. Everything had so much flavor! The salsa weren't too spicy but they had amazing  flavor. This place definitely takes you to flavor town. It doesn't disappoint, service was good too we meet the owners wife and she was too sweet. We talked about the Oaxacan based food and the history of it. It was very nostalgic and heart warming to say the least. Every plate was licked cleaned! Honestly can say I will be telling everyone about this place. O and make sure you order a there main dish, and a torta with the steak and chorizo, and a chicken taco if it's your first time. You will leave so satisfied. Where is the yelp Michelin star?
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Best Mexican food I've had in Los Angeles. I had them deliver food for my Birthday. The food was delicious, it was more than what we expected and they delievered right on time. They even gave us hibiscus tea which was amazing. I cant recommend them enough. If you need someone to cater to your party, they are the one. Cant wait to order food from them again.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We came here for a late lunch after landing in LA. The two women working were incredibly friendly and helpful, answering all of our questions and checking in on us throughout our time at the restaurant.It was my first time having a Tlayuda, which they happily made a vegan version out of the vegetarian one. It was delicious! Light and crispy, massive, veggies cooked perfectly, and it came with two hot sauces - the verde one was unreal.My partner got Huevos a la Mexicana which he loved, and I got one of each of the Chipotle and Mole hibiscus tacos (vegan!). The tortillas were outrageously good, the mole had deep flavor, and the chipotle sauce contrasted and complimented perfectly with the hibiscus.We both got horchatas as well which were fantastic. All around delicious! We'd return often if we lived here.
Address: 5450 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Other than HS making a song about this place, it's actually is a very good place to eat at. I would come to eat here every time I visit LA. Since there's only a few tables inside, the wait can be sometimes over 45 minutes. Parking is hard to find fyi during breakfast hours.Also, the Hollywood sign is so close you can drive up another 5 minutes after eatting here.Food is great. Coffee is great. Customer service is great.
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: The Beachwood Cafe has a very home-y feel to it if you stop by at the right time. During the summer, it can get really busy, but during normal times of the year, you can really feel The Canyon's ambiance in respect to this cafe. I came to this spot for brunch and we were seated quickly through their online waiting list which I think is very technologically efficient as it allowed for us to get in a walk around the beautiful neighborhood until our food was ready.My server was very kind throughout our meal and patiently came back to our table a few times until we were ready since it took us a bit to begin ordering. I ordered the Classic French Toast which had strawberries and powdered sugar on it in addition to a Nutella Iced Latte. I originally thought the portions for the french toast were a little small for the price, but it was surprisingly filling. I would definitely recommend this for a brunch meal. The Nutella flavored latte, however, I would not recommend as it did not taste like Nutella or hazelnut and rather not that pleasantly flavored at all. I did unfortunately feel like that purchase was a waste.At the end of the day, the external environment and internal ambiance makes this cafe worth a visit for a brunch meal, but one shouldn't expect the highest of food/drink quality.
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: I recommend going to Beachwood for their breakfast. Their lunch menu isn't my favorite... But their breakfast burrito is the best thing I have ever tasted. This is my go-to order whenever I'm in the area. My partner usually share the burrito and ordered the 2x2x2 (eggs, bacon, pancakes). Their coffee is not my favorite unfortunately, but their pastries are perfectly made. The workers are friendly and always check up on their customers.Inside the restaurant, there is plenty of seating. If you ever want to eat in this area, there is some parking near the market and it's walking distance to the restaurant.
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: My recent visit to Beachwood Cafe left me with mixed feelings. The ambiance is undeniably charming, with a relaxed Hollywood vibe that draws you in. However, when it comes to the food, I had higher expectations. It's not that the dishes were bad, but they didn't quite live up to the hype. The menu had various options(maybe better to shorten and keep the best ones). It is what it is - a great place to soak in the atmosphere, but the food is important for me. I will not take my friends to there.
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: Amazing food! This will forever by my boyfriend and I favorite place to eat. Best service so far we always feel extremely welcomed! Very pleasant place and very friendly people as well
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: Love this place so much. Tied with Met Her At A Bar for my favorite Eggs Benedict in Los Angeles. We had a wonderful breakfast this Labor Day weekend. Beachwood is located in the Hollywood Hills and really has beautiful surroundings. If you're lucky enough to sit near a window, like we did, you will have plenty of views of the houses, hills, and passersbys. They have a large, free, parking lot in the back of the restaurant and we were able to find space there for a 10:30AM Sunday brunch. We got lucky with our arrival time so were able to be seated as soon as we arrived. Our server Jennifer G did a great job and was very attentive.As mentioned they have one of my favorite Eggs Benedicts' in LA. The hollandaise is seasoned well, the eggs were perfect, and they all sit on a Texas toast which really adds to the flavor and allows you to soak up the egg. We also order Caramel Lattes which I would highly recommend, the Avocado Toast as a share plate which was fantastic due to the labneh below the avocado, and also the Berry Pancakes, which were a hit as well.Overall one of my favorite breakfast spots in LA. I love how hidden and out of the way it is. It really feels like a place for LA locals like me; there didn't seem to be a large tourist crowd like some other locations have. I will be back many times!
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: It's just alright. Nothing special here. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't exactly good either. The food was average and not worth the price tag. Hubby and I had two coffees and two meals for $60. Maybe that's considered standard price to some, but it wasn't worth it for what we got. Small and cramped seating, street parking. Probably won't come back here
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: Came here because I love Harry Styles and if he mentioned it in his song then I had to go see it for myself!! I was surprised there wasn't too many people there, still a packed restaurant though. I got the birria tacos and they were so good! It does say you get to see the Hollywood sign but beware it's very small and you have to go back a few hundred feet to even see the sign because it's blocked
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: So good every time I've been. I definitely recommend going in the morning for their breakfast menu. I love their breakfast burrito and the vegan breakfast burrito is pretty manny as well. Their breakfast pizza is also very delicious and fresh. Tasty coffee too!
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: Awesome little spot, would recommend with one exception. All the staff was very helpful & friendly, except for one of the older waitresses. She was VERY impatient, rushing us, not making much eye contact & not answering our questions very well. After a little, we started to recognize she was having an issue. At the end of our meal, we needed takeout boxes and a takeout cup, which she slammed on the table while walking away & left the Coffee (takeout) Cup's lid open. Which made me question if she wanted us to spill the coffee. Towards the end of our meal, we felt as if she was only asking us "customer service" questions to rush us out of the restaurant (which we didn't take very long). I believe her name is Guadalupe V.
Address: 2695 N Beachwood Dr Los Angeles, CA 90068

Comment: Rude staff!!  Who looks down on customers.Just because we did not order alot.Bad experience.Great manager though.
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This is the spot that you cannot make decision but easy and fast - do not expect any good service here. It is like cage, you come sit and eat and pls go. I never felt welcoming in BCD and foods are just so so.
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Was slightly off the heezy a few shots and some glasses in when I thought to myself, "Damn it's a vibe in here" LMAO. But really it is tho. The ajummas are direct and to the point just like the food itself. It's no frills here. Tender delicious yummy galbi plus soup plus this lil fried fish plus some drank for like $30 sumn dollars? I'm down.
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: We ordered three of the Tripe Soon Tofu and most of the tripe in all three soups tasted like dish soap.It also had a strand of what looked like pig hair on the tripe.It was absolutely disgusting...I'm really disappointed because this was my favorite place.
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The food is outstanding the service is always top notch and the ambiance is welcoming
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Love both dining in and getting takeout from BCD. Their side dishes are so delicious (you get an entire fish to yourself!) and the tofu soup doesn't disappoint. You usually hear a lot of Korean being spoken among the customers, which to me is a good sign. A reliable standby whenever I'm craving Korean food!
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Always loved their Kimchi Soup but had no idea they had Raw Marinated Crab on the menu too!  Their combination plate is well worth it.  You get a full entree in addition to your choice of soup!  Not to mention all traditional Korean sides that are bottomless.  The price point and portion size is very worth it!  You get to pick your desired spice level and the medium was just perfect.  The only complaint I have is that their kids menu was for ages 7 and under!  They seriously expected a 10 year old to eat a full entree???  My daughter ended up sharing with me but that means I had to get chicken teriyaki instead of the spicy chicken which is unfortunate as I'm sure I would have enjoyed it much more.  Other than that, staff was friendly, the wait was short, and the food was great.
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Great good. Can't beat the value for what you order. Come on down! You won't regret it.
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: so so yummy! can always find a parking spot; depending on the day/time you arrive, you can wait a while but it is worth it in my opinion :) once you get seated service is pretty quick! love the side dishes they provide too!
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Yummy! Been eating here since college. Love the late hours and the service is always great too!
Address: 3575 Wilshire Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: One of our favorite spots in Echo Park. Whether you get the deep dish pizza or the thinner crust, you can't go wrong. The deep dish takes a little longer to make but they let you know up front and it's totally worth the wait. They have a great selection of local beers as well. Every server we've had has been incredibly helpful and friendly. The funky vintage ambiance and music selection is the icing on the cake. Love Masa!
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: We were tooling around LA, on our way home to OC and decided to see what was around for eating. This place looked interesting and I was curious why a pizza place would name itself Masa - surely it must be something different. We were lured by the pictures of the deep dish pizza and promptly exited the freeway.The restaurant is smack-dab in the old downtown area of Echo Park. We requested a table and the host was kind enough to let us know it takes 50 minutes to get the pizza from the time of ordering on a Saturday night, so we could place an order at the to-go window and have it sent to our table. Everything else we ordered with our server, Kelly, who was warm friendly, and checked on us frequently was absolutely delicious!The pizza itself - oh, that pizza! It's got a nice thick crust with a slathering of tomato sauce - and as I write this, my mouth is totally watering! The crust has a curious flavor to it, almost along the lines of sourdough. I can't really describe it but it's slight tangy all on its own.We will definitely be trying to find ways to always hit up this place when in the LA area from now on!
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: First and foremost, a homey yet intimate atmosphere that is perfect for a date night or hanging out with friends. We came on a Sunday night and maybe we were lucky but we were seated immediately.No complaints with service. Just as a tip, they take last call for deep dish pizzas early due to how long they take to cook so plan accordingly.Now to the food!Suppli - I was immediately flashed back to my time in Rome. The creamy risotto inside a perfectly fried shell. The mozzarella core was such a pleasant surprise.bonus - the marinara sauce on the side HAD to have been made in house. I particularly appreciated the slight acidity that makes this sauce unique.Calamari - your above average restaruant calamari. Enjoyable, crispy but a little salty for my taste.Traditional Deep Dish Pizza - before I say anything else, I enjoyed this pizza.  That being said, the crust is a lot thicker than more authentic Chicago style pizzas. Often times above said crust goes toppings and cheese, then a large heaping of sauce. Given the sauce, I was most excited for this. But because the crust was so thick, I felt that the other elements were not only out of order, but lacking in amount. I particularly questioned the choice of having one large patty of sausage placed atop the pizza because it would often slide off. It was delicious, just not comparable to Chicago.
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Delicious deep dish!!! Super cute place that can be easily hidden, but it's a must try. Only come here with time tho because 1. it takes a while to cook the deep dish and 2. you're going to want to take your time! Service was okay too!
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Parking is easy, the ambiance is pleasing, and the staff + the food is up to par with some chi town thaaaangs. Kudos
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Undoubtedly the finest deep dish pizza in LA! The ingredients are incredibly fresh, and interestingly, our family finds the pizza even more flavorful the day after.
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Deep dish pizza is so satisfying . What a gem in the heart of echo park. Everyone was polite and friendly great vibe
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Deep dish that is worth the wait! Prepare to be here for a while as each pizza is made fresh to order. The ambiance is fun and loud. Don't go here on a first date cause you'll be here forever and if the date is a dud you'll hate your life hahaha!
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Went here a few months back with a few friends and loved it! Great pizza, never had this kind of traditional deep dish Chicago pizza. I was disappointed before as we tried to go here before but it was jam packed at dinner time. This time we went early around 6 and we got a table after a short wait! By the time we left there was a huge line of people waiting to get in! Try this place for a great time with friends and some amazing pizza!
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Love the deep dish pizza served at Masa.I have ordered many times and picked it up. It has always been ready when they say it will be.
Address: 1800 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Absolutely delicious. This place is a little out of the way for me, so I had it delivered so I can't say much about the service or ambiance, but as far as the food goes, I'd 100% order again
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The food was awesome! Totally recommend this place to anyone. The only thing I didn't like was that orange juice isn't pressed
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Order the bacon and egg sandwich with avocado. It's savory, slightly sweet from the eggs, creamy from the avocado, just...all the good things. A mess to eat, but totally worth it.
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: I have been wanting to come here since I saw them on IG a little bit ago and I literally drooled. If you haven't had soft scrambled egg from Egg Tuck then you better go soon! I wish we weren't two hours away, because I have been wanting to come back.The restaurant is kind of like a walk up restaurant and there's tables outside. They do not have restrooms, so if you have to go then you'll probably have to go to Starbucks nearby. Other than that they have a few tables outside. People come and go pretty quick so it's not hard to find seating.When we visited it was a nice sunny day. Wind was blowing and the weather wasn't too bad. Tables are metal tables and it seems like someone comes out to wipe them because they were clean when we sat down.I ordered the sandwich w bacon, but I believe the one by itself or with avocado sounds like it's amazing on it's own. I also saw that they have vegan options! The actual egg mixture is a vegan mixture from my understanding. I would really love to try that out in the future. If you haven't been, I highly recommend this place!
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Great breakfast choice for a bargain! The portions are large and the eggs were done perfectly, so soft and so bouncy. It's a slightly heavier breakfast option and even more so if you add on tater tots but they compliment the egg sandwich quite nicely.
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The food is so damn good. This place hit the spot! The prices are super reasonable (I expected it to be more) and service was friendly AND fast. There isn't any seating inside but there are table outside to eat and people watch. I'm 100% coming back.
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Extremely delicious despite being so seemingly simple, the sauce is perfect. Service was as expected at a fast casual place and the ambiance was fun enough. Definitely would recommend, do not be scared off that eggs are simple, get the sweet egg sandwich you will not be disappointed. It is worth noting that it is messy to eat.
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Saturday breakfast at 9:15 am- sweet egg sandwichService: self-paid kiosk, quickie style , no fancy , no need any serviceAmbiance: small store, couple of outside tables availablePrice: okFood quality: loved the sandwich, filled full of eggs on the brioche bread, really really good, but a little bit difficult to eat, make sure to bring your wet nap to clean up the messy handsHighly recommend
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Got the avocado egg sando (well done eggs). Nothing over the top or fancy. Good quick bite for on the go. I have a nut, fish, chickpea and mustard allergy. Safe eating here happily!Note: There is no seating
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: SO YUMMY!!! A must try for a quick egg sandwich breakfast in LA! Tater tots also bomb :)
Address: 3458 Wilshire Blvd Ste 1/2 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Fire all the plates are fire. The price is a little high but leftovers are always great. The team was super nice, cashier was friendly and they bring your order out while you're sitting. Parking isn't the best but if you find a good spot you're set
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015
