Comment: Literally come here almost every lunch and order pick up. They have my order ready to go way before the pick up time which is nice cause sometimes I get out early. They are so nice and chill. Sometimes theres a line but its not even that long of a wait. The food hits the spot every time.
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Great Service! Shoutout to Suzy for the amazing recommendations. She has great knowledge of the menu and she has great energy. I am thankful that I had the opportunity to enjoy a meal from Habachihana.
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Susie was great! She accommodated my order and made sure I left satisfied. The food was great and gave me extra sauces to top it off.
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Paid $50+ for one plate and food took too long. Left without food not worth my time unfortunately. If it's gna take that long without any other customers, informing us would be nice
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Great service shows actual enjoyment when on the clock and the food was great would definitely recommend
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Food was meh. They were very offensive music on full blast. Lots of swearing and inappropriate words. Asked them to change the music and they did. Which was good of them
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I ordered my food from this place on Uber eats so I have no idea of the service or ambience.I ordered the New York steak with chicken and the garlic noodles with shrimp fried rice.Chicken was cooked perfectly, steak was chewy and I only found three shrimps in my rice. My total was close to 60 dollars for just that one entree. I feel like it was way overpriced.I don't think I will try anything else from this spot. The prices are steep and the food does not match my financial out put.  I have enough leftovers for another full meal but even that is not enough to get me to come back.
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: First time visiting. Food was fresh,tasty and cooked to order. Loved the outside sitting area and dessert cart. Manny the owner was extremely welcoming and friendly. Service was great for them being so busy.
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I've come here probably 6xs because I like the food but the last 2xs that I've went it wasn't so good. I went about a month ago and then 2 days ago thinking that maybe a month ago they were just having a bad rush day but when I went 2 days ago, it was just as bad. I don't know if they changed the cooks or if it was busy so they didn't really focus on timing but it was not good at all. I got the salmon and shrimp plate. My salmon was beyond dry, ridiculously dry. I could tell as soon as I opened the container. The salmon was hard in certain pieces, it wasn't burnt but very very over cooked. The plating was very nice but it was difficult to eat the salmon because of the dryness and hard pieces. I've never had this issue except for the last 2xs that I visited here. And I always get the same thing and both times I was very disappointed.It's disheartening because I spend $100 there easily every time I go and I expect to get quality food for spending that amount every time. My husband and son also got a plate but chicken and steak. The chicken was just as dry as the salmon.I'm unclear what's going on the last few visits but I don't think I'll be returning any time soon. There are a few Hibachi restaurants around so I may have to try another spot from here on.I would recommend maybe try something small first instead of getting a plate because you don't want to spend a lot of money on something that's not cooked to perfection.
Address: 1045 S Hill St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Their lomo saltaldo is sooooo good! The green sauce is absolutely delicious and just the right amount of spice (quite spicy) which is perfect if you love burn and so flavorful def recommend this spot!! My co-worker is such a gem for showing me this spot!
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The food here is So GOOD I recommend this placeVery good taste100%.... Delicious a little expensive but it's all worth it
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The workers there were very nice and quickly fixed any mistakes. My family and I were the last ones to leave but the ambiance was never a negative one. They have many food options and I really enjoyed my soup. The proportions were big so we were able to take the rest to go and eat it at a later date.
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Best Peruvian Food in all of Los Angeles! I've been coming here for 20 years. The food quality is consistent every time. When you see that one chef in the back with the red bandana on his head you know you're plate is about to be fire!! He's an OG chef and been holding it down forever. It's a real city gem & must try!
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Embark on a culinary journey at Mario's, a true testament to timeless excellence that has graced Hollywood's dining scene for over a decade.  Step into a realm where tradition and innovation converge, crafting an experience that's as rich in history as it is in flavor.With a legacy that spans years, Mario's has mastered the art of weaving Peruvian magic onto every plate. From the sizzle of Lomo Saltado to the zing of perfectly crafted Ceviche, each dish is a harmonious blend of authentic flavors that tell a story of a culinary heritage lovingly preserved.The wait during peak times? Consider it a nod to the restaurant's unwavering popularity. It's a testament to the community that has formed around this culinary gem, a family of food enthusiasts who know that exceptional taste is worth the anticipation.As you enter Mario's, you're greeted by an ambiance that's bustling yet welcoming, a reflection of the vibrant spirit of Peruvian culture. The frames gracing the walls, showcasing encounters with renowned patrons, reveal Mario's status as a cherished destination for both locals and celebrities alike.In a world where dining establishments come and go, Mario's stands tall as a beacon of culinary consistency, a place where passion, dedication, and flavors converge to create memories that linger long after the last bite.
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We stopped by Mario's after a very but a very long time when we used leave around the corner so today we experienced another great time and tasted their delicious lomo saltado as my dear madrecita was craving itOnce again kudos to Mario's for a fabulous customer service and specially to Dennis for being a very good listener to my mother and hopefully they put back few things back in their menu for our sweet cravings taste. So cheers to Mario's with an ice cold chicha morada till next time
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Food always tastes amazing. Service feels like family and everyone is nice and welcoming.
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This place has the best Peruvian food in L.A hands down, I've tried many other Peruvian restaurants and nothing compares. Only downfall is parking! And area.
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Horrible service! ! Unless you're a Spanish speaker, otherwise be prepared to wait half an hour before they will bring you some water and take your orders. Such a racist place!!! On top of that, the food was very salty and oily. The lomo was tough to chew on, the beef was not fresh, almost feel like the leftover. Will never come back again . This place is so overrated!!!!
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Don't let looks fool you. Any time I'm in Los Angeles now I want this, It's hard to not come here every time!
Address: 5786 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: PROS:Let's start with the lone positive.  Service was excellent. It's the only thing keeping this from being a one star review. Note, however, that a 5% kitchen fee will be tacked onto your bill.CONS:* Food was pedestrian across many courses. Nothing stood out. I hope you like black garlic because it's seemingly on every dish.* Ambiance is meh. They did, however, have a little Michelin tire man statue at the entrance to remind everyone that they're in a Michelin star-rated restaurant. Classy.* Both my partner and I had...shall we say...gastrointestinal distress a couple of hours after the meal.  Can't pinpoint what might have caused this, but the yellowtail and duck both seemed "off" at the time of eating.It's disappointing enough to pay Michelin star prices for food that's not at a Michelin star level in originality, ingredients or preparation.It's an absolute travesty to pay Michelin star prices for food that may be a health hazard.Can't recommend.
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Steak was extremely salty, as in unacceptable level salty, Inedible. Service was good. The other dishes were good. I'd say the risotto stood out the most. Look, it's a typical LA restaurant on a grungy street with too long of a menu description for too small a portion. Wouldn't recommend.
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Been there twice and both times were unremarkable. First time was the tasting menu and second time was a la carte. Went there the second time because I completely forgot I had been there before - and that's how unmemorable it is! It's not bad, but you can get same or better quality food at lots of LA restaurants so not sure why it deserves a  Michelin star. Service was also not right... front desk asked if we want to sit at the "cute" patio, which was right by a parking lot so hell no. But he seemed annoyed when we said you would rather sit inside. Writing this review so I remember not to go again lol
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: While I appreciate the efforts of the staff at Kali, the $175** seasonal tasting menu left a lot to be desired. Aside from a pretty tasty mixed seafood appetizer, freshly-baked bread, and a genuinely delightful salted egg ice cream, the other dishes missed the mark and honestly would have been below average at even half of what was charged. The scallop "ceviche" was overly salty and lacked the usual acidity, and the cheesy black truffle risotto, while rich in flavor, was also heavy on the salt. The main, a tiny strip steak, was tough and bland.Service was attentive, but there were moments when the timing felt off - my server kept asking my opinion of the food while I was still chewing the first bite, making it rather hard to provide immediate feedback.Another oddity was that their tasting menu dishes seemed to be taken directly from their a la carte menu, without a package discount. Had I known this I would've chosen a different set. And the absence of tap water meant an extra $8 and change for bottled.**That's including their "5% kitchen appreciation charge" which was annoying back when restaurants had their COVID surcharges, and it's still annoying now. If it's anything other than tax or a service charge in lieu of gratuity just include it in the price please!
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We celebrated my husband's birthday here & the dining experience was excellent. If you don't care to dress up & looking for a casual atmosphere but want good food & drink, this is the place to try.  Service was attentive & friendly.
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Great experience. Definitely would come again. Food is delicious and full of surprises.
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We stopped by Kali last year for dinner and tried their tasting menu.  The food was creative and interesting, the plating was beautiful, and the portions were filling!  (The only reason I give 4 stars is that it was quite hot, but it was the end of August, and I suspect that may no longer be an issue.)
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Great food and service, unique, and savory dishes. Highly recommend for a team dinner.
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I had high hopes for Kali as I have heard, over the course of a couple years, from my boyfriend that kali is his favorite restaurant and that they finally received a michelin star which he "knew  was coming". We opted for the seasonal tasting menu $165/person, an add order of their beef tartare cigar $18, and of course couple glasses of wine.The standout dishes for me was the first dish, the crowded beach, which was visually beautiful and the last dish, the gelato. The gelato was the best gelato i have ever had in my life - rich, creamy, with some bites being slightly salty from the egg yolk shaved on top.The in between dishes  such as the gnocchi, new york steak, and scallop were decent but all quite forgetable. The beef tartare cigar definitely tasted unique but I didnt want more than a bite of it.Of course, the standout dishes for my bf was everything. He loves this place!Ambiance is hip and casual. Service wise, nothing special- we got seated, no smiles, got introduced our dish, got our checks, and got thanked on the way out.Overall, it was an okay experience.I would come back but order individual dishes the next time! I wish they sold their gelato by the pint..
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Transporting food. Spectacular service. Great attention to detaiwhat a great restaurant
Address: 5722 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Definitely want to mention first that the service and wait staff were great.Unfortunately, our food was a huge disappointment by comparison. We received el pastor that had what clearly was bagged cheese that was unmelted lining the bottom of a lukewarm skillet. We also had lobster enchiladas that tasted fishy and were covered in an overly salted sauce.We came here to enjoy a great meal and we are very polite about not enjoying the food that we were tasting and requested to receive a discount on our bill. This was refused by the management. We ate almost none of the food and left.Very disappointed. Highly recommend staying away from this place other than the wait staff being very nice.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: We dined in for my husbands birthday. There was no wait, reservations not needed. Our server was phenomenal. He had our waters chips and salsa at the table when we arrived. There are lots of opérions on the menu, a bit pricey if you're bringing the kids. The food was hot and fresh. The dessert was delicious. I recommend stopping by for a bit in you are in the downtown area.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: First time trying this spot after the tequila fest! And the food was very good! I ordered the agave bowl with chicken and for my drink a Hennessy sidecar. The chips and salsa was soooo good too!The service was phenomenal, we had Elmer and he was very patient and kind. He never rushed us and was informative on what to order. The hostess was very nice as well.The ambiance and environment is very nice! The decor is nice, very spacious restaurant with lots of seating and nice bar area.Overall, I will be back because I love the location by LA Live. Great customer service and very tasty food! O
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Food was really good. Chicken Mole enchilada was perfect. Service and restaurant were great.  The restaurant was lively, fun and everyone was friendly.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: My friend and I went for dinner on a Wednesday evening and it was spectacular. We each had the margarita flight  and those were delicious. For our dinner, we split three appetizers: ceviche with shrimp, sugar cane tenderloin, and the octopus salad (apologies for not remembering the exact names of the dishes). Nevertheless, the flavors and textures were absolutely stupendous!  We plan to return in the near future to enjoy more tasteful drinks and dishes. Also, when you step inside, you feel like you are transported to a different world. Very aesthetically pleasing.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: This place is really good. Was in town for business and went here. Food was great. Salsa had good flavor. Elmer was our server and was great.  Gave us recommendations and answered our questions. The inside was nice and had TVs to watch sports on. Would go back.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I had the pleasure of visiting sol- agave last night and was absolutely delighted with the service provided by their bartender, Elena. From the moment I sat down at the bar, Elena made me feel welcome and attended to.Not only did Elena have an impressive knowledge of cocktails, but their creativity in crafting drinks was truly exceptional. I tried their signature cocktail, the Sol agave Margarita tamarindo, and it was a perfect blend of flavors. Elena even took the time to explain the ingredients and the history behind the cocktail, which added to the overall experience.What impressed me most, though, was Elena's attentiveness and ability to engage in great conversation. They were not just a skilled mixologist but also a fantastic host. Their recommendations were spot-on, and they made my evening memorable.I highly recommend Sol Agave for the incredible bartender experience provided by Elena. The combination of super  drinks, warm hospitality, and a welcoming atmosphere made for a fantastic night out. I can't wait to return and explore more of Elena's creations.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Great happy hour!! Great service! Awesome vibe! Thanks to the amazing hostess who got us the best outdoor seat for people watching in the LA Live District.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Amazing food every time I come here! Was a little upset to know Rosa Mexicano isn't here anymore, but this restaurant is really just as good or maybe even better. Drinks are so succulent and have a good kick to it. If you're on a bit of a budget, try the happy hour! Great prices and the portions are big.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Food, service, and ambiance is great. Well, maybe the music is a little loud.  Made a second trip very soon afterwards.
Address: 800 W Olympic Blvd Ste A130 Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Buchon: *****Got recommended this dish, the pork is crispy and very flavorfulUbe flan: *****This is surprisingly good, strong ube flavor!Will come back for the halo haloParking: street parkingAmbiance: the place is the cutest! You can tell they decorated the place with their loveService: the lady is sooo sweet, she recommended the food. She makes me feel like I'm eating at my grandma's.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: First time trying Filipino food. Ambiance is super cool like a museum but the food was average. Best dish was the lechon. I didn't like the oxtail, the sauce tasted like peanut butter. The chicken adobo you can skip it's very mid. The ube cake wasn't good. Best dessert was the green coconut one. Service is fast and good but wish the food was better.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Came here for brunch on my 30th birthday. It felt like I was back in the Philippines, sitting at a Tita's kitchen. The portions were huge and enough to share with a small family. I highly suggest coming here with a group of friends or family, so you can try different dishes together. The dessert was really good too! I can't wait to be back in Los Angeles so I can have more,
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: definitely get tocino and buchon if you haven't been to this place yet.i don't recommend getting the noodle. it was little plain for us and little disaaplointing.service was quite slow although there were 4 other tables.ambiance was nice, it feels like you are at your friends place for a nice dinner.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: The food was amazing, felt like I was back home to my mom and Lola's cooking! The owner and server was so nice they recommended dishes and were so welcoming. Service was AMAZING. The whole restaurant's ambiance felt like my Lola's house - LOVED IT.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Service is very slow. We waited more than an hour for our food. It looks like they are very short staffed. Very disappointing. Would not recommend.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: LA Rose Cafe is apparently a legendary Filipino eatery in LA. I'll never know. I called ahead to get a reservation for 4, only to have us wait over 2 hours in the heat, on the sidewalk. We looked forward to trying their food, so we were as patient as we could be. Every time I checked in with the front hosts, I was met with poor attitude from the host/owner. Servers avoided eye contact with everyone and did not engage any inquiries - they did look overworked. Phrases like "We're doing our best, but understand we don't have enough seats" are acceptable enough, but what isn't acceptable is confirming a reservation they never intended to honor. When I confronted the host with this conflict, he angrily asked me what I'd like him to do, and I asked if we could be seated soon since we waited a long time. This request exasperated him - I understand the stress, but again, if he doubted he could seat us at all, he could've said so in the beginning when we first checked in, and rejected the reservation request over the phone even earlier - instead of telling me to show up on time and have our party wait for hours outside. After this rude encounter, we left soon after and went to Barrio Fiesta, which IS a solid and legendary Filipino eatery in Glendale. I want to support my fellow Filipinos and their businesses, but LA Rose Cafe made that difficult.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: The usual place where we get Filipino food is quite far, so we decided to try this place out.  Here's my honest personal opinion on this place, based on my own experience.Food: 2/5.  Nothing special.  The food were just OK, but the serving size is small, compared to the other Filipino restaurant that we go to.Price: 2/5.  Not too expensive, but way more expensive compared to, again, the place where we used to go to.Service:  3/5.  A little slow, specially considering that there was only one family in there, other than us.In short, we were not impressed with this place.  Next time we're in the area, I think I would rather drive the distance so I can enjoy better Filipino food, at a cheaper price.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: LA Rose Cafe is an absolute gem that has stolen my heart! This charming eatery has become my go-to spot for the most incredible arroz caldo and pancit. The flavors are so authentic, they transport me back to my grandmother's kitchen, evoking the warmth and love of home-cooked meals.The atmosphere at LA Rose Cafe is truly enchanting. With each visit, I'm greeted by a nostalgic ambiance that resembles my grandmother's cozy abode. The sense of authenticity is overwhelming - from the traditional decor to the heartwarming service, it all feels like a genuine Filipino dining experience.As someone who craves the comfort of homemade Filipino dishes, I can confidently say that LA Rose Cafe has mastered the art. The arroz caldo is a bowl of pure comfort, rich with flavors that remind me of family gatherings. And the pancit? It's a masterpiece of textures and tastes, just like the one my grandmother used to make.In a city as bustling as LA, finding a place that encapsulates the essence of a home-cooked meal is a rarity. LA Rose Cafe has not only achieved this but has also managed to infuse every dish with love and authenticity. If you're in search of a heartfelt culinary journey back to your roots, don't miss the chance to savor the delightful offerings at LA Rose Cafe. It's not just a restaurant; it's a heartwarming experience that'll keep you coming back for more.
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Whenever i crave bistek and diniguan this is the place to be! Me and my husband love this homie restau and love the service as well!!! Great filipino restaurant!!!
Address: 4749 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Went there to check out this new spot. I sat at the bar solo and the lady that sat me wasn't the most warm person. They're more interested in following their own rules, than taking care of new clientele and marking sure they're happy and wanna come back. The server was polite but tried to force a couple of stupid rules on me. I told him that I m gonna order a couple of apps then I ll see if I wanna order more food. He said they prefer if I order everything right away, which I know it would help the kitchen but honestly it's my first time, so not sure of the items I ordered or the portion. Then he grabs my menu after I just finished telling him that I might order more stuff. The answer is we grab menus after taking the order, which doesn't make any sense. Then I asked him if I can order stuff to go to my partner at home, and the answer was that the sandwich is the only thing they do to go. A whole bunch of stupid rules that don't make no sense.  Do these guys understand that being accommodating is a skill that's needed to stay in this industry. Just weird pretentious spot. Too bad even though the  food wasn't traditional Portuguese, it was good and full of flavor that's why I gave them 3 stars. I still added tip on top of the 20% they added, coz I don't believe in stiffing severs, it's their bread n butter. But in all honesty the service is subpar. I wish them the best and hopefully they follow a more customer driven approach so they can survive in this tough market.
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: Excellent service, food, and wine! We were seated in 5 mins on a Saturday evening and had the best night. Thanks Barro Santos!
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: Average on a good day. No dish was something special one must go back to.It is really about the convenience of having a new food spot in the neighborhood. Service was OK. She seemed annoyed. Could be Sunday or us.The small table get really small when you order 5 dishes. Was challenging to maneuver.
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: Food was delicious! Bread, cheese, piri piri chicken and salad were excellent. Only con is, even on a weeknight, we were told to expect a 30 min wait, at worst 45 mins, but we ended up waiting a little over an hour to be seated. Waited another ~15 minutes for our main courses once we ordered. Also, seating arrangements aren't very comfy. Otherwise, the place is cute and has great food, I would just expect a long wait. I think it would be great it they created a reservation system.
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: Great service, beautiful place, and amazing bites! It does get crowded so make a reservation.
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: Delicious food, exceptional friendly service!! Came from AZ to support our Goddaughter, Melissa, Exec Chef & partner, and cannot wait to return!! Is my review a bit biased? Of course!!! But true!!Wishing you & your partner the very best & may you continue to succeed!!! We are so very proud of you!!!
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: This is one of my favorite new spots I've been to in a minute. Barra Santos is tiny, and doesn't take reservations, but the wait is worth it. These small plates are perfect for sharing so you can try as much as possible. Service is kind and friendly. The spot is cute but most of the tables are outside, most of the indoor area is bar. But if you don't mind eating at the bar, the wait on a weekday wasn't too bad! Every single thing we got was delicious, but the crudo was my standout favorite.
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: Came at 4:30 pm on a Saturday and there was already a 45minute wait. We were quoted 45 but it took about an hour. We didn't mind though because we ordered a glass of wine while waiting on their benches outside. Super small and cute restaurant with good vibes as it was in a quiet neighborhood. There really is nothing else around though so it was a bit of a drive and parking was difficult to find although it's surrounded by neighborhoods.Our favorite was the shrimp although it was a bit fishy-- the oil was great with the bread. The tuna Crudo was very refreshing although the lemon flavor overpowered the fish. The sardine toasts were great but I wish it was all warm or all cold. The endive salad was unique but not my favorite. The fish was also unique but a bit too herbal for my liking.Our server was great! All the male servers were friendly but the female servers were less friendly. They also let you know that they already have 20% gratuity included on the bill before you pay.
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: Okay so I seen this place on Instagram & 1st off looks can be very deceiving ‍ I don't know what I was expecting perhaps a bigger place to seat inside.I think it was only like bar seating but they did offer seats outside.Like little cute outside seating. It's definitely good vibes.The waiter Troy was magnificent & he made me feel like I was definitely at a 5 star restaurant.He even offered bread for me to dip in the butter sauce  that my shrimp was in....  I think it's safe to say I tried everything & everything was very very good!!!!Buttered sardine toastTuna  crudo #magicalEndive saladPrawn  #myfavBacalao fritters #yummySo pricing I had 2 glasses of wine & ordered lots of food for the price of two w/ gratuity included about $189Keep in mind I ordered double the foodI think for the taste  & the service it's fair.Honestly I've never tried Portuguese food before & this tasted like something I've never had before.The food was very fresh & worth every bite and honestly I didn't fill to full & disgusting after like at American restaurants when I over eatI felt very satisfied & I went home happy and not over stuff. I will definitely be back!Parking is a much. Hardly no street parkingNo reservations so you either got to wait or be seated right away.Restaurant isn't that big but it's very cute and intimateMust Try
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: This hidden little gem packs a big punch in every single dish! The flavors are unlike any I have ever tasted. Every bite is like an explosion in your mouth that leaves you craving more. The endive salad was  divine, the tuna with the lemon/orange and olive oil was absolutely amazing, the prawns were heavenly, the fritters were very tasty as were the sardine toasties. Be sure to order bread to soak up every bit of the prawn and tuna sauce! I can't wait to go back and try the entrees! All of the dishes were brought out quickly. Our waiter, Troy, provided excellent customer service!
Address: 1215 Cypress Ave Los Angeles, CA 90065

Comment: It's not actually one star but the place is so badly yelp overrated that I had to put this in here to compensate. It's... 2-star. In Thai town, in this day and age, you can find a LOT better, fresher places to eat, only a few feet away.
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Food was pretty good. Service was DECENT. Had to ask for water so many times. At the end, as we we're paying, the lady asked us if we were going to tip. Never in my life have I felt more pressure to tip someone at a restaurant. This really made my girlfriend upset because it felt like we were forced to. We tipped only because it felt forced, but we shouldn't have. No restaurant should be forcing its customers to tip. Very unprofessional and unethical. Food good tho.
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Definitely one of my new favorite Thai spots in Little Siam!!! I had been searching yelp for a good spot in the area, but this spot stood out the most. The shopping center is small, but this place is here right when you enter. I had to order to go because the restaurant was completely packed. Service was great for takeout.When having Thai food, I always judge the restaurant by their most basic dishes. We ordered chicken pad Thai and beef pad see ew. It was so incredibly delicious. Their pad Thai is not overly sweet like some places, and the noodles were cooked perfectly!! The vegetables in the pad see ew were perfect, and still crunchy. The food also came with chili sauce, red pepper seasoning, and vinegar with chilis. The vinegar made the pad see ew out of this world. I usually have leftovers after Thai food, but we completely devoured this. Ruen pair is a true gem!!
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Been wanting to try this place after seeing great reviews and how they have super long lines. It was definitely a top tier thai restaurant for me! Everything was so good, super flavorful and well balanced.We came on Labor Day for a nice early dinner at 4:30 and was pleased to see a minimal line but packed store. We were able to be seated within 5 minutes. Turnaround was quick, and initial impression gave that authentic vibe we were looking for. The restaurant smelled so good once we entered.Ordered the Chicken Pad Kee Mao, Shrimp Pad Thai,  the Spicy Clams, and Thai Tea.Spicy Clams was definitely the highlight of the meal, with an amazing sauce and generous portions of both clams. Would be great paired with some rice next time!The Pad Thai had the perfect balance of sweetness, countered by the limes. Next time I would try the beef, but the shrimp was a nice upgrade.Pad Kee Mao had a good sauce mix, with the spicy kick adding in a little to the dish. Not to mention, the eggs in the pad kee mao + pad thai were standouts :) (if i could get double portions of eggs i would 100% go for it)Overall, if you are looking for authentic thai food with no funny business, this is the place to go to. Would love to try the raw crab papaya salad + curry dishes next time. Don't forget to grab a thai tea while you are there for a sweet refresher!
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Been going here on and off for several years now. That's why I'm surprised at myself and upset that i haven't written a review about this restaurant... All I can say is DELICIOUS  THAI FOOD, they never fail to impress in regards to taste!!! Always a very friendly staff and the price won't break your wallet for the portion of food you get!!! Ambiance is family friendly and the decor is simple and beautifully done. You guys should try this place!  all the way!
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Straight Fire. Brought the fam out to LA for some good eating and decided to check this place out. Let's just say it did not disappoint. Surprised we only waited 10 min and got seated quickly on a busy night. Tom Yum Ka and Crispy pork w/ green beans are my faves. The BBQ pork was mid but the rest of the fam loved it. Thai Ice coffee was on point with the tiny ice chips. -if you know you know. I would definitely recommend if you want some Authentic quality Thai Food. Enjoi!
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Ayo! Finally getting to try Ruen Pair from my Thai Town bucket list and let me tell you, it didn't disappoint.  There is a reason why it's on the top of list for Thai Food on Yelp. Every single dish was amazing, but the Soup and the BBQ Pork were the stand outs for me.  We waited max 5-8 min for a table, you have to sign in on list and wait outside. Service was so fast, they had food out in less than 5 min once Beverages were dropped. Thai Iced Coffee was refreshing.  Service staff was very nice. They have a parking lot but you have to Valet. Restaurant gives you a validation ticket to get a discount. I will be coming back soon!
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I am disappointed with the service today.  We sat for 20 minutes watching the waiter take other customers' orders who came in after us. When she finally came to take our order I pointed out to her and started giving her our orders, instead of apologizing she refused to serve me and told me she'll have another waiter come take our order. I refused to be treated this way when I have been a loyal customer for many years so we left. I will not be going back for a while.
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This was the busiest Thai restaurant in a Thai plaza in Los Angeles! Papaya salad was so good, my favorite dish. We waited probably 30-40 minutes since there was a lot of parties ahead of us. It was worth the wait in my opinion.
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Loved this place when my friends took me here. We did family style and got to try a variety of food and they were all really yummy. But I will say, their mild spice level feels really spicy still. The papaya salad was so yummy but kicked us in the ovaries.The wait can be long so be prepared but the food is worth the wait!
Address: 5257 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The food is so good! Definitely glad to be here again. Saving this spot for the future
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: First time here, enjoyable experience. Spicy pork bulgogi was good! Will come back definitely.
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Very good food + the service was quite amazing. 30 bucks a person past 4pm is not a bad deal.
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Exceptional,Enjoyed every moment of it.The quality was great and the environment was excellent !
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Had the pleasure of meeting a friend after a long time of not seeing each other and decided to take him to an AYCE restaurant Korean BQ place and found the perfect spot in the Koreatown part of Los Angeles, there is validated parking under the building and they can extend it to two hours. The food selection was impressive wherein you can order the prime cuts of beef from a menu and the regular marinated meats was already in the counter for you to cook as you wait for the prime cut to come from the kitchen. The place was clean and the staff took the time to check up on your needs and the steel grill was constantly replaced to ensure clean cooking. The service was fast and since it was not busy at that time for lunch, they extended the time limit to two hours instead of the usual 90 minutes. My friend, who is white was thoroughly impressed that he left a huge tip that to me, being Asian was amazed. The bathrooms were clean and had actual hot running water. I highly recommend this but be prepared to wait as the lines can get very long.
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This place was awesome! Our waitress Jas was amazing but everyone in that place is constantly asking if we need anything. Highly recommend!!
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Awesome ! Great vibes ! Great service ! And the best KBBQ in town . If you want a fun time and good vibes come here
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Cute date night place. Service was amazing, they are every attentive. The food was incredible and I loved the meat bar  such good pork belly!
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: FoodI've been to this place quite a few times and I can say that this place has some good korean bbq. They have a good selection of self serve marinated meats and other food such as karaage , radish, kimchi, japchae, etc. I have to say the japchae is really good and a stand out. They also have a good basic selection of meats that you can order in a menu. This place is a bit on the pricier but given the amount you can choose from it is quite understandable. The quality of the meat themselves are pretty okay. The prime sirloin steak is definitely our go to order most of the time as it seems to be the highest quality one that they have. The brisket and beef belly are also good choices. They have a good variety of side dishes too that can help give a break in between meats.Service/AmbianceThis place is packed most of the time, but the staff were still nice and accommodating with pretty quick service.
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Traveling from Riverside County! Great food! Wonderful service! Nice ambience. :) Would recommend!
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: The best food! Great ambience and nice service! Best place ever. Come get some Korean bbq
Address: 3785 Wilshire Blvd Unit 217 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Some of the best pizza I've had in LA!Also, the ambience is quite nice and exquisite and chill.
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: I'm compelled to say, this is the worst breakfast I've ever had in ANY restaurant.  My dog & I pass by here often on our morning walks & I kept thinking "One of these mornings", we're gonna stop & have a pleasant outdoor breakfast. I got the "pleasant outdoor" part right, but the breakfast part was beyond the pale disappointing, almost annoying.  First, I'm absolutely sure none of the food was fresh. The "breakfast potatoes" looked like round black rocks & were almost as hard, & had some other soft, mushy types of vegetables mixed in. The sausage was dry & hard & the bacon, which I'd asked for very crisp, was like a soft, greasy sponge (even my dog wouldn't eat it) & the eggs, which I'd asked for medium well, we so undone, they ran ALL over the plate. None of it was hot in the meaningful sense of the word. I enjoy any fast-food restaurant breakfast much more.  At least the food is always fresh & hot & the price is within the range of common sense. In addition to the seriously overpriced food they serve, they add an additional 5% "surcharge" which they say is to mitigate inflation & other operating costs" but make it clear that an "employee gratuity" is additional.  Restaurants keep getting away with this because a naive & gullible public gladly validates the old adage that "A fool & his money are soon parted."  I find this trend annoying & offensive &, I fear, it's only going to get worse as more & more people simply pay up without objection.  As for Bottega Louie. their other food & their pastries look good from the window, but my dog & I will never find out. BTW, I'm now considering adding a "surcharge" to all of my tenants' monthly rents to cover increasing operating costs.  Sounds fair to me.
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Jessica is an amazing waitress!  Always on key, gets the order right exceptional service!  Food off the hook as always!  My favorite place to go!  Drinks are always tasty too!  Chris Wood the general manager always exceptional!  He takes care of us like we are family!  These 2 Jessica & Chris Wood should be recognized!  If you didn't have them I wouldn't bother to come here!  Besides great food service means everything!   1000%
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Chris Wood again was over the top amazing.  I didn't even look up and he not only remembered me but took the time out to make sure I was happy and satisfied with everything!  He is one reason why I come to Bottega Louie!  The food was delicious and unbelievably tasty!  Keith our server was fantastic and made sure we were taken care of! This is my favorite brunch place!  The ambiance was amazing as always!  I would give this place 1000 stars!  I just have to mention Chris Wood makes you feel like you are a huge star with the treatment he gives you!  Thanks Chris for always making me feel special!!!
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Chris Wood the general manager made our dining experience much better as the waitress completely forgot about us!  He was so sweet he comped our drinks and came over to check on us!  With him our experience was 100% wonderful!  The food was amazing as usual!
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: First off the last time I went there for brunch my partner was served her meal and all of a sudden my meal was given to the couple next to us and when I complained about it the manager was more perturbed I got upset and said well people make mistakes!! So while my partner ate I had to wait!  Crappy service so I tried it again with a friend of mine and when I asked for water glasses 3 times nothing came so I got up and got it!  Now they add a surcharge for us to pay for their employees and their health insurance they also add a neat charge on alcohol which to me is unbelievable but not only that they had the audacity to charge me for rocks which is essentially ice now I never asked for on the rocks but it came that way!  Never in my life have I ever been charged for these miscellaneous items and when I spoke to Moa the manager she took those items off but when I called back about other issues well she did nothing!!! I will never go back there!! Crappy service oh and by the way the dinner was horrendous absolutely disgusting!  The fish was so smelly and gross I wouldn't serve it to a homeless person!  Do yourself a favor don't go the only thing good there is the bread!
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Omg the food is amazing & so is the service!  Everything I eat there is off the hook!  Best restaurant ever by far!
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Just had brunch here with my girlfriends yesterday and WOW - it was amazing! The ambiance, the food, everything was so girly and chic! What really blew us away was the service we received from Jessica. She made our experience so much more amazing. She was kind, attentive, and just all around super good vibes. Because of her, we'll definitely be back!
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Great food and ambiance, and the first impression we got was from the hosts - Von and Tyler. So welcoming and friendly and they were the reason we stayed. Thank you guys for making us feel so welcome! Great energy.
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: I had lunch on a Friday afternoon, the food and atmosphere was amazing!  The music was old school vibes and the servers and host were so friendly.  Our server Jessica recommended the salmon which was absolutely delicious.  All of her recs were on point, she made the experience truly wonderful.  100% would recommend.
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: My recent visit to Bottega Louie in West Hollywood left me once again enamored with their culinary delights. Having previously fallen in love with their French onion soup at the downtown location, I was eager to savor it on a rainy day in Hollywood. However, upon arrival during brunch hours, I learned that they don't serve this delightful soup during brunch. But the hostess, who was incredibly accommodating, told me to return in 30 minutes so I could indulge in what I came for.During that brief interlude, my partner and I explored the charming area, making the most of our time. When we returned, the same hostess greeted us with a warm smile and genuine interest in how we spent our time - a delightful touch that made us feel truly valued.Our waiter, Jessica, deserves special mention for her exceptional service. She guided us seamlessly through our dining experience and was a wealth of information when we had questions about their bakery offerings. I kicked off my meal with the long-awaited French onion soup, and it was nothing short of amazing. I was so excited to savor it that I regrettably forgot to snap a photo of our main entrée: the pepperoni pizza with added sausage.
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: My fav local spot.  I'm a single guy living in Beverly Hills and this place feels like home.  The patio in the back is a sanctuary (weather permitting).  Open kitchen, everything here has been fantastic and the wait staff is always attentive French style service.  I meet friends and first dates here for coffee or drinks.  Gorgeous bar is also a cool spot to hang.  And, oh those desserts!
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Had an amazing meal today and the staff is amazing. I had the pleasure of having Jessica as my server. Brilliant, kind, and a joy
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Beautiful ambience! Clean. Cute setup and good people watching. The back patio is just as pretty as the front patio. Either way gorgeous restaurant . Yummy mimosas. Yummy beignets  and decent service. We'll def be back!
Address: 8936 Santa Monica Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90069

Comment: Sadly disappointed. Especially given the hype. Went to watch Thursday Night Football, was told after sitting down they didn't have it.  So much for the sports bar. People who wanted a college game were also told no. If you want a game, go to Buffalo Wild Wings, the people here do not care about what you want to see.Compared to buzzy LA restaurants like Mother Wolf, Bestia, Mozza, Bavel, cha cha cha, you name it, the food here is nowhere near that level. We had leftovers and didn't even box them up. I can't remember the last time that happened.No parking, just to add another negative.It took forever to get a reservation, I was really looking forward to this meal. What a letdown.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Ambiance is unique and fun. Food is creative and top quality, I would recommend everything I had but I think about the red wings almost every day.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I cant handle how insane this place is.  The food is some of the best in LA if not America.  Service is solid, get a res a month out, worth it.  Vibe is perfect.  Indian Italian Sports Bar.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: It lives up to all the hype. And if by the grace of god you get a reservation, you gotta go.  The decription says it all- The Indian Italian Sports Bar next to the Comfort Inn. It's like no place else on earth.I do wish they had more vegan options. They used to and they took a few off. The Spagghetti vindaloo was awesome, it deserved better.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Ordered other items on the menu that were not as popular to see if they have a well-rounded menu. Nope. Almost every item we had was bland or sweet. Onion rings, lamb sliders and rickshaw pasta. Not even a little heat. Why?! The pasta and pizza faves that people post about here were the only items on neighboring tables. Kind of one note. The soft serve saved them, but then we were told to hurry up and leave. There were people waiting for our table. Hookay, next time don't expect us to pay the full 19% service fee + ask if we'd like to contribute 3-5% more. With the tables so tightly close together, and the noise up a couple notches because of the sports games on the TVs, it wasn't a comfortable meal, either.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Tasty!! A little packed up in there. The pizza was interesting.. the pasta tho! Malai rigatoni is bomb and you should have it! The mango lazy cocktail is super good, but if you're not into turmeric I'd say avoid licking the glass.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: They now take reservations!! So I finally got to try it. I stayed away for awhile because I don't like waiting in lines and I don't like loud sports bars. There are TVs with sports on them (tennis when I went so I'm here for men running around in short shorts) but they are muted with music playing. Cocktail list looked great although I didn't try any. The okra tots were awesome and so was the chutney pizza (got the pineapple) but the star for me was the rigatoni. I will dream about that perfect pasta. Probably not a first date place unless you are parting ways right after. I'm looking at you spicy foods.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Food was incredibly great fusion of Indian and Italian. Who would've thought. Thank you
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: We got lucky and only had to wait 20 min to get a table without reservations because we showed up at 4:50 and because we truly got lucky. The thing to get here is the rigatoni. The Pijja was okay. My son has dairy and egg allergies so he didn't have much options (also because he can't handle spicy food yet). They agreed to make him a cheeseless pijja with peperoni. The sauce was not traditional tomato sauce so picky son was not super into it. We took it home and added vegan cheese to it and he ate a little bit more. The vibes are great and the rigatoni is also great. The cheesy rickshaw pasta we got was not the best. I'd def return to try some of the meat dishes.
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Wow! I had been anticipating my Thursday night out to Pijja Palace because reservations are highly recommended and they did not disappoint.My server was attentive, sharp, and well mannered. I enjoyed the lively atmosphere and loud screens covering almost every inch of wall space. It sort of reinforces an intimate feeling because you have to either be close or yell to interact with your party... And then there's the food. Sweet Lord. Do yourself the heavenly favor and order the green chutney pizza and masala rigatoni. Everyone is telling the truth. It is that good.Green Chutney Pizza is sublime next day, cold!!
Address: 2711 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Poor cooking and lackluster customer service. We ordered three bowls of noodles, and one contained undercooked, starchy strands. Although our waiter promptly informed the kitchen, we were still charged for the replacement bowl.Given the quality of the dish, this is unacceptable. At this price point, you are either paying for the meal or service yet neither were achieved. I believe Michelin should reassess this establishment's rating and standards.
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: Delicious Michelin star restaurant at such an affordable price! Let me just say, it's not everyday I eat ramen from a Michelin star restaurant. I mean the food here is just amazing. The ramen is $30, which to me is quite affordable compared to other Michelin star restaurants. Such amazing food.
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: The Michelin Stars had me expecting an exceptional ramen but it was average overall. The shrimp tempura and the Summer Salad were good - not extraordinary but fresh and good. The ramen was just okay to me. I got the Purely Vegan Old School. Considering the price ($37) I was expecting something amazing. Noodles were good but clumpy and not as fresh tasting as I expected. The broth flavor was pretty good but it was very oily - I asked for it spicy and they added some spice that was pretty good. My friend got the pork ramen and thought it was okay as well.Overall it was an average bowl of ramen to me. I would definitely not return for ramen again (regardless of the price).
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: TO BE CLEAR - this place does NOT have a Michelin Star. It's easy to be confused by that and I can see why the majority of the customers have been confused since the Michelin logo is plastered everywhere in this joint. It's on the menus, walls, doors, etc etc. The place is a BIB GOURMAND restaurant and recommended in the guide, but again, they do not have a star. In addition to that information, I don't think they should be included at all, but it should be known that they do not have a star...
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: Food was real good. But for a place that brags about its Michelin recommendation and charges $40 for ramen it missed the mark. Restaurant wasn't super clean, they charged a staff appreciation fee which I dont have an issue with (I always tip at least 20%) but as I said I'm not walking away impressed. Food was real good, but I don't see myself ever coming back.
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: Overpriced and subpar .  I rather go to Angry Ramen, imo their food is superior and the owner isn't cocky.
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: Extraordinary!! The nuanced flavors and delicate cook... a foodie's treasure. Highly recommend.
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: What I find beautiful about Japanese culture, is understanding, how gastronomy has played a major role in their rich history. Let's begin by Saying earning a Michelin star is no ordinary occurrence. Having three Michelin stars makes you absolutely unique and extraordinary.You have earned the title and respect, because for you, it's about passion.You don't believe in cutting corners when it comes to the highest quality ingredients. You believe that if one must deliver the best experience and food quality it must be done right or you don't do it at all.My family and I had a wonderful experience at the museum corridor near Wilshire and La Brea. We used Yelp to search ramen restaurants in that area and Kazan populated first.Noodles really didn't become a stable food in Japan until the 1800s. If you truly want to taste an authentic Japanese ramen house you found the place, no need to fly to Tokyo anymore.Oh boy, what a wonderful experience. As you can see by the photographs the restaurant is a bit small but Gosh when it comes to the taste of the fresh soba thin noodles ,the distinctive flavors of the light broth, and to your tongue's desire you feel the tender texture of the chashu pork,. Now, you realized you are in Ramen's heaven.We ordered two Signature #1 dish, and one Lei ramen. Absolutely, delicious. Something I personally found interesting the design of the serving bowls. As you are being served you don't realized that the size portion of this soup is rather large, but it looks small.Trust me it's feels you-up because the bowl has a unique design that keeps a lot of the noodles at the bottom of the bowl.The restaurant is absolutely clean, the staff were friendly and professional.Last, this is a secret, if you want the best time to peacefully enjoy your meal and savor every ingredient come around 4pm. We parked at an adjacent parking structure next to the restaurant just pay the fee and relax. Thanks for reading
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: I think the Michelin rating made the owners Ego huge. Judging by the responses I'm seeing.Anyway- I loved my ramen although it was super pricy. What I did not love at all was the service.My friend ordered a Ramen #1 and immediately said it was too oily. She sent it back right away.We got our bill and we're charged for it. So we asked if we could have it removed.They said they never have people return food....never ever??...they suggested to take 30% off the dish. We requested to speak to a manager...then We had to suggest requesting a new meal Comp'd. Which we did get but still ended up paying full price for the ramen- not to mention the food she ordered was cheaper.We then asked to speak to the owner. We were told he was not there, when we asked when he would be there they said they did not know. We looked on the website and saw the owner in the picture and then realized he was in the restaurant standing next to us.We asked him, are you the owner? And he said yes!Sooooo ...that was enough for us that night.
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: As a Michelin restaurant, no good environment, no service, no taste good, ridiculous!
Address: 111 N La Cienega Blvd Beverly Hills, CA 90211

Comment: tried it for the first time with a long wait. the food is ok. pad thai needs more sauce pretry pale/blant: seafood tom yong is good my kids loved it; beef pad see ew normal needs more flavor; fish with ginger is ok; the dusty pig is also ok a little salty; egg rolls normal; orange chicken ok. of all the orders its only the soup made it if we comeback. its just ok.
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: AWESOME. PLACE. I wish I could eat here every single day!! Every time my boyfriend and I go here, we always get a bowl of curry, and it's awesome because it comes with so much curry you can share it! Just make sure to ask for an extra bowl of rice! My boyfriend always asks me if we can try a new curry, because they have like 10 different options, but I love their yellow curry so much I always say no! :) Oh and don't let me forget how awesome the vibes are here!! You're sitting in a super cute old house in the heart of silverlake, with the cutest twinkle lights surrounding you, and a giant storybook tree going through the middle of the restaurant! Service is always great here, also fairly quick, which we love!
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: So far one of the best Thai places in LA that I have ever been to!! We drive past this place all the time and finally decided to try it out and I'm so glad we did! We ordered a few things and nothing disappoints. We got the spring rolls, golden shrimp, Tom yum (amazing!!!), papaya salad, shrimp pad thai, curry fried rice. All very very good! This will definitely be our new regular spot
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: came here on a sunday evening for a friend's birthday and was so glad we made the drive. food and ambiance were both amazing, and service was also enjoyable!i had the khai soy noodle and the portion was so generous, i had to take some leftovers home. the thai tea was also delicious. would definitely recommend coming here for thai food and sit on the patio if it's nice out because the environment is so cute!
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: The food tastes amazing, but I ordered a vegetarian dish, and it had meat in it... Chicken and what I guess is either pork or beef. I literally started getting sick to my stomach after accidentally eating it. I am a pescatarian, but I have alternated between vegetarian and pescatarian for 11yrs. I currently eat mostly non-animal products, and seafood occasionally (2-3 times a month). Details so you can understand why it's such a big deal to me.I am beyond irritated and sick to my stomach...but they did refund me and were very apologetic and nice about it.PSA: If you do not eat meat and are excited about their vegetarian / vegan options, do not eat here; you will probably get sick. If you are a meat eater, 10/10 recommend and would give it 5 stars.If they didn't handle the situation properly, and if it weren't so good (pre sickness), I would've rated it 1. But because they handled it so well and the food is undeniably good, I had to give 3 stars.
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I can't say enough about this gem. Affordable delicious meals, great and cozy ambience, super kind staff- order the Khao Soi and thank me, yourself, and god later.
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: The food is a 10 out of 10. Everybody who works there is so helpful and friendly. The food came out really quickly and they have a full list of natural wines. Ambience is really cool. Definitely sit outside if you can. They have lots of plants and lights to make a really cozy and fun environment for a night out.
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: The vibe is very true to Thailand, I felt like I was back in Chiang Mai the moment I entered. The employees were so nice and helpful and actually seemed to enjoy being there. The food was delicious and though it's in a bit of a weird space as all places in Silver Lake are, it's definitely worth the trip.
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: We came here for a late dinner. We signed in and waited maybe 20 min. The ambience is very cute and chill. Seating inside and outside patio with bistro lights. We were sat inside by the register. We ordered the green curry, spring rolls, fried rice and Thai teas, coconut water, and the brought us a large bottle of water to self serve. The food was delicious, flavor and spice was perfect. My husband loved his tom kha gai soup (I tried it a little bit and I wished I would've ordered one for myself). The only thing I didn't like was their restroom- it's a single use and it was really hot inside. Other than that service was good- they did forget out drinks but when reminded brought over immediately. Would definitely come back here again.
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Among the top Thai restaurants in LA. The lakeside seating added to the ambiance, and the service was excellent. The "heavenly shrimp" was outstanding!
Address: 1737 Silver Lake Blvd Ste 1 Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Stopped in here on a Tuesday night for some drinks and was absolutely amazed by the ambiance and the service. We were greeted promptly and our bartender was extremely kind and professional making sure we were taken care of throughout the night. I would highly recommend this spot to anyone looking for great service and some solid cocktails. I can't wait to come back! Thank you employees only!
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Cool place to hangout, they have amazing drinks and the staff is friendly, the food is also tasty but I would say better for drinks than food, I went with 3 of my friends and had a blast, would come back again!!!
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Employees Only was definitely a lovely treat.We decided to do date night last minute and employees only had a few good reservations left.We ordered one of their eo classic cocktails called the ready, fire, aim and it was very delicious.For dinner we ordered the crudo, tartare, duck, and scampi pasta, and ended with the tiramisu. The tartare was my favorite and I love how they mixed it table side. The duck was cooked perfectly and the cabbage it's over was DELICIOUS. My pasta was good but my noodles we too al dente but overall taste was great.My reasoning for four stars over five is our waiter wasn't the greatest, she just wasn't attentive at all. It wasn't just us because we saw others flagging her down throughout dinner.
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Wish I could leave 6 stars. This place was the HIGHLIGHT of my trip to LA. The drinks were amazing (even got a last word, which is pretty hard to get in most bars when I'm from because of the green chartreuse shortage). The Cesar salad was the best Cesar salad I've ever had and the steak frites was phenomenal. (A girl next to me let her try the truffle fries, next time I'm going to substitute the regular fries for truffle fries). The place is dark, sexy, and super vibey. Great music. Friendly staff and bartenders too! I can't wait to come back... best part of my trip to LA. Hands down!
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: High-quality custom drinks that are prepared quickly and efficiently. The staff was friendly and allowed my boyfriend to enter the restaurant despite not demonstrating the proper dress code. I would suggest making a reservation if you would like to sit at a table, but if you plan to hang out at the bar casually, I would not be concerned about coming unprepared.
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Vibe and atmosphere. It has the Low key feel, combined with enough party vibe to have a good time. Not a big drinks connoisseur, but this drinks made my taste pallet explode. 10/10 recommend
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Definitely a go to for a late dinner, great vibe, service, music and drinks!   Even the doorman is chill
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Hosted an event here in the private dining room. The ambiance is incredible. We had some music going and the room was nicely lit, had a beautiful private bar, and accompanying private bartender. The menu was prefix and tasted great. Service was wonderful and quick. Overall I had a great birthday party, thanks Employees Only!
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I visited this place once again, and I have to say it is a really nice spot.This time I came in at dusk on a Saturday evening, and just sat at the bar. The bartenders that served us, Adrian and Ryan, were especially both attentive and capable. We had a few appetizer type dishes (calamari, and french fries) that were really quite nice, although not necessarily indicative of what their major dishes had to offer. That being said, I have no worry about the major dishes being, quite frankly, major.Another really enjoyable evening jere at Employees Only, where the atmosphere was great the music was gentle yet provided sounds that filled the room with energy and their bartenders were quite delightful!
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Went back for a second time and this time was better than the first (and the first time was awesome).This time is was a weekend, the DJ was in full effect (but not full volume), the drinks were delicious and the food was yummy.The crowd was eclectic, stylish and energetic while not overly loud (which would have been problematic considering how low the ceiling is).I love this place a lot, it makes the neighborhood more special to me than its ever been.
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Loved this place. came for a date night with my boyfriend and they had the most incredible singer doing live music. so relaxing and such a vibe. on top of the atmosphere, the food was 10/10. We had the summer salad, the focaccia, the wagyu burger, and the steak & frites..all amazing. will definitely return.
Address: 7953 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: My place to go each time I visit Beverly Hills, food is very delicious, highly recommended this place to everyone!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Amazing food and amazing service. The place is also beautiful. Would definitely recommend
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Love this place. Most romantic restaurant in Los Angeles. They always execute the romantic package perfectly.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: The most romantic restaurant in LA! I came to Il Cielo for a friend's birthday dinner. Their outdoor seating area was effortlessly beautiful with lights. It's pretty during the day but more charming at night. For starters, we got the calamari fritti ($24), burrata pugliese ($26), and cesare ($18) to share. The calamari was good, but not crispy. While the burrata was pretty small.For pasta, my friends got the spaghetti latini ($36), tortelli di burrata ($38), and pappardelle al cinghile ($42). My friend also got the salmon ($44) and I got the pollo arrosto ($42). The portions were good and filling. My pollo was juicy with a yummy sauce. They don't offer anything complimentary for birthdays, but they do nicely decorate any dessert you order. We got the cuore di cioccolata ($18), which was a heart shaped chocolate cake.There were lots of servers, always ready to help. The service was great! If you're looking to celebrate any special occasions, I suggest coming here for the ambiance!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Went there to celebrate a birthday. I was looking for a cozy romantic restaurant and I had heard that this was the spot. I can honestly say the romance was 7/10 it was t what everyone raves about, I prefer 71andabove . Also, the service wasn't great, our waiter hardly smiled, he stared at me up and down like " who are you" he didn't have a good energy, I know what type of restaurant this is and how expensive so, yes I was planning on spending. He brought the birthday dessert I requested and didn't even say happy birthday to the birthday girl, he was so dry and blah! The food was 7/10, nothing to rave about, flavor was good but not superb . All in all this was a one time visit
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Beautiful romantic restaurant. I went there with couple of friends. We sat at the front patio, ordered glass of wine, started with cesare and Tuscana salad. it was my first time tring the Tuscana salad and I really liked it. For the main entree, we ordered Branzino, Burrata e Aragosta, and Funghi porcini and we all loved our food. For dessert we had Affogato and Biscotti. everything was great. I highly recommend this place for special occasion or a romantic date.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: This is definitely one of the most beautiful and romantic restaurants in LA. This time we were sitting in the front patio since there was a private party in the back patio. Honestly, both patios are beautiful. We started with couple of drinks and Cesare salad and mixed green salad. I thought the salads were ordinary, nothing to brag about. Maybe I should try a different salad next time. for main course, two of us ordered the Burrata e Aragosta, it was very delicious but only two small piece of lobster in it and the rest was rice and creamy sauce. As I said very tasty but for that price, we both thought they should have put more lobster in it. For those of you who had read my last review on this restaurant, last time I was there, I had ordered the same thing but asked our server to substitute the rice with any kind of pasta if possible and he said yes but he didn't mention anything about the extra charge for substitution and brought me pasta with lobster in a creamy sauce and the price was almost twice as much which I noticed only when he bought us the check, from $39 jumped to $64 which I thought for a substitute, if the price is jumping that much, you MUST let the customer know in advance. Of course, $39 was the old price for this item and now I think it is $54 which is too much for what you get. My friends ordered Salmon and Branzino. She was happy with salmon, the other one with Branzino said it was just ok. for dessert, I ordered Affagato which was basically scoop of vanilla ice cream with espresso over it and a piece of biscotto. It was good if you like ice cream.  The owner also sent us Dolcetto de limone because of the last time messed up which was a nice gesture from him but unfortunately none of us liked it but if you like the lemon taste, you probably like it but non of us did. When we got the check, first we didn't notice that 22% tip was already added to our total and we  were ready to leave tips on top of that but one of our friends who checked the check noticed it was added. I could see adding the tips automatically for party of 6 and larger but I think even if you are going to add tips automatically, should be 18 to 20 % not more than that and leave it to customers if they want to tip more. Now, do I go back to this place, probably yes because of the beautiful ambiance and honestly my food was tasty but over priced for what I got. I highly recommend it for your first date if you are looking for a romantic restaurant.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Il Cielo is definitely one of the most beautiful and romantic restaurants I have been in LA. I had not been there for a long time but I remember it used to be one of my favorite restaurants because of the good food and also the violin player they had going to each table and play a beautiful music. So, I called the place to make the reservation and asked them if they still had the violin player, they said not any more. I decided to still make the reservation since I really liked their beautiful patio. When we arrived we were seated right away. It was a little bit cold to sit out and they offered the back patio and gave us the option to take either one. The other couple that we were meeting suggested the back patio which was as gorgeous as the front one if not more. The service was good and we got our drinks right away. My friend ordered Bucatini all' Amatriciana $26, our husbands both ordered Pappardelle al Cinghiale $28 and I ordered Burrata e Aragosta $39 which is Carnaroli Rice, Lobster, Burrata Cream.I thought well, I like the lobster and creamy sauce but not the rice so I asked our waiter if I could substitute any kind of pasta for the rice. He said yes, I could get it with Pappardelle, lobster and truffle sauce. I said ok any kind of pasta is fine as long as I am still getting the lobster with white creamy sauce. We got our foods and they were all good. Mine was in a very rich creamy sauce which was little bit too heavy on my stomach but I should admit that it was one of the most delicious dish I have ever had. When we got the bill, we noticed that one of the items were $64 which was more than any thing we saw on the menu and none of us ordered something for $64. We thought that must be a mistake and when we asked our waiter he said that was for my food. That was the only reason that I gave it 4 stars. I didn't think for substituting rice with pasta the price of my food jumps from $39 to $64 and I think we should have been told about such a big price change by our waiter. Later on I called the restaurant and told the manager that in other restaurants when you substitute something they will let you know right away even if the difference is couple of dollars so don't you think when the price changes to twice as much you should definitely let the customer know? He explained that this was a different dish than the other one because had more lobster with truffle sauce ( I just asked for a substitute not a different dish) but he also agreed that we had to be told about the big price change. He was very nice and understanding and said next time you are here you will have your drinks and couple of desserts on the house. I thought that was fair and good customer service and I am definitely going back since I love the ambiance but I will be very careful with my substitutes. Lol.... I also have to add that this is a beautiful place for special occasion or if you would like to impress someone on a romantic date.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: If you are looking for romantic and delicious food! This is the place to be! The 3 course meal allows you to experience dinner so effortlessly !
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Came here a while backIt's a cute placeVery prettyThe service was goodI'm not sure if it was an off day but we didn't really enjoy our food. We love Italian but just didn't enjoy the food especially when it's priceyI'd probably come back again just to give it another chanceBut definitely a beautiful place doesn't even feel like you're in LA once you're inside
Address: Verified by Business
