Comment: We were originally sat right by the front door w/ a real bush growing into our table (disgusting, not charming) and my date was cold wrapped up in her jacket.  no one noticed so I had to explicitly ask to move to back patio where we sat next to now slightly less encroaching fake bushes.The largest offense was when we tried to order some antipasto from our very rude server who informed us they "had a very small kitchen and the chef would prefer our entire order at once" and to 'let him know once we know what we want for our main entree' and then and only then he'd take our appetizer order.We ended up ordering apps and over priced weak watery brunello from another friendly enough server only to be incredibly disappointed w/ the quality of the food.  Calamari was nothing special, olive garden quality.  antipasto plate was generic lunch meat and the char broiled octupus was not even cooked through all the way.We left the food and the wine on the table and left w/o ordering anything else.  the server tried telling me my card was declined (never got a notification on my phone of even an attempt), gave him another card (from the same issuer) that worked just fine ha!  The same card he said was declined worked just fine at the valet.I would avoid this place at all costs.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Good food. Lobster pasta $85 but tasty.We booked the 45 birthday package comes with roses and a chocolate cake. The cake was surprisingly tasty.They have nice outdoor dining area, great service!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Nothing special actually not good at all. I ordered the number 19 and I've had much better sandwiches at other delis. The service was good. The people were nice but the food was absolutely nothing to write home about.
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: I'm pregnant and was craving a Reuben sandwich so my husband told me about this place and we came for lunch and I was so satisfied by the food but to top it off the service was great! Love this place it's like going back in time in a good way!
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Service was great! I had a higher expectation on the pastrami sandwich I wish it had more flavor.
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: #19 and fries: YES!Sandwich fillings seem to be less generous with each visit, but quality is excellent and unchanged. I've been a customer for more than 50 years.My guest wore a fashionable, black TANK TOP, and we were not allowed in. The policy is stated on a placard at the entrance; be advised. (He bought a $5 t-shirt nearby, then we were seated.)
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Although this is my family's favorite pre-game dining option, this was my first visit.  The restaurant is old -- vinyl seats, formica counter...Menu is as expected with all the usual deli offerings.  It is also overpriced as expected.  I had the matzo ball soup and brisket french dip.  Soup was overly salty with average matzo balls.  The sandwich was good, but not worth the almost $30 paid (they charge an extra $4 if you want extra lean meat).I'm glad I finally tried this place, but it is overrated.
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Langer's pastrami should be protected by UNESCO provenance regulations.  Any other "pastrami" should be referred to as "spiced corned beef".
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: This place hits the spot every DAMN time! So good! #is a must order. Pastrami fries are exceptional as well, would highly recommend the Caesar salad too. The service is great and always super efficient.
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Man, it's been years since I had Langer's!  I decided weeks ago that before I drove back to Phoenix, I was coming here for a sandwich.  I was getting the #19, and I was going to enjoy it before my long drive back home lol.I drove down and parked in the lot.  They give you a ticket to get validated, its one hour free parking.  I walked down the block, opened the door, walked inside and told them I wanted to place a "to go" order.  They write down your order on a yellow piece of paper, you pay at the register ($26.00 or so), and then I took a seat.  A few minutes later, my sandwich was ready.  I took it to go, back to my car and bust it open on the trunk of my car.  How was it?#19- Sweet baby Jesus!  This sandwich lives up to the hype!  Its hot pastrami, cole slaw, swiss cheese and Russian dressing piled on their double crusted rye bread.  Man, this sandwich was bomb!  First bite in, I knew I was in the presence of greatness.  This sandwich is huge, too!  You could probably split one with a buddy, but you are also missing out on pure deliciousness if you don't eat the whole thing yourself.  The bread was warm, chewy and crunchy, the pastrami was hot and fatty and tender, the cole slaw and Russian dressing were cool and creamy, and the Swiss cheese added a little tang.  Pretty much a perfect sandwich.  I "oooohhhh and aaaahhed" after every bite and made my way through the whole thing. Loved every single bite.  The only thing I might do different next time is get "light dressing".  It was very wet in certain parts and on certain bites.  Didn't detract from the sandwich, might just be a little less messy with lighter dressing.It was a perfect sandwich to end my long weekend in LA.  I'm already thinking about the next time I will be in LA, so I can get another one.  Definitely in my top 10 sandwiches I have ever had in my life, probably in my top 5.
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: This may have been the best pastrami sandwich I have ever consumed in my life!My buddy Dave G wrote an updated review on this spot a few days ago. His descriptions and review set off a red flag in my head.  I need to try this place soon!   Ive always wanted to come here and try it out, so those 2 things combined, I knew I was going to get a sandwich!We parked out on the street and then walked up and waited in line.  5 minutes later we sat down.  My buddy was full so he didn't get anything, and I was super stuffed too but had to try it out.  Placed my order for a pastrami on rye and a Coke.  A few minutes later my sandwich came out.Its a basic looking sandwich.  Meat and bread served along with some pickles.  I really enjoyed the double crust rye bread.  It was soft in the middle and crunchy and delicious on the crust.  The pastrami was the king of the show!  It was hand sliced, thick, tasty, fatty, flat out delicious!   I was super stuffed from eating pizza just an hour before, but I finished this sandwich no problem!   Yes...it was that good!  For a sandwich and 2 drinks it was about $18 bucks.  Well worth it!  I'm really glad I finally got to try this place out, and look forward to coming back someday in the future.
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Best pastrami ever! Great, warm, friendly service. The interior is completely original from 76yrs ago, so super nostalgic. Really cute place & authentic. (They have free parking too).
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: The #16 was delicious as usual. On the pricier side but very delicious. The meat is lean. Fries come out hot and crispy. The rye bread was exceptionally fresh today. Crispy edges and very soft
Address: 704 S Alvarado St Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Truck is nice. Area is clean and lit up up. Menu is easy to read and filled with great options. I got the 2 skewer combo, including the filet mignon and wagyu skewers. I would definitely recommend them. The noodles were very delicious and better than expected in my opinion. Stop by yakitana for some good eats! Ps: lots of parking.
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Great delicious food , nervous at first but welcome with great customer service they help me get enough food for my budget , truly recommend to everyone and a great place to clear your mind an just enjoy the surroundings an environment with food
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Presentation of the food truck is clean. Has a nice seating area. Food took a bit longer had to wait about 30 min. Not sure if you can call in an order. Didn't try.Pretty pricey, but then again getting wagyu and scallop etc some "premium" meats.Side portions is hefty. I got a side of white steamed rice and added chicken. They mistakenly gave me friend rice and walked over to stop me from eating it to fix, but it was fine. Big portion of fried rice with chicken.I got the following platinum bowl (4 skewers)Wagyu- nicely cooked, juicyBacon asparagus-okFilet mignon-juicyLamb- interesting they marinated it with a sweet marinade. Tasted more like a pork chop. Unless I had pork chop without realizing it.-1 star wait time.Only thing is it's a great concept, but yakitori is better when the skewers are served as soon as they're cooked, otherwise it's cooled and doesn't taste as good as it was right off the grill. So I personally wouldn't do take out. Maybe fine tune menu to perhaps have food that cook at the same rate.
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Nice clean food truck with restaurant quality foodA-5 Japanese Wagyu - Lamb Chop - Pork Belly- Filet Mignon on a half spicy noodle & fried rice!!Meat was cooked to perfection the filet literally dissolves in your mouth super juicy!!!! Lamb chop had a great flavor the wagyu & pork belly are just as good and the sauces they are top with are out of this world!!! loved the service very friendly and the fact that the food was brought to the car was the icing on the cake!! I seen some comments on here complaining about the prices you want cheap and fast food go to McDonald's!! I disagree its worth every penny i drive at least once a week from the i.e to downtown la to treat my self some yakitana!!
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Listen up folks, if you're in downtown Los Angeles and in need of a truly satisfying meal, Yakitana Food Truck is where you need to be. This is my favorite food truck in the city, hands down. The menu is extensive and offers a wide variety of options, but let me tell you, their bacon-wrapped asparagus is a must-try. It's the perfect balance of smokiness, saltiness and a hint of sweetness. It's the kind of dish that will have you closing your eyes and letting out a deep sigh of pleasure.Now, I'm not one to shy away from traditional Japanese street food, but Yakitana takes it to a whole new level with their creative options, like the lamb skewers. The flavors are bold and the portions are generous, and the staff is friendly and attentive. Plus, the truck itself is clean and inviting, making it the perfect spot to grab a bite after a game at the crypto arena.In short, Yakitana Food Truck is a must-visit for anyone in search of authentic and delicious Japanese street food. Don't sleep on the shrimp noodles also! trust me on this one.
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I was glad a could order a healthy meal..for the most part compared to McDonald's, Popeyes etc late in the evening near Staples. With that said, the food was just OK. The white rice wasn't the best..just ok like the rest of the meal. It was a bit pricey but once I got my order, I sort of understood why. The Tupperware they use is high quality (reuse it for work), they give you way above the sauces needed (half of what was given was all the was needed) and the packaging/marketing was very nicely put together. With that said, they should save on the cost of the above and buy better white rice.Again, I would come back only because a) I expense my meals for work b) healthier options at this late evening. Check out the price in the pic so you don't get surprised.
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Best hibachi truck in Los angeles!! They have such a unique and tasteful flavor in every bite. All the meats were so tasty and the fried rice was cooked perfectly and delicious. The portions seem small at first but 1 plate filled my girlfriend and myself up just fine.
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I was very surprised with this food truck! I didn't expect to fall in love with their food so much.I ordered the 2 skewer combo with Lamb Chops and Filet Mignon. The lamb chops were divine. Melted in my mouth and had so much juicy flavor!!I also got the spicy noodles and spicy fried rice and it's the best fried rice and noodles from ANY HIBACHI place hands down!!! Make sure you try their yum yum sauce!!!!Definitely will be back!
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: The pictures looked good on the truck menu. I ordered 1 wagyu beef, 2 pork belly, and 1 bacon wrapped mushroom skewer plus the spicy rice and spicy noodles. Cost over $50 with 15% tip.  They snuck in a service fee, for what I don't know. I didn't like that. They charge quite enough already, thank you.The food was the worst. Every single skewer was bad. The wagyu beef was tough and chewy. I've had proper wagyu and this was far from that. The pork belly skewers tasted like overcooked pork from somewhere other than the belly.  There was none of the tasty fat I would expect from a proper pork belly. The bacon wrapped mushroom was chewy, tasteless and boring.The spicy noodles and spicy rice were the only good things. Overall, quite a waste of money, and time, as it took about 30 minutes to get. I would have done much better at most any restaurant for $50 plus dollars.I will not be going back.(This review is from the Yakitana Truck on Hope and 12th Street, Dec 2022)
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I ordered the most expensive menu (I think it was the $60 one) cause I fought with my wife. So I wanted to treat myself. But then the food was subpar.. too salty yet bland.
Address: 1212 S Flower St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Delicious bread and butter. A beautiful space. Fun cocktail and mocktail (limited) selection. Price point a little high, but not so much so above the standard. I wouldn't order the steak again. And their version of a caprese salad is a bit busy.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great ambiance, subpar expensive food.A little pretentious without the quality to match.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great date spot! Service was good and food serving size is on the smaller size. Ordered a few items and shared between two. Drinks were great and very pretty!
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing ambience and service plus the best brunch we have had in a very long time. The biscuits and fried potatoes were almost as good as my southern grandma's. The entrees were hearty with an LA healthy twist. The location is a really fun place to stroll too. Lots of funky cool shops. Can't wait to go back and try their happy hour and dinner.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I was really impressed with the atmosphere even though I didn't eat in the restaurant. They were very accommodating in preparing the meals to go. In addition, the food was excellent and I will be returning to eat in. We had the steak and frites along with the gnocchi. Fantastic
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Ambiance is amazing  food it's ok. I definitely come back for the drinks. I recommend their bread.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I love the arancini, caprese salad and gnocchi. And the buffalo maitake and the crudo.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Third time strong. Question: are the gods still here? Answer: Yes.This cute spot is quickly stealing our foodie hearts.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This is my second time coming here and the food was so good we just had to ask ourselves just what kind of experience are we having right now. The winning quote, "it's like God came down and jizzed in my mouth". "Which God?" you might ask? "All of them."You should eat here.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Highly recommend as a cute place for date night or get together with friends! Easy parking nearby if you don't mind the paid lots, which we grabbed a lot off Melbourne Ave behind the 13th Church of Christ.On a hot summer day, the outside seating was still nice with a breeze. The umbrella gives you more than enough shade too.Service was fab. Real nice and checked in at appropriate times. Food came out on time too.Food we ordered:+ Oysters: Good quality, although my boyfriend felt it was a tad salty but I thought it was perfect when balanced with the sauce and lemon.+ Arancini: The truffle didn't stand out as much as I hoped, but still a really good snack with a lovely soft inside.+ Maitake: Rich and creamy in a good way. Nice mix of buffalo sauce with a side of ranch. Carrots were nicely done, with still a small bit of crunch to it.+ Gnocchi: On the richer end with the sour cream. If you want a really soft pasta, go for this one.+ Summer Arrabiata: I really liked most of this dish. Perfect pairing of squash and baby corns for texture and al dente cavatelli. Unfortunately for myself, I'm terrible with spicy food and I didn't realize this would have a kick to it. I wish the spice didn't overpower the dish as much, but some would probably like it.+ Panna cotta: We had a panna cotta with mango slices on top. I really liked this as a lighter dessert. For those of you very familiar with dim sum, this actually reminds me of Chinese mango pudding... #iykyk.On a last fun note, the bathrooms were nice in that there were two individual rooms, but my one complaint is the lighting situation. I get having a vibe and there was a dim light over the sink, but the toilet side of the room was awfully dark without any lighting. I could barely see where the toilet was and couldn't figure out the light switches as they were taped up as if I wasn't supposed to touch it. Ended up using my phone flashlight to go. Either I'm dumb and couldn't figure out the lights or they are trying to set up a very different mood that I couldn't appreciate for a simple bathroom situation. But it'll get the job done.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The food, the service, and the ambience is wonderful. This is a great place to have happy hour, the cheeseburgers, the salads and the cocktail choices are amazing.
Address: 1816 - A N Vermont Ave Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing food even better people. Cozy, and great for special occasions, family gatherings and romantic dates alike.
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Wonderful restaurant.Amazing food on Friday they have belly dancers and people get up to dance with them.Try the lamb and the Moroccan tea.We will be back soon!-Tony
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I am in love with Casablanca Moroccan Kitchens. I could eat here every single day. They are always welcoming, swift, courteous, and the food is AMAZING! I always eat my weight in food when im here. We usually get the 3 course meat lover and 3 course pescatarian! (I really can't pick a favorite dish because it's all spectacular, flavorful, and amazing..BUT I am OBSESSED with the lamb honey tagine and chicken pastilla.) The ambience is warmly lit, inviting, and just SOOOOO cute inside. I have recommended and will continue to recommend this place to every person who is willing to listen!!
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: My friend is Moroccan and he's been saying this is the best Moroccan food in LA.....well, we finally went. And let me tell you...WOW. I'm currently in a food coma trying to summons the strength to clean all the plates. Staff was very pleasing & accommodating. Definitely coming back, might jus nap in the corner to make some room & wake up to indulge again! Cheers
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: First time here to celebrate a friend and WOW! So beautiful inside! I loved the plants and dimmed lighting. My family is from Mexico so I've never had Moroccan food before. It was such an amazing experience! The food was cooked to perfection! The lamb was the best I've ever had too! They took care of use every step of the way. The belly dancer was also very beautiful and magical; such a wonderful night here! Totally a date spot for that fancy anniversary!
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Listen, this place rocks. I'm currently in a coma. The salads rock. The pastilla is crazy here. I'm talking CRAZY! Service is A+. I did get a glimpse of the shrimp and I'm for sure going get some next time. Oh and the setting is dope. Guys, bring a girl here.
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Food, service & ambiance on a 100. This place simply rocks. The hosts are extremely hospitable.
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The food here is 100% authentic. I would definitely come back here again. The Kefta Tajine is a hit.
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I wanted to try something different and found this Authentic Moroccan eatery.If you're a tea lover you have to try their yummy Moroccan mint tea.They were running late opening the doors but that's A-ok they made up for it by giving**my hubby NOT one but TWO Lamb shanks.That's the kind of service that I look for. They went the extra mile.It is hard to find an establishment these days that provide awesome food and impeccable service. You guys are Fantastic!!!I loved my Lemon chicken Tagine.I am a picky person and I don't like carrots but I loved their carrot salad.I don't have any negative to say it.Thank you. I'm definitely coming back.
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Last night was my first time here but it certainly won't be my last! The hospitality from Naima and the rest of the staff was top notch! The space was intimate but not small, beautiful lighting...just a great spot for a date or a special event! And the food? *Chef's kiss!* I mean, have your ever had a meal transport you to another place? According to my taste buds, I have been to Morocco! We started with the couscous salad which was so vibrant and fresh and the flaky, warm, flavorful scallop pastilla (pictured below). For the entree, I had the lamb and vegetable tagine; the lamb was so tender, I never used my knife and the veggies,  soooo flavorful. My date had the chicken tagine and the flavor literally unfolded and transformed in my mouth. Perfection! If you're in the LA area, do not miss this experience!
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: 3.5/5The atmosphere at this restaurant is somewhat funky - a weird combination of rustic and romantic with a bit an artificial note. It's definitely not bad, and feels like a family type place, cozy despite the funkiness. Lacks authenticity, at least in the atmosphere.Food was quite good, although some dishes were definitely better. Carrot salad - absolutely incredible! Tagines were great too, much better with couscous on the side than meat and coucous together. Chicken pastilla was great too! I wouldn't recommend any of the vegetarian variations - vegetable pastilla or vegetable tagine.Service was very good!Parking - none. There is no parking lot and no valet. Street parking can be challenging in that area, and most streets require permit.
Address: 6919 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We came on a late Friday night and were seated immediately, which was a plus.Good food and environment - pretty much what you would expect from a Korean pub in Ktown. Food came out quick and the servers were responsive enough.Cup noodle fried rice was surprisingly delicious but the kimchi cream pasta and rose tteokboki tasted pretty much the same (I would recommend getting one or the other).
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Great food, great service, and an amazing vibe for a night out with the girls !! They also have the cutest photo booth to take pics !! and if you're there for a few drinks, their mango soju cocktail is our go to !
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: OH MY GD this place is so good. The guy that took my order was so nice, and the food. Let me tell you something. I had the salmon over rice, and the fish just melted away in my mouth. The flavor was incredible, it made me try to recreate the dish and I haven't been able to do anything close to what they've done. And their Korean army stew was hearty, flavorful, and deliciously spicy! I'll definitely be coming back. Plus I live their take out containers
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Really loved the food and experience we had here. They were able to accommodate our large group even  on a busy night. We called ahead of time to make sure we could get in. The food was all reasonably priced and was some of the best Korean pub type food I have had. Great corn cheese, awesome seafood pancake, really good rice cakes, and great popcorn chicken. The staff was extremely friendly and a lot of fun. I look forward to coming here again with my friends
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: They just reopened after few months of closure! Missed this place and I'm happy they are back on their business. Great place to hang out with few drinks or to have dinner ! Highly recommend their food. They also have many promotions going on with their reopening so you should check their instagram @jail.joa to take advantage of it ;)
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: This place reopened after the owner (Jin) finally got her liquor license back ! Now that they can sell alcohol, they added more k-bar style menu to their old menu. Server told me that jin makes all kimchi so everything with kimchi is good! Everything was DELICIOUS and plates were fun especially cup noodle fried rice. If you are looking for fun k-bar vibe that serves great food, you should definitely try this place!
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: This place got closed down by the Department of Health.They never got their health permit.Womp womp.
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: I LOVE THIS PLACE!The servers are very friendly and attentive, the food is flavorful, and there is easy and affordable valet parking.I've been here a couple of times on a Friday night around 8ish pm and never have to wait although it seems like it picks up around 10ish pm. Food came out quickly which is a plus! SO pleased with this spot! Great place to share a variety of dishes and drink with some friends. Will keep bringing more pals to this spot.HIGHLY RECOMMEND!! NEEDS MORE HYPE (or do we gatekeep this lol)
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Jail Joa easily become my favorite place to eat and drink with friends.I've seen the place fill up starting around 9PM but haven't had an issue getting seated pretty quickly!all of the servers are super friendly and helpful!as for the food, we've tried the rose tteokbokki, kimchi cream pasta, popcorn chicken (fried or sweet n sour), and the seafood pancake.everything was tasty. highly recommend!parking: street or valet (cash). we usually valet since it's ktown and parking is a battlefield.
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: Not bad for a late night snack! We ordered the spicy beef stew with dumplings, spicy pork and octopus and the donkatsu. The soup was a tad spicier than we could handle and the donkatsu sauce was a bit sweeter than we would have liked. But the spicy pork and octopus was great and highly recommend!
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: This place actually surprised me! We came here after a Kings game at the Staples Center cause we were craving some late night Korean bites.Although we didn't order an alcohol here, I could definitely see this place as a great hangout spot to pregame before going out or just in general a great space to get a bit lit! There are different rooms in this place, but they were only seating everyone in the room with the movie-theme.We ordered two plates: the chicken gizzard and the spicy intestines. Both were great however I was hoping that there would be slightly more gizzard and intestines in each dish compared to ratio of the onions, garlic, etc.I was also a bit bummed that they did not have chili paste at all. They did have sriracha and gochujang so that sufficed.Our server was nice, but at some point he started eating with his other colleague and so flagging him down for the check in the end was a bit harder.Overall, a relatively decent option in the east end of Ktown! Parking was ok for us because it was a Monday night and pretty late, but the lot was still like 90% full, so I can't imagine how the situation would be on a weekend night.
Address: 2500 W 8th St Ste 180 Los Angeles, CA 90057

Comment: BLOWN AWAY. Was working in Ktown and came upon this gem. I've been a Korean food fanatic for over 20 years and eaten at many spots here in Ktown and all over LA. Can't believe I never came upon this authentic "Mom n' Pop" spot. Sundubu is amazing, Bibimbap is legit, banchan is on point, authenticity and charm makes this place perfect. AND so many other items on the menu that look enticing.The chef's son painted the walls with some beautiful Korean landscapes as well.Do yourself a favor: COME HERE!
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: If you like Korean food this place has the best home style Korean cooking in LA. Also their tofu soup is Mike's better than your usual spots like Surawon. The store itself feels like home, but service can get busy during lunch time. Have some patience :)
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food and service are amazing~! Soy bean stew is my favorite food here. I strongly recommend this restaurant and I also should come back soon.
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food was great and authentic. I asked for extra rice and they didn't charge extra. Service was great as well.
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Recently stayed best western, really wanted some Korea food, found this restaurant nearby, decide give a try, but I was so regret!!!! Absolutely Waste my money! There is tons of Korea restaurants out there!! ordered Kalbi-tang & BiBimbap, BiBimbap come out cold, it's not on stove, also they give really small amount!!!  and kalbi-tang is tasteless, also not on stove which they supposed to be on stove, just like they just dump meat at water so much oil and they chopped small pieces!!!I looks so pale don't even have any color on it! it's worst Kalbi-tang I ever had in my life!!! I love Korea food but if this is the korea food will be like, i will never want korea food again! Also this old woman working there, she is not nice! Probably because I'm not korea? Because I see her very nice to Korea customs there!! Races! I really hate restaurants people doing that!!! If you want treat people differently, then don't welcome us! Don't let us in!! $24.99 + $18.99, can I expected better?
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Came here for lunch on a Saturday. There weren't many people dining in at the time so we got seated right away. The store is clean and service is decent.We ordered Seongbukdong Gukbap and Sogogi Sundubu. Portion size was smaller than expected. I normally couldn't finish a soup but was able to here and didn't feel I was full. Taste wise, it's not salty so that's good but nothing amazing that will make me come back again.
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: - only one server for the entire restaurant- and the restaurant was crowded-the wait times to even put in our order was 35 minutes. Every customer was complaining-I'm vegetarian and I ordered the one vegetarian thing on the menu- the Kimchi Jjigae - it came out with pork!!.I used to come here all the time, and the quality has plummeted like i've never experienced before
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: First impression: SOO MUCH FOOD!!When they say 2-3 to me that's like 4-5 persons meal. It's A LOT. All sides are there (potatoes, kilchi, pickles, rice, salads and etc). The flavors just shut you up. I went silent when I started eating. I was in heaven.Second impression: This is the real spicy. So if you order spicy just know it is spicy. If you can't handle it please order non spicy. This is for real and that's my own preference.If like me you have been influenced by instagram Korean gentlemen and gentle ladies eating, then yea you want to order from this restaurant. The look of everything is the same as in their videos, the flavors actually impressed me nothing was too sweet or too salty. Everything is just right.I order bibim bap so fresh, LA Galbi so much meat, sogogi sundubu got gasping, galbi jjim (the beef stew this was the highlight of my order)Anywaysss in conclusion I BOUGHT 2 WEEKS WORTH OF FOOD BY MISTAKE and I don't really regret it.
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: This is one of the best tofu soup places I've been to in LA! Their tofu is so soft it almost melts in your mouth. I got the beef and seafood soup which was amazing. Their spice level was perfect for me (I typically like my food a little hotter than the standard). The banchan was also delicious! I came in 30 mins before closing and there was no wait however, I felt bad because it looked like I was the last to check in. I wanted to try the green onion pancake as well but they said they ran out. I'll definitely be trying that next time! Overall I feel like there's not more to say rather than to check it out yourself!
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: If you're looking for a Korean restaurant that offers traditional dishes and provides friendly service, look no further than Seong Buk Dong. This family owned business is a breath of fresh air in the sea of fusion Korean restaurants!
Address: 3303 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: A friend recommended this place and it did not disappoint! I came in to catch up with aforementioned friend and we shared two meals family style. My favorite was the roasted duck curry. Super filling, creamy, and full if flavor!
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: An excellent Thai restaurant!I came with a big party (7 people) on a Sunday night. The food came out a little slow and in waves instead of all together, at the same time. This made it a little awkward at the table since some of us were well into our dinners before others had gotten their order. Other than that, the waiters are very nice and accommodating. They take your preferences and dietary needs into consideration when preparing your food.The Pad Thai here is the best I've ever had. The sauce was a perfect blend of sweet, savory, and acidic. The flavors of this Pad Thai were much more intense and powerful compared to other Thai restaurants I've tried. They also give a healthy serving that's worth what you're paying for.The restaurant is located within a shared parking lot so parking might be tricky, but not impossible. If there's no parking in the lot there's also street parking available.The restaurant has ample seating both indoors and outdoors. It gets a little hot inside so, if you can, try the outdoor seating.
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Large portions, pretty authentic Thai food and open late! I wouldn't travel for this place but would return if I was craving Thai food and was in the area.
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: All the food was amazing this is my go to spot for Thai boat noodle. Especially late night. I haven't been back for years but brings back all the memories.Delicious
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This has been my go to Thai spot for years!! LA has so much options to eat when it comes to Thai, but hands down this is the best. Some of my favorites are Egg Noodle BBQ soup with wontons, Pad Kee Mao,  Pad Kra Pao, and Larb Salad. Good food, good prices, and good service! Also, their spice level is fire!
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: LISTEN UP! To all my OG THAI FOOD Connoisseurs, this is NOT the place. You can act on your own accord, give 'em try, say to yourself "maybe it won't be that bad" and find out the hard way. Thai food is one of my favorite foods and this place fell way short. Unbelievably salty, greasy, overcooked, and all the wrong things. Only reason I'm giving 2 stars is cause they didn't charge us for the disappointment. We returned all our dishes.
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Good food. Generous portions. Fast & friendly service. Parking still sucks. We parked on a residential street and was a little irked by a man in his yard staring us down and shaking his head at us.  No worries though since we planned to eat quickly because we were starving. We ordered Yen Ta Fo, Chicken Pad Siew, and Yum Woon Sen. We felt happy and content as we waved good bye to the man in his yard.
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Soooo yummy!!! We were seated immediately and had amazing service. The food was brought out quickly as well. Great reliable thai spot in Hollywood. The portion sizes are large and generous. They also do not skimp on toppings!! Our curry was filled with so much chicken as well as bamboo shoots! Would definitely come back again to try more dishes!
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Pad see ew is very good. Shrimp cakes too. I've been coming for decades and they have remained consistent
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The pad see ew with chicken and pad thai with shrimp were great! Moderately sized portions you can share. Service was fast. It's a small restaurant and quite popular so there is a long wait. Casual and chill environment.
Address: 5176 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Love this place! Great food, friendly staff. Beautiful back patio.. loved sitting outside
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Damn dont know what's going on in that patio I was there for 4min got bit all over by mosquitos. Also the tea I got remained burning hot, took 1 sip and that was it couldn't drink it. Hot tea should be served at around 185 degrees not boiling temperature. Spray your backyard with something my neck is itching like crazy.
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I go there for there breakfast burritos but there pastries are a great guilty pleasure. I also like the service. Helpful it no overbearing. Great spot.
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: So good!The food and coffee are great!The staff is friendlyA Must try!
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Great breakfast / lunch place! Ive had the spinach omelet and breakfast burrito. Both are excellent options. Very nice staff! One of the best breakfast places in the area. Will be back here soon!
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Ambiance is good and staff is friendly. Food can be hit or miss, but if you need a place to do some work or have a coffee break, Bolt is good.
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: They are limited on different kinds of drinks. Didn't have chai or matcha so I got grapefruit juice, wasn't craving coffee. Pastries were good. My favorite part of the place is the OUTDOOR patio. East coast vibes.
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food is good, service is good, locations a bit difficult due to parking but I have ordered for delivery and food was still warm and fresh. Their hash and pancakes are delicious.
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This is a super cute restaurant.  Friendly employees and good food!  I had the feta spinach omelet and iced coffee which were really good.  Cute patio for outside dining.
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I stopped in while having a car washed. I am so thrilled that I did. The vanilla latte I ordered was perfectly made. The roast they use is a nice chocolatey blend. They also have half orders of the avocado toast! This was perfect for me as I would not have been able to eat a full order and didn't want to take food to go. Everything was delicious and the wait time was very low. The staff is super friendly and even take time to chat a bit. They also have Wi-Fi! So, if you're in the neighborhood, this is a place to definitely visit.
Address: 5648 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I've been wanting to try this restaurant for a few weeks and I finally got the chance to go - what an incredible place!!! The interior design is very spacious and elegant, with high ceilings. I love how the tables are very spaced out and you can have privacy in your own conversation while still getting to see people around you. The bar is stunning!Let's get into the food... wow. It's the best meal I've had in a while. If you love food, and love FLAVOR and spices you will love! Our server, who was beautiful and amazing - Saira - made the experience even better. Every single thing I ate was delicious. The chef even came out and said hi to us. The drink I ordered, Slumdog Millionare, was similar to a tequila sunrise but much better! The presentation of everything was gorgeous. Some of my favorite dishes of the night were the Chicken Malai Tikka, Lamb Keema, Tuna Bhel - the jalapeño cheddar naan is essential for sauce dipping - and my favorite dessert was the pistachio ice cream, made unique by the infusion of saffron.I want to come back and try more! Definitely would recommend if you enjoy Indian flavors with a contemporary style. I had a great night here - 10/10.
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Go now! We loved it so much for a birthday celebration, service, cocktails, food could not be better quality. Highlights were pauri, short ribs, and eggplant.
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: This is a good place for special occasions, it's a very beautiful space, but not necessarily a great Indian food restaurant. It's aiming for an Indian fine dining experience: the presentation, service, ambiance, and prices match that. However, if you just want some amazing Indian food or a new spot to go when you're craving some amazing Indian food, this probably isn't it. The place has good service, but it's the annoying good type (always pestering you, but on top of it) vs the predictive great service (not sure if people will get what I mean or relate). We tried several of the dishes and drinks here, see the breakdown:4/5 - Baar Baar Butter Chicken: a solid butter chicken dish with good flavors and great presentation, but very small portions with no sides of rice or anything. ($32)4/5 - Paneer Pinwheel: a delicious fine dining take on a classic North Indian dish and a nice presentation, but same small portions as the other main dish. ($32)5/5 - Mango Ghewar: an amazing mango forward dessert with delicious fresh mango cubes on the inside, looks gorgeous and tastes even better, definitely the best thing on the menu! ($18)3.5/5 - Ragi Brownie: a really beautiful dessert that is very chocolate forward, but not super sweet. However, it's disappointing in comparison to a phenomenal dessert like the Mango Ghewar. ($15)4/5 - Dahi Puri: a solid light, but refreshing appetizer. Cool presentation, perfect for two people and one of their better apps. ($14)3/5 - Saffron Rice: pretty standard rice side that is enough to share amongst 2 to 3 people. ($6)2/5 - Cheese & Jalapeno Naan: pretty mediocre, even the presentation wasn't that nice, and worth it for what you get. The regular naan seems to be a better option if you're ordering naan (seems like it's a larger size, 1/2 the price, and already cut into 4 pieces as well). ($12)Drinks:4.5/5 - DDLJ: a great modern twist on a tequila sunrise inspiration. A good mix of tangy and lightly sour flavors. ($17)3.5/5 - Rockstar: not listed on their drink menu, it's a seasonal specialty drink that features rum and is a twist on a tropical favorite. ($19)4/5 - Various decent quality wines (~$25 per glass)Food & Drinks: 4/5Service: 4/5Ambiance: 5/5Value: 3/5Overall: 4/5
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Last night, we decided to try this restaurant for dinner on a semi-whim, having made a reservation the day before. Our reservation was for an early slot, so we were seated pretty promptly. The decor is really interesting - definitely different from other restaurants in the area. What really impressed me was the timing of the service - everything, from the food to the drinks, arrived swiftly but not uncomfortably fast.The dining experience here is family-style, with a recommendation to order a variety of shared plates and entrees, which are served as they are prepared. For our shared plates, we chose the dahi puri, cauliflower 65, Kashmiri duck (birria) taco, and the chicken malai tikka. Among these, the dahi puri and the duck taco stood out as my favorite bites of the entire meal. They were unique, refreshing, and incredibly flavorful. However, the one disappointment of the evening was the chicken malai tikka, which seemed a bit lackluster and reminded me strangely of a bland chicken alfredo.Moving on to the entrees, we opted for the butter chicken, short ribs, and lamb shank roast, along with garlic naan and saffron rice. Each dish was sensational in its own right, but the lamb shank roast stole the show with its tender, melt-in-your-mouth texture.As a side note, if you're in the mood for a unique and tropical-flavored cocktail, do yourself a favor and order the Sholay. It'll transport you to a distant paradise and complement your meal perfectly.In summary, our impromptu visit turned out to be the perfect shared meal. With prompt service, attentive and helpful staff, a diverse array of flavorful dishes, and a standout cocktail, this restaurant is definitely worth considering for a memorable dining experience. I would just plan to skip the chicken malai tikka and savor the other delectable options they have to offer.
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: We went for dinner on Sunday night at the recommendation of a local friend. We enjoyed the drinks and food. I thought their twist on traditional Indian recipes was unique but not too far gone that you couldn't taste the original idea. The jackfruit cutlet was my favorite dish. Our server was very kind and knowledgeable and almost too attentive lol! The decor is great, a fun environment and very trendy. Worth checking out!
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I was very excited to try this place when I heard they opened an LA location. Immediately walking in I was very impressed with the decor and the ambiance of the restaurant. We had to make some adjustments with our reservation and they were very accommodating and nice about the last minute changes. The staff were all very friendly and and seated us immediately when we got there. The drinks were all named after popular Hindi movies and were very good. The food came out very quickly and was great! We had the dahi puri, lamb kheema, lamb chops, and avocado bhel for starters. The lamb kheema with the pav was to die for, definitely the best dish of the night. The puri was also very flavorful. For dinner we had the paneer and the butter chicken, both of which were decent. I have been very unimpressed with Indian food in the Los Angeles area, but this restaurant was definitely the best one in LA. Will definitely come back, highly recommend!
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Beautiful venue at the old Faith and Flower restaurant.  As soon as you walk in, you can smell the aroma of the spices.  We went there as a party of 4 and ordered a bunch of plates to share.  They all come in very small portions.  (We ordered the shrimp dish for $18 as an appetizer, it came w 2 pieces), the butter chicken came with about 8 PCs of chicken.) but everything that we ordered was really good.  Service was ok.  Definitely a place to experience for a GNO but was it worth $300 for Indian food for a table of 4?  ‍‍‍
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Would I go back?  Yes.Would I recommend a friend to try?  Yes.Did the food impress?  YesWas it worth the price tag?  MaybeBeautiful space where Faith and Flower used to be.  Service was top notch and the ambience was bustling for a weekend night.This modern creative take on Indian food was interesting.  We had the butter curry (which I believe isn't really traditional Indian, but who cares?!?).  Delicious.  The cocktail menu was impressive, but I wish there were more interesting and varied curries on the menu.  The shrimp plate and lamb chops were delicious.This place is fancier/pricier than a place like Badmaash.  Overall, a great spot to do a business dinner.
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I came to Baar Baar with very high expectations but left entirely disappointed with the food. Perhaps it was just an off day, or this just is how their food is, but I found myself very underwhelmed by the quality of the food.Everything felt like it had a distinct lack of flavor. The spices were barely there on some items and it felt like for an Indian restaurant, barely anything tasted like Indian. We ordered a large variety of dishes and maybe only two stood out as decent.Then to cap it all off, we ordered the Masala Chai at the evening and it came out as basically brown water. It was heavily diluted and has no flavor. Our waiter was kind enough to see that there was something wrong with it and removed it from our bill.So sad to say, I don't think I'll be coming back. For the price point, this was not at all with it. Very bland food which was overpriced. Hate to say it after coming in with such high expectations.
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Indian is so hit or miss in LA, so didn't have huge expectations from this place but I was pleasantly surprised. Perhaps because this is a transplant restaurant concept from NYC. Nonetheless, had a great time here.All the dishes were great tasting, I especially loved the shrimp and cauliflower dishes. Butter chicken was well done too.I would say the drinks and desserts were the weakest for me. Way too sweet and textures were very plain.
Address: 705 W 9th St Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Food is great! Service could use some help. Place is cool and intimate great for friends or a date.
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: Ahhh... we left with our hearts and bellies so happily full!!Small, family run operation. Service was super warm and friendly, and not too much/too little.Food was rich, delicious, and generously portioned... we started with the vegetarian french onion soup (I was surprised at the depth of flavor and did not miss the beef stock), creamy escargot stacked in a potato shell, and had the melt in your mouth boeuf bourginon, and salmon entrees.**Three fingers to my puckered lips... mwah... magnifique!!**Chef Christian came by to ask us how our food/visit was and I nearly passed out, after getting used to all the LA establishments who barely greet you while they're text messaging. They will be participating in this year's DineLA happening from 10/6-10/20, and will be offering an all inclusive menu at $55/pp. Yay!!
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: Don't judge a book by the cover, the out side is to be honest a little simple, yet when you walk inside and you smell what is going on your mouth begins to water. The Lamb shank is an epicurean delight !!!! The french do soup right and your taste buds will come alive with passion. Everything is relaxed even if its a little busy. The service was gentle and relaxed and most enjoyable. I still wonder how I could actually enjoy something as simple as butter so much, it was so rich and creamy. Wonderful time !!!
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: I was here for the first time as a celebratory dinner, bringing in my birthday! As context, I hate comparing restaurants especially when I've had authentic Parisian/French cuisine in France before, but I accidentally began comparing as soon as I saw the menu. Thankfully, the dinner did NOT disappoint.We began with some drinks and the first selection we made was "Passionate Affair" which was absolutely PACKED with flavor and fun bubbles. We ended up getting another because we were pleasantly surprised at how well the flavors sat on our palate. After, the appetizers made our way to the table.We decided in the Bone Marrow and Escargot. Now, honestly, this was my first time trying bone marrow and I was not a fan of the texture, however I can not comment much more on the effectiveness of the dish. There was flavor, and provided some smokiness and char-like flavor provided by the toast that accompanied the dish, but again was just not a fan of my first experience with bone marrow. Now as far as the escargot goes, I have tried them in Paris and was very anxious to taste AFA's take on the classic! Very simply, DELICIOUS. The plate is smooth on the palate, packed with a calming creamy flavor that reminded me of a flavor profile almost like a pesto, served on top of a baked potato. The serving size was also appropriate for an appetizer and did exactly what it was meant to do to warm us up for the main course. Simply could have had many more of these dishes but then... the mains came!We decided on Moms beef bourguignon and the Lamb shank tagine. Both meat selections absolutely melted in our mouths and really had their own strengths. However, we did prefer the Beef to the lamb because it had just a bit more intensity and punch that we were looking for, than the lighter, more delicate lamb with vegetables. It really just comes down to how heavy of a dish you are looking for and on another day I could see myself selecting the lamb. The pasta, made in house, was a good compliment to the beef due to its thickness and smooth contrast to a more layered protein. There was much more beef to pasta, which we had no problem with.Lastly was desert! Creme brûlée is one of those options that's simple and delicious when done right, but also has much potential to be bland, and just not up to par. It tasted exactly how you would imagine the great dessert to taste, with flavor, creaminess, and a perfectly crisped topping. No surprises, just very well executed.Overall, I have no complaints with my experience at the restaurant. Parking was accessible (a lot just behind the restaurant), there was welcoming service from the moment we walked in to the second we stepped out of the door, the environment was hip, romantic, and lended itself to conversation and liveliness, and just overall photogenic. I very much recommend this restaurant, and applaud its originality and fresh taste reminiscent of a Parisian experience right in LA's backyard!
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: This restaurant is very unassuming but the food, service and ambiance certainaly did not disappoint! We'll definitely come back next time we are in the area.
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: You feel like you are in France.  Lovely French cuisine.  Friendly service.  Bouillabaisse was delicious.  Great for small and medium size groups.
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: Had my birthday dinner here, it was incredible French cuisine. The place was so cozy, warmly lit, and enjoyable to be in. They're a family run business, both the owner & his wife were there, they greeted us personally and were so kind & accommodating. 10/10 check this place out. (Beef Bourguignon was incredible)
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: Absolutely delicious! Quiet place sort of off the beaten path on Robertson in LA. Service was excellent and all of the food and drinks were absolutely perfect! Service was wonderful and everyone was super friendly!
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: Very good. Came here for Dine La and the options were great. The chef even came out and greeted us. Such a cute and cozy place for date night or catch up with a friend.
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: Wasn't as good as I was expecting. :( For the price I've had much better meals.  Service was fine.
Address: 1513 S Robertson Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90035

Comment: Ambiance was amazing! Gorgeous views and pretty good food. Not amazing, but still good for the price. The service was also up-to-par..nothing too special but not bad either. Go for the views!
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Great food, super accommodating to a gluten allergy. We ordered a bit of everything and shared!
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Rich Peruvian food! Good cocktail bar! Beautiful viewFood: 5/5  |  Service: 5/5  |  Atmosphere: 5/5
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Vibrant food and a great view.  Kale & Swiss chard empanadas are flaky and delicious with an herbaceous chimichurri.  Beet/quinoa salad brings all the flavors and textures.  Salmon skewers are lusciously prepared.  Service is competent if a little off-hand.  Ten-star view.
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: This place is AMAZING!!Went here for date night. Had reservations at 7:30 on a Tuesday and got seated after a short wait. We sat in the inside portion of the restaurant, which had large windows and we were able to see the bright lights of Downtown LA.We ordered: Tuna & Tots, Salmon Skewers, Yucca Fries, and Parihuela. All of the dishes were a 10/10. Star of the night was definitely the Yucca fries and Tuna & Tots! The staff was very attentive and friendly. Will definitely be coming back!
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I recently went to Cabra LA for my birthday lunch and it was one of the best experiences I could have asked for! Our amazing server, Amber, explained the menu clearly, recommended us great choices for food and sparkling wine and was super nice.  Amber even gave us complimentary desserts which were all very delicious!  The restaurant itself has a very nice rooftop ambiance that myself and my friends enjoyed. I would highly recommend coming here!
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: A friend and I decided to try Cabra to celebrate my birthday.  I made reservations through the Open Table app, and plenty of tables were available. The place was cute, but not that impressive. The servers were terrible,  small food portions and the ambiance was alright. The hostess was the worst. She set the tone for the evening, and it was not pleasant. The drinks we ordered at the bar never reached our table, and she chalked it up to them being busy. Really?? There was no apology. I am disappointed with this place. I wanted to love it; alas, I could not.
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: A little disappointing...I started with a cocktail - LA Dreamin MINUS the pomegranate syrup (basically a Moscow mule) and it wasn't bad but wouldn't get it again..and moscow mule is usually my go to. Then I ordered guacamole and let's just say, 0/10. The worst guac I've ever had, it was so nasty I didn't even want to order dinner so I just ordered dessert which was BOMB...the picarones are probably the only plate I'd come back for. The dessert alone is the reason why I gave 3 stars otherwise it would've been one....the view was nice though and so was the ambiance. The tables were so flimsy and rocked back and forth...not my cup of tea.
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: Loved the beautiful ambience and great service from Amber!  Just be mindful that the portions are tiny!
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: LOVE THIS PLACE!!So much flavors & texture ls in their food, it was a culinary rich experience!FoodWe ordered went fish dish on the menu.Favorite was the Kingfish Poke & Bass Ceviche!!Tapas styles so ordered two of everything for a group of 7.AmbienceAlways love a good rooftop place, Beautiful view, and friendly staff.
Address: 1060 S Broadway Los Angeles, CA 90015

Comment: I had the pleasure of dining at DiDi Vietnamese restaurant recently, and it was an unforgettable experience! We chose this place for my birthday dinner, and it exceeded all expectations. The attention to detail in every aspect, from the table settings to the decor, creates a true oasis-like ambiance.The food at DiDi is simply delicious, and there are a few standout dishes we highly recommend: Tuna Tartare, Shrimp Ceviche, Honey Glazed Tiger Prawns, Spring rolls, and Whole Fried Snapper. They were all incredibly flavorful and well-prepared. For dessert, we indulged in the Vietnamese coffee crème brûlée, and the flavor was divine, although one side seemed slightly overdone for our taste.What truly sets DiDi apart is its exceptional staff. From the welcoming hostess to the knowledgeable servers, every interaction was a delight. If you're lucky enough to have Michael as your server, you're in for a treat. His attentive service won't disappoint.DiDi Vietnamese restaurant is a must-visit for any occasion. It's a culinary oasis with outstanding food and a staff that goes above and beyond to make your dining experience exceptional.As for parking they offer valet or you can find street parking.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: I was so excited to try out the food here after hearing the hype. We arrived on a Tuesday night and had a reservation, the spot is beautiful and the servers were nice. After a $150+ meal, I left disappointed and did not finish one plate of food, I'm Vietnamese and the fish sauce wings were dry and not flavorful like other spots I've tried, the shrimp toast was super heavy and greasy, the sesame noodles were okay at best. For being "known" for the prawns, I was also disappointed. Breading was not crispy, shrimp was not juicy.Sorry but I would not recommend this place.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Ever since this restaurant opened, my best friend kept wanting to try. We were in town and made a reservation since we know it's a pretty popular place.We got their before our reservation time, the host informed us to wait a little. So we waited...and waited...and waited, then it was about 15 mins after our reservation time. This whole time we were standing next to a table of 4 that was EMPTY from the time we got into the restaurant. We all joked with each other that they will seat us there.. and guess what, they did.After getting seated, we were handed a menu and I was pretty underwhelmed. It was more Vietnamese fusion/inspired rather than authentic Vietnamese food. (Not a huge deal but just wanted to point that out)Overall, the vibes of the restaurant was good.. the drinks were doable, they have certain tastes to them (just make sure you know what each ingredient in the drinks taste like before ordering).I don't think I would come back to this restaurant, it's pretty small and the food was not memorable. But it's worth trying, just to try.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Parking: either find street parking with the meter or do valet for $15Food: as much of a fan I am of Tue Nguyen, the food did not live up to the hype and expectation I had. I had recently just traveled to vietnam as well so I was excited for the nha Trang beach club cocktail but wasn't too excited when sipping on it. I do recommend getting the prawn and beef carpaccio, if you go. They were delicious but just felt overpriced in my opinion. The crab fried rice had more shell than crab meat. Overall, I really really wanted to like this place but sadly my experience is preventing me from wanting to go back. I still highly recommend everyone to try this place and experience it themselves. This is just mine.Tip: the host won't mention it, but if you don't have a reservation and they're fully book, ask to sit at the bar as it is first come first serve. But be careful, my friend and I sat there, but it felt like a splash zone with the bartenders mixing the drink. I had to wipe my face several time from the splashes I was getting from it.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: 10/10 for the ambiance and the decor of the place.8/10 for the service.  Had to ask the server multiple times for fresh chilis, however was still never brought to us, so had to ask who seems to be the boss to help us get the chili.1/10 for the seat time. Made a reservation for 9:15pm however was not seated till 9:45pm. What is the point of reservations when your still required to wait way pass your reservation time.1/10 for the food. Definitely not worth it for the price and portion of the food. For what your paying, definitely could get more for your buck.1) Honey Glazed Tiger Prawns ($24)- Aside from how big the Tiger prawns are, literally deep fried in batter and that was it. The only glazed was on the plate for presentation and nothing on the prawns. No flavoring what so ever. Had to cut the Tiger prawns to dip into the glazed that was on the plate.2)Chicken Wings ($23)- Fish sauce chicken wings were soooo salty, couldn't even eat it alone. Nothing special but that it had fish sauce flavoring.3)Lobster Curry ($44)- Loved that we got chunks of fried lobster meat in the curry, however no curry flavor and just coconut flavoring.4) Whole Fried Snapper ($64)- Definitely could've gotten a lot more for the price. But one of the better dishes they serve. Fish was well fried. However, the sweet and sour sauce seems to have been the one straight out the bottle.5)Hot Sesame. Noodle ($24)-Noodles was super bland and had no flavoring even with the chili and garlic crunch. Garlic crunch was over fried and bitter. Noodles was under cooked and this dish was super disappointing.(No picture)6)Crab Fried Rice ($25)- Literally this dish was not worth it. Portion was super small, and you could taste it literally was just fried rice. No crab flavoring or even crab meat in the fried rice. Super salty.Lastly, got charge 4% for entertainment fee. When we asked what the charge was we were told "we have a DJ in house Friday night and Saturday night."  Come on DIDI. Having a DJ is not the customers request. Shouldn't charge customers for something your establishment decides to have.Overall, it was an experience definitely not worth the money.Everything with the entertainment fee included $232.32. Definitely for this amount I could've spent it elsewhere.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: I recently heard about DiDi through TikTok and was super excited to support and dine at this restaurant. Here's my 4/5 Yelp review:Food: 4/5I tried the Tamarind Ginger Mocktail, Shrimp Prawns, Snapper, and Hot Noodles. The food was delicious, and the flavors were on point. My only minor gripe is that the noodles could have been a bit hotter. Everything else on the plate was served at the perfect temperature, and the taste was fantastic.Ambiance: 5/5DiDi's ambiance deserves a solid 5/5. The atmosphere was inviting, and it provided a great backdrop for a memorable dining experience. It's clear they pay attention to detail in creating a welcoming space.Price: $$$/$$$$While the pricing is on the higher side, it's justified by the quality of the food, the fantastic ambiance, and the music. DiDi offers an all-around great dining experience that's worth the occasional splurge.Customer Service (Dawn): 5/5Dawn, our server, was exceptional. She was charismatic, knowledgeable about the menu, funny, and helped curate our order to perfection. Her presence added to the overall enjoyment of our evening.Parking: $$$Parking was a bit of a shocker. $15 inside their structure is reasonable, but $40 on the street in front is quite steep. It's something to consider when planning your visit.In summary, DiDi is a TikTok find that's definitely worth trying. With mouthwatering food, an inviting atmosphere, and exceptional customer service from Dawn, it's a dining experience that leaves a positive impression. While the location and parking could be better, I'd still give it a solid 4/5 and would happily return for another visit.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: This place is AMAZING!Been here twice in a matter of ten days.Their glazed honey shrimp are literally the best thing on the menu.Shrimp toast could be better. First time I had it, crunchy and bomb, second time a bit soggyTheir crab rice is ridiculous along with their lobster curry.Not a fan of the 4% fee ontop of already heavily inflated prices of food. It's a new restaurant; pay your staff more and charge accordingly.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Every aspect of our dining experience was exceptional - from the ambiance and top-notch service to the delectable food. I'd rate it a solid 10/10! For starters, I had some doubts about the shrimp toast, but I'm delighted we ordered it; it turned out to be my absolute favorite from the menu. The honey-glazed tiger prawns and the Mama Do buns tied for a close second. The crispy egg rolls were also a delightful treat. While the crab fried rice was decent, I might opt for the regular fried rice next time. The snapper dish was not only tasty but impressively sizable. I got the tropical thunder for my cocktail and it was tasty; not the best or strongest drink i've ever had but still refreshing! Can't wait to return!
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: I would 100% come back. I've been meaning to get back to try more items on the menu. And love to support my fellow Asian girly. Ambiance was typical of weho. The night was 818 night which was poppin. Decent amount of influencers were there. Ambiance and vibe is cute and trendy. Music on point. Get the wagu. Won't be disappointed. Fried rice was good. They brought us an extra bc the kitchen was actually quite slow to bring the rest of our items out which was nice. Highly recommend for a high end viet spot since we know most viet restaurants are not the trendy whatsoever. Valet only.
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: My friends and I were visiting from Texas and we were super excited to try this place. Especially since we are Vietnamese and twaydabae is as well. We got there for our reservation a bit late, so we hung out at the bar until our table was ready. The decor and ambiance of the restaurant was beautiful. It was elevated Vietnamese design. Every corner was a photo spot. We got the tropic thunder, Nha trang beach club and Nguyễn in Rome. Surprisingly the Nguyễn in Rome was our favorite drink. It looked to be the strongest but was actually the sweetest. Tropic thunder and nha trang beach club were a little bit too sour in our opinion and we were expecting a more milky or refreshing taste. We ordered the tiger prawns, bo luc lac, banh xeo, lobster curry, and Vietnamese coffee creme brûlée. All the food was delicious and full of flavor. The tiger prawns were good and in a sweet sauce. The bo luc lac was really delicious. The meat was very nicely marinaded and the beef was cooked perfectly. It was served on a bed of greens that was also very good and light. The banh xeo was very crispy almost like a taco. The lobster curry was the star of the show and served with delicious flavored rice. The creme brûlée was good but it would've been even better cold. Overall, would definitely visit the restaurant again to try the snapper or sea bass since they were out of the snapper. A perfect date or girls night place. Staff and service was amazing!
Address: 755 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: So good! We went to El Capitan for a movie and really wanted ramen. This place was close and had good reviews so have it a go.. outside you'd say it's like a whole in the wall, inside a strip mall, and it's small. But don't let that fool you! Got the corn brûlée (reminded me of cheesy Mexican esquite!) garlic rice (could use a little more garlic), kimchi (nice little kick), pork buns (yum!), and the premium spicy Tonkatsu ramen with chashu pork (so tender) and a big portion.. All amazing! Medium spice had me good! Nice spice but not too crazy. And then the honey toasted bread dessert was BOMB! Service was perfect, she was helpful with suggestions. It's a holiday weekend so hopefully that is why is slow, bc they're yummy.Thank you!
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: All I have to say is WOWWWWW! Second time trying this place and it's so delicious. I felt so well nourished and fulfilled. Staff was great and food came so quickly.
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: A very small quiet location. Great food, great service...Everyone is so welcoming.Love all their ramen...Their organic salad with chicken and mushroom is a good start with the vegetable gyoza!!! Another try is their spicy  bun!!! You can't go wrong!!!
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The place is quaint with limited seating and boxes galore near the menu board. The parking is very limited as there is an additional 6 vendors/stores sharing the parking area.We were greeted, and sat immediately as the place was empty with no patrons. We ordered, a pork bun, ramen, spicy tuna bowls, pork curry and spam. It sounds like we ordered a lot, but the item came out portioned very small.The taste was good, just very little serving size. Ramen tasted ok, and curry tasted like it was either microwaved or sitting a little as the sauce was not consistent and sort of clumpy.Food came out quickly.Overall, if your hungry and looking to eat up, unless you pay over 50 bucks for two persons, it's not happening. If you're just looking to have a quick bite and not super hungry, this place is it.The place looks a little dated, but reminiscent of place in Okinawa and Japan. Will I return; maybe...
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: I asked for milk tea with no boba balls gave me a iced coffee didn't try till already home. Pretty sad.
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Cashier with pink hair is such a hypocrite lolI was next to the counter about to order, and she says, "can you please step away to the other side of the table because I don't have my mask on" lolI said, I didn't realize people still were concerned with that, and she said, "well I am." With attitude.Then proceeds to walk around the small restaurant with no mask on and comes up to my table 1 foot away for me multiple times to bring me my food and water, etc. lol such an unnecessary comment to make, even though she took ZERO precaution if she was SO CONCERNED . Then the next customers came in and they were like 1 foot from her when they ordered and she said nothing. Such a joke.Should spend a little more time educating yourself on Covid over making ignorant comments to your customers.
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Okay place for quick eats, but nothing amazing. It's a small restaurant with limited seating, but they have a free parking lot, so that's a plus.
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Maybe the best vegan ramen in Los Angeles. Certainly in Hollywood. Ambiance leaves something to be desired but that's how you know they're good.
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Amazing food! The Ramen is top notch and my go too spot ! The premium tonkatsu ramen is one of the best I've had anywhere.
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: I got to say, I've been eating a lot of ramen in and around LA over the last 20 years, and this place is the absolute best!
Address: 7361 W Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Really liked this place! Was a bit hesitant because I have never had Thai hainan chicken rice before but I got the dark meat and added gizzards (not a fan of liver) and it was delicious! Chicken was tender and rice was flavorful.Generous portion of rice, wish there was a bit more chicken though.Service was fair although it was a bit hard to understand our server, but he was friendly.Ambiance is nice and clean.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This is a Thai Hainan chicken place.I went here with my mom and she definitely enjoyed the food.We got the fried chicken and rice.  The batter was super crispy and light.  The chicken was moist.  I enjoyed this more than the regular chicken.We also go the fried pork with noodles.  The pork as well was well fried.  The batter again was super crispy and the pork was moist and tender.Each dish came with a small bowl of  chicken  broth.  This was seasoned with pepper and salt.  It was very clean tasting and delicious.  It made me order a bowl of chicken pho.  Unfortunately I was disappointed as they added cinnamon to the broth.  This was really unnecessary as the broth was fine by itself.FYI The sauce for the hainan chicken is on the side and you can add as much ginger/chili to taste.I was pleasantly surprise by the fried chicken here and no order is complete without it.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Garlic noodles w fried chicken. I mean, I could have this dish at least a couple of times a week. That good. That consistent.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Came here for lunch the second time and it was about 30min wait. The sauce is great as usual pairing with the Hainan chicken! Zaab crispy pork rice was awesome too, but I prefer a little lesser spice.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Love Hainan Chicken and this little place in Thai Town does it right!  Their menu is fairly small but the last time I went they had a new menu with a few additional items. The Hainan chicken is similar to the Singapore version but it's done Thai style. Meaning the broth, rice and side sauces are a bit different. The sauce they use is like crack and they keep it on the table so you can pour to your hearts content!  They also have ginger and chili on the table that you can use to customize your sauce. Their Pork laab and shrimp wonton are also very good.  They also have free parking in the attached motel!
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Food is good! I ordered the fried pork and chicken with garlic noodles and it was good! Would recommend this place for casual feel good food.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The chicken fried rice was so delicious the customer service was awesome ass well I wasn't really sure of how the rice tasted and the details but the server explained and told me everything so patiently I definitely recommend this place and the chicken fried rice a new customer for sure
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I do not know where to start about Heng Heng Chicken rice other than I left with a smile after eating here.The food, service, to the ambiance of every thing being served was just so perfect!
