The employees were super nice and attentive making the customer service amazing. When I first took a bite of the Hainan chicken I was INSTANTLY transported to my late Thai grandmothers chicken and the memories of her making this dish as I was a child watching her cook this in the kitchen.I don't even want to continue a long review. I am going to need you to finish reading and run to eat here.I am usually not that easily impressed with restaurants but this place deserves a Michelin star review for the quality of the food being served here.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The food here is soooo good. The restaurant is small so there might be a wait during busy times. The sauces that pair with the proteins are extremely yummy. I ordered the garlic rice with crispy pork and white meat. You are able to park in the motel area but it is super easy to miss since the entrance is small.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Food was amazing! The crispy zaap was the star of the show for me. The poached chicken with there house sauce was amazing as well, the fried chicken was good when dipped with the chili sauce. Great service! Small place but very clean and comfortable.
Address: 5420 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Their bento box is amazing! Especially the farmer's market salad, the vegetables and fruits are fresh... They give you a good array of different foods in the bento that keep the taste buds happy and exploring :)
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Saikai is a beautiful spot and surprisingly spacious, but the ramen dishes that we ordered didn't justify the price.The spicy beef tsukemen is $25. Whoa.  For this price, it should come with a soft boiled egg (probably even two), but it was an additional $1.50.  The dipping broth was extremely salty, less of of s dip and more of a full on sauce.  It was hard to finish - there was just a lot of flavors that didn't really work together.  The pickled collard greens on the side were innovated and delicious and the noodles were standard and thick.  The beef chunk that was included came with the bone, nice chunk of meat.I ordered the gyukotsu (19) once again very expensive and not the memorable.  It also didn't come with an egg. The broth was rich and creamy and the beef was enjoyable.  Compared to the tsukemen though, it was very very mild.My favorite item was the collard greens which came with the tsukemen.  It was spicy and tasty and probably the best part of the meal.  My friend recommended the brussel sprouts which I'll try if I come back.
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I went for their bento box! I got the chicken katsu sando. It came with a cup of fruit, salad, and I chose pork gyoza. All were refreshing and delicious. The sandwich has a hot kick with a horseradish/wasabi taste. It's filling and I was so full I had to take some home.
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Cute neighborhood spot with good bento boxes. The portions are generous and the fried chicken katsu in particular was very good. We also got Mazeman which is pretty good and our least favorite was the tonkotsu ramen .
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Beautiful relaxing atmosphere and good food! What more can you ask for? This restaurant had it all! The food was seriously good. We tried the spicy miso ramen and shrimp katsu sando and both were good. Broth was rich but clean in terms of flavor and the katsu sando was crispy with lots of shrimp and pillowy soft bread! The katsu bento box came with so many items, pickled cucumber, fruits, salad croquette and lots of other items. I'll be back to try other menu items!
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Best spot in K-town and maybe LA!  Love it here. SO DELICIOUS!  There are a lot of great spots in this area but you have to start with this place. I keep going back at it every time I go back I add to my favorites list. I love the spot so much. Cannot go wrong here.
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Decor  - 5/5 (very cute! Loved the aesthetics)Service - 5/5Fried garlic miso shrimp - 5/5 (delicious!)Mazemen - 3/5 (egg didnt ooze, but they said it's supposed to be cured like that? Taste wise was good, although doesn't compare to menya)Iced matcha tea - 1/5 (the worst. It was water with matcha flavoring. I'd recommend not providing it, or providing it for free, def not worth $6)Hit or miss on some things, but glad I tried it
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I have been a semi-regular at Saikai for the better part of a year, after first discovering this joint and becoming hooked. While the ramen is AMAZING and definitely worth coming in for, it's the bento box which immediately blew me away.I ordered for takeout and was not expecting presentation as gorgeous as what I received. Salad, karaage, sando, fruit, and pickles, all beautifully arranged inside of their box, not a shred of presentation lost in the trip back home.However, as pretty as food may be, it counts for nought if the flavor isn't there.Salad is exactly as you'd expect from a Japanese joint, what tasted like a sesame dressing on top. Light, refreshing, enjoyable start to my meal.Karaage came with a dipping cup of mayo (?), but I did not need it as the chicken on its own is beautifully marinated and flavorful. Fruit cup delivered exactly what you'd expect, fresh fruit that was perfectly arranged and served at peak flavor. Main event Katsu sando at the forefront, perfectly flavorful chicken sandwiched in between bread with cabbage and mayo; perhaps I'd go a bit easier on the mayo but the flavor is all there so I'm not complaining!Having not been a fan of pickles my whole life, I proceeded with caution as I said "might as well try them". What followed was the serving of pickles that single handedly made me a fan of pickled food as a whole! Spicy, flavorful, and not too intense in their flavor!I'd say I'd return, but given that I've now been a semi-regular, it's not matter of if, but when!
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: I didn't like ramen before I tried this delicious spot. And recommend to try the whole menu it's all delicious
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: There are many reasons to definitely check out this hidden gem of K-town, but I'll just mention three.First of all, the food temperature was perfect.Second, the freshness of the ingredients was impressive.Finally the food presentation was beautiful.If this restaurant were closer to the heart of K-town, I would come everyday.
Address: 209 N Western Ave Unit B Los Angeles, CA 90004

Comment: Nice meal. Would come again. Service good. Ambiance was also good. Would suggest to others.
Address: 1538 N El Centro Ave Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: As a previous member of Neuehouse I was delighted to receive an invite to try out the new Reunion Hollywood. I was skeptical as there was very little information on the restaurant/ menu/ food, but having spent time at Neuehouse and even tried their cafe's I knew they would not disappoint. And they certainly did not. Everything at this place was done tastefully and elegantly. The entry way is beautifully lit with terracotta lanterns and the terrace has a beautiful classy yet warm vibe to it. This place screams pretentious but it is surprisingly not - wait staff are incredibly friendly and attentive. Now the food. Everything on the menu sounded appetizing and since there was only two of us, we couldn't order too many different things. We were torn between ordering a few items to get a feel of the flavors or ordering the whole fish and just enjoying it. We went for the whole fish and we were glad we didn't order anything along with it. The rockfish arrived in a tasteful stainless steel platter, and was filleted in the kitchen and sliced in the platter without losing its "whole fish" look. It sat on a bed of a medley of fresh salad veggies that maintained their crisp consistency despite sitting under a hot fish. Aka. They were not soggy. The seasoning of the fish was perfect, and the herbs mixed in with the spring veggies really lifted the flavors and made everything taste so light, smooth and fresh, while maintaining some richness thanks to the boldness of the olive oil in the sauce/dressing. I would highly recommend trying this place out. I'll definitely be back to taste more of this gorgeous menu!
Address: 1538 N El Centro Ave Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This place is so beautiful. The vibe, service, decor, food and drinks. Such a vibe. Highly recommend for a cute date or just getting a table with friends. Everything was amazing.
Address: 1538 N El Centro Ave Fl 2 Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Decent breakfast joint.  I came here once for breakfast because I was staying close by!  The menu said that the cornflake French toast was a main dish and I took them up on it.  It was Nice and crunchy on the outside and the cream was a great touch to soften the bite a bit.  Fruit was sour to me but over it was good!!!
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: It was the morning after the Jonas Brother's Concert at Dodger Stadium, and my wife and I were in desperate need of a solid solid breakfast to kick off our day. We had only eaten once the day before and ended up having to raid our hotel's "mini store" at about 2am after the concert lol.Blu Jam Café did not disappoint at all! The food was extremely good, I am big breakfast guy - as it is my favorite meal. Both my wife and I created our own scrambles (she got egg whites), we both were very impressed by the portions that they give you as you really do get your money's worth. They have about 5 freshly squeezed juices to choose from and she ended up choosing Orange Juice which was so fresh! My dirty Chai was very good as they topped it off with cinnamon that was a great compliment to my scramble. I would definitely be coming back to Blue Jam the next time we are in the area!
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Picked this place because of the waitlist option, which made it very convenient to get in without too much of a wait. It's cute inside and out. Good choice of menu options. The food was pretty good.  I ordered the California omelette. Hubby got the El Paso Chicken Sandwich.  I guess they're known for the crunchy french toast which the people at our neighboring table got and said it was really good.Three stars due to the way you order - either on their app or at the ordering stations.  We used the app and it took a really long time to get our food.  Tried to ask the ordering station staff but she was too busy issuing refunds (I think those people were leaving because their food took too long).  We wanted to add something to our order but the only option was to select for it to be ready in 30 more minutes.  Would've preferred wait service - especially when the app has you include the tip before you even get your food.
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The food was pretty good. Customer service was alright but could have been better but didn't disappoint. The ambience of the place was also pretty good. Downtown city vibes. Definitely would come here again.
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: One the best breakfast spots in LA. Food was on point, clean. Not a lot of traffic on a Wednesday morning which was nice. There are no waiters to take your order you order via phone or have to go  to counter to order. Will def come back .
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: We were visiting LA and happened to come across this Jem. Everything about this place was amazing. From the second you walk in, you are greeted with a big smile and great customer service. The food was sooooo delicious.Can't wait to be back!
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Blu jam cafe has absolutely tasty food. Their crispy French toasts are to die for. Super fast service.  Good portions and great vibe.
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Blu Jam is absolutely delicious! I ordered the Muscle Beach plate and tried the Blu Jam crunchy french toast and I instantly fell in love with this brunch spot. After sitting down, we were instantly welcomed by the server with a fresh jug of mint-infused water. We tried the vanilla latte and it was the perfect amount of sweet and caffeine.The service is mainly by QR code and the food came out within a perfect amount of time. The ambiance is very chill and casual, as we came in right after a hike.There is luckily a small parking lot in the back as well as some street parking.
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: My daughter choose this place after a drop off at LAX on our way to the Grove. So good! The vegan tostada was super unique with crispy tofu on top of potatoes and black beans topped with avocado. A must try. I was not disappointed even though I wish I had ordered an egg with it. It really was not lacking in flavor. The churro French toast was really yummy too. The restaurant doesn't have syrup which I am not sure as to why but food was excellent.The ordering is kind of self serve with QR code menu or you can order at the counter. The servers only come out for water and to bring your dishes to you.
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Really good food here as well. We stopped here for some Blu Jam Benedict and Egg Benedict plates. They have lots of great menu choices of Breakfast and lunch. Nice cozy big restaurant. First time here and we got good waiter service. The coffee is good here as well. I had some coffee for breakfast with my meal. All fun and cool. I will be back again.
Address: 7371 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The food is delicious & the margarita tree is great!  They have a decent happy hour as well.
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: My friend and I wanted to try Durango Cantina for my last day in LA. We ordered some items including the beef ribs, bone marrow tacos and more! I loved the bone marrow tacos and the guacamole with rice crackers as one of my faves!This is a great spot in Fairfax to check out! I'm having a great experience! I love how the decor inside Durango Cantina includes some of the props like the Game Center! I have to give the props to the staff for being so friendly to us by introducing the dishes and describing them.
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: A new little stop on Melrose. The decor and ambiance are so pretty and perfect for pictures. The food and drinks were also delicious. I highly recommend the bone marrow taco.
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: amazing food, amazing drinks, and TJ was the best server ever. we're obsessed with him. the guacamole and beef ribs were excellent. come and see TJ and get a valentiono or two!!
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: DRINKSDrinks are pretty weak tbh. The margarita tree is a very fun idea and the variety of options in marg make up for the lack if strength.FOODBe careful of the salads. If you're trying to avoid spice, skip them. That dressing is pretty deadly.SERVICEI have been here for a couple birthday gatherings now, and can say they have great service.
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Great food and amazing happy hour! The tamarind and strawberry frozen margaritas are so good. We had a chicken and shrimp taco. They were amazing! This is our new spot.
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Food, Service and Ambiance was great!Plates are some what big nice size. Greeters are friendly and our waitress was awesome. We were able to take advantage of the buy one get on Monday deal !
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: 20/10 place the owner was so sweet & their happy hour is perfect! food was absolutely delicious & their decor is fantastic. will be coming back ASAP.
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: This place is awesome. The biria tacos and all the other tacos are delicious. Highly recommend!
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Extremely sketchy place. Won't be around for long given how gross it is. Found hairs on my taquitos.
Address: 7661 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Taberu is a sleek interpolation of an izakaya, the traditional Japanese pub, in the Arts District, a few blocks east of Little Tokyo. Although the address is on Third Street (the same address as Yunomi Handroll), the entrance is actually on Traction Avenue, between Wurstküche and Loqui. Along the back wall is a long banquette with two-tops, while a massive refectory table sits in the front for shared dining. Around 5:30 P.M. on a Tuesday, there was only one other party of two; leaving around 7:00 P.M., there were maybe four parties total (one of which was that same party that was there when I arrived). The meal starts with a finger bowl to soak the little napkin pellet, and after a flashback to Melissa McCarthy in "Spy," you're off to the races.The menu has a large selection of Japanese and Japanese-style craft beers, but the prices are high (as is common with imported Japanese suds), so I decided to try one of their drinks based on shōchū, a neutral spirit that is generally around 25% ABV and the Japanese analog to soju. (They only have a beer-and-wine license, so no Toki highballs here.) The Ginger Lemonade High was made with gari ginger, the pickled ginger served alongside sushi (an odd choice), and the advertised mint was nowhere to be found. The big wad of gari and ice took up a lot of real estate in the glass, and, for $9, it was rather disappointing, and I switched to draft Sapporo after that.Taberu lists its kushiyaki as "Yasai Maki," translating to "vegetable rolls" -- even when there are no vegetables involved. Servers come over with a large box of uncooked skewers for diners to peruse, like a yakitori version of a dessert cart. (Between the dim lighting and forest of identification twigs, it's close to impossible to see anything in that box.) They have some unique varieties, although the most creative aren't necessarily the best. I made the mistake of cutting the chile relleno with the knife provided, and the ground pork chili filling oozed out everywhere; it was impossible to eat with chopsticks. It was tasty but a ridiculous mess. The shiso and gari rolled with pork belly was surprisingly bland, as was the bundle of green onions wrapped in pork belly. The tsukune (chicken meatballs) were tasty, but I would have preferred the traditional sweet soy glaze over shredded Parmesan, and three smaller meatballs over the two large ones. My favorites were the more traditional skewers: yakitori, beef ("yakiniku"), and okra wrapped in pork belly, which is probably my favorite kushiyaki ever. The kushiyaki are served with a curry-like dry spice blend that is very tasty, though it can overwhelm the flavors.The gyōza are made in-house and probably the second-best examples in L.A. after the reigning champions about a mile south at Afuri. They are unique in their shape, which resemble a taquito rather than the well-known crescent shape. I did miss the traditional tare sauce. (As with the skewers, they recommended I slather the gyōza in chili oil.) The karaage was also excellent, with five plump, flavorful pieces of dark meat in a powdery, tatsuta-age breading. I ended up taking most of the gyōza and karaage home, especially because I had to save room for the hōjicha pudding. Hōjicha is green tea that is roasted in a pot over charcoal, and it has a nutty, toasty flavor. The Japanese are master pudding makers, and this version, which is just slightly sweet, creamy, and slightly tannic, is delicious. As full as I was, I could've devoured a half-dozen of those tiny little puddings. It was the star of the meal, hands down.My experience at Taberu wasn't perfect, but it was definitely positive. There are many things I did not get to sample that I want to try, and I'd like to go with others next time -- Taberu definitely seems like it would be more fun with a group. I did feel like I was forgotten a few times at the back of the room, and some empty dishes lingered on the table a bit too long, but my server was very friendly. I would recommend having some regular napkins along with the magic tablet one: I thought that was simply for cleansing one's hands at the beginning, not to keep through the entire meal, so I ended up having to duck into the restroom for paper towels at one point. Don't most places take the wet towel away after one use? But I digress. As Little Tokyo seems to have fewer and fewer good Japanese dining options, it's good to see a place like Taberu opening up nearby, and I think it holds promise as one of Downtown's most promising Japanese dining options.
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Rating: (3.5/5)I recently dined at Taberu, and it left me with mixed feelings. The appetizers, notably the karaage and seafood tartar, were absolutely delicious, deserving a solid 5-star rating. However, my overall experience was tempered by some disappointments.The main dishes, unfortunately, didn't quite live up to the same standard as the appetizers. They were generally okay in taste, but nothing exceptional. Now, the real letdown was the service. It seemed like a tale of two experiences - heavenly food from the kitchen and a somewhat frustrating encounter with a few employees.In particular, during our order of the Yakisoba, we encountered an unsettling situation. To our dismay, we found a hair coiled between the noodles. We politely pointed this out to our waiter, expecting an apology and for the dish to be replaced. Instead, his response was rather disheartening. He asked us, "So what would you like me to do? Remove the hair or do you want us to remake everything?" This response felt dismissive, as if our concern was being brushed aside with a casual remark.While the food itself had its moments of brilliance, the overall experience suffered due to subpar service. The chefs clearly have culinary expertise, but the front-of-house staff could benefit from a more customer-centric approach.The interior of the restaurant is a visual treat. It exudes a warm, inviting ambiance that's perfect for a night out. The comfortable seating arrangements make it an ideal spot for a relaxed evening with friends or a special someone. It's a place where aesthetics meet comfort, enhancing the overall dining atmosphere.
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: OVERALL EXPERIENCE: everything was great! would def be back!!AMBIANCE: patio seating offers a more calm/pleasant dining experience. inside can be loud and almost stuffy as the tables are close together... just depends what your preference is. Patio seating allows dogs!DRESS CODE: CasualORDERED:- yuzu high (low alcohol content but was refreshing)- mochi (super yummy!!)- yellowtail carpaccio- taberoll- WOW gyu uni donabe (OMG WOW!!)- tiramisuSERVICE: Service was great!!!PRICE: ~ $50+ ppPARKING: free street parking all around. they also have valet.Food: 5/5 starsService: 5/5 starsVenue: 4/5
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: This place is amazing. Saviour was our server really great guy very polite and helpful. The food is so good we tried a bunch of items from the menu and everything was money. I extremely recommend you to come here
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: The experience is phenomenal! The food options, ambience and style remind me of a chic izakaya from Japan. Services are top notch. Definitely recommended!
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Incredible experience!!! Our waiter recommended all our meals - for us and and our young kids. They were all incredibly delicious! We had service every second we turned around ... my son dropped his fork and by the time he picked it up, someone was handing him a clean fork. Highly recommend the spicy avocado cucumber salad and the chicken and salmon skewers! The karaage chicken melted in our mouth! Everything perfect!
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: After finishing our meal at Yunomi Handroll in the Arts District of Los Angeles, my girlfriend and I stumbled upon Taberu next door which we had been wanting to try for a while.Food: 7.5/10The food is fresh and they use high quality ingredients. We enjoyed that they have yakitori style skewers that consist of traditional meat and veggie options, with the yaki niku and mochi being our favorites. We tried both of their chicken meatball and satay chicken thigh options and were not too impressed. We also had their wagyu and uni wagyu options, both of which were solid.We haven't tried their entrees or their ramen, but the Gyu Shabu Soba Salad was excellent and we recommended that they keep it on the menu! The flavor was very rich and refreshing at the same time, with generous portions of both soba noodles and meat. Lastly, the artichoke mochi gratin was also pretty good. Personally, I wish there was a bit more artichoke inside as it tasted a lot like a creamy mochi gratin, which was still good and flavorful.Service: 7/10Upon entering, you are greeted by the host and the owner, both of which have been welcoming in our two visits. Our server the first time was decent, but our server the second time was very sweet and accommodating. She was attentive and knowledgeable of the menu, engaging in small talk and not being pushy.Ambiance: 8/10The restaurant itself is pretty dim and not very big. The decor and arrangement of the room is nice, but I'm personally not a huge fan of dim restaurant lighting. The tables and seating are overall pretty comfortable and clean which I can appreciate. No real complaints here.Overall: 7.8/10Taberu is a solid restaurant with good food and drinks. Probably wouldn't go out of my way to come again, but wouldn't mind stopping by while in Arts District.
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: I would call it a Thai Japanese fusion. Which is refreshingly different since Thai and Chinese are more often close relatives. Very peanut-forward. The tan tan ramen is absolutely a winner and should be celebrated. I believe I tasted peanuts in my soba fried rice dish also. They have laska and chicken satay and other Thai influenced items as well, all with the Japanese twist. Interior is casual but classy. Yellowtail carpaccio was quite good. If you're looking for traditional tonkatsu, curries, or miso based dishes this is not the focus here. Prices are very reasonable for what you get. No full bar - just soju and sake based beverages. Above average.
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Came here on a Friday night and it was not packed. Tried to order a summertime drink but they were already out by 7pm. I tried the grape high and it was really good!My favorite dish had to be the yellowtail carpaccio. I would 100% get it again. Chicken karaage was huge! Love that. The yakitori was really good, I would come back and just order the above mentioned.Tan tan ramen was pretty average. The fried tofu was very meh as well.The service was very good and I will definitely be back to try other items on the menu!The interior and ambiance is very nice and quiet. Perfect for a date night!
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: Nice relaxed ambiance, very friendly service. Tonight was my second time here and taberu does not disappoint!We got theArtichoke mochi tofu gratin: very creamy and delicious but I wish the portion was a little biggerChicken thigh satay skewer: flavor was good but a bit too peanuty for my personal liking and seemed the slightest bit undercookedYaki niku: ordered it the first time I was here too. One of my favorites tastes really good w the curry powder and chili oilChicken meatball with parmesan: not really a fan of this one. Slightly too salty for meGrilled mochi wrapped in pork belly and seaweed: really good. First time trying grilled mochi and it does not disappointGyu shabu soba salad: STAR OF THE SHOW this is part of their summer menu but I hope they put it on the permanent menu. It is so light and refreshing and still filling. So good. Could use a little more cherry tomatoes but other than that, chefs kiss.
Address: 806 E 3rd St Unit 140 Los Angeles, CA 90013

Comment: oh noooo why are they temporarily closed?? we came here after watching 'moulin rouge' for dinner and everything was very pleasant.aside from our waiter mixing up our credit cards and causing drama, the dinner was good!
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Restaurant was listed as temporarily closed but now has For Lease on it. The last thing Hollywood needed was another vacant restaurant but here we are.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Beautiful restaurant. The waiters were so kind and helpful and made conversation throughout the night. The food was incredible and we appreciated the fast service. Perfect for a date night or formal dinner. I would absolutely come back
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Good food and service. Don't like the fact that things cone out separately. Convenient though for the Pantages.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This spot far exceeded my expectations. We arrived early for our reservation, were sat straight away and orders and received our food promptly. Nice thing about this menu is that most of the items are shareable so we opted for some spin dip and shared the double standard burgers. Both were absolutely delicious. I only wish I had enough room to try another appetizer or something sweet at the end. I love the cozy feel to the rest and appreciated that it was warm inside. Great good, great service, great location. Highly recommend.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I wish I could give them 5 stars. The food was really good, the hostess and busser where very friendly. The reason why I'm giving them 3 stars is because of the waitress (She took for ever to get our drinks and food order), the food took for ever to arrive, and the cocktails are hit or miss. We tried the Mezcal cocktail "blame it on the mezcal" it was okay, we also order a Mint Julep with mezcal and that was WAY better.If you are seeing a show at the Pantages theater and want to eat here, I would arrive 3-4hrs early.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Came in last night because I had tickets to the Lion King at the Pantages across the street. Food was good and the drinks were as well. We sat at the bar and had a great bartender, I am so sad that I do not remember his name. I would go back if I was in the area. The restaurant itself is beautiful, I especially liked the mural in the front hallway of Maya Angelou.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Went here with friends before Lion King show at the Pantages theater. It's the perfect place to go for food and drinks because it is just across the street. Park in the El Centro parking lot for $20 all-day parking. You can walk to the restaurant and theater with no issues and I hate walking so that saying a lot lol. The food was good but the portions are small. We got popcorn shrimp, sea trout, fries, seashell mac and cheese, butterscotch ice cream, and donut holes. Drinks we good as well. We got Accomplice and Mockingbird. It will be my go-to spot when I'm in the area for a show. We sat upstairs which is nice and they have bathrooms upstairs so you don't have to go up and down. There is a beautiful indoor-outdoor area as well.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This is a very convenient restaurant if you are seeing a show at the Pantages. However, it also makes it pricey and not necessarily the best.The good - the artichoke dip was delicious and hearty. They barely gave us any bread though so we had a lot left over. Fortunately, our waiter offered to bring us more.The not so good - it took us forever to get our bread. It also took forever to get our food!! The pasta came out 15 min before curtain!!! We had to eat so quickly and the food wasn't even that great. I'm sure the waiter was busy with all the other patrons but we were just not attended to well enough. Had to wait for everything, salt and pepper, water refills, etc. Honestly, salt and pepper should just be at the table and maybe out down a water dispenser for the table - I don't mind refulling myself. Maybe have some extra staff on show nights - especially if you are going to add an extra 20% service charge. I don't mind it. However when the service and food isn't great you do wonder about this fee. Also it was ridiculously hot upstairs. It was a rainy day but I think I would have preferred to be downstairs where it felt cooler.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Accomplice cocktail delicious! Chicken and waffles amazing. Service great. Plenty of seating upstairs, downstairs, patio, take your pick. Bar area great to hang out. I'll definitely go back.
Address: 6280 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I LOVEEEE Qianloxiang Hot Pot! It's one of those pay by pound places and it cost about $16 a pound. I love that i can add as much or as little as I want and pay for it that way. The service is always wondering and the couple time's i've gone it's been pretty empty which is nice. It's quiet and a good space to eat with friends and talk.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Came with a friend on Saturday night around 7:30, was surprised to see it so empty-- we were the only patrons in the store. Because of this service was quite attentive but the overall empty ambience was a bit weird.Options are quite limited for vegetarians-- I made my own dry pot plate (Malatang), where you self-serve and choose which vegetables you want to be cooked for you in a spicy savory sauce. It was a bit oily but very flavorful and filling, satisfying my spicy craving. I also ordered tofu and vegetable roll skewers. The flavor was delicious, Smokey, spicy and sweet. It was very hard to bite, though, and a bit hard to chew. Both the vegetables and tofu skins were tough.My friend ordered chicken skewers and kimchi bokkeumbap and enjoyed those.Pretty enjoyable place-- if the restaurants around have too long of a wait, I'd be happy to come back but would not necessarily choose this again as my first choice. I was especially disappointed because I was really craving hotpot but they had no vegetarian options.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Fresh ingredients, great taste, polite service. Re-visiting for sure next timeSpicy Dry Hotpot//Beef Dry Hot Pot
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Yes it was good and I asked for spicy dry hot pot but at least give a little more rice. Don't be so cheap with rice portions next time. I needed more rice to help balance with the spicy levels!!!! Aside from that, it was delicious and I added a little bit of everything to it. They have so many options to choose from.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: really good dry pot, really loved it but especially the bebabs, those are amazing, must get the lamb and beef intestine.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Our family loves their foods & we don't want to eat num & too spicy and requested so they made perfect for adults.They also did non spicy for my girl . Food & service r GREAT
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Hot pot delicious i want to order 1000 more skewers. Potato tornado and spicy lamb the best so far
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: dbq，刚吃了其他烤串，也不好吃。。。很奇妙的各种调料都有就是没香味。。。来LA探店几十家了PLZ我这几个月来第一次浪费食物，我也不想的。但是感觉吃了占肚子空间我滴妈只能扔了
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Here is new location hot pot!!my favorite mala tang place ever!!!!!!!!!!There was so clean and friendly staff.I ordered miduem level it was good spicy level for me.It was a very satisfying dinner and i will go soon agian.
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: Great addition to K Town!Had a Hot Pot and Mixed Vegetables!Hot spicy Hot Pot was perfect for the Hot Summer day!The owner was very kind and quick service.I will be coming back for more!
Address: 3377 Wilshire Blvd Ste 110 Los Angeles, CA 90010

Comment: This place is a hidden gem. Food is spectacular as well as the service. Highly recommend trying one of the several pastries they offer. For now, there are no lines.
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Excellent flavors, service, and cute ambience. Pork belly melts in your mouth... super tender.
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: My taiwanese boyfriend introduced me to this place and told me I would like it.. and he wasn't wrong. The food served here really makes you feel at home and provides a feeling of warmth and comfort.  This place really strives to bring the best experience to their customers. Plan to come here as much as possible.Literally created a yelp account to compliment this place because it was so good
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Had to stop in today to try this new spot after walking by! The interior is so cute and welcoming and the staff was super helpful with suggestions and making sure everything tasted great! Everything is a great price (especially for the area) and the portions are perfect for lunch. We took the pastries to go and they made the perfect post-lunch treat! We'll definitely become regulars here!
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: So so so good!! The decor is so cute! It's everything I wanted and expected it to be! Minimalistic, clean and modern. The food was so bomb! Matcha cookie was so gooey! The pao tsai (pickled cabbage) was so good, crunchy and not too sweet. Probably the best I've ever had, just missing some stinky tofu. The pork belly rice reminded me of my dads. Super super bomb! The shredded chicken rice (famous chiayi dish) was pretty good. I feel like it's missing something though.. oh and we tried the Jasmine passion fruit tea, so goood!! I can't wait to come back to try other dishes. The curry and fried pork dish was not available on our visit. Service was also excellent, everyone was very friendly and nice. Oh and the pineapple bao was really good. Think of a brioche bun with the sweet thing on top.
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: So excited for another place I can get Taiwanese food! + egg tarts! Clean, modern ambiance and delicious food - Chinese favs with a touch of innovation (i.e., scallion pancake with smoked salmon + roe). We sampled a bunch of stuff- said salmon scallion pancake (tasty, unique), peanut butter cookies with a pepper finish (nice bite!), matcha white chocolate cookies, jalapeno cheddar biscuit, traditional egg tarts (yummm), pickled cabbage (refreshing, crisp), chicken rice (gives that healthy comfort food feeling!), and spicy wontons (drizzle chili sauce all over everything please). Wishing Liu's Cafe much success and fortune!
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: TL;DR Food Amazing, Ambience Great, don't sit on the white stools.Happened to see the soft opening sign while my wife and I were on our way elsewhere and I thought... "why not?" I'm so glad we did because... wow!We walk in and the ambience is great. Nice, clean, minimalistic/newtro aesthetic. It was also nice seeing the chefs working behind the counter rather than hidden in the back. Guy at the counter was super nice. Ordered our food, took our table number card, and found a seat immediately. It was busy but not packed. There's some nice big tables in the center of the dining area which could comfortably seat 6 maybe crush in 8, and some smaller tables on the perimeter. I sat on the side that had the long bench with white stools on the other side of the table. I don't recommend the white stools, my butt went numb after a while, try getting the other seats with the nicer chairs especially if you're a bigger person like me.Despite the discomfort of the stool, this place gets 5 stars because the food is amazing. We had an order of three Braised Pork Belly over rice, Chiayi Chicken Rice, Egg Tart, Hong Kong Milk Tea, and later a free Pineapple Bread.Chiayi Chicken Rice was nicely seasoned. As the seasoning soaked into the rice it gave it a partial congee texture which made the meal feel very cozy (I may get this on sick days from now on). The spicy pickled radish it came with gave it a nice contrast. Add the chili sauce to every spoonful of chicken rice and it was perfection.The Braised Pork Belly over rice came a little late which is why we got our free Bread but it was worth the wait (also not docking points because it is a soft opening after all and they're figuring this stuff out). Once again the seasoning was key, and the cucumber pickle perfectly cuts the greasiness of the Pork Belly. I wouldn't advise everyone at the table getting this together though. My wife and I shared half and thought it would have been a bit overwhelming to deal with if one of us had our own bowl.Egg Tart was so good. It was a more custardy egg tart. Wife says the texture reminds her of a soft serve. Perfectly flaky on the outside. A+Pineapple bun... mm...mmm... chef's kiss. So soft out on the inside and perfectly crispy on the outside. They gave us butter with the bread but honestly didn't need it.  Now I'm glad our Pork Belly dish came out late cuz I would've missed put on my new favorite Pineapple bread.
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I'm going to be the first customer here!!! It's Chinese food real authentic in Koreatown!! I can't wait.
Address: 3915 1/2 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: My friend knows I love sandwiches so as soon as I landed we headed here for lunch. What she didn't anticipate was me wanting everything but a sandwich once we got inside. Inside there's a cornucopia of truffle products for sale. From sauces to pastas, you name it - it's there.After fan-girling over truffles, I ordered the minestrone soup and a pizza. My friend got a sandwich and we both ordered wine. We sat outside and were surprised with the portions and flavors. Everything was delicious and plentiful. We took some leftovers with us and added a salad and an order of truffle pasta. Boy were glad we did, that pasta was amazing. So much so, I had her bring me some on her last visit.Oh I'm definitely going back the next time I'm in town.
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: If you were looking for some authentic Italian food and or fresh ingredients this place is a jackpot. It's a hidden gem nestled in the middle of nowhere in midtown LA. I had a salad with some truffle pasta and a Italian spicy chorizo pizza and everything was absolutely amazing. You can't go wrong with this spot and the owner Michael is super cool. You have to try this place I promise it will not disappoint!
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: Love Love Love this place. Been here three times this month. I get the Classico, which is a prosciutto sandwich that is so delicious. Every component of the sandwich is super fresh, from the pesto, to the handsliced bread, to the procutto itself. I usually get the lentil soup and it is the cherry on top and very flavorful. The staff here is also super friendly and helpful. Outside they have a shaded front patio which is so nice to eat at during the hot summer.
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: The Truffle Brothers was recommended to me by a good friend who loves Italian food, and boy, was I in for a treat. From the very entrance to the inner workings of the restaurant and kitchen tools, it was nicely cleaned, maintained, and most importantly, the staff were very knowledgeable and friendly.The food I tried were one of the best pastas I ever had and was also surprised that the amount of truffles on the dishes did not overpower the dish itself and instead complemented it. Paired with their signature wine, it was all in all a unique and memorable experience.If you're looking for a place to eat or a small marketplace for Italian ingredients, look no further than Spaccio Salumeria by the Truffle Brothers.
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: Food is fantastic, great place to have a wonderful Italian meal. Service was friendly and attentive. Amazing Ambiance! Good times, it's just like taking a trip to Italy without the flight. Enjoy!
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: Amazing!! Truffle is to die for. Truffle pizza amazing- all the pasta so good- must come here! You wont' regret it! Taste if Italy you need it
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: I lived in the neighborhood for most of my life, so to see the old BOFA bank turned into this place, I was in awe. This place was fantastic! I had the Classico sandwich. The bread, pesto, cheese so fresh and yummy. I could not stop there I needed dinner to, so I bought the bolognese pasta, AMAZING! The flavors were so rich and authentic. You could tell that the pasta was fresh! If your in the mood for a little of Italy in Los Angeles, you must stop by. Wonderful food, and nice outside set up!
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: Everything was so tasty and the outdoor seating area was very cute! The pizza crust was thin chewy and crispy and the prosciutto was delicious!The sandwich was also super tasty! The meat was crispy and delicious and the caramelized onions and dressing were a nice compliment.I wasn't a fan of their gelato ice cream cone but the cashier told me that their gelato supplier hasn't been sending new stuff for a bit so it may just be that it wasn't very fresh.
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: Ok, decent food. Perhaps not worth the price? The service on the day I was there was surly and slow.
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: This is a treasure of a find. It's only open for lunch from Tuesday to Friday. Great pizza and other authentic Italian. A must if you are in the area during a weekday lunch and looking for something exceptional.
Address: 4073 W Washington Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90018

Comment: I went with a group of friends and we ordered most of the menu. Everything was great; food, service, atmosphere, wine!
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Our friends introduced us to AOC and now we go there for special occasions like our anniversary a few times a year. We love the food, the ambience and the servers and staff are great. We feel comfortable there as an LGBTQIA+ couple as well. Highly recommend!
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: AOC was great, I think they actually had the best french toast I've ever had in my life. The entire menu was super interesting and everything we ordered was excellent.Our server was wonderful, super attentive and really kind about giving suggestions and recommending alternatives.I think this would be a great spot for a friend brunch, but I can also imagine it would be a great place for date night. I came for brunch but I definitely want to come back for dinner.
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Fist time getting some tapas in West Hollywood. The restaurant has a very classy nice ambiance. Service is a pretty slow compared to other restaurants but our group was busy talking so it wasn't too big of a deal. The fried chicken was really good, but the other two dishes were un-memorable. I really liked the flavor of the black rice (very umami) but the rice makes your teeth turn black hahaha
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Charming and cozy patio area highlighted by the tasteful decor and exceptional service!The entrees were flavorful but unfortunately not amazing.There is an additional "fee" they add to the check.AOC is not cheap and to slide these fees in is tacky. There is a cost to doing business and their prices reflect that.
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Came here just got drinks and based on that we had a really good time. Sat at the bar which was clean and aesthetically pleasing. The bartender was very helpful and made amazing drinks. Friendly attentive service. I really enjoyed their summer chilada. Had 3 total. My date enjoyed her mojitos.Will be returning soon for dinner.
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: I always love coming to this place. This ambiance is just amazing while you sit outside. Service was great and fast and the food for the most part was great.
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Me and my boyfriend dined here on 7/29 and wow, I'm very impressed. He raved about dining at AOC in the past so he went ahead and made a reservation for us. We dined outdoors when the sun was still out so this makes a pretty cute date spot. This was my first time having dinner here and im floored by their decor and the spacious outdoor dining area.Service was amazing! Staff was attentive when it came to clearing our table and very friendly. They make up for the wonderful dining experience I had.We ordered the farmers plate, Spanish fried chicken, and their liberty duck breast. The duck breast was my favorite out of the three cause of how succulent and tender it was, but everything else was very good. They have a small mocktail selection. Since I don't drink, their orange and hibiscus is a great choice.Dessert was their sticky toffee cake and i highly recommend this. It was topped with ice cream so it was perfect for the summer weather.Overall, I've had a pleasant experience. AOC's vibe doesn't feel very pretentious and feels homey.
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: We have been regulars at AOC for years, and I can't say enough wonderful things about this magical place. The food is always perfect, inventive and delicious with seasonal surprises along with reliable stalwarts.Please don't miss the bacon-wrapped dates, the clams, and the dessert platter to share.The service is always impeccable: friendly and attentive. The setting is beautiful whether on the outdoor patio or in the cozy dining room.If you want outstanding food in a relaxed setting, you will never go wrong with AOC.
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Came here for dinner recently. Overall, good, but overpriced. They also charged a misleading extra 5% fee that I did not see until getting the check.The food was quite good. The heirloom tomato was particularly excellent. One of the best I've had. The green quinoa dumplings were so-so and not what I had expected--they were basically like falafel. The spiced fish tagine was solid and a generous portion. But prices were high relative to the quality.Cocktails and wine were good but overpriced.Also, they charged an extra 5% fee, supposedly for their workers, but I checked their website afterwards, and it's clear that the fee is going to the restaurant, not directly to employees. I felt that this was incredibly deceptive. Moreover, I did not even know about the fee until we got the check. Apparently it was somewhere on the menu (which I did not see when ordering), but who reads all the fine print on a menu? And apparently we could ask to have it removed, but that felt very awkward at the time because they made it seem like the money was going to the workers--when in fact it was going to the restaurant!
Address: 8700 W 3rd St Los Angeles, CA 90048

Comment: Really enjoyed the warm lobster roll, oysters and clam chowder. Skip the mussels - they were covered in a mountain of overcooked soggy fries, and the broth was bland/under-seasoned. Service was slow - our cocktails didn't arrive until after our appetizers were cleared (we saw them sitting on the bar for 15 mins and were tempted to grab them ourselves until a runner finally brought them over). 4% restaurant fee added to the bill, sigh. I would go again if I was in the area, but not a destination spot.
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: salmonela ‼‼salmonella‼‼salty girl ?!?more like salmonella girl!!!!this place is a brreding ground for salmonella and food poisoning and they dont give a rats ass!!!after being in bed for over a week and hospitalized the manager basically shrugged his shoulders and said you have proof and giggling as if this was some type of joke?!he basically broke down the business plan how "were here for a good time not a long time sweetheart"total scam artist!!! notice they dont reply to bad reviews horrible business practice and they get them taken down so read this while it last come here if your ready to gamble your health in exchange for a cute ambiance !!
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: So you guys don't have a contact number on yelp or google ?! My experience was great food tasted amazing drinks were good ambience was a 10/10 the reason for my 1 star is because I made a reservation through resy for Saturday of last week and both me and my fiancé have been bedridden ever since mind you it's currently Thursday of the following week we've been so sick from food poisoning from the oysters we consumed and I've emailed the restaurants "support " email and no one has gotten back to me so maybe this will grab someone's attention 213-270-3135
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Went to Saltie Girl for lunch with my work team because someone recommended it and the place did not disappoint!We sat on the patio and it was such a cute vibe! Everyone was really nice and gave such great suggestions, which I love! Our server suggested the watermelon mocktail but spiked with our favorite alcohol so two of us ordered that with tequila.  The appetizers we ordered were the Grande Seafood Tower (a lot of options with 2 levels), the scallops which were so delicious (cheesey, garlicky, perfection), and the steak tartare (wow! It comes with delicious cheesey bread to dip). Two of us ordered the Saltie Girl Burger as our meal and that came with fried lobster on top and fries. My boss ordered the fish and a side of broccolini and although I didn't try it, it looked really juicy!I'll be back again for brunch because this was such a cute spot and I still need to try their sticky bun that they only offer for brunch!
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: House caviar was really great! Service was amazing. Lobster roll was something to write home about... AND did! Highly recommend! Espresso martini was delicious.
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Plenty of parking, private lot in the back.. Nice size dining room and patio.. Good spot for lunch meetings and dinner. Customer service was really good and friendly. Food was really good, I ordered the lobster roll and fries.. Nice size portions, cooked to order.. I will definitely come back
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Jackie is the best! Made our night! Such good food and friendly service! I totally recommend coming to the restaurant. If you like seafood and good service come here
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Cute little spot in sunset plaza, which means easy parking. Got the lobster spaghetti and a salad. Both were good. Service was average. I had some leftovers after my lunch.
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Highly recommend. Will be coming back. Enjoyed their tin canned fish. Everything ordered was delicious. I will reorder most if not all that I've already ordered. Will need to try the ice cream but the cookie was worth it. Service was good. Get there early. Arrived at 1:15 and a few popular items were already sold out. Anything scallops was great. Cute ambiance as well.
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: The restaurant was very pretty and the chill vibe was interesting. Our server was very kind but the service was very slow and the food we ordered took forever that we had 2 hrs lunch by then. All dishes were over priced compared to the taste of each dishes were disappointing.
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Best selection of tinned seafood on this side of the hemisphere. If you like sardines or octopus or tuna in a can, this place has dozens of options for each. Excellent oysters, like their oysters bar in Boston, and indulgent caviar serving. Oh and the lobster roll obviously. Bartender is super friendly and his cocktails are refreshing. Did I mention their blue crab toast?
Address: 8615 W Sunset Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90069

Comment: Service was absolutely amazing. Food a little underwhelming a little overpriced. All in all a great time.
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I've had many good memories here but have to take a step back. Maybe I'm the fool, but, when I get hostility from the bartender when I ask for a martini (and I watch him make it) and there's no vermouth so I inquire about the vermouth and he gives me attitude, I get defensive. I'm sorry, but, a martini has vermouth. Yes, the amount is relative but otherwise it's gin/vodka up. How dare you give me attitude because I want a drink made the way it's supposed to be...Post COVID the world seems to be upside down. This is the perfect example: "Oh, you want pepperoni on your pepperoni pizza?"
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I loved the ambiance of the place it felt like old Hollywood with the pictures, booths and my favorite part was the bathroom I know weird right!! There are pictures from customers covering the bathroom walls and ceiling it was very interesting to see abd gave you something to look at haha. The services was quick and the staff was very nice. Our food was amazing ny hubs for a steak and I got the carbonara both were amazing!! If you are in Hollywood and like the old Hollywood feel with some amazing Italian food make a reservation before 11am and enjoy some great food at Jones
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Such a cool hangout spot with music and a great crowd.Excellent service by such a kind, bubbly waitress.The food is outstanding!Ahi Tuna - absolutely incredible dish, makes me crave white beans.Beef short rib - so tender, fell right off the bone.  This dish was so delightful, can't wait to go back for more.Apple pie - I wish you could smell the goodness.Orecchiette with Turkey - good pasta dish, healthier option with turkey.Can't wait to return for cocktails and more delicious food!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I went in last night for the first time. They sat us in an area where there was no table service so we had to order from the bar. We were fine with that. So I go to the bar to order food and I'm standing there in a great mood, chatting with the nice drag queen that was working, when suddenly I feel a hard triple slap on my shoulder. I turn around and this female bartender (found out her name is Amy) gives me the nastiest attitude and yells at me that customers are not allowed to stand there. I was shocked! I looked at her and said don't you ever put your hands on me again. Then, she replied, "You can go see the exit!" Wow. First of all, there would have been no issue if she kindly asked me to move. The audacity that she thought she had the right to hit me is beyond my comprehension. And then to tell me to leave instead of apologizing after? So I asked for the manager. I watched her as she went over to him, pointing at me, really just acting and looking angry and out of control. The manager came over and basically told me the same thing she did, that customers can't stand there and she was letting me know. Yes, I understand that. But can we address the fact that she was rude and placed her hands on me? He told me he didn't think she really did that! My friends were standing there watching and other customers were shocked. So not only did this uncouth bartender assault me, but the manager told me I was lying about it. What a hellhole. BTW, the manager's name I'm told is Cody. Also, after reading the other negative reviews of this place, they all have the same theme. This place has the worst customer service I've ever experienced. They are not just rude, they are abusive. Don't spend your money here.
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: They have RATS and ROACHES!!!! Please don't eat here it's gross and they service is HORRIBLE!!!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Racism is so appalling here the bartenders will ignore you literally placed my order then try to get check and the bartenders told me he won't serve me cause I was "trying to get his attention all night" he said this then when I left he said yeah go eat mc Donald's then when I flipped him off he got me kicked out . I have came here for years always talked highly until now this was so disrespectful disgusting experience I have ever had i regret any money I have ever spent here the bartenders are so entitled you would think they were owners killed the whole vibe never going back if your black this place is wackkkkk and racist !
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Would never come back here. I'd never been treated so poorly by a bartender in my life. I honestly left nearly in tears after he snapped at me literally because I sat at the bar to order food. I don't know what would possess someone in hospitality to brutalize a customer like that but I 100% did not deserve to be treated that way and I hope others aren't receiving the same treatment.
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Been going to jones for late night dinner for many years. Used to love it. They still have the same great ambiance and pretty good food, but my friend and I had just a totally awful experience there last night, saturday 8/12. Our waitress was beyond rude no matter how much we tried to be friendly : and it was overt. we asked for bread 4 times before it came and the busser slammed it on the table like he was pissed. She left us alone for nearly half hour waiting for our bill and her and the busser continued with just awful attitudes. It was almost comical they were so mean. Was tempted to stiff her but wanted to take the high road - gave her 22 percent. This experience may have ruined it for me. Not sure if I'll be going back.
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: This place is amazing! It's super packed but I like the vibe. I didn't try the food but it smelled amazing and looked great. Got an expresso martini and by far it was my favorite martini I had. Beautiful cocktails!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Always delicious, late night food. The pizza is light and tasty. The vibe is great. Highly recommend!
Address: 7205 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I used to come here in the 90s and was pleasantly surprised how much it HASN'T changed!! Love that. One of these days I'll eat their food but until then...(clinks cocktails) "cheers!"
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I ordered the Loco Moco breakfast item. It was delicious, scrumptious, and I want to come back for more!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I'm a huge fan of the Formosa Cafe! The Orange Chicken AWESOME; it's so incredibly delicious. And the Sticky Short Rib Sesame Noodles was pure perfection!Now, when it comes to the Char Siu Pie, it didn't quite meet my expectations. I'd give it a 6/10.The service was also great here.
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The Formosa Cafe was so beautifully decorated and the atmosphere was amazing.  The service was great and the waiters were so nice.  The food was great and definitely save room for dessert!  Will be coming back soon!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Pretty good food with good vibes and great service. We sat in the bar on the second floor and the twinkle lights really set the ambiance that you didn't even realize you were in the busy West Hollywood. They give big portions as everything is family style and they have quite a few vegetarian options. Parking can be hard to find (since you're in West Hollywood) but most street parking in the area is free after 7 PM. The bathroom on the second floor was clean-ish and it's a single bathroom so there was a line.
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Fantastic food. Very noisy, but food was worth it. Been there forever and can't say enough about the food and quality.
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Incredible food, wonderful atmosphere, and a great experience with our server, Matt, and the AGM, Harrison.Firstly, the restaurant was able to accommodate our larger party with only a few hours of notice. For two out of the seven in our party, they had dined there before. The rest of us were excited to try all the things we'd heard rave reviews of.Immediately Matt G made us feel like we were old friends. He was charming, polite, and very knowledgable. He answered all of our questions promptly and humorously and continued to check in on us as the evening went on--making sure our water glasses were always full.The food was delicious and everyone left there full and happy to have leftovers for tomorrow. Half of our party ate family style and the other half got their own dishes. Both of which are easily doable so whatever experience you're looking for they can accommodate. i even forgot to ask for a dish to be not spicy and they immediately took it back to the kitchen and re-prepared it for me.After the meal I asked for the manager to express how wonderful our server, Matt, had done. Harrison was kind and funny as well and I really enjoyed speaking with him.All in all an incredible experience and one I hope to repeat again soon!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Great Chinese food with the old school Hollywood feel ..highly recommended, definitely coming back
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The food was tasty! The ambience was dark just like I like it, love the colors, love the vibe. 10/10 recommend!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: So much to rave about here. The history, the vibe, the food, and the staff were all fabulous.  My wife and I ate here in June and then came back in July. We had the sweetest little redhead hostess who warmly welcomed us and took great care of us.  Our server was very attentive and our glasses were never empty (a pet peeve of ours).  We had some wonderful cocktails to start our evening. My wife had the Matador and the Passion & Paradox (recommended by our hostess) and I had the Green Tea Martini. Kudos to the mixologist behind the bar!We experienced a variety of food on our two visits--Pot Stickers, Chile Wontons, Kung Pao Chicken, Braised Pork Belly, Orange Chicken and Xiao Long Bar "XLB" Soup dumplings.  Everything was delicious. In fact, it was so good we forgot to take a picture of the food!  Overall, our total experience was exceptional. Cannot wait to return and y'all need to follow suit!
Address: 7156 Santa Monica Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I was looking forward to trying some delicious Thai food but was immediately met with disappointment as I sat around waiting for someone to take our order. Although the service was slow, I still held out hope for the food. However, the food was also disappointing. The shrimp cakes did not have much flavor and reminded me of chicken nuggets. The food arrived cold and the basil fried rice did not have enough flavor. Thai food is one of my favorite cuisines, so I was especially unpleasantly surprised. The restaurant itself was very open and had a large bar but I didn't try the drinks.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing and authentic thai food. Pad see yu, morning glory, papaya with blue crab, ton yum goong!
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Depending on how busy this place is, that will determine the quality of service you receive. When you're the only customer here the food is delicious and they tend to your table frequently to ensure everything is going well. Should there be more than 5 tables with paying customers, there will be eggshells in your food with no chance on getting a refill on your drinks.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The worst Thai Food and perhaps the worst dining experience I've ever had. 1.) I repeatedly had go myself into their kitchen to find a waiter.2.) We ordered the "Chicken Hell," which is one of their "specialties," and it had bones that were so small and fine that I cut my gums and the roof of my mouth, and both me and my guest spit out blood from the small cuts the bones had created.3.) I explained to the server why this was a problem, and he just smiled and nodded as if I was telling him how nice the weather was, and then he turned away only to bring a bill a few minutes later.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The inside is absolutely beautiful with bar on the side but unfortunately can't say the same about the food we had! Ordered Chicken fried rice & Mint Leaves Basil & Chili Chicken (Pad ka Pow) w/ Hot spice level but we had no idea that we'll get level-8 spicy so really couldn't enjoy it and suffered with mild stomach pain the following couple of days! I think they need to be careful about the spice level they are serving the customers or at least should have warned us beforehand!
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Might be one of the worst experiences I've ever had eating somewhere. First this little parking lot actually charges an $8 valet fee which if u saw the parking lot u would laugh. Then when u get there no one speaks English and what I thought was karaoke night was the actual entertainment. The music and microphone was so loud I could not hear myself think. No one seemed to be working and I had to hail down someone who I guessed was working. They Findlay bring my food and I was so hungry I dug in. $50 for two dishes that universally cost 10-15 each. Mind u they have NO PRICES ON MENU. I tried to enjoy my meal but the woman singing was sooooo loud I was in pain. I paid and ran out of there. Never ever ever again
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great spot to eat. Great and prompt service. Food taste was very good I had no complaints. My family and went to the other Thai restaurant that's starts with a "T" down street for 25 years. We live two hours away and only  ate Thai at that place. Service and ambiance is gone at the "T". This is my new place when I'm in town. Hollywood Thai really know how to treat clients , serve good food and is super modern and clean. I really liked my experience here. Recommend.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Be aware! They overcharge you!There is no price on the menu and they over charge you. We ordered one pad Thai and one morning glory, ended up paying $50 including tips. And found out both dishes were only $16.95 each . The bill was hand written only and they asked you to pay cash. What a scam
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing food was great' they are so kind and I will definitely be back!!! Yay this place is open late,Perfect for you and your hungry friends on a Sunday night ! Service was amazing!
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: We came in here tonight after doing a photoshoot nearby - we were a party of two young women. The restaurant had an overwhelmingly unpleasant 'fishy' smell as soon as we walked in, like spoiled seafood, and the vast majority of the restaurant was empty. We were seated immediately in a booth and brought water but it took awhile to get menus and drinks. The server was friendly but he NEVER came back--- we were left on our own for SO LONG without anyone coming by to see how we were doing. He told us to use the QR code for accurate pricing since the menus they gave us were not up to date (then why give them to us at all?). I ordered fried tofu and asked for a side of peanut sauce instead of sweet chili, and my friend ordered pad see ew and some mango sticky rice for dessert. Our food took maybe 20 minutes to come out. The food was hot and fresh, the tofu perfectly crisp on the outside, but it was VERY mushy and soggy on the inside, like too much water was left in it maybe? And extremely bland, no flavor whatsoever. Even when I dipped it in the peanut sauce that just tasted like peanut butter, no seasoning or heat in the sauce at all.  It was like eating spongy cardboard with a mushy center. My friend said her food was good but honestly, we were astonished by the service. We sat down to eat at 9:15. We finished eating around 10 and waited for the server to come by to offer us to-go boxes and bring the check. We sat and talked, our plates obviously finished, no longer eating, until 10:40 when I finally flagged him over to bring us to-go boxes and the checks. He brought the to-go boxes and then vanished again. We boxed up our leftovers and waited, but no check arrived. At almost 11 he resurfaced and I flagged him down again and asked for the checks again. He said "Oh, no one brought them to you? Sorry!" and went to get the card machine and brought it to us. The food is a little pricey - my appetizer of fried tofu was $20 plus tip and the mandatory fee for using a debit card (we actually used Apple Pay) and while the portion size was generous I can't say the flavor or the service is going to make us come back. I know there's better food in Thai Town.
Address: 5241 Hollywood Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The reason that ixlb DimSum Eats - Hollywood does not get five stars is because they absolutely refuse to alter anything in their menu - they even refuse to cut up the Chinese sausage in the Bento Box, even though, technically, it is NOT any kind of substitution (I wanted to order the Bento Box for a person who could not eat large pieces of food, thus the request to cut up the Chinese sausage). I even spoke to the Manager, who absolutely refused. So, I ended up NOT placing a $65 order - their loss.Compare this to any other Chinese restaurant, most of which will customize their menus for the diner.We have not gone back to ixlb DimSum Eats since the infamous "Chinese sausage" incident. There is a really good upscale dim sum restaurant in Studio City which has a much larger selection of dim sum and is an actual restaurant, as well as a section for counter service to-go orders (that restaurant is Shanghai Rose).It is a shame about the lack of flexibility at ixlb DimSum Eats, because they have good dimsum, and I used to drive in from Monterey Park (to pick up large orders for several people) because I preferred ixlb DimSum Eats' dimsum to dimsum from various restaurants in the San Gabriel Valley (which is saying something, because the SGV is known as a great area to get Chinese food!)One thing that I loved is the turnip cake - it is very flavorful, but I suspect it might only be ordered by those people who are open to Chinese food that is not "Americanized." You can find turnip cakes in Chinatown in authentic dimsum restaurants.ixlb DimSum Eats is an upscale version of those authentic dimsum restaurants. The hargow and shrimp and chives dumplings are delicious. The sticky rice ball was disappointing: hard and with pieces of uncooked rice - we only ordered it once, and never again. Instead, we would order the seafood pearl, which is similar, but the rice is sticky and SOFT. The curry puffs are good, but extremely greasy. The Smiling Fish Bun is a take on Bao, in an open-faced style. It is good! But if you want just the same fried fish without the Bao and toppings, you can get the Fried Fish Fillet which has 2 pieces of fish and a side of the same sauce that is in the Smiling Fish Bun (the Smiling Fish Bun only has 1 piece of fish).Parking is horrendous around ixlb DimSum Eats. There is a very small parking lot behind the restaurant (parallel to Sunset) and very little street parking. There is an Arby's nearby with a larger parking lot, but I don't know if they will tow away cars if they see people parking there and NOT going inside Arby's. I would wait to go to ixlb DimSum Eats until after 8pm just so I could find parking.In sum, the only reason I give ixlb DimSum Eats only 3 stars is their lack of customer concern and lack of flexibility (it would have taken less than 2 minutes to cut up Chinese sausage for the Bento Box ... ). Other than a few bad items, most of the food is very good.
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Yes please!!!! Amazing small bites. Will not go wrong with anything you choose. Definitely a lunch gem!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Ordering was quick and easy, got our food in about 10 minutes. The rice was a bit over cooked for my liking but i enjoyed overall and the soup dumplings are a must! It is a bit humid inside, but it is kept clean. Would definitely go back!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Amazing! Free parking (for one hour), quick service (got our food in less than ten minutes), and super nice staff! Everything tasted delicious, especially if you're looking for a quick dim sum fix :)
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Luv this din sum .. service was fast.. prices r affordable .. parking is limited ..  foods r so delish .. luv it!!!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: This place is sooo good. The staff is so kind and professional. The owner came out and introduced himself. We came late and they let us finish our food and use the bathroom even though we came with only a few minutes until close. All of the food was so good. So hot and fresh. Best dumpling place I've tried.
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: This place is sooo good!! Do yourself a favor and come try the dim sum! This is a good place for a quick bite. All the food comes out within minutes in takeout containers. The staff is so nice!
