We came as a big party(about 7 people) about 10 minutes before they closed and they were able to easily accommodate our large party.Here's everything we got:-pork xiao long bao 9/10-spicy cucumbers(spicy isn't super spicy but they provide extra chili oil if needed) 9/10-shrimp shumai 10/10-spicy garlic noodles- pork bao bun- we got a lot more but these were some highlights!!!We enjoyed everything we got
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: WOOOWWWW if I could leave a 100/5 star review I would! The food was fresh and tasty  the staff and owner seriously the sweetest people. Love how clean and easy it was to order my food.  If you are ever in LA I would recommend you come here!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: Ordered delivery and food came hot and delicious! Perhaps they could have included a bit extra sauces and condiments for the dishes (such as sweet sauce for the spring rolls), but hardly a huge complaint given how everything was.Pork Siu Mai - PACKED with meat and veg, this is perfectly seasoned and just explodes in your mouth. One order was 4 pcs and enough for a good portion of a 2 person meal. That said...I bought 2 orders for 2 people and am happy I was indulgent ;)Xio Long Bao - My comparison point in Cal is Din Tai Fung and these dumplings held up to the competition - for a fraction of the price. DTF's version has more soup and fills your mouth with hot broth immediately, while ixlb's are more subtle, but more than make up in flavor what they perhaps lack in soupy KA-POWness.Shrimp Wontons - Again 4 per order and that's plenty! Absolutely yummy, came with most crispiness remaining (not bad for a few mile trip!) and their chili sauce is solid. Seems like at least two shrimp (or a beautifully tasty and huge single) in this monster. Loved this dish.We also ordered the fried shrimp balls (odd texture at first, then that rich flavor takes over and you're transported to another, kinder, place). Spring Rolls were hot and fresh and delicious (see note about sauce above), and the Cha Siu was fine, definitely have had better in town, but I primarily ordered to make my own fried rice later in the week, so fine by me.No comments on ambiance of actual store as only delivery so far, but this is definitely my new GO-TO (or COME-FROM) spot of Dim Sum in Hollywood and mid-city!
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: I love this cute little fast food dim sum place. A great snack option - It's affordable and quick. I've been to both their locations. The Westwood location is nice as there is outdoor seating.I honestly cannot fault any of their dishes. I've tried almost all of them and they are so comforting and tasty yet simple and hits the spot when you just want a filling snack.
Address: 5900 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90028
Style: Dim Sum, Hong Kong Style Cafe

Comment: I came here after exploring Little Tokyo nearby because a friend recommended it. It seemed like it was still in soft opening or something, but we were starving and willing to try something new. I've only had tsukemen 2-3 times in my life, so I was excited to see how this compared.The ambiance inside was pretty good. Seemed like they were busy. My friend asked the waitress what kind of soup broth the ramen had (miso, shoyu, shio, etc), and the waitress couldn't answer, she just said "traditional". But then when further asked, she said that she was still training and still new to the place, so it was understandable.The wait was probably 20-30 minutes before we got our food, which normally wouldn't be a problem but we were definitely starving at that point.We all ended up getting the Tsukemen since it was in the name of the restaurant. To be honest, it was a bit underwhelming. The meat was almost like....deli meat you'd find at the grocery store, or in a charcuterie platter. I was expecting like actual chasu that you'd find in ramen typically. But maybe it was a different style? Also the soup was a bit salty for my taste, but maybe it's supposed to be that way. Either way, it wasn't my favorite thing, and by the end I wish I had tried the ramen instead.Overall, it was an okay experience. Not sure if I'd come back, but if I happen to be in the area and wanting noodles, I'll probably try the ramen. I'm sure the service might be better next time too given our waiter isn't someone who is still training.
Address: 232 E 2nd St Ste B Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Ate here for lunch today and really enjoyed the food! I ordered the small Tsuekemen Original and was super impressed at not only the portion, but how beautifully plated it was. The broth was rich and flavorful, and the entire meal was delicious! Will be back for more.
Address: 232 E 2nd St Ste B Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Aizen Tsukemen is actually accessible from 2nd St, not San Pedro, as indicated on the map in Yelp. I spent some time locating the entrance and was a bit sweaty by the time I arrived. To my delight, the waitress brought me a glass of ice water as soon as I sat down without me having to ask. Great service!Before my order was served, two trays of condiment were presented to enhance the flavor. The regular deluxe Tsukemen I ordered has a decent amount of noodles and a spectacular display of meat. With the 15% soft opening discount, it is not unaffordable.While the plating is magnificent, there is one problem. The noodles are sitting in the center dip of the plate, half-covered by the cold water draining off from the shimeru process. As a result, the noodles become softened, and the seaweed placed on top of the noodles also softens. Some tsukemen shops use a bamboo strainer to avoid this problem.The ajitama is aggressively marinated and has a dark brown exterior, but the interior is very white suggesting that it's not been soaked for too long. The yolk is pleasantly semi-runny. Besides the thinly sliced pork spread around the plate, there is also shredded pork in the center, and a few pieces of fatty pork in the broth. It made me wonder if this could be a viable option for a protein-based diet.The broth is bonito-based and tastes similar to the one at Tsujita. It's not piping hot either. Overall, I enjoy the thick, al dente noodles at Tsujita more. The array of condiments didn't do much to alter the flavor; perhaps I'm too modest in using them.At the end of the meal, I was given a small glass of mint lemonade to cleanse my palate. A nice touch. The atmosphere is trendy and clean, although there are some gnats flying around the shop. Considering the location of the restaurant, I don't find it too offensive. I guess no gentrification can clean this part of town up.
Address: 232 E 2nd St Ste B Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: TSUKEMEN LOVERS REJOICE!!! No longer are the days we have to drive all the way to Sawtelle or 626 for proper tsukemen, Aizen is reopened and serving some of the best noodles I've ever had!The prices great, the ambiance is clean and bright, the broth is so rich (but not fatty), and the thinly sliced toppings complement the perfectly cooked noodles ... well perfectly!!!If it weren't for my cholesterol and my bank account, I would literally walk downstairs and come here every single day!!!No, I don't have any pictures because I ate the food too fast  but come see for yourself and get here before the TikTokers and influencers find this place and blow it up~
Address: 232 E 2nd St Ste B Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: The best ramen I've had in a looong while.  Their bonito based soup is a refreshing change from the common tonkotsu based soup available at most other ramen places.  It's my new go-to.
Address: 232 E 2nd St Ste B Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: New place, new review.The soup: Ramen + egg + bellyThe Price: Reasonable price for the qualityThe verdict: great new location with quality service. I appreciated the atmosphere and plating. Great choice. As for the food. The soup broth was great and very rich' not watered down... the noodles were soft and easy to eat. Definitely great for a lunch run!
Address: 232 E 2nd St Ste B Los Angeles, CA 90012

Comment: Huge fan of their rice! Char siu and their beef are my favorites. Only wish they were open more days of the week. Please don't change anything else.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Needle was a big let down, sadly. The people working there were lovely and kind. But the food took a while to come, and when it did, it was bland and unimpressive. My husband got the beef and onion and I got the char siu rice, which was supposed to be their most popular dish and I cannot see how, with how bland it was. It was just plain rice, a few pickled vegetables, and pork slices lightly coated in some sort of sauce. I'm not sure I would try again.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: So cute and so good! Never seen a modernized Hong Kong cafe before, and they did it so well! A great and yummy spin on the classics like the French toast and pork bun, but still had the classics like cheurng fun and char sui rice. I had the char sui rice and it was so yummy, and reminded me of the way my mom makes it!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Stop looking! This place has the best char siew fatty rice. You won't regret it!!!!!!!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Stop reading and get your butt over here for lunch before they run out of everything. The char sui (option of lean or fatty) is so well done compared to other LA spots. The salted egg yolk French toast is also one of the best I've ever had. The egg custard sandwiched by two slices of bread double battered is perfection. Also really enjoyed their mango lychee tea which wasn't overly sweet. Their side dishes and green beans were a nice balance for fiber as well. Fried chicken imo was good but too salty for me.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Needle is a small charming eatery in Silverlake. Once you enter, it takes about 20 steps to exit. I believe there are 2-3 tables inside leaving most of the seating outside near the entrance and around the corner. Though not a very large menu, there are enough variety to accommodate most people in my opinion.The staff is friendly and casual.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Im sad i wasnt able to taste needles dinner menu but im so glad i went for brunch. Everything was soo delicious and i cant wait to come back for more.One of their standouts is def the salted egg french toast, it was soo creamy and flavorful. Please get this, it may or may not change your life.Lowkey i love their french fries. They were the perfect curly fries. If you like crunchy and crispy but soft on the inside, this is for you. And the ting leftover bites were just heavenly.Theres parking in the lots and street parking but may be hard to find. Staff was really nice and they have a help yourself station with water, napkins and utensils.I love this place and highly recommend it if you want a cantonese / taiwanese inspired brunch!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Hidden gem in sunset blvd strip. This restaurant's sign doesn't really stand out because all you see is a drawing of some sort of rice bowl  on a plane green solid color background. But if you get closer, you will notice a standing sign hand written "Needle"along with  today's menu. Their menu items aren't that extensive thus not many dishes to choose from. But their grilled pork belly on a rice and a stir fried udon was spot on. They were delicious. Not too sure if they used MSG or not but I enjoyed them.They deserve 5 stars for serving me delicious food! I can't wait to try other dishes they have!
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: amazing. I've been wanting to stop by for so long and it didn't disappoint. friendly staff and a great place for a quick, delicious bite! we had the chow udon, pork shop sandwich, and char siu. each meal was wonderful, but that pork chop sandwich visits me in my streams.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: So good. The service is fast and always super kind. I love their udon - the flavor is so fresh and delicious.
Address: 3827 W Sunset Blvd Ste C Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Delicious. Inventive.  Makes me never want to cook a meal for myself again.Gorgeous Space. It is eclectically charming with a portage outside area for a special event. I wish had one Just To eat in that semi-outside patio area.Gorgeous waitstaff.  They made wonderful suggestions and took care of us almost TOO MUCH.Gorgeous food:  delicious. Juicy chicken thighs. A Whole fanned-out fish (just how I like it).  Incredible chocolate salad with avocado, peas, herbs! Warm buttered bread comes with olives, prosciutto and olives.   OUTSTANDING.  YUMMMO!
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Came here for Mother's Day brunch today. The food was absolutely amazing. Everything from the appetizer to the main entree was tasty. The items are perfect to share. In addition, the service was great as the waiter was able to advise us on the menu as well as the number of things to order for our group. Also, the ambience and decor was really pretty to look at. The manager mentioned that the restaurant will be open every Sunday for brunch going forward. Which is great to try all the items on the menu.
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: My girlfriend told me about this place, she gave me some deets and was really looking forward to coming here. She hadn't known but I was planning a trip to Peru so I thought this is ironic. Anyway we went during the week so it wasn't jam pack which I actually prefer.We were greeted by our server and asked for recommendations since we were new. We had a few different options to chose from and we were so excited to try it all. The owner I believe came out to greet us, so cool!The place  was such a great ambiance. They had a private room, well actually they have a few couple private rooms for big parties. I also stumbled across a speakeasy bar on my way to the restroom.... again pretty cool :)Our food came out promptly we literally ordered so many different options; from seafood, to pasta, back to seafood. Staff was super attentive and helpful and very nice. I loved everything about this place and will def be coming back or maybe trying some of there other locations.
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: If you've experienced Ricardo Zarate's food before you won't be surprised, and if you haven't, be prepared to be delighted by his latest venture.The space is welcoming and comfortable and the food - remember, this is Zarate - amazing. Don't miss the salad (the bread is pretty terrific also). We tried two of the pastas, both amazing and will try try the third next time. Ditto with the deserts, although it will be hard to beat the arroz...BTW, there was plenty of parking right in front (all the spaces weren't taken by valet).This will be a regular for us!
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: The location is very convenient and the food is amazing and delicious they made it with charcoal and the pasta is so yummy can't wait to go again. Bravo.
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: The food is fine, but portions are small. Didn't justify the price.Service was lacking and slow.Probably better for a date night than a group.
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Colibri in West Hollywood was such an amazing experience!!! The food was SO good and the service was impeccable.We tried the kanpachi crudo- light, crisp and refreshing. The bread- and I'm not kidding it was the best bread I've ever had lol I don't even know how it was so good! The rigatoni with lamb was delicious- placed on a bed of ricotta- perfect- it almost reminded me of a gyro but in pasta form  lastly, the sea bream which was so decadent and buttery.I still want to try to pop up in Hollywood, too, because if it's anything like this location I know it will be fantastic! I really hope the WeHo location stays open for a long time!
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: Fantastic foodFantastic serviceSexy vibe!The lamb ragu verde are out of this world!Congrats on this new venture!
Address: 514 N La Cienega Blvd West Hollywood, CA 90048

Comment: This place was great! I went in for a quick solo lunch, had the blt on focaccia which was delicious and a mimosa. Prices were great and service was fantastic. Would definitely come back!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We used to live nearby and come here all the time and it never failed to impress. Went back today for a late lunch and it was just as a remember. There was a woman being a COMPLETE jerk to the server today and he handled it so well.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We live within walking distance and this is our go to place. The food is always delicious- literally every breakfast item, the mashed potatoes, and their veggie sandwich are my favorites. The staff is quirky and friendly and there's always cute dogs on the patio. I only wish they would add Happy Hour and cold brew coffee for brunch.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: This is a gem of a restaurant. I love this place so much! Always eat here when I'm in the area. Can't remember how I found it, but I have been coming here off and on since at least 2017, maybe earlier. They're very generous with their Mimosas, which are very refreshing in this heat. The brunch menu is a must have, especially the pear pancakes. Fluffy, not too sweet, and they pair really well those crispy strips of bacon. And if you don't make it in time for brunch, you won't be disappointed with their other options. Big shout out to my wonderful server from last time. Very attentive, I felt well taken care of.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Food and service was excellent, relaxing atmosphere and reasonable prices. I had the streak, medium rare, it was a little undercooked but that was fine. The seasoning was reallllly flavorful!  I'll be back very soon :)
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Had a very tasty and reasonable dinner at this low key neighborhood diner after going to bear happy hour next door at Akbar. Had the fried chicken Rochelle recommended and it was delicious. The mashed potatoes could have used some of the gravy on the chicken and the asparagus was very thick stemmed and woody, but I had switched from the green beans it normally comes with. Will happily go back!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: A real surprise. We were looking for something near the bowl, and thought we might need to settle on food. That was not the case at all! The food was fantastic, the setting quaint, service was great and we'll definitely be back.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: We'd passed The Kitchen 1,000 x's & never tried it. One day, my friend asked to meet me there and wow! Great service, chill atmosphere & the food was great. That crème brûlée is for REAL! Don't pass it. Try it!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: First time at The Kitchen; will not be the last time! Food was delicious, & great service. (The crème brûlée is to die for!)
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Omg! My daughter took me to this cozy little gem! Their beet salad was SO damn delicious!! Tried their steak frites and it was SO good as well! Highly recommend it! The food, ambiance and service was impeccable!
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Lovely place. Had a hard time finding it but staff was very helpful on phone. Had the Shepard pie, absolutely loved it. Decent parking in the back. Indiscreet off the street but gives it a very almost hidden gem vibe.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: A Los Feliz neighborhood institution with a homey vibe and time-tested classic recipes. Try the crab cakes Benedict for brunch, or the deeply savory Belgian beef stew for dinner.
Address: 4348 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Food is delicious! Great flavor profiles. Love her spin on traditional dishes!  Bravo.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: I almost hate leaving this review. I'm afraid the world will swarm this restaurant, and I'll never get a seat. A friend and I had to find an alternate place for dinner when our original choice fell through, and boy, am I glad it did.First, the food was beyond amazing. I had the fried green tomato BLT, and my friend ordered the spicy vegan spaghetti. Both were so good that we made a pact to keep returning until we tried everything on the menu.Second, the staff! Friendly, upbeat, and happy to share what each item consisted of and their recommendations.Third, the ambiance.  If you've ever ventured out of the bigger cities in Louisana to one of the roadside juke joints and loved it, this is your jam.  No fuss, dress down, and spill a little something on your shirt.Fourth, the music, the music, the music, the music.  I wanted to eat and dance at the same time.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: My foodie weekend ended with this wonderful restaurant. We got there when they opened and the young woman who took our order was very pleasant and personable.The young man who brought our food was just as pleasant and personable. We were impressed with these young people who are very service oriented and pleasant and personable. Very rare these days.The food was creative and tasty. Great experience and will go back to try differnt items on the menu.Thank you for the great experience.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Simply, spectacular... i wan to try everything on the menu, yet ill have o reserve that  journey over time... so, so  worth every bite...
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Ordered on UberEats and the temperature of the food was tepid at best.It looked really good so I still had high hopes. Unfortunately, the bbq fried chicken, while juicy, was bland and the skin was flacid and falling off of the chicken Big disappointment.As far as the sides, the dirty red rice had an okay flavor and was the most seasoned item. The greens, though tender, were entirely too bitter and acidic. Overall, each of the items I tried were just imbalanced in flavor, so even though the portions were generous, I wasn't excited to finish the meal.Solid packaging. I don't think I'd return for another meal.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: 4++ great soul food spot near the Fairfax / Mid City area. Has a warm, family/ home style cafe vibe to it. The folks here were very friendly. It's order at the counter style and they bring out the food. So the presentation is beautiful and it still has a fast casual feel to it.This place has been on my go to list for a while now. Finally got to go with couple of friends. I ordered the fried catfish with the cheesy grits as a side. The grits were delicious and had a nice firm texture to them. The fish was fried perfectly with flakey bites and crisp outside. I got to try some my friends shrimp and grits and oxtail taco. Both very good.Definitely a great spot that I would love to return to and try some of the other stuff on their menu. There are a lot of desserts there that I would like to try as well. I was kind of full and we were kind of a rush to get somewhere so I didn't end up getting any dessert this last trip. But they are behind the glass at the ordering counter and they all look wonderful. Especially that German chocolate cake.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The service was so great and made me feel like I was at my family business. The music and vibe was also really good. I can't believe I haven't yet been here. The setup felt so embracing of Black culture and history from the decor to the food. The shrimp and grits was so good. I'm craving it just thinking about it.They did have plaza free parking but it was shared and limited so street metered did the jobThe dessert I had was strawberry cake and it was okay and not as I anticipated but sure if I had asked they would've happily replaced. The lemonade and tea was addicting and so good! Can't wait to go back and try out more.
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: Omgeee omgeeezeee , this is definitely a must try when in Los Angeles,First let me say don't judge a book by its cover, Do not SLEEP on My Two Cents,Get in there ,get in there ,get in there  ,You'll get a rich warm smile and welcome from the staff .They will help guide you through the vast menu of yummy goodness ,you'll want to order everything on the menu,Before indulging in our main feast ,We were were presented with bite sized cornbread with an  amazing sweet drizzle (I can't remember if it was honey or butter )Whatever it was it was amazing.We then ordered the ground turkey and cheese tacos , Baby Beet Salad ,and Seafood Gumbo, and topped it off with a warm made from scratch crack cake perfectly plated with a dollop of light whip cream and a mint leaf,The food not only looked pretty it tasted amazzzzzingEverrrrrrythinnng was a 10/10 Perfectly seasoned, tender ,flavorful and made with love . And speaking of LOVE We had the privilege of meeting the chef and owner Alisa ReynoldShe was very gracious humble and loving to our family as with the rest of her staff. I told her at your TWO Cents one gains a million dollar experience.,and of all the stars in Hollywood she and her staff are the biggest STARS .
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: The venue is small but the flavor is BIG! My two cents is one of my favorite places to grab lunch when I'm in LA. The healthiest soul food experience you'll ever find. With an emphasis on culture and a conscious operation that uses local and organic ingredients, this place will be sure to impact your tastebuds and not your wallet. This isn't just any soul food, its food for the soul! Go get you some!
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: I'm a native of the neighborhood one of my best friends favorite spots, she spoils her daughter she loves the steak it was cooked to perfection with a side of grits and green's, fantastic, the most popular shrimp and grit's amazing a variety of homemade desserts made with LOVE just outstanding , l love the poundcake, and the strawberry cake needs to be left out for 1/2 hour to soften the frostingeverything was amazing the best staff young actors. The chefs are very professional you can tell they cook with lots of love & her recipe's all prefect a black & Latino chef brother working together outstanding  presentation . The quality is there not the quantity. I hope you enjoy it as much as l have especially since the sister puts her heart and soul in to every. I left nothing on my plate to take home. It's true the music is loud so if you don't like loud music get it to go! Congratulations on ure new series it's fits you perfectly thanks for all your love & support  ure Mo Better Family
Address: 5583 W Pico Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90019

Comment: This is my second time here and I really do enjoy it but we forgot Saturday was not happy hour and the prices are just too expensive and they don't have any food at all on the happy hour menu which I find strange. Good service and really fresh sushi but my tempura vegetables were way too undercooked. Would really love to come here more often, but considering the prices we won't. The robot is a fantastic addition. It even winks at you. Very fancy and fun.
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: What a wonderful place! Everything was perfection. I especially loved my spicy tuna cut roll, they put sesame seeds on it, which really kicks up the flavor. The tempura was perfect and even the edamame was boiled to perfection. I love the way they serve the hot sake and our server Gabby was just fabulous! it is a little pricey, so I'm hoping they'll put some food items on the happy hour menu so we can come back more often. The ambience and interior are beautiful, very comfortable booths and I love the blocks on the table so you can alert your server. Thanks you!
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Had the Tonkatsu ramen...delicious.  Service was friendly and helpful and food came quick.  Have been here multiple times and it never disappoints.
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: I went here during my recent Hollywood stay. The staff is super friendly, even when you show up around midnight.I had the Brussels sprouts and the pork belly teriyaki and both were really good.The rolls are prepared fresh on demand and delivered by a robot, kinda funny!I can totally recommend the restaurant , and again, the staff was so super friendly
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: place says open till midnight showed up @ 11:05pm and they turned us away said that it was closed!note to the owner update your hours or hire better staff that isnt lazy and non compliant on business hours!drove 25 minutes to this place, completely unacceptable.
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: This is my go to sushi spot. The sushi is so good and fresh. The drinks are good.. but I usually get a Sapporo and Hot Sake. They have a really good drink deals till late. Service is good, everyone is so friendly and attentive. The owner is cool too he'll walk around and greet the tables, I like that. Oh and they have a fancy bidet in the bathrooms!
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: It's so overpriced that no one ever is dining in there. Like the whole place is completely empty every time I pass them by. So I guess there's no ambiance.I've decided to give it a try as I live right by but I regretted I did. This is what $35 will get you in Shin. Like 2 smallest rolls with mediocre quality fish. I was shocked tbh. I took it to go but still tipped em $5 guess not enough to at least offer me some water while waiting.I have no idea how places like this survive.
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was very good, but portions are small and quite pricey.Also, my $30+ Cod had A LOT of bones in it.Sushi:Toro 9/10Albacore 9/10Salmon 8/10Beef and Asparagus 8/10Baked Cod 9/10 (except bones in it)Cucumber Salad 8/10Rice 8.5/10Teriyaki sauce 9/10
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: There's limited parking around this restaurant. We walked so it wasn't an issue. Servers are friendly and attentive, they give you hot towels to wipe your hands which is cool.Pesto pasta - 5/5 the texture of the noodles are firm which I love and the pesto sauce goes well with the noodlesCrispy rice spicy tuna - 3/5 the extra crispiness on the rice felt a little off but flavor was goodDouble spicy yellowtail - 4/5 this roll was super yummy. Perfect for those who love hamachi. I would take the garnish off cuz it didn't add much to it.Vegetable tempura - 4/5 comes with 2 pieces of shrimp, carrot, zucchini, and pumpkin, lotus root. Everything was great but the lotus root was a bit too firm making it hard to chew.
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food is AMAZING, dessert tastes like heaven, the services is beyond wonderful, and the entertainment is magical Thank you Tim for my favorite Sushi/Ramen place
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We have a great experience every time! Clean. Fresh ingredients. Great customer service. Owner is awesome and left me daughter with great birthday memories. Food is awesome. We love the many different appetizers, ramen selections, and fried ice cream!
Address: 1655 N La Brea Ave Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: i loved this place! nice service, the food was excellent. a little in the pricy side but everything tastes very quality. a lot of these are north african/middle eastern inspired as well!! ambience was warm and inviting. will come back here eventua
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: We sat at the chefs table and had a wonderful experience-both watching the food being made - in a wood burning oven - and eating it - absolutely delicious - the staff was friendly and accommodating - we will definitely be back!
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Great food, great service. Foods not heavy and everything we ordered was sooooo good.
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Great food, great service, great wine, great martinis! This review needed more characters so here are more characters.
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Had a great dinner here. The ambiance and service are both amazing and it's a nice location because you can walk around before or after dinner. The food was absolutely delicious. We got the radicchio salad and asparagus and egg salad with ham on top. Amazing. The chicken and fish were both delicious. The real prize was the cheesecake. Best I've had in a long time.
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: what a cute place to eat+drink! to me this place is like a 'no fuss/no muss' type of neighborhood hangout (tho I don't live in the area) and one of the few places in silverlake that doesn't blatantly try to overcharge u for sh*** food and sh**** service!! I really like the bartenders here.
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I was just walking down the street and I happen to come across this restaurant. I wanted a glass of wine. This is a super cute restaurant with great ambience and the wine was delicious. I will be coming back for more.
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: They've changed the menu radically from lots of tinned fish (very niche & not exactly staple fare in Spain) to now deliver a real feast of delicious dishes.  Wine & service also above par and the room is very buzzy, warm and welcoming:  all in all a very good restaurant in a neighborhood that has been crying out for something a bit more professional & grown up
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: I had a very good, but not outstanding experience here which I didn't feel was proportional to the final bill, so I don't think I'll be returning that often even if I live in the neighborhood.- the ambiance / location is very nice, probably the best quality of the restaurant. Very nicely designed and a nice general vibe. Good music too.- that said, the acoustics were horrible and we could barely hear each other talk without excessively shouting over the chaotic din. But I understand this is a sacrifice for a beautiful space and lively crowd.- service was very good, friendly and attentive, helpful and knowledgeable about the menu.- the food was very good, but the menu felt a little generic for LA without any strong unifying concept. Any Spanish inspiration seems to get washed out by an aggressive Californianization which makes it feel like every other LA restaurant of this type regardless of regional inspiration. We appreciated all the fresh and high quality ingredients, but the overall experience didn't seem proportional to the bill we paid at the end.
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Sunday supper with the girls. Since it was still daylight (early supper) we opted to sit outside since inside was too dark (so early).Quaint and cute. Service was good.Loved the pan con tomate on the thick bread, scotch egg and salad. Ordered a few other things but forgot to take pics. Octopus, grilled prawns.Love canned food, but the mussels weee just okay.Would come back. Easy valet parking in front.
Address: 3705 Sunset Blvd Los Angeles, CA 90026

Comment: Ryan is a great server. Always on time with everything he does. Very nice to engage with.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: One of my favorite places in LA! Corbin is our guy and he helps us have always a great experience!   Ilhame is the best host ever!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Most amazing service. Corbin is always welcoming and makes great suggestions. He is an absolute asset to La Boheme.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Service was the best (Ryan).Food was great. Halibut and sole with popcorn shrimp. Outdoor dining.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Exceeded my expectations!I thought this to be an expensive over the top place. It wasn't.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Awesome bohemian vibes. Nice lights, furniture oh yeah and the drinks and food choice Magnifique! The service is very charming 5 stars.
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Never having been, I decided to spend my birthday dinner here!  GORGEOUS atmosphere, like breathtaking.  We were greeted by the nicest of hosts, and our server Brendan took excellent care of us the whole evening.  The incredible food is some of the best that I've had in Los Angeles, and I've lived here over 20 years.  Thank you, La Boheme, for the wonderful night and the Roman candle on my dessert.  You know how to make an old gal feel special!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Where do I begin...Our experience was fantastic!   We were a party of just 2.  Came to dine on a Sunday evening and we were welcomed right away by the lovely host with the beautiful French accent, I believe her name is Alyssia.  We were seated outside at a fire pit.  The ambiance was breathtaking!  Our server Brendan was attentive and welcoming.  We had the charcuterie board, salmon and the chicken with fries.  That chicken was .  It had so much flavor and the sauce was the perfect addition.After dinner we decided to go inside to the bar since it was happy hour.  To our surprise, no one was in the bar so we had our drinks on the outdoor patio and took in the Hollywood night life.  This was such a nice experience.  The music, food, service, drinks were outstanding!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Cocktails, dinner, and a show! Our long time group of friends came to La Bohème to gather for a birthday. We enjoyed the drinks, the music, and of course the performances!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Ryan was the best!!! Food was great and service was better. Come on Wednesday nights when you can find him!
Address: Verified by Business

Comment: Tried it for the first time and let me tell ya is so worth it! Im definitely coming back to try other cuts!
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Make sure you come to enjoy eating, didn't taste or hear anything negative. A bit pricey, but you get what you pay for.
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Pros-service is not bad-ambiance inside is niceCons-parking is street only and I parked in a clearly marked spot outside the restaurant and there valet driver starts yelling at me in a condescending tone to look at the sign and he says not the park there which is so absurd because there is no sign saying people can't park there. The whole experience ruined the night-over priced for what you get-not the best quality-they charge a $4 share price
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Pros-Herbert is the best server ever-the chimichurri sauce is to die for-flank steak is delicious-burrata salad is really goodCons-no private parking but street only-wasn't a fan of the ribeye cap-pricey-they charge for water
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: First time at this restaurant! Nice ambiance and Guy was a very nice server! The food was delicious and definitely worth the price! The wine was delicious and they have a long wine selection. Definitely going back.
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: This is the BEST steakhouse in Los Angeles. The lamb chops, the ribeye cap, sides. and desserts are all to die for.
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Carlitos Gardel has been an Argentinian steakhouse I've been wanting to visit for years. Armenian family-owned from Argentina with a lot of delicious varieties of entrees, appetizers, wine, desserts, and coffee/tea. We were delighted with our service and for meeting Gerard. It's clear that there is a lot attention to detail and genuine care about the cuisine and the culture that impacts the entire experience.The ambiance in the outdoors patio was intimate, lively and clean. It was a fun time. I really liked the lamb chops, the gnocchi and the cappuccino!PARKING:Valet or street perking if you're lucky
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Carlitos Gardel is a true gem for Argentinian cuisine. The mouth-watering steaks, cooked to perfection, and the rich selection of Argentinian wines never disappoint.The intimate, old-world ambiance, coupled with exceptional service, makes for a memorable dining experience.This is a must-visit for all food lovers.
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: The food was great, i especially loved the steak and cream of asparagus soup! Our server was Guy, he was really nice and patient, he explained each dish to us and fully answered all our questions. I wish the vibe of the restaurant was a little different because I can't understand it.
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Oh My Goodness this restaurant was AMAZING! Our server GUY was exceptional! His suggestions were ON POINT!  His attention to detail and service was extraordinary. The ambience was wonderful. The host was gracious. The food was delicious.  This is an experience I would recommend to anyone.
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: Amazing food, great service from Guy. Best restaurant I've been to in LA. I have recommended it to three friends already.
Address: 7963 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90046

Comment: We went around 5:30 PM on a Friday and got seated in the outdoor area right away. The outdoor seating area was nicely decorated and would be a nice place to chill at night. The food was good but we thought the service could be better.From the beginning, it took awhile for someone to take our order. The set includes fried rice, which is cooked on the same grill after you are done with your meats. After we finished our bbq, no one came to check in on us to see if we would like to order more or if we were ready for our fried rice. We had to flag the staff down multiple times to remind them and we were kept waiting for so long that the oil and remaining vegetables were burnt. When I pointed that out, they did replace the grill for us but we were disappointed the fried rice wouldn't be cooked with all the good meat essence from our bbq (and as expected the fried rice tasted blend).I think for the price point, the service could be better and the staff could be more attentive. When we came it wasn't even that busy so I'm not sure if the service would be even worse during rush hour.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Service was awesome, meat quality is great, outside patio setting is chill. Perfect meat portion for the combos.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The wait was excessive, but the food was very good! Our cook seemed to be working all the tables outside as the owner helped him. They are fairly new so it makes sense that they are getting used to the clientele etc. although the whole process did take long I would love to go back when they are more established as the food was great and the servers and owner were polite enough. Also the owner let us take the bibs home  love that part! And the ambiance was a little underwhelming as far as the Korean campsite feel, but nothing to discourage you from visiting.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food, service, and ambiance is amazing! Thank you to our amazing  server John! He took care of us all night! Anything and everything we got was good! From the beef, pork, and even cold noodle options, it was all good! They have a restaurant inside that takes advanced reservations. The patio is walk-in only. They have a bar too. You can find parking at the equitable plaza; it's a $5 flat rate on nights and weekends.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: First order of business when arriving in LA is always K-BBQ. Although there are so many options in Ktown, since the weather was quite warm, we thought Mun Patio would be perfect on a hot day.We were a bit unsure if we were supposed to go through the front entrance or if the patio had a separate entrance. Since we arrived a couple minutes before opening, we decided to walk around the building to kill some time and found a side entrance with a sign so we peeked in. Although we were STILL early, we were welcomed to take a seat on the patio. The sun was still out but there were several tables in the shade. The tables were situated far from the street entrance so the hustle and bustle of the street is blocked. String lights were hung above, which I would imagine would be beautiful later in the evening.The patio menu is limited, but you are allowed to order from the inside menu. The patio menu includes 3 different meat options, 3 noodle items, and 3 stews/ramen. For 3 people, we ordered the pork set (port shoulder, pork jowl, and pork belly), which comes with fried rice for $65 and added one order of the Kkodorri noodles (definitely recommend). This was the perfect amount of food for us. There was a DIY ramen station if that's what you're craving after some drinks.Our server cooked all of our meat for us and even grilled the kimchi (and potato!), which I love. He recommended what sauces to pair with which meats, which were all great in my opinionThe prices are more than reasonable for the service and quality, especially compared to other K-BBQ places in the vicinity. Definitely would go again and would recommend.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Must visit and definitely a frequent visit. Recommend coming earlier if the group is larger, but one of the best and affordable kbbq in LA.The pork meats are definitely the highlight, but the Bul-nificent is also incredible and highly recommend. I would order pork first, order Bul-nificent and then cook the fried rice in the left over sauce.Also, the owner is super friendly and the service is top tier.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: One of the best kbbq restaurants in LA and vest vibes.Would definitely ask for the patio seating for the vibes and "Dontastic" combo. They use a wok like grill that's unique, and really helps cook the meat quick and very well. They also cook the kimchi in oil after the meat the meat cooks, which is how it should be do.The owner also comes around and is super friendly and will definitely take care of you.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Food: 5 StarsService: 5 StarsAmbiance: 5 StarsI love this place and 5 stars all the way! I was there this Saturday and just loved the ambiance as soon as I walked into their patio area. Got there around 5:20 pm, and all the tables were filled by 6 pm. Not sure if it was just that Saturday night, but it was less crowded after 7:30 pm as we were leaving.We ordered Don-Tastic and extra Pork Belly for three. We tried all three pork, and they were all so good. We also had Golbaengi Noodles, and this was also good. It's not the typical spicy golbaengi noodles though.I just loved the ambiance. It almost felt like glamping since we were grilling our meat under the tree and with string lights around the tree. Since it's outdoor, your hair will not smell like bbq. I'm already thinking about going back next weekend.
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: I can not say enough good things about this place. Immaculate food. Immaculate staff. Immaculate vibes. One of my favorite Korean BBQ spots in Ktown and I will be returning next time with my parents. That's how good it is. It will exceed the expectations of my Korean parents and anyone that comes here won't be disappointed. Order the noodles and pork belly at the same time! Shoutout Brian Shin for putting me on!!
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: The best Premium KBBQ place in KTLA so far. The meats are really juicy and high quality. Service is 10/10. The servers are very friendly. They also cook the meat for you and they really know how to cook it to perfection. We also got a free egg soufflé for waiting. We will definitely be back. :)
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: My friend introduced me to mun patio and I am just obsessed! From their service to their food, I'm going to have to give them five stars! They are banchan is super fresh and pairs well with everything that is so served on the menu.The service here are so sweet and attentive! As a Southern girl, hospitality is a major component in rating a restaurant and mun patio exceeded my expectations! Shout out to Esther and the servers for making my experience at mun well worth the drive from the west side!!The space is out in the courtyard with a bunch of tables, portable grills and in the corner they have a self service room and bar, which is complementary for guest who eat at the patio.I wasn't able to grab a picture, but at the end they make you the famous Korean fried rice with the meat, and a bunch of cheese!This is a great place to have get together's with your friends or go on a date. Also, I forgot to mention their drinks are phenomenal!Just a little tip on the weekends they don't take reservations so I'll try to come for an early dinner so you don't have to wait ! Cheers!
Address: 3519 W 6th St Los Angeles, CA 90020

Comment: Really cannot say enough good things about Kuya Lord. From the food to the service to the quality to the coziness of the dining room - it's all five stars across the board from me.I'd actually never heard of this spot before heading up to the LA area for a work trip. The guy I was with, though, he not only knew about Kuya Lord but was very excited for us to try it out. Luckily, we had a couple of hours to kill between events and this place was close enough for a quick lunch.The dining room was pretty packed when we arrived, though "pretty packed" here means there were two larger parties already posted up at their tables. The dining area is tight, so be prepared.We decided to share a couple dishes: the Lechon Kawali rice bowl (pork belly, rice, salad, $25) and the Beef Tocino bowl (short ribs with egg, $26). We also each got a glass of their honey calamansi juice ($7 each) and - because we're crazy - decided to share the calamansi pie $(10.50).The first bites of the Lechon rice bowl instantly transported me to my youth, to being in a family kitchen with my mom and aunties, to hearing my uncles talking about the proper marinade for the beef, the best way to sear in the flavors, the perfect pairings as sides. The Tocino bowl made me pause - beef still whole on my tongue - to appreciate the complexity of the flavors and the juiciness of the meat.To say we both enjoyed the meals would be an understatement. We're still talking about the food to this day - and this was only the second meal we'd ever shared together. The power of good food, man! Building relationships and memories without even trying.The honey calamansi juice was refreshing, a bit tart and slightly sweet. The calamansi pie was...well, it was a bit much after all that food. We got through a quarter of it before having to tap, but it had a nice bite from the calamansi, and a smooth texture to the filling. I wish we could have taken it back with us, but we had several more hours in the car before we could get back to our hotel, so that wasn't an option.We both very much enjoyed our quick (though slightly expensive) meal here and acknowledge our new friendship was built over the dishes and the conversations we had while in the dining room.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Been here a couple of times and really wanted to love it. Food was greasy, flavors were so salty and it was way overpriced. $58 for three super mediocre things.We had:Laing goodJava rice so oily & salty and the shaved onions came out of a package, not fresh.Calamansi juice $7 each! And it tasted gross.Skip it.Try Spoon & Pork or L.A. Rose.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: This is definitely a hole in the wall in a hard to find parking location but once you do, it's so worth it! I loved every plate that I tried, especially the fish. It's a little pricy but they have great portions. The service was self serve for a lot of items but I prefer that rather than asking for everything from a server all the time. The location is small and cozy and it has a cool ambiance. I would definitely come back here again!
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Super good & a little different than other Pilipino places which I like.  Even their desserts r worth an order.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Kuya Lord is great if you want proper Filipino cuisine. It's one chef and one employee that manages the front. Order at the counter and sit where you find a spot. This place is very small & if you have a large group get it for takeaway. Food prep is slow, but you know what? It's one person & he's pumping out freaking delicious food. So don't be a jerk and be patient. Loved the LAING, LECHON KAWALI, PORK MAMI, LECHON KAWALI RICE BOWL, and the PANCIT CHAMI. ENJOY!VPS: There's only street parking & I ubered just to keep my sanity. :)
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: I got the lechon kawali tray and it's perfect for 2 people. It comes with 2 scoops of rice, noodles, pickled papaya and a side of vinegar sauce. All the flavors paired well with each other. Lechon was perfectly cooked and the Java rice had such good garlic taste.The noodles were slightly too rich and got saltier the more I ate. It was tamed by the cabbage, so I wish there was more of that.Parking is tricky. You will need to find street parking which is tough and there is rarely any space in the residential neighborhoods.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Food was bomb! Super broad range of flavors and felt like a home cooked meal will be coming back. Friendly staff as well and cool open kitchen!
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: The tocino was really good. Probably the best I've ever had. The food is a bit pricey but the quality is there. I would definitely go back in the future.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: We've been wanting to check out Kuya Lord! It was nice to have classic dishes served in unique ways. We had the Lechon Kawali and Lucenachon rice bowl. Both were tasty and has its unique flair while having some traditional components.  The place is on a busy street, but parking was easy since we went after 1pm. Kuya Lord himself was there and a pleasure to chat with. Service was also quick.
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Being half filipino, I always have a soft spot for all things filipino as well as the cuisine so getting to take a bite of this in LA really reminded me of home
Address: 5003 Melrose Ave Los Angeles, CA 90038

Comment: Fast service, great ambiance and fresh ingredients across the board! Great stop for quick eats. Pull up & stay eatin!
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Staff here is super friendly and always in a great mood. The food is always delicious and made to order. Super fresh and doesn't have the fast food taste other hot chicken shops have, you can tell they make it fresh and use fresh ingredients. Love that they have parking and have indoor and outdoor seating.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Great food. Very sweet and nice lady at the register. (I am writing about the Hollywood restaurant). Always smiling and willing to help
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I ordered a Loaded Mac, it came ahead of time and it was delicious, It wasn't greasy and the chicken was on point, they have delicious things.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Brenden was incredibly helpful in helping me choose what to order when I had never visited before, and was also very kind - 5 star service!
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: It's aiight! Gave the leftover fries to a homeless manChicken strips were over seasonedI got the jalapeño rub which was suggested by cashierGonna have to go on a diet this week
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: I've tried Howlin' Ray's, Dave's Hot Chicken, and Angry Chickz.If I were to rate each of these places SOLELY based on taste (of the chicken and not anything else), I'd give Howlin' a 10, Angry Chickz a 9.5, and Dave's an 8.Service wise, Dave's takes the win, but Howlin' is a close second.Accessibility wise, Dave's wins by default cus it has the most locations and stays open the latest depending on the location you go to.Wait wise, Angry Chickz takes the win.Parking wise, I've never had an issue finding a spot at Angry Chickz.If I were to compare these places based on sides, then Angry Chickz has my vote because their cole slaw, pickles, mac n cheese, and buttery rice are FIRE! Plus, I don't like bread (which is why I mainly stick to tenders), so the fact that they offer rice is a complete game changer.Fries from all three places are equally good.Other than flavor, 2 reasons why Howlin' Ray's has an advantage over the other two:1) It travels slightly better than the other two (I've dined in and ordered take out from all 3 places)2) For Angry Chickz and Dave's, if you order anything above medium or hot, the flavor significantly goes down and the spice overpowers the taste. However, with Howlin', I've ordered every spice level on the spectrum (even howlin', which put me in pain for 3.5 days), and as spicy as the food may have been,I was still always able to taste the flavor.But anyway, I'll say this.If I were doing take out, I'd choose Howlin over Angry Chickz. If I were dining in, it'd just be a coin toss between the two. Or I'd choose based on the wait time for each place.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: This is how it looks yummy sandwich I get it with no sauce my wife loves the sauce it's .service is great . The place looks amazing .
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Amazing service from two gentleman, food was great (little better than the Ceres location if you ask me). Definitely a must visit.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: Jose and Frances were amazing! Great customer service will definitely be back  First time trying this and we loved it. Perfect meal after visiting the museum of love.
Address: 5065 Hollywood Blvd Ste 102 Los Angeles, CA 90027

Comment: The service, food, and presentation were excellent.   We will look forward to another visit.  Well worth the money.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: The food and flavors of Phenakite are in a league of its own. I knew it might be special after having been to her Porridge & Puffs restaurant before the pandemic. Chef Minh Phan curates her menu so thoughtfully, and to watch her in the kitchen is to watch an artist and chef building every dish with love. The mochi dish is not only delicious but an event that awes and inspires (I didn't take a pic so as not to ruin the surprise). Excited to see what the future brings for this chef and her food.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Phenakite has returned in a super stealth, under the radar multi course fashion inside of the Forest from the Trees art installation in East downtown Los Angeles.You are shocked when you refresh the Phenakite Tock for your daily check to see if they are back and serving and see actual reservations. You make one with no hesitation or care about the cost.The no-publicity approach seems to be destined to keep things on the DL. There appears to be a single seating for just five tables per night. It's all inclusive, food, tip and alcohol paid for when you make the reservation on Tock.The evening begins with a non-alcoholic yuzu drink while you wait for a private time in the art installation. Unusually everyone at your dinner has arrived early or on time (besides a party that no-showed, shockingly). Which left some lag in the schedule as the art installation has some time padded in. You enjoy the cool air and the opening of the exhibit where a series of microphones have been cleverly changed into small speakersThat experience is great; and interesting, however the real magic begins when you slip into a gallery esque dining room. Five tables all facing a kitchen where Chef Minh Phan works with her team composing a multi course meal. You might say it's nine or ten courses but some of the courses include multiple small dishes so you wouldn't argue if the chef told you it was a 15- or 16-course meal.Thematically the idea is tied to that of the art exhibit, indigenous foods (tho not religiously, like you might find at Owamni - The Sioux Chef, in Minneapolis), no waste, and the heartfelt imaginative cooking of the chef herself that is unlike any other in Los Angeles.Her laptop sits nearby connected with an aux cable to a speaker. It keeps turning off as the laptop goes to sleep and the chef fiddles with it to restart her playlist of 90s and 00s indie rock and alternative. Wilco and the Magnetic Fields serenade you.The walls are stark white with gallery lighting and a few branches screwed into them, but some have fallen. The wooden tables are decorated in a way that's elegant but also homey and reminiscent of how your mom or aunt might.And then the food. Bold at every step. Looking at past Phenakite menus you see some of her themes, a blowtorch (which ties wonderfully to the art exhibit) lights filled mochi and a fig leaf on fire, creating smoke and ash that drifts over the table during the course.Fauna of the forest with a flavor profile that is dreamlike. Different stems and pieces that might be thrown away used and pickled.A series of small dishes including a three sisters dish, a crab cake with the perfect season of dill and tarragon, pickles from the sea to go with it.  The lone dish of the night that fails to live up to its brothers and sisters is a shrimp with an elegant birds nest of root and tuber tempura fried on top of it. Salty and beautiful but pales compared to the flavors of everything else you are served. Perhaps that misses the point, and the salt is there to cleanse the palette.A fish dish with a medley of flavors and vegetables and perfectly splayed out fried mushrooms. The porridge course that one expects and loves from the beloved chef behind Porridge + Puffs. Two remarkable bites of venison with bright seasoning and mouthing numbing qualities.A course called a Dance Party that again minimizes the waste from the kitchen. Followed by a staple herbal granita and a crème desert.Throughout the meal alcohol pairings were served. They match the food beautifully and you make note of new wineries to check out in Santa Barbara next time .The service is warm and enthusiastic. The servers when introducing themselves reveal that they are an art student and an actress. It's at once surprising, revealing and excusing. Wines are poured occasionally with no explanation of the vintage and food dropped off without explanation, the menu is on the table so you can read, but the story is slightly lost in these moments. The lack of experience is at once endearing while also occasionally jarring given how remarkable the meal is.You embrace the at times awkward service with the same love and familiarity that the staff and space embrace you and embrace the strange situation they have found themselves in.From the entire time you felt purpose, warmth, and love poured into the meal you've been served. There isn't anything else quite like it, and you feel bad about wanting to tell people about it, as if it being secret could help it exist in its purity for a bit longer.And at the same time, you must talk and tell your friends about it, because you leave changed and touched in a way that few other meals ever accomplish.As you leave the gallery, You wave goodbye to the chef, and wish you could have this first experience all over again for the first time
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Had really high hopes for this place after getting LA Times restaurant of the year and a Michelin star. Overall I think the concept was cool but the execution on food and plating was lacking.First, they seat you by order of which you arrived. The weird thing is, they don't take note of who arrived first and go around asking everyone. If you plan on seating by order of arrival, then a staff member should take note to make it an easier transition to the table for the guests. Other than that, I'd say the service was solid.Some of the plating felt a bit too much, random stones on a plate or unneeded rocks. I was able to look past that but the food was just not executed well at all. There was a tempura dish that wasn't crispy, it had no crunch and felt like it was sitting in oil for way too long. The pork belly course was way over cooked. I could see each fiber and I had a tough time cutting into it. The mochi that accompanied the dish was great though. The fish dish was severely overcooked as well, I couldn't take more than a bite. At first, I thought it was just an off night but when I spoke to friends who went prior to me, they all commented similarly. I'm not sure if it's lack of a proper kitchen or what but for $200+ per person, I was expecting a lot more.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Chef Minh Phan and team have created something very VERY special. This was more than just a meal. It was an experience. Everything felt near perfect, from the food, to the drinks, to the staff, to the ambiance and serving-ware. It's definitely a splurge meal that should be saved for a special occasion, but for me this is what all fine dining should aspire to be.THE FOOD: They only offer a nine-course set meal. It was a tremendous progression of tastes, flavors and stories that are meant to be a journey through the land, sea, and air. Some items didn't entirely hit, but overall it was a near impeccable journey. One of my few complaints is that they serve a lot of food, but don't let guests take leftovers home...so bring your appetite!THE DRINKS: We shared a beverage paring and it was a great match to the meal and felt like a perfect amount of drinks.THE SPACE: The team somehow transforms the courtyard of a coworking space into a fantastic secluded outdoor garden. It would be nice if they had heaters, but it is protected enough from the elements that it didn't get too cold.This was quite simply my favorite Los Angeles meal / dining experience over the past couple years.HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Best restaurant in LA for a reason.We loved the food & interesting drink & wines pairings at @phenakite.la but it is the heart & soul of the people especially Chef Minh Phan who presented the mochi & pork belly dish as a release ceremony asking us to think of something to release as she set the dish on fire.My fire burned especially bright as I wished the breast cancer treatments worked and will never return.Thank you for an amazing dinner filled with excitement, Love and Light on our anniversary and during Breast Cancer Awareness month!!!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We appreciated the dining experience after reading the LA times review several months ago. Feed was excellent. Service was fantastic as staff are fully explained the ingredients of the dish as well as the intent. One thing that confused us was their requirement to see proof of vaccine when the entire dining area is located outside. I'm not anti-vaxx but I asked why this precaution was mandated when there are no county protocols instructing diners to show show vax proof of eating outdoors. I think this was unnecessary and when I asked for an explanation I was just given shrug of the shoulders by the host. Really strange.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Had a wonderful pre-bday (for Ishita, my wife) and pre-anniversary dinner at Phenakite on September 17, 2021.Chef Minh Phan and her team are among the most welcoming, warm (though being under the stars was a bit chilly at times ), and caring we've ever met. The food was delicious, exquisitely prepared and evocative of memories and #feels. From the moment Chef Minh greets us with "hello friends", we were taken on a gustatory journey that was exotic yet familiar. This gem of a restaurant, born in the midst of the pandemic, truly embodies the mineral that forms under extreme pressure and conditions it is named for. Definitely recommend!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Magical. Perfection. Creative beyond words. Photos of the space and the food do not do the restaurant any justice, but maybe that's a good thing. Every twist, turn, & corner was a surprise. I don't want to ruin it for everyone. So just go! Book the ticket. You will not regret.They are requiring that diners show their vaccination card, so don't forget to have it handy! I had a moment of panic as we were checking in and had to search through my emails.Chef Minh Phan is so welcoming, sweet, and seriously an artist. She's put so much thought into every detail of your experience. She's injected Vietnamese soul into her food, and every time I spotted it in the dish, it took me back to a part of my childhood.Best part? You can request a vegan menu.Loved everything about tonight. It was so special and will go down in my books as one of the best meals I ever ate. Thank you!
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: We so enjoyed our magical meal here.  We are fans of the chef's other restaurant, Porridge+Puffs (temporarily closed during the pandemic) and were not disappointed in her fine dining experience.  She is an artist, plain and simple.  It felt like an leisurely stop at an oasis during the pandemic.  Delicious and creative food, friendly staff, lovely setting.  We had let them know about a few food restrictions ahead of time, which they seamlessly accommodated.  We are grateful and look forward to seeing what Chef Minh does next.
Address: 1370 N St Andrews Pl Los Angeles, CA 90028

Comment: Food was amazing . It is. It a sit down place but food was amazing . Great to go or for a quick meal
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: This is the best thing I ever eaten for breakfast in my life! And I know a good breakfast!!! I still dream of the day I took my first bite!I am probably moving back to L.A just so I can eat egg tuck 3-4 times a week at least!
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: I saw this place on TikTok and had to try it so I ordered an egg sandwich with avocado and bacon threw Uber Eats oh man it's very good.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The food is delicious! You have to visit place if you are in LA. Their mango iced tea is beyond the great! I love everything! There is a small line every time but order is coming out fast. They are currently working to go but it may be even plus for everyone to have a juicy and enormously delicious breakfast egg sandwich!
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Egg tuck is always a 12/10. Though known for their sandwiches, their breakfast burrito is my favorite in town. Crispy tots and I love to add bacon or chorizo.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Was looking for an easy breakfast place but was worried about a crazy line since it was a Sunday mid afternoon. Egg Tuck location isn't a dine-in type of establishment, which is fine by me, I was able to make my order on their tablets setup in store. Easy to use, made modifications and added a little extra to my bacon & egg sandwich. The wait time was minimal, maybe about 8 minutes, there was a line ahead of us, but 8 mins is nothing in comparison to trying to dine in somewhere. Food is always excellent, salivating thinking about it now! Lol
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Well what shall I say they nobody else have written already? Yes the sandwich is great, the eggs so fluffy you can't believe they make them fresh every single time, the bread crispy - I wish they would have an non white bread alternative but that's on a high Niveau - the bread they serve is just delicious.Yes it is messy to easy and somebody recommended wet towels - yes you better have them handy. And if you are a big guy like me maybe even a shirt to change hahah.What picture shall I'll make that wasn't madeAlready? Look at all of em And then get here and enjoy!
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Great sandwich.  Fluffy eggs.  Well seasoned.   Great tots too.   I ordered online and that seemed to work well as there was a pretty big crowd waiting at the restaurant when I picked up my sandwich.   Short walk from my place so it's a perfect morning breakfast sandwich place for me.   Definitely will order from here when I have guests in town.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: The egg burritos were 10/10. Fast and efficient service. Great newer spot. Can't wait to try it again.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Super good and tasty food, I highly recommend. Service is always welcoming. And the place is not to eat in, but it's great to pickup
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Let's talk about the menu. It is small, but it's enough for an egglicious breakfast.  Everything is tasty.
Address: 7131 W Sunset Blvd unit B West Hollywood, CA 90046

Comment: Had a great experience here. The spot is really charming and fun inside. The food was fresh and vibrant, I liked how they weren't trying to mask the flavor of the ingredients with overly rich sauces and spices. They let the quality ingredients speak for themselves. Our server was really nice and I would absolutely come back here again.
Address: 4880 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: not amazing. went there about two months ago with two friends who really wanted to go. staff was nice, we had drinks while waiting outside, but it was too pricey and taste was not memorable, nothing to write about. it was hip and hype but not hot enough to bring me back.
Address: 4880 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: This place is a true gem. The restaurant is small and their are a few tables outside. There is only street parking and a challenge to find a spot. Waited for 45 minutes for a table but we'll worth it. The staff is amazing and very attentive. We had a bottle of wine while we waited for our table. . There were 3 of us. We got a dozen oysters,crudo, the bread with anchovies, lobster roll, and scallop tostada to share. All of the food  was delicious. They also had my favorite key lime pie. I'm very picky  when it come to key lime. Could have eaten a whole piece by myself.
Address: 4880 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: I am from New England, and have a pretty high bar for raw seafood. Found Oyster is very good. Their oysters are flown in, and kept quite fresh, offering great taste and served with excellent condiments/garnishes. Other items on the menu are tasty as well, and definitely worth exploring.The wait staff was friendly and attentive, without being pushy for you to leave so they could clear space for additional customers.The only reason I have excluded Found Oyster from the 5 star ranking is because of its prices and physical space. While the food was good, the price point was a bit high considering what it is at many other seafood places I have eaten at. (Ones that are actually by the water where the oysters are 20 min old) It's also tiny inside, which I realize is simply the space they have to operate....but it feels cluttered and definitely affects the overall dining experience.Overall, it's worth a visit if you like this kind of fare.
Address: 4880 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: So yummy and the service was on point.  Everything from the oysters to the scallop tostada was fresh and delicious.Loved sitting at the bar and watching all of the hustle abs bustle.  Will be back soon!
Address: 4880 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: Amazing! I started following FO on Instagrams few year ago and I was able to visit twice before covid hit. I easily fell in love! I was able to order during the first weeks of covid when they only had a walk up window and visited a few times post with the new "deck".I love oysters and raw bars, but in LA I've never found a place I liked as much as Lure in NYC, Swan in SF or the Walrus and the Carpenter in Seattle. Till now!!The menu is a small but I love this because this means it's all fresh! I really wanted to order one of everything but always some raw oysters. They have specials depending on season like razor clams, shrimp etc. You can't go wrong with anything from the menu, it's all fantastic. The scallop tostada is orgasmic and the Sicilian crudo is to die for!!
Address: 4880 Fountain Ave Los Angeles, CA 90029

Comment: I'd had a rough day today, and there's just nothing to lift my spirits like sitting at a bar with some raw oysters and a glass of wine. So I headed over to try Found Oyster on my way home, hoping for a lively but casual environment where I could just sit by myself at the bar and enjoy my surroundings.First of all, parking is a challenge before 7 p.m. (when restrictions are lifted on Sunset) and if you're going to be there past 6 p.m., when neighborhood permit-only parking takes effect. Timing-wise, it's probably best to arrive at Found Oyster when it opens at 4 and spend a couple of hours and then get your car out of there. After circling the surrounding blocks for about 20 minutes around 5:30 p.m. on a Friday, I finally found an unrestricted spot about 0.2 miles away, but I was almost ready to give up.When I arrived, there were already people spilling out onto the sidewalk, waiting for tables. The restaurant has a bench and some chairs next to their outdoor seating that are dedicated specifically for people on the waitlist, and the nice thing is that someone will come out and take your wine order so you can get the party started before you're officially seated. I, however, got lucky and took the last seat at the end of the bar.When you first order, you check off boxes on a double-sided paper menu, kind of like you do in a sushi restaurant.
